title: Great experience
text: This hotel is beautiful and staff are very professional and friendly. Alan especially was amazing he made our stay super comfortable.The rooms are clean and comfortable also this is a great place for quick family vacation.The amount of professionalism from all staff were great, greeted us at the front door with open arms like we were family

title: Ok Hotel, Fantastic Staff
text:
This was a mixed review visit for us. Our room was cold. Heat did not work well enough to warm it up. Breakfast was eh, no hot food and doesn’t look like it was replenished much… front desk staff was PHENOMENAL! They were a 10 out of 10, every single one of them was fantastic. They Greeted us warmly Every single time we walked up to the desk or walked  into the hotel. Allen was a stand out.  
Really quite impressed with the whole staff.

title: 5 star review
text:
Dear Team at Mondrian Park Avenue Hotel,

I am writing about your exceptional service extended to me during my recent stay at your hotel. The cleanliness of the room and the inviting ambiance of the Terrace truly enhanced my experience. However, what truly set my stay apart was the unparalleled dedication and attentiveness of the staff.

A special mention must be made for Allen, the Front Desk Manager. His exceptional care and consideration towards me and my family did not go unnoticed. Such genuine and sincere hospitality is a rare find in my travels, and Allen's professionalism and warmth truly made our stay memorable. Allen, you are more than welcome to visit Ireland, should you ever wish to explore its beauty.

Once again, thank you for creating a delightful and welcoming environment for guests like me. Your dedication to service excellence truly sets Mondrian Park Avenue Hotel apart.

title: I've Stayed Before, I Will Definitely Stay Again!
text:
I absolutely adore this hotel and all the staff working there! They are so friendly and attentive, it's refreshing to see such stellar customer service!  Sarah at the front desk is a delight, I wish I could remember everyones name that made my stay. 

The rooms are clean and quiet (besides the occasional NY traffic horns). The hotel itself is conveniently located near subways, koreantown and other tourist hotspots. I don't typically eat breakfast but it does come with your stay -- but I can vouch that the coffee is really yummy! 

The only downside is that there is no gym on site, bring your running shoes and hit the pavement. Also there are only two elevators so your que time might be a wee bit longer during the morning breakfast rush.

title: Wedding Anniversary
text: The Mondrian was a sexy and romantic experience spent with my spouse for our 5th wedding anniversary. The room was phenomenal with a view just above the highly esteemed Park Avenue in NYC. Although we did close the blinds... it made you feel like you were taking part in a voyeuristic film experience. Martin, who serves as the hotels Manager, did not skip a beat to make sure we had an extraordinary stay. Upon check in, he greeted us with bottle of Moet and a plate full of exquisite treats. Our welcome did not stop there as he reserved special access to the Ivy Room. A restaurant within walking distance where we had front row seats along with dinner to a unique musical experience. The staff was exceptional and leaves no doubt in my mind that we will be back.

title: Will stay there again.
text:
From check in to check out everything about our stay was perfect.

Great location, great staff, wonderful room. Small yes, but they do small very well.

We walked everywhere and felt we were in an intimate home away from home. Although we did run out of bath gel but it was on the last day of two. 

Oh and the price per night was fair.

title: Great NYC hotel. Nice amenities, great location.
text: Fabulous hotel in a great NYC location.  When traveling for business as a woman it’s important to feel safe. Upon my arrival, Sarah and Edwin were super friendly and welcoming. Then they delivered wonderful news that the hotel offers a free continental breakfast and that the water and soda in the mini bar are free!  They also have a  terrace on the 15th floor with great NYC views.

title: The Gold Standard
text:
Allen, who is the front desk manager, is the best representation of this Hotel. He is the Gold Standard of Customer Service, and Hospitality. Allen goes above and beyond his job description. Customer is the number foundation for any business. 

The Mondrian is THE ONLY PLACE TO to stay if you want a real feel for the warmth & charm of NYC  & its people, instead of a cold impersonal hotel. The owners & staff make you feel like part of their family,  and give wonderful support in every need of your visit for  tours.& transportation. They speak very good English and their breakfast & coffee are excellent and will accommodate any request if possible. I stayed at 15 hotels in nyc in the past 2 months,  and this one was my favorite for its peaceful and gracious atmosphere. 

I would recommend this hotel to anybody who is in NYC and I wouldn’t even stay at the Ritz Carlton. The personalisation and the genuine experience of staying here is second to none. 
 
 I am a woman by myself in NYC and staying at a hotel that makes me feel like home is is very it’s important to me, and very hard to find.

Thank you, Allen and the whole staff at the Mondrian, I greatly appreciate your Hospitality.

title: classy simple chic
text: loved every minute. breakfast was delicious, the room was well appointed and we were afforded so many amenities we weren’t expecting (heated floors!). the staff were friendly and distinguished. Allen was of particular help, amongst the already sterling service from all of the front desk staff.

title: 40th bday !
text: We went for my friends 40th birthday. Great spot. Martin the manager there was very helpful and made sure our time there was nothing less than amazing! We got a complimentary bottle of champagne and mini cupcakes. I will recommend this hotel for anyone having a fun night out in the city.

title: Midwestern Mom staying in NYC for work. Nice, comfortable room, excellent service, friendly staff
text: What a delightful experience! The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, ensuring our stay was truly enjoyable. We will certainly return in the future. Our visit was for business, and the hotel's proximity to the UN made it convenient for our meetings, with a safe walking distance. The room was cozy and the breakfast, particularly the spinach and egg croissants, was delicious. The staff went above and beyond to assist a directionally challenged Midwest Mom like myself, displaying remarkable accommodation and knowledge. A heartfelt thank you to Alan and the entire staff for making our stay memorable!

title: Five Star Treatment!
text: Staying at this hotel on Park Avenue was an absolute delight! From the moment we arrived, we were treated with deep care and attention by the attentive staff. Our room was not only immaculately clean but also wonderfully spacious, providing us with ample comfort during our stay. The hotel manager Allan and the staff went above and beyond to ensure our needs were met, offering helpful recommendations and ensuring we had everything we needed. The location couldn't be better, with easy access to all the attractions and amenities that NYC has to offer. Overall, our experience was nothing short of exceptional, and we can't wait to return. Five stars all the way!

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Great Boutique hotel. The service is amazing. Allen and the staff were so accommodating to our needs. There was 4 of us and the room was always clean and had enough towels in the room.  Anything we needed they were always so quick to get it for us. We look forward to coming back again.

title: Dope check in
text: Got here early and my Man Allen totally took care of me. Got me checked in early after a little bit of finagling to make sure I got the room I wanted and paid for. Was just the nicest and coolest cat I’ve dealt with at a hotel in NY. Room was fantastic and ultra nice 10/10 would stay again.

title: ur all amazing
text: room was AWESOME. sarah was so so so sweet and beautiful! she was able to upgrade my boyfriend and I’s room.  she was amazing and so was jason!! this hotel was by far the fanciest and nicest looking one i’ve been to. 10/10 will go again. i look forward to seeing you all again!

title: Will be staying again!
text:
We had the most fantastic stay at the Mondrian Park Ave. The front desk staff was welcoming and answered my MANY questions about the hotel, food, and area in general. We were able to check in quickly and get up to the room. 

Our room was STUNNING. Lots of space, beautiful, and clean. Would be great for a girls trip because there are SO many mirrors! Each time I was getting ready I found a new spot (: So much natural light as well! We had a nice sitting area where friends came to hangout and we had more than enough space. 

We also went to check out the terrace, which for the winter is a lounge area, which was cozy and inviting. We also were able to get free breakfast that had all the necessities to fuel us for the day. The decor and atmosphere are calming and cool. Would highly reccomend staying here!

title: Great stay
text: Breakfast was great and I appreciate having until 10:30 to get there... I'm a late sleeper. Loved the bedding and the room was well appointed and very comfortable. I arrived 30 minutes early and was able to check in.  I also spent some time on the terrace with great views.

title: Business trip with some personal fun made better with the hotel staff
text: Allen was a joy to work with friendly helpful and accommodating. True example of the true customer experience I would stay again. I love the area and the people where very kind and warm to me even housekeeping.  I true enjoyed my trip to nyc and I'll be coming back again soon

title: 5 Star Hotel Experience
text: I absolutely loved staying at the Mondrian Hotel. It felt like a 5 star hotel such a beautiful, spacious, and clean room!!!! It's at a perfect location so close to everywhere in the city!!! I want to give a shoutout to Allen and Edwin never met such helpful, friendly and professional people!!! I will definitely be staying at the Modrian next time I come to NYC!!!

title: The Mondrian is a work of art!
text: The staff at the Mondrian rock! I was treated like a king at this beautiful hotel. I highly recommend it for any NYC visit. Absolutely beautiful rooms - grab one on a high floor with a balcony and you will see what I mean. 10 out of 10 for my stay!!!!

title: Mondrian Park Avenue wonderful
text:
Upon entering the Mondrian we were greeted by Sarah,Iliana,Luis and Jason all were great! The Mondrian staff are professional and friendly.
The room we stayed in was very clean. The bedding was all white and perfectly made. Very upscale decor. The bathroom was well appointed and also spotless. The Mondrian is a well taken care of Hotel. My husband took advantage of the complimentary continental breakfast in the morning which was nice. Thanks Mondrian we had an enjoyable stay and the location is prime.

title: Stylish, clean, bright, well appointed - great hotel in NYC
text:
This is a really quality hotel. I have stayed in a few hotels in NYC, but was happy to find this one. This was my second stay. I really felt the advantage of it being a smaller hotel, not just another one of many in a huge chain. Gabriel and the front office staff were all super friendly, warm, welcoming and helpful. They made a point of welcoming me back to the hotel, were able to accommodate my room preference and seemed to really care that my stay was a good one. 

The rooms are stylishly appointed, clean and bright, have a fridge, (and a tea kettle on request) and plenty of bottled water. Bathrooms are also bright, and spacious, with nice toiletries by Malin+Goetz. Mine had a relatively open view across Park Ave (beats looking into a neighboring building, which can be just 10’ away!) with big windows (very high ceilings) bringing in so much light. The roof deck is a great view and underused - a good workspace. It’s a very good location and feels quite safe at night. Some familiar big names (Wholefoods, Starbucks etc) within a couple of blocks, as well as a lot of good local options nearby. And the subway entrance on 32nd. 

I am happy to have found my ‘go to’ hotel in New York.

title: Amazing staff and service
text: The staff at the Mondrian went above and beyond when we needed help. Special shout to Gabriel, Sarah, Allen, Jason, and Sayla. The room was clean and when we needed things, they were very prompt. Very happy with our stay and the property. Will definitely come back

title: Mondrian Park Avenue Revew
text: Excelente hotel com funcionários atenciosos e instalações limpas. Café da manhã muito bom. A localização também é ótima - perto de tudo e de estações de metrô. Voltaria e recomendo com certeza. Um hotel com excelente custo benefício. Parabéns a equipe!

title: Super staff & great location
text: I love the convenient location and the hotel had complementary breakfast and free water.  The staff was super nice & helpful- I accidentally left some things in the safe and the front desk called me immediately and mailed them back to me.  The room was really nice and comfortable.

title: Amazing stay
text: I really enjoyed my stay at Mondrian Park Avenue. Check in process was quick and Sarah at front desk was very welcoming! The suite was very spacious and the balcony view was amazing! Everything was very clean when I arrived. I definitely plan on staying here again.

title: Great city stay
text: This was our third stay at the Mondrian Park avenue. Sarah at front desk was very welcoming and accommodating. My stay in the balcony suite was great! Comfort and space, couldn’t ask for more. We will definitely be returning. Thank you for the great service :)

title: Nice stay for a short trip
text:
My family and I stayed here this weekend for one night. We live locally but were attending an event near by that was ending late so decided to stay here for a night instead of traveling home at a late hour. The hotel met all of our needs for a one night stay and we were pleased with our time there. We had a room with 2 double beds for myself, wife and 2 kids. This was adequate space for us. The continental breakfast in the morning does not include hot food like eggs, pancakes or bacon but was more than sufficient for my family to enjoy a meal before leaving the next morning. Breakfast includes croissants, bagels, toast, cereal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, juice, tea and coffee.

My only complaint here is the staff not understanding the policies of the hotel. After reading some negative reviews here, I decided to call the hotel before booking to inquire about the "resort" fee and included breakfast, etc. The front desk associate told me breakfast was complimentary if you decide to pay the resort fee of $45 but you have the option to waive the resort fee when you check in at the hotel and therefore breakfast will not be included in your stay That sounded good to me so I proceeded with booking and paying directing through the hotel website. Immediately after submitting the booking online, my credit card was charged $45 more than the price that was shown at checkout. When I went to check in to the hotel later that evening,  (different front desk associate now than in the morning when I called) the front desk associate told me that they had no idea why that employee told me that you had the option to waive the resort fee when this in fact is not true and it is a mandatory fee. So two employee working for the same hotel at the same front desk have totally different understandings of the hotel policy? Not a great look. 

We ended up going down for breakfast in the morning since we were already charged for it but would have opted to skip it if we had the choice. My assumption is if you book through a third party, they'll charge you this resort fee separately upon checkout at the hotel. 

Hotel needs to be more transparent about these fees as it is an apparent reoccurring issue here based on the reviews. Would have rated higher were it not for being misled prior to booking.

title: Not a 4 star hotel
text:
First off it’s not a 4 star hotel maybe a 3. Our room is pretty good, a little on the smaller size but okay. The towels are linen are poor quality and all ripped. The shower leaks all over the floor and the continental breakfast is not great. I understand it’s Christmas but there is no where near enough food for the people that are here, they only bring out top ups for each item 4 items at time which just won’t work when you’ve got 15 people waiting for food. 
The staff are doing their best with what they’ve got and they’re friendly. 
The location however is so good. Only a few blocks away from most of the attractions in Manhattan. 
The rooms are not cheap by any means so I suppose you expect a little more than basic. 
The resort fee is expensive and if you want to use the gym you have to go across the road to another venue. 

All in all, I’m pretty disappointed especially with how much we spent to stay here and I wouldn’t have booked if I knew I wasn’t getting a actual 4 star hotel stay

title: Nice stay
text: This hotel was nice and the location is good but the rooms are slightly smaller than I was used to and the amenities were limited. The staff is very nice and it is Christmas which makes it a nice cozy feel.

title: Thinking of staying here? Don’t!
text:
If you’re drawn in by the Mondrian brand or arty pictures on their website - I implore you to stop, close down your booking page and find somewhere else - this place is not a 4 star hotel, it’s 2 at best and here’s why.

First the pros:
1. Location - it’s well located and the area is good for shops, cafes etc. 

And that’s where the pros end.

The cons:
1. When we arrived which was after check in time our room wasn’t ready so they tried to put us in a lesser room than we booked - we refused and waited for our room.

2. That’s not really the issue though - the issue was the staff. They’re really unprofessional, having very very personal conversations in front of guests checking in. They seem to think they’re working in a super cool hotel and they can be chill and relaxed - they’re not, this place is not cool, trendy or hip. And I don’t want to hear who your colleagues are sleeping with as I check in.

3. The rooms are disgusting - the pictures I’ve added show you a shower ceiling falling apart and dripping on your head - who knows what’s dripping. The wallpaper is peeling all over, the floors are filthy, as are any corridors too. But somehow the worst part was the mould - the wallpaper is hiding mouldy walls. They stink and who knows what effect they’re having on guests health. The sheets all had holes in too - despite asking for them to be changed, if they were changed they were changed for more ones with holes in!

4. For the price you pay - and it’s not cheap, you expect some basic facilities - there’s no iron, no tea or coffee machine, the towels are tiny and rough, the plug sockets are loose.

Overall they don’t care about service, cleanliness or comfort.

We complained, wanted to move rooms - but we were lazily told no other rooms available - they just didn’t care.

There are thousands of hotels in New York, and it can be exhausting to find the right one - but delete this one from your list. You’ll regret booking here.

And if anyone from the Mondrian wants to reach out to discuss this - feel free, I’m not letting this one drop and I’ll be making a more formal complaint today.

Amazing stay at the Mondrian, rooms are great, staff are super helpful especially Gabriel. He made our stay special. We will definitely be returning here, I hope to see Gabriel promoted to manager on my return.

title: Shocked by the quality
text: This is not a 4 star hotel, not even 2. Rooms are completely falling apart, it’s not clean, just awful, wallpaper peeling of everywhere, there isn’t even coffee or tea maker, nothing you would expect from 4 star hotel. Extremely disappointed, and I just arrived.

title: Perfect location
text: Great location & friendly staff. Gabriel and his team are lovely! It was raining a lot during our stay & we were told one evening that there was an umbrella shortage so it was limited to one per room - that was our only complaint! Everything else was great and we would return.

title: Not as advertised
text:
I stayed here with my daughter, when we arrived we had a problem with our room and had to change 3 times. Even then the toilet seat was broken and the glass furniture had chips or cracks in it. The carpet was stained/burned and the hinge on the safe cupboard was also broken, we did report all this to reception. We emailed the management as requested but have heard nothing from them. 

The only good thing was the location, it’s about a 10-15 minute walk to the main attraction and a really safe area to walk around.

title: Better than average
text:
Situated a few blocks south of the Empire State Building, so ideal for position to explore most of New York. 
Room was clean and tidy, lovely shower. Fresh towels. Could get the safe to work but used my lockable case for valuables. 
Didn’t eat here so can’t comment.

title: Bad Business
text:
Booked and paid for two beds. Confirmed the reservation and the two beds at 3:30. Arrived at hotel at 10:30 and told there was an issue and I now have one bed and a cot. The cot is deplorable. Not possible for an adult to sleep on. Four inches thick with metal
Springs. No blanket just a sheet. 
No two bed rooms available. Still paying for two beds though. 
When I was waiting at the front desk a woman and her daughter checked out at 10:30 pm because the room next door had a dog that had been left in the room and had been barking for four hours straight. They checked out and went to a Marriot. When I went back down 20 minutes later the two front desk staff behind the curtain at the front desk were discussing how they were going to put me in the barking dog room the next day because it had two beds in it despite the fact that this woman just had to move hotels at 10:30 at night and was really upset about the incessant barking. So bad to worse. Expedia was no help. They could have let me out of this reservation that is not consistent with what I booked or maybe refined me the difference between the rooms or gotten me another hotel with two beds but no - tomorrow while I’m working a room may become available and I may be able to have that room but maybe not so when I get back here I may still be in the room with one bed paying for two and a bed that an adult can not sleep on. This is a scam.

title: You will get scammed
text:
I'm writing this as I am still staying in the hotel.
Despite having booked my stay through the Amex portal where I clearly booked a room with no breakfast, when I got to the hotel on Saturday the receptionist told me I will have to pay 45 extra dollars per day for using the gym and the breakfast service.
I told her I DIDN'T WANT THIS SERVICE but she said I had no option and I had to pay it anways at the end of my stay.
It's a shame you scam your guests this way because knowing I had to pay for this services, I would have gone to any other of the hotels I have been in the past.
And to make matters worse, the breakfast has SO few options and is not good for a 4 star hotel.

title: Aesthetically Pleasing Birthday
text: I was visiting New York for my birthday and chose the Mondrian to stay at specifically because of the photos of the room. The experience was beyond amazing. The staff were so helpful and sweet and the room was beautiful. Gabriel and Jason were really kind and helpful on our last day there and gave us a rundown on everything to expect regarding payment. They were all so understanding regarding our needs and when it came to valet parking, assisted us and made us feel very welcome.

title: Chambre basique .
text: Toutes les photos sont trompeuses .pas de bar pour se désaltérer après une longue journée de visite .Personnel a la réception pas un mot de français .Je suis un grand-pére de 80 ans en séjour avec mon petit fils de 16 ans

title: Great Customer Service!
text: The customer service at Mondrian Park Ave is like nothing I've ever experienced! After leaving valuable items in the safe and realizing it once I'd traveled back home, Sarah Waheed at the Mondrian did everything she could to quickly ensure that my valuables returned to me safely. They are responsive, helpful and the kindest staff I've ever encountered. Not to mention the hotel was a wonderful stay for marathon weekend! THANK YOU SARAH!

title: Hidden cost, not honest. Avoid!!!!
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights with our teenagers
The hotel is very well placed for visiting everything New York has to offer, you can literally walk the whole city from here
Modern hotel, but tired in places.
Service ok, we enjoyed our stay and was perfect for what we needed. Basic, but fine.
Reason for the low rating is we had booked a room only rate through our travel agent. When we arrived reception told us breakfast was included. We said we didn’t think it was and was assured it was. We checked it again in the morning
We therefore had their very simple (toast, pastries, water) breakfast every morning.
Three days after returning home, having been told there was nothing to pay at check out, £165 per room ( we had two) was taken off my card. When I questioned this I was eventually told it was to cover ‘resort fees’, which was breakfast, WiFi (this was horrific and we didn’t use it) the gym (never saw one) and the terrace (which is just a lounge and were told was free for guests to use, but we didn’t). They insisted it was for my agent to inform me of this extra cost but they didn’t know about it. I think it’s incredible they never mentioned it even when asked! Even if you did know you were being charged etc this is terrible value for  money. Breakfast is on paper plates and very basic and WiFi unusable 
Avoid. Absolute scammers.

title: Extremely poor cleaning and service
text:
Poor service and low cleaning. 
I never write bad reviews for hotels, in general preferring not to, but I will make an exception in this case.
I have stayed at the Mondrian Park in the past for its location and price point. I have never expected a five-star service but abasic minimum. The standards of the hotel have been down. I checked in October 22nd. In the evening I noticed that the A/c extraction were extremely dirty (even dangerous for breathing air as probably not been clean in months). On October 23rd morning, I nicely approached the front desk with a picture asking for the room to be cleaned properly. The front office person didn't really care but said in a none caring way it would be done. 
I came back to my room at 5:00 p.m. to get change and noticed nothing was clean. I once again nicely approached the front desk showing the picture. The front office person (a different one) was nice and said it would be done right away. I came back to my room, and nothing changed. On October 24th morning I approached the front desk in a direct tone of voice asking for immediate cleaning and compensation. the manager said it will be done. I came back at 5:00 pm and yes it was finally clean. Housekeeping left a lot of empty boxes of cleaning products in my room which I brought back to the front desk. they thought I had delivery, I explained it was from the hotel and left behind in my room. 
On October 25th morning I called the front desk to mention that I will be departing on October 26th morning and not 27th as planned. Front desk agent said all is good and the last night was canceled accordingly. 
On October 27th early morning I went for my check out, system were down. I asked front office to send me the bill for review prior to the charge as I want to see what the compensation for the poor cleaning service was. I received the invoice end morning with $100 discount in total from a total bill of arund 1,400 USD. I replied with my stupefaction for this low gesture for this large issue. My credit card was charged for 1,800 USD on Octoer 28th. I called the front desk and they told me they were charging the for the night of October 26th. I explained to the person that I checked out on the 26th and front desk agent confirm the cancelation of the night of the 26th back on October 25th, so no charge should apply. After multiple emailed and called, I finally had the incorrect charge remove and the proper charge apply. Yet extremely poor service experience at the resort with no management even apology and a USD 100 discount which based on the whole experience is more a joke than anything. 
Extremely sad to have to share this review. This hotel has been going down big time. a shame from what was a good value hotel once upon a time.

title: Thieves in the hotel, management doesn’t take responsibility
text: The hotel was nice and everyone there was very professional. The rooms are small but the design is nice. The reason for the bad review is that I forgot an apple device in the room when I checked out and instead of it waiting at the front desk when I called to notify them I forgot it, they didn’t have it. It was stolen by someone in the hotel.  I tracked it to a homeless shelter in Brooklyn but the hotel wouldn’t help me to get it back or provide any compensation despite the fact that it was taken from my room in the hotel.  Someone from the hotel stole it or they have thieves wandering around the floors. Either way it’s not a place I’d feel safe returning to.

title: Beware of inaccurate room descriptions!
text: Beware of inaccurate room descriptions!  I booked a room with a King bed and balcony and ended up in a teeny room with Queen bed.  When I called to say I was placed in the wrong room, I was told that all rooms have King beds.  Not true!  This bed measured 60" across which is a Queen bed.  The carpet in the room was also disgusting.  Good location, but I would not stay here again.

title: Absolutely no.
text:
I’m utterly confused by any good review of this hotel or anything above 1 star. The rooms are TINY and feel very claustrophobic. Bathrooms TINY. The AC vent blows directly onto the bed and is so loud and you always feel a huge breeze no matter what temp it’s on because the wall is 1 ft away from the bed. One of our windows didn’t even shut properly. The wallpaper is stained and peeling in all areas of the room. The bed is uncomfortable and pillows rock hard. Everything is old and stained and drab. The minibar is two cans of coke and two Poland spring waters. Do not be fooled by their photos or park avenue address. I felt dirty just being there. This hotel is gross and needs a gut renovation and is one of the worst hotels in this class that I’ve stayed. 

Hallways are also not clean and are all stained and marks all over the walls. 

Then there’s the included breakfast which I don’t even know where to begin. Dirty tables in a weird burger joint restaurant. Breakfast is cheap 2* hotel breakfast buffet of pastries and breads with bananas and some yogurt and PLASTIC cutlery and paper bowls and plates! All self serve with a coffee and tea station. The staff is unprofessional and sloppy.

title: Worth it.
text: A perfect location to watch the fireworks. Rooms were nicely sized and the complementary continental breakfast was a perfect treat to wake up to. Within walking distance of shops and perfect walk to Times Square, Central Park and surrounding places.

title: Amazing Stay!
text:
What an amazing stay! From start to finish, I felt like I was truly welcome here despite never having been in NYC before. The doorman, Jason, was very helpful with getting my bags out of the taxi and helping bring them to the desk where I met Fjolla, Justin, and Sarah. Such a friendly group of people! Check in was so smooth, and the room was perfect for everything I needed. Iliana was very helpful with rooftop recommendations, since unfortunately, the bar is closed at the moment.
Would definitely come back the next time I'm in the city.

title: NOT SAFE
text: DO NOT stay at this hotel if you value safety. No security measures in place. No key swipe on elevators to access rooms (so anyone off the street can access any floor), no doorman, no cross-reference check on any stated guests off the street attempting to gain access to a room, and lack of overall organization by the staff. As a single female traveler, I experienced two unidentified men attempting to break into my room through the lock using tools, even after I screamed through the door to walk away. Instead of walking away, they continued to attempt to break the lock, and also pulled the fire alarm on the floor to make me open the door. One of them stated he worked for the hotel as a maintenance worker and that this room belonged to someone else per the front desk. When I called the front desk to inquire, they stated they gave my hotel room key to another man who said he was my guest, after the front desk employee willingly told him my name, which I did not have any guests. Front desk never contacted me to ask if I had a guest before giving a room access key to a stranger. Thank GOD the key they gave him did not work, however, it is still a mystery to me as to how it got to the point of having a hotel maintenance worker attempt to then break the lock- after I yelled through the door to go away. I have never been so frightened. This was also my second hotel room, as the first one was warm/never cooled, and smelled like mildew. Manager response was not satisfactory on the entire incident. I checked out immediately and stayed at another hotel. I will never stay at this hotel again.

title: Da rivalutare la struttura
text:
Albergo con delle potenzialità in buona posizione purtroppo lasciato andare a se stesso. Camere piccole ma pulite e arredate abbastanza bene.
Colazione a buffet inclusa in terrazza decisamente da migliorare.  Appena sufficiente la scelta del cibo che presenta solo alimenti dolci. 
Ristorante dell’albergo in ristrutturazione.  Personale accogliente.

title: Great hotel, and management addresses concerns!
text:
UPDATED: The hotel very quickly and graciously resolved the issue after reading my review, so I've updated to 5 stars.  This hotel is fantastic and I'm glad they listen to and respond to feedback.  I would stay there again in a heartbeat!   

Original review:

We stayed for 3 nights in August 2023. The hotel itself is lovely. The rooms are small, but it's NYC, so that's to be expected. The bathroom is well-appointed, with dual rainshower faucets (one in the wall and one from above). Location is nice, it's on the east side and in a fairly quiet area, so street noise wasn't an issue. At night it was very quiet. There's also a lovely terrace on the 15th floor where continental breakfast was served, and you could take your food out to the tables and sit and look at the city view. This space was also open during the day, and we went out there a few times with a snack and just enjoyed the atmosphere. All in all, the hotel itself is quite lovely.

However, we did experience some issues during our short stay. We like to fall asleep to the TV and our TV would not connect to their cable/satellite system. We just continuously received an error message. I informed the staff of this each day of our stay and was always told someone would be coming to fix it "immediately," but it still wasn't working the day we checked out. This was a minor annoyance, particularly as I had to continue to bring it to their attention and was assured it would be fixed and never was. The MAJOR problem with our stay, though, was the A/C stopped working in the entire hotel. We came back late (like 1am) on our second night and I once again stopped to speak with the front desk about the TV, and during that conversation was informed that the A/C was out and they were hoping to fix it in the morning. The desk clerk did say that many people had already checked out because of it, but if we stayed we of course would be refunded/compensated for the inconvenience. Since it was 1am and we didn't want to try and pack all our stuff and scramble to find another place to stay on short notice, we opted to stay. It was a pretty brutal night. It had been very hot and humid in NYC that day and evening, and we watched the thermostat in our 17th floor room hit nearly 85. We had no ability to open windows to get any kind of breeze, so we basically just sweat it out all night and barely got any sleep. Thankfully the A/C was fixed while we were out all day the next day. We were able to sleep in icy cold comfort on our last night.

We checked out the next morning in a hurry to get to our train to Boston, and the receipt was sent to me. The reason I'm leaving this negative review is that upon reviewing the receipt later, we were never compensated/reimbursed for the terribly hot night. To be clear, we didn't ask for it, it was immediately offered by the desk clerk as she informed us of the broken A/C, and told us it would be automatically applied by the manager the next day. I feel we were pretty understanding of the situation. Things happen, A/Cs stop working. We get it. But to offer your guests compensation for the inconvenience and then not follow through is just bad hospitality. Coupled with the fact that I kept having to ask about the TV and it never getting fixed, I have to believe this hotel has service issues and the management team doesn't care. For this I'm leaving a negative review. Had my issues been handled appropriately, I'd be writing a glowing review. I would have happily returned to this hotel, as I really loved the convenience of the location (close to subways), how quiet it was, and how comfy the bed was. Plus that terrace really is a great amenity and one I would have looked forward to experiencing again. Unfortunately, service needs to be fixed and for that reason I don't think I would spend the money again. It's too bad because with excellent service this hotel would be a true gem in the city.

title: Overpriced
text:
The location is very good and right in the middle of New York and close to many attractions. 
There is no main restaurant apart from a new start up which was virtually empty when we were staying and is downstairs next to reception and more like a school canteen. Menu seems pretty basic. 
Breakfast mainly consists of pastries and is served with disposable plastic cups and plates and with plastic cutlery.
Service was ok but not very friendly.
I had the same conversation about breakfast being part of the booking more than once and finally had to ask the company I booked with to confirm this. Breakfast has no hot food and my wife and daughter did not go to breakfast after the first day. There is no coffee/tea in the rooms and I saw several people balancing cups of coffee in the lift to take up to their rooms from breakfast. 
Room was cleaned well but shower gels were not replaced every day. 
the Terrace on 15th floor is just an open space with no tea or coffee available. There is no night club in the basement. 
Better value for money for this could be found elsewhere, as effectively this was just a bed for the night. 
The bar a few doors down - Pando Park was excellent especially the service and they asked if we were from the Mondrian as many people find their way there to eat.

title: No facilities, shabby decor, not close to what a Mondrian should be.
text:
Not at all what I expect from a Mondrian or tbh any business hotel. The hotel is very average for the price. All hotels have gyms - the Mondrian does not. Not even a partnership nearby, when I asked I was given a list of nearby gyms - with some literally listing members only - useless. The Wifi is also terrible - sun 5mbps unless you ask at reception for the better wifi - it’s 2023 just give out the good wifi as standard. 

The rooftop bar is closed until further notice and is now just a members lounge for working. There is no onsite restaurant just some niche cafe. The decor is tired and the rooms very small even for new york standards. 

The location is good but that’s pretty much it. I’ve stayed in lots of hotels in the NoMad area - give this one a miss it’s a waste of cash.

title: Awesome stay!
text: The staff was friendly and amazing. The location is perfect, close to many great restaurants and events. The room offered a great view and was very comfortable. I would highly recommend. Shout out to Iliana, Gabe and Jose.

title: Highly recommend!
text: This lovely hotel was absolutely splendid for our girls trip to NYC on Easter long weekend. It was a beautiful quiet street but so close to walk to all the hot spots. Sarah, Jason, Iliana, and Justin provided excellent customer service as well. And all of the hotel staff were great too! We would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend.

title: Nice choice
text: Comfortable bed, good shower, fridge in the room. Good tv. Hard to find the hotel, poor signage. Very nice rooftop open for breakfast (no bar or snacks till further notice). Yogurt, juice, pastries and coffee. Waffles and bagels hard as rocks. What I really didn’t like is the $30 fee per room/night they stick onto the bill, on things that should be included in the room price. After reading the nightmare reviews on other locations, I’m happy with this place.  Not cheap, but nothing is in NYC. Very good location too, near great restaurants and shopping. Not a super touristy area.

title: non è un quattro stelle
text: Buon compromesso tra prezzo e qualità. posizione comoda a 10 minuti da gran central, vicino ad una stazione della metro, a due passi dall'Empire. camera di giuste dimensioni, e con letti comodi. la moquette a terra era macchiata come anche il piatto doccia e le tende. gli infissi lasciano entrare molto rumore anche se sei al piano 16 . La colazione è compresa (cosa rarissima a NY) ma lascia molto a desiderare. c'è il minimo sindacale. è un buon hotel ma non è un quattro stelle. Ultimo appunto (che però riguarda tutti gli hotel di NY cosiddetti di lusso, la facility fee è di fatto una tassa a loro favore. . alla fine del soggiorno oltre alle tasse si prendono una cifra a loro piacimento per generici servizi . naturalmente la cifra non si conosce al momento della prenotazione ma solo del saldo.

title: Good location in Manhattan.
text:
Good location to walk around and  use public transportations. 

Some facility problems through they tried to help out ASAP. ex. Wet Carpet, Lamp light bulb change, New towels and water bottles, Elevator..etc.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Wonderful experience at the hotel! Location was excellent, very central and convenient to everything. The staff was very courteous and friendly, and in particular Justin, Sarah and Fjolla went above and beyond and I am very grateful to them for making my stay memorable.

title: Best Experience in a Minute
text:
Just had the most amazing stay at the Mondrian on Park Ave! My friends and I took a little staycation for the weekend and chanced upon this hotel, since we love the area. From the moment we got in, we knew we made the right choice. Jacob at the front door helped us with our bags and brought us over to the desk where we encountered Marshall, Gabriel, and Iliana. The three of them were so welcoming and pleasant. We couldn't check in right away, but they stored our bags and gave is recommendations to go to Sarabeth's for breakfast which was delicious.
We came back and hung out on the terrace which had awesome views until we received a call from Gabriel letting us know we could check in early! We also got a free upgrade which was super kind.

The rooms were nice, and I'm sure once the restaurant opens, this hotel will really take off. The service alone was reason enough to come back, and I can't wait for another reason to stay in the city.

title: Horrible customer service
text: I tried to make a reservation.  I was given a price for a room and then asked if there are any parking specials.  I was told by Ashley that she needed to check.  She came back and told me that there was a rate that was different. When I calculated the price it was higher then if I got the original rate and added parking. I asked why she could not explain. I asked to speak to her manager, and Desiree answered the phone, when Desiree answered, she explained the same thing again that she did not know why. I asked if there was a difference. Her answer was let me explain it to you again and maybe you will be able to understand. I did not appreciate this response and then she hung up on me. I called the next day to speak to a manager at the hotel. I spoke to Gabe. He told me he is not able to do anything about those two since they work at the reservation center and not the hotel . He said he can book a hotel for me, but that’s all he can do. I asked him to book the hotel and add the parking again. He did not know why there was a difference. I asked him if I got there and added parking. Would I be able to do that . He said yes I then said I would like to add parking and he said he can’t do that. It cannot be done from the front desk. I then said I would like to do it now and he said he was able to do it. I said now for all of this aggravation, are you going to give me any kind of discount. I was on the phone for over an hour.  He was “trying to figure it out“. Then Amani picks up and says that there is nothing they can do. I again asked to speak to Gabe and was put on hold. When I finally hung up after an hour of being on hold and speaking to somebody for maybe 10 minutes total they answered the phone seven different times and hung up directly on me. At one point somebody answered the phone and yelled gibberish into the phone and then hung up. I called back, and Gabe finally answered and pretended he did not know me and did not know the situation. When I reminded him who I am, he said that they are extremely busy and couldn’t speak to me about it and there is nothing they can do , when I asked to speak to a manager, he said he is the only manager available when I asked to speak to the front desk manager she is not there when I asked to speak to the GM. I was told not only does he not have an extension or a way to leave a voicemail, but he is on vacation to  Gabe, then put me on hold again and left me on hold for more than 10 minutes when I finally hung up, do not waste your time at this hotel

title: Nice base for a family stay
text:
I was a bit nervous about our stay and nearly csncelled after reading the reviews but we’ve enjoyed our stay. As a family of four, the rooms are a bit on smaller size but it’s New York! The bathroom was plenty big enough and for all the time we spent here, absolutely fine! 
Standard of rooms again was all good for us. Only quibble is outside noise as were on a lower level but again, it’s standard for the city. Great location, central but away from the hectic areas. Summer Streets was on while we were here so Park Ave was closed off to vehicles over the weekend which was amazing as we could step outside the hotel and walk direct to Brooklyn bridge or uptown on the same street with cyclists, runners and walkers. Few more dates for august so worth checking out as a great atmosphere.
Again, I was worried about the breakfast but really good choice, and although not always working properly, there are toasters which are perfect for warming the bagels and waffles! Definitely plenty of food to fill up on for the day and absolutely stunning views on the terrace, can’t think of a better location to eat breakfast. There are some room for improvements don’t get me wrong but for a base that is perfectly comfortable at a fair price for Manhattan, it was good for us.

title: Amazing!
text: Great!!!!! Loved it here. I had the pleasure of being assisted by Fjolla at the front desk during my recent stay, and I must say her service was exceptional. From the moment I walked in, she was incredibly attentive and went out of her way to ensure I had a smooth check-in experience. Her warm demeanor and genuine concern for my comfort made me feel right at home. I was truly impressed by her professionalism and dedication to her role. Thanks to Fjolla’s outstanding service, my stay got off to a wonderful start, and I left feeling extremely satisfied. In fact, I’m already looking forward to my next visit, largely because of the fantastic impression she made. Kudos to this location for having amazing staff, and clean rooms. 10/10 recommend staying here.

title: Needs a Refresh
text:
I recently stayed at the Mondrian on Park Avenue, and while the staff were pleasant and eager to help, the hotel itself and particularly the rooms were in need of some attention. The professional photos here on TripAdvisor look nothing like it does in real life and cannot have been from the last 5-10 years. 

The room I stayed in had very visible signs of wear and tear, which detracted from the overall experience. I've attached photos to show the extent of the wear: hole in the glass shower, chipped sink, missing curtains, highly damaged bedside table. While the location is convenient, I was disappointed that the hotel is listed as a 4-star property when it clearly falls short of that standard. In its current state, it feels more like a 3-star hotel at best. The hotel needs major updates and renovations.

title: Location, friendly and professional staff, clean and spacious rooms, great location
text: Spacious clean room, two blocks away to the center of Fifth Avenue and decent rates. I want to thank Marshall Waespy for his prompt correspondence and meeting all our requirements prior to our arrival.

title: Thank you staff
text: We had a great stay. The staff are super helpful and accommodating.  thank you Justin and staff for being so amazing! The room is a good size and we enjoyed the rooftop view as well!! We will deff be in the city again after having a great stay !!!!!!!

title: Super hospitable - well located, great valye
text:
The staff were SUPER accomodating and welcoming from the minute we booked. Ensured a superior room, early check-in, etc.

The room was large for NYC, clean bathroom, decent amenities. It is also well located as you are a 10 minute cab from both the Upper East Side as well as Soho area. We walked both, which took about 30 minutes.

I would definitely stay here again!

title: Dream NYC get away.
text: The front of house and housekeeping staff were exceptional. They welcomed us latent with baggage out of the midday heat. They were always kind. The room was spacious, clean, and impeccably styled. I will seek out Mondrian hotels for future travel.

title: Awesomeeeeeeeeeee
text: The beds are sooooo good and the staff is very helpful and nice Jason and Gabriel were super nice and helpful. The bathrooms are very clean and the hotel in general is very nice. The location is amaizing.

title: Wonderful!!!
text: The staff at this hotel were unbelievably lovely. Justin, Jacob, Lee and Iliana were by far the most welcoming and friendly staff. I will definitely stay at the Mondrian again when I come back to NYC.

title: Excelente localização
text:
Quarto com bom tamanho, cama muito confortável e um bom chuveiro. Excelente localização a poucas quadras do metrô, é possível ir caminhando para várias atrações da cidade.
Único ponto de melhoria é referente ao café da manhã.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Just spent three great night at the Mondrian. We had booked a premier king but we were upgraded to a balcony suite. Huge sitting area by NY standards with amazing views and a comfy bed. Bathroom was stellar with a rain shower and heated floors. The continental breakfast was a good way to start the morning before heading out. One small complaint is that they could use a toaster to heat up the bagels and the waffles. The front desk was very helpful especially Zoila and Gabriel. Highly recommend you stay here on your trip to NYC!

title: Highly recommended!
text:
Enjoyed my stay of several days.  I’ve stayed in many hotels in NYC over the years.  The Mondrian is a smaller “boutique” hotel in a great location. 
Most importantly, the staff was exceptionally friendly and attentive.  Kudos to Sarah, Lee, Gabriel and Jason!

title: Excellent location and excellent service
text:
I made two business trips to New York in May of this year, and after my first stay at the Mondrian I booked immediately for the second trip.
The hotel is clean, the rooms are lovely, and quiet, the location suited my needs excellently - and there are lots of restaurants, clubs and bars nearby. The Continental breakfast on the upstairs terrace was completely delightful and the ambiance there left room for conversations with other guests and travelers from around the world. 
Helping with my late check-in (delayed flight) and with everything else I needed (baggage, photocopying, spare phone charger, etc.) was an attentive staff all of whom deserve praise: Iliana, Moises, Sarah, Justin, Lee, Jacob and Luis. 
This is a terrific place for families, for tourists and for business travelers like myself. 
I will book again on my next trip to New York.
ps. The artwork in the rooms 'mirrors' Piet Mondrian's modernist designs.

title: Nice and quiet with a splash of great service.
text: Service is excellent, very reliable. Slept well .. which is hard to find in nyc ! Location is great for work, easy to get to Airport via train. I found the room to very clean, the front desk was beyond nice. I’ll stay again. Not a party place., but great if you have boo with you.. and plenty of spots to eat and drink at.

title: Trip ruined by lack of customer service.
text: The stay was fine. I do feel like the hotel should inform you that there is no mini bar, no room service, and no restaurant on site. The rooms are also very shabby and it was very hard to get your room serviced when staying for a long time. the hotel and the rooms look nothing like the images - they are extremely old pictures or stock imagery. The front service were very friendly on check in and check out, unfortunately the wrong card was used for my taxes and there are two charges on my card which still go unexplained even though ive emailed repeatedly to swtich over the card for the charges and ot find out what the additional charges are and im now being ignored. when you call you get told to call the front desk number and the front desk number nobody answers or they hang up. The worst customer service and im super frustrated and this has ruined what was otherwise a great trip to NYC

title: Recommended stay
text: We had a fantastic stay, despite encountering issues with the Chromecast and a few lightbulbs that needed replacing. The room provided ample space for our family of four, and we were thoroughly impressed with the efficient and attentive service from the staff, particularly Justin Lee and Luis, who were incredibly friendly and helpful. The level of customer service was exceptional. The breakfast selection was extensive, although it lacked options with meat and eggs. All in all, our stay was absolutely wonderful. Near Korean town and Empire State Building.

title: Welcoming well kept property
text:
Justin and Sara, the front desk representatives were wonderful! They were very friendly, helpful and made our stay feel very welcoming. 

Hotel is in a great location. Would stay again based on the friendly staff.

title: Lovely Hotel in Central Location
text: I travelled from Scotland with my husband and stayed at the amazing Mondrian Park Avenue Hotel in NYC, in June, for the wedding of one of our daughters, and it was a great base for sightseeing. The staff were very friendly. We had a lovely, bright, spacious corner room with a fridge on 8th floor, conveniently across from my daughter, the bride. We loved  the beautiful bar and roof terrace and breakfast on the terrace. Housekeeping staff were very attentive. We also enjoyed the location, with subways, bars, eateries close by. We were able to leave luggage here after checking out, for a last wander round, before leaving for the airport. If we return to NYC, we would stay here again. Thank you, Justin, Gabriel and all Mondrian staff for our stay.

title: A nice stay
text: The front desk staff at The Mondrian were absolutely wonderful, in particular the incredible Justin who was friendly, highly professional and sweet. Housekeeping came way too late each day at 4pm but otherwise a great stay at The Mondrian.

title: Aloha, from Oahu,Hawaii
text:
During my stay in the beautiful New York City at the Mondrian on Park Avenue, customer service and hotel satisfaction were met through the “T”.  The professionalism and wonderful front desk employees to be mentioned to include specifically as follows: *Lee,Jacob, and Gabriel, were nothing but helpful and very informative. I will definitely be staying here again in my future endeavors to New York City.
 Mahalo(thank you) to the team and front door staff, as well as hotel services and a wonderful happy hour at the terrace. 

* Tip* - Consider the room upgrade, very affordable, and very convenient after a long flight.

Mahalo(thank you)
Wiljohn Ho

title: Mondrian Park Avenue/Friendly, Warm Service
text: I stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue recently and wanted to praise Justin at the front desk. I stay there often and not only does he always greet me with a friendly smile and warm hello but he also happily helps me with any of the many various issues that come up with my work. The Mondrian Park Avenue is lucky to have him as the first face you see when you check in and during your stay!

title: This used to be a nice hotel
text: Understaffed, power in the room didn’t work, valet took 30 + minutes, door to balcony wouldn’t stay closed, shower only had one temperature, breakfast is embarrassing, place feels super neglected. It used to be a nice hotel but it’s now an absolute disaster. Avoid it.

title: Don’t be fooled by the images and name..
text:
Don’t be fooled by the images on Trip Advisor. The Mondrian Park Ave lobby looks nothing like this and the restaurant is no longer open. Breakfast was included with the room, but they really shouldn’t have bothered. It was a sad display of day stale baked goods (donut balls, mini muffins, bagels cut in half) whole fruits (apples, oranges and bananas), orange juice, pots of sugary kids cereals and flavoured low fat yogurts - all served on plastic plates and cups. It all felt very temporary and badly planned. Not what you would expect from this hotel group. 
The bedrooms and bathrooms were thankfully clean and mostly quiet, but we needed to ask couple of times for additional towels, and toiletries were never refilled or replaced when empty. It seemed hard for them to grasp that there were three of us in the room. 
I wouldn’t recommend this hotel unless you are looking for 4 star rooms with 1 star amenities.

title: Not worth the effort
text: We had a confirmed reservation booked through Delta. When we arrived on Memorial Day weekend, we were told they couldn't find our reservation. They offered us a room at twice the price. Never going to stay here. They're credit card processing system was down, another guest was trying to get a room and they wouldn't give her one because they couldn't run the charge on her card because their system was down. Pretty inept.

title: Avoid
text: Terrible service - rude front desk that hangs up on you.  Toilet paper is like sand paper.  No hot water kettle, slippers, or other basics you would expect from the Mondrian.   If not for the location this place would be out of business like the restaurant downstairs.   Avoid.

title: Amazing staff, basic spot
text:
Thanks for the stay! Although the hotel is basic , in that no water in the room, no room service,
the young vibrant front office staff is gold!
Thanks to Jason , Justin, Gabrielle,Sarah, Moises! You were amazing. 
The lady at the breakfast was super friendly and hospitable too.

title: Great Trip
text: First trip to New Yorkwith my two sons, hotel was excellent, staff were friendly and helpfull, rooms were clean,and comfortable,vey good shower,great location, would definetly stay again and would definetly recommend to others.

title: 4 star!  Really???   This hotel is no way a 4 star hotel!!
text: This hotel is really not 4 star standard.  I’d say 2 star with frilly knickers.  The bedroom to be fare was comfortable enough but needed closed in storage and an update.  The bathroom looked newish but shelves in bad places where my husband bashed his head over the toilet and cut it open.  Breakfast ha ha well if you like over ripe bananas and fruit plonked on a tray halved stale bagels plastic cutlery???? 4 star???? The staff were very pleasant though and the poor girl on bar was very embarrassed when I asked for coffee and she couldn’t serve me one as it was only for breakfast???  A good job it wasn’t raining in NY I’d end up getting a flight elsewhere!

title: My stay at the mandarin hotel park Avenue
text: My friends and I stayed at the mandarin Park Avenue hotel, staff Shontaye assisted us with our stay . She  told us about what was in the area such as entertainment, she was very pleasant and informative

title: Zentrales Hotel ohne eigenes Frühstück
text:
Das Mondrian Park Avenue in New York ist sehr gut gelegen und für einen Städtetrip absolut geeignet.
Bei der Ankunft wurden wir von einen super netten Rezeptionisten empfangen. Wir hatten 2 Zimmer bestellt und nachdem Check In sind wir auf die Zimmer gegangen. Ein Zimmer war leider sehr laut und beim anderen Zimmer fehlten die Gardinen. Wir haben dies direkt an der Rezeption gesagt und der freundliche Mitarbeiter hat uns direkt zwei andere Zimmer gegeben, diese waren deutlich besser. Insgesamt ist der Stil schon modern aber hier und da könnte bisschen renoviert werden. Frühstück gab es leider im Hotel keins, dafür durfte man in einem kleinen Cafe um die Ecke frühstücken. Das Essen dort war sehr lecker und auch das Personal freundlich.
Im Hotel war während unseres Aufenthaltes alles bestens. Bei Check Out sind wir auf einen nicht so freundlichen Mitarbeiter gestoßen. Dieser war sehr hochnäsig und unfreundlich, dies hat das Gesicht des Hotels total verändert und ist wirklich schade, dass man mit diesem Eindruck abreisen musste. 
Alles in allem für New York ok.

Had such an amazing experience last month at the Mondrian Park Avenue. The check-in experience with Justin and Iliana was the perfect example of hospitality. They were so friendly and were able to answer all of my questions. The room was very clean, and the rooftop bar had great cocktails with awesome views. Definitely recommend and will be back!

title: Tired and past its best
text:
This is one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. We stayed here exactly one year ago and it was like a different hotel entirely.
The room we were given had a view of a brick wall despite us asking for a room with a view of the street.  The aircon was broken, the tv was broken (it took maintenance 3 attempts to fix it), the mini bar was empty and not plugged in. When I took a shower the door jammed shut and could not be opened from inside the shower. My husband had to wrench the door open from the other side.
Worse still was breakfast which was staggering in its awfullness. Stale bagels, waffles in plastic bags, plastic cutlery and hand towels from the bathroom instead of napkins. There was no toaster to try to revive the bagels or anything hot on offer. A year ago we were given vouchers for a fantastic coffee shop around the corner with a full breakfast menu. 
There are also no tables to sit at so guests are expected to sit in armchairs and balance plastic plates on their laps. Breakfast is served in the bar and we would have been happy to sit at the bar itself had it not been for a sign saying ‘DO NOT APPROACH THE BAR’.
After I complained I was told that that was a standard continental breakfast which is frankly an insult to both my intelligence and everyone on the continent.
We were moved to the suite we had a year ago which was an improvement but I immediately noticed that the coffee machine that was in the room had been removed as had the kettle and complimentary tea, coffee and milk.
The overall feeling is that this hotel is closing imminently. The Hotel restaurant is now permanently closed and  the receptionist was telling people that it was up for sale.
The Mondrian Park Avenue is tired and neglected. Its a shadow of its former self and an embarrassment to other Mondrians around the world.

title: Great stay at the Mondrian
text: Had a great stay at the Mondrian.  It started at the front desk with Sarah who was just lovely.  She went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.  All the employees were top notch and very friendly.  The terrace bar was a real treat and the bartender was great as well.  Our room was really fantastic with a great view from the 19th floor.   Very spacious and very nicely decorated with an upscale, modern vibe.

title: Amazing staff, beautiful rooms, great views and a nice rooftop bar....the perfect hotel!
text:
I had the best hotel experience I've ever had so far at the Mondrian Park Avenue thanks to Justin and Moises who were upfront when I arrived. Stellar service and I was treated to a free upgrade, which I've never received before. They even gave us a complimentary drink as we had to wait for our room, which was so brief that they honestly did not have to comp us drinks but they did anyways. That honestly made me feel special. Having just flown from Seattle the previous night I was exhausted and everything they did just made me super happy, appreciative and semi speechless. I felt famous haha =) 

The drinks and views from the Terrace bar and rooftop were really good. We got some beautiful pictures of the city and the same can be said from our room, which was a balcony suite. The shower was also really nice and big and I loved the rainfall showerhead.

Getting around was also really easy and convenient as the subway was just a block and a half up the street. 

I could say a whole lot more but I'm sure you get the gist. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and definitely plan to book again and for longer my next visit to NYC. 

Thanks again to Justin and Moises and all the staff for making my stay so wonderful!

title: My daughter, my friends & l had a nice time, very much enjoyed the terrace, and the location was great!
text:
Had an issue with ants on my bed/ in the room and originally was only offered a change of linens from the inspector. I called the front desk and was immediately given a new upgraded room. 

At checkout, there was a mixup regarding the bill, but the employees handled it quickly and were very friendly throughout the situation. Iliana, Sarah, Jason & Jacob should be commended for great service!

title: Amazing stay
text: Fjolla Justin and Iliana were the highlights of my stay! Wonderful check in process and a mixture of great personalities. Coco from the rooftop bar had impeccable service as well. Will definitely be coming back to this property for my New York stay!

title: Just Okay
text:
Great location, just okay amenities. No bellhop service, rooms are a decent size for New York. Updated decor & super clean. There’s no restaurant so room service isn’t a thing. Rooftop bar was nice.  Now the most luxurious but it gets the job done. 
I would stay again for sure.

title: Sarah Jason and Justin..DREAM TEAM
text: My stay was short but sweet. Great location, nice rooftop area. Staff is amazing as well! From the time I pulled up…Jason was there to greet me and assisted with valet. He even walked me to the front desk where Sarah pleasantly greeted me. Sarah, Jason and Justin were such a pleasure. Justin I encountered ar checkout and he was a pleasure also. I heard him in the phone being so generous with another client. Great customer service really brightens the day. Wow very helpful, attentive, pleasant and just marvelous. Can’t wait to come back!!

title: Great
text: Justin made the check in easy and was very pleasant. The room was very clean and well decorated. I’ll be staying here again!  The TV is new and has all the channels needed too. Location is close to everything

title: A great time at the Mondrian. We will be back!
text: Our stay was delightful from reception to checkout because of Gabriel and Jacob at the reception desk. Ardi and KoKo at the Rooftop Terrace made us feel welcomed and cared-for. And soo much fun! Thanks to everyone for a great stay

title: anniversary stay
text: Wonderful staff, Hosam Gabriel and Jason welcomed us very warmly and ensured we had a great room for our anniversary! The continental breakfast on the terrace has great view. Rooms are a bit worn but the staff is awesome!

title: Spring into Action
text: Good Location although the hotel is very basic. No tea or coffee facilities in your room and continental breakfast was basic. We went out most mornings. The hotel has complimentary access to the New York sports club facilities which was convenient and in walking distance. Reception staff were friendly but for the price we paid for accomodation I would expect more for the dollar. There is a nice terrace on 15th floor for evening drinks. It was just ok!

title: Super!
text: Each stay is great, comfortable experience! Thanks so much to the front desk crew, Shian, Shontae, Gabe, Jacob and Justin for being so courteous and accommodating. Will be back again!   Very recommended!

title: Staff accommodation to guests
text: The staff was absolutely delightful and very accommodating. Easy access to transportation, clean rooms, quiet area, fast WiFi, continental breakfast is a plus. I will definitely come back to stay on my next trip to NY.

title: March Business Trip
text: The rooms were very comfortable! It had the perfect amount of space for me. The bathroom was really nice as well with the overhead shower. I loved the style of the hotel with its decor. And the bar was very nice!

title: Brilliant stay
text: Just returned from a brilliant few days at the Mondrian. Check in was super easy room good size and clean.  Lovely rooftop bar and location perfect. I would like to say a big thank you to Justin Shiay Gabriel & Jacob on reception who helped us with any bookings of restaurants etc very friendly and helpful.  I will definitely return.

title: Great service needs bathrobes
text:
The service at the Mondrian is what keeps me coming back. On this trip, Gabriel, Justin, Jason and Iliana were all so kind, informed and productive. 

Hotel though needs to stock bath robes!!!! That would add a lot.

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff
text:
I had a great experience at the Mondrian. The rooms are gorgeous and very spacious. The staff treated us like royalty. I highly recommend this hotel. It’s in a great location. This is a hidden gem in NYC.
I can’t wait to return.

title: Highly recommend
text: Great hotel! Gabriel was great, made sure I was comfortable with my stay, he was very professional and made sure I had everything I needed. Definitely would recommend and I will be booking this hotel for my next stay.

title: Best front desk staff ever!!!
text: The front desk staff - Sarah, Shian, Gabriel & Justin - were the most caring and amazing we’ve ever experienced. They embraced our 7 year old daughter and made her feel like a princess and part of the family. Sarah put a Valentine’s Day bag of presents for her. When food we ordered on a delivery app never arrived, they went and brought food so my husband didn’t have to leave our daughter in the room alone. Above and beyond! Thank you.

title: Quiet and artistic
text: Front desk service was attentive, requests for accommodations were met quickly. Sarah and Lee are phenomenal workers. If you go here I hope, they are the ones you get to be greeted by! Would stay here again:)

title: Consistent and reliable
text: Guest service was extremely helpful!  Gabriel, Justin, Lee & Jason all were so nice and made our stay extra special.  This hotel is a go to if you need something consistent and you travel a lot for work.

title: Mondrian Park Avenue
text: The staff were lovely. The sheets were high quality. The owner of this hotel has not kept up with capital improvements. Decrepit balcony chair, chips in sink edge (3), improper distance from faucet to bathroom light fixture. It came with breakfast the first day but then did not the next. Really weird. The location was fine. Lots of dust on curtains and air vent. Heat was too much and you could not adjust it. Balcony view of buildings not Central Park. No ice bucket or ice machine-but you can call for it. Not even a chair to sit in -yet the online picture has it as having a loveseat. Would not return.

title: AMAZING!!! Best Hotel Experience
text:
Staying at the Mondrian is an unmatched NYC experience. The location, cleanliness and rooms will make any trip to the city feel like more of a vacation and less like a trip. The customer service is the best I have yet to find in the city. Gabriel, Justin, and Jacob made my stay delightful. They were beyond accommodating and I felt that I was a true guest at the Mondrian, something I haven’t felt at any hotel in the city ever. There was an issue on my end when I checked in and they were extremely helpful while the issue was being resolved and in the time waiting told me all the “must eat” places in the area. ( which were on point) I stayed for 5 days and every time I returned to the lobby I was greeted by a warm welcome and I felt that this staff truly cared about my day and my stay. This hotel has a beautiful terrace for breakfast, gym access, spacious for NYC rooms, and the location is unbeatable. 25 min from LGA and 10 min for Penn or Grand Central, you can get anywhere you need quickly. 

I would stay here again for the staff experience alone. Thanks Gabriel, Jacob, and Justin - you made my week :)

title: A hidden gem in NYC
text: Me and my family decided to take a trip to NYC coming from California. And I can say the front desk has been so friendly and welcoming to me and my family! We love the hospitality that was received from Lee , Gabriel, Justin and Jacob. They went above and beyond with making sure everything from beginning to the end of our stay was perfect! And the breakfast on the terrace was lovely. I recommended this place anytime and we will definitely be back the next time we come to NYC! Thank you Mondrian team for treating us like family

title: Bad experience - not a 5 star
text:
We checked into the hotel and the staff were friendly and the hotel seemed fairly nice. When we got to the 3rd floor room, it was kind of on the small side but fine for our needs. Then it all went downhill..we were woken up at 3am from garbage trucks smashing bottles outside. The windows were very thin and you could literally hear everything!

We finally got back to sleep and woke up to a dripping water sound coming from the bathroom. It got worse over time and we realised the ceiling was leaking through the light and vent above the toilet and the floor was filling up with dirty water.

We spoke to front desk who apologised and told us they will move us to a new room (also on a higher floor because of the street noise). We were given 2 free drinks tokens as an apology.

We went out for the day and came back to our new room. The new room was a shoe box and absolutely tiny. We had somehow been downgraded because of the leak in the last room. So despite the annoyance of having to move, we then lose out on room size too.

To make matters worse, I went to use the shower and felt hair on my face, I pulled this off and it was a very long hair (definitely not my own) then I looked at the wall and there was just a big clump of long hairs stuck to the shower wall - it was absolutely disgusting! There is absolutely no way the shower had been cleaned before us as you couldn’t miss it (photo attached to this). The rest of the room felt very dirty too.

Regardless of the terrible experience above, this hotel is definitely not a 5 star hotel. It’s pushing on 2.5. I have no idea how it got a 5 star rating - there’s no restaurant, no gym, a shoddy bar, poor amenities in the room and just a general dirty/run down feel.

I stay in New York all the time and I’ve been to much better and cleaner hotels.

title: Overpriced and disappointing
text: Very tiered, old hotel, with stained carpets, crumpled wallpaper, no minibar, no toiletries (cotton pads, dental kit etc), no complementary drinking water (they will charge you 5$ for 300ml spring water). The window overlooking wall, with practically no sunlight. Don’t be fooled by styled website photos. Overpriced and disappointing.

title: 5 stars!!
text: Let me start off by saying What an amazing location but what made this experience the best was the staff OMG!! Gabriel was the best! He checked me and my friends in and let us know about the amazing breakfast at blank slate!! That welcoming smile Gabriel had as soon as we walked in made us feel right at home! Look forward to staying there again!

title: Would give them 6 stars but is not possible
text:
Just returned from the best staycation and birthday I've ever had after staying at the Mondrian Park Avenue, and this was THE BEST STAY IN NEW YORK IN MANY YEARS!!! I usually don't leave reviews of hotels in the city because I've never felt inspired to do so, but after my incredible stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue, it just did not sit right for me not to leave one. After a long day, I arrived and felt the most welcomed by Rachel, Iliana, and Shian, and let me tell you, these women were outstanding! I've never had a more unique and enjoyable check-in experience at any hotel in the city. We talked, we laughed, and I was given the most amazing room, with a balcony facing the city's most beautiful and genuine view. Upon my arrival at the room, I was surprised by Sarah's nicest message of wishes, which greeted me as I entered the room, elevating the experience even more. Gabriel immediately assisted me in the morning. He handed me the voucher and guided me to the nearby breakfast/coffee establishment. Thanks to Shian, who was delightful and helpful during my stay, I had the most seamless and convenient checkout since I was permitted to check out an hour later. I'd also want to thank Leeangie, Iliana, and Rachel for their recommendations for restaurants and genuine recommendations for things to do in the area. I can't say enough nice things about this stay. This was one of the most enjoyable stays I've had in the city. Thank you so much for making it so unique!!!
I look forward to seeing you again soon!!!

title: MVP Justin!
text: I had such a lovely stay and I can mostly put that down to the front of house team member Justin, by far the most helpful and friendliest I've ever encountered in all my travels. From such a lovely greeting on day one, to on my last day leaving I nearly missed my flight but he helped me get checked out and in a car so efficiently I made it just in time! You're a gem! thank you!

title: No hot water no heat no tv
text: Room was tight. Nice balcony with park ave view. No hot water, no heat and no tv. None were working properly. Had to be moved to another room 11pm at night. Was told id receive 25% refund. Hope i get it. Ac/heat is way to loud. Nowhere near 5 star. More like 3 at best. Would not recommend.

title: My NYC happy place…
