text: There are many choices in NYC… When I arrive at The Mondrian I feel like Im home! Hosam, Gabriel, Jason and Justin greet me like Im family! The hotel is understated but very comfortable and centrally located. The rooms are practical, cozy and quiet.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text:
I had the pleasure of staying at the Mondrian Hotel during the holiday rush :) It can be the most challenging season to book and definitely a hassle to receive some level of additional support services while in town. To prepare, I called before booking my stay and shout out to the guest services agent, Shian, who was very knowledgeable of the area, room options, activities and proximity to the theater district. Upon arrival, the staff was warm and welcoming which was exactly what anyone would want. Honestly, that lovely woman deserves a raise on the continued display of patience and care alone! This made my stay an easy 10/10. 

If you have the pleasure of being greeted by Shian be sure to remember I told you here first! 

Thank you again!

title: Mondrian Park
text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Mondrian Park Avenue, while checking in we met Rachel at the front desk… she was absolutely amazing. She made us both feel comfortable and welcome. She was accommodating and very pleasant. I will definitely book another stay at the Park Avenue location again.

title: Mondrian Park Avenue
text:
I stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue  for one night and had a wonderful time. The rooms are beautifully decorated, clean, and welcoming. The bed was so comfortable I was saddened that my visit was so brief. Breakfast included in the price at a neighborhood restaurant was above and beyond. Upon my arrival, the front desk staff Gabriel, Jacob, and Lee were amazing. While on-site parking was not available all, they offered valet service at a nominal price considering the location. Melanie. W.

title: Perfect Weekend
text: I had a fantastic experience. Great room, great price, perfect location. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, particularly Sarah, Rachel, and Jacob. Special thanks to them all. I will definitely stay at The Mondrian again.

title: Can't wait to go back!!!!
text:
Just returned from New York after staying at the Mondrian Park Avenue and I have to say this was THE BEST STAY I have had in New York in many, many years!!! title: Our honest opinion!
text:
I’m not usually one to post reviews, but felt the need to do so for my time at the Mondrian just because we have been nervous to stay here following reading recent reviews, so thought we’d give our honest opinion of our stay here to help others who may have felt similar to us before staying. 

We had booked to stay at the Mondrian across New Years as we’ve stayed at the one in London earlier in the year and absolutely loved it. Unfortunately Park Avenue isn’t to the same level of standard that we have experienced at their other property. Whilst it has a 5 star hotel status, I would personally class this more than a 3/4 star hotel, for the reasons we experienced including…
- Lack of decent facilities in the room, including iron and coffee making facilities. We also struggled with lack of towels the first couple of nights, and had to go down to reception/call a couple of times in order to get some more for the room
- There were minimal toiletries left in the room, of which when staying at a 5 star property you would expect this to all be there for you at your disposal. We were left to needing to go out to purchase shower gel as all that was left in the room for us was a small bottle of shampoo
- The room also had several cracks in bathroom and mirrors across the wardrobe, it could do with a update 
- The overall daily clean of the room wasn’t to a huge standard, but we did get new towels daily
- They state breakfast is included, however as you may have read in previous reviews you get a voucher for a local breakfast cafe around the corner. This does not bother me, but they only give you $10 credit to spend per person and all of the food is a minimum of $12-15 in the store, so you would always need to be contributing your own cash in order to get anything, especially when you then also order a coffee on top. 

That said, we still really enjoyed our time here and want to highlight how helpful all of the staff have been during our stay!

title: Great Service and Friendly staff
text: When we got to the hotel, Sarah and Afiya were very welcoming and interested in our plans. We got checked in quickly.  We had an issue with our TV picture and it was fixed very quickly. The staff was great throughout our stay with anything we needed. Upon departure, Gabriel and Justin were helpful and we were sad to go.  Had a great time, and the staff made us feel very taken care.

title: Perfect

😘

title: Mondrian Park Ave
text: Great staff and location. Very attentive and friendly staff. Front desk offered perks and great surrounding recommendations . Room was clean and beds were comfortable. Definitely would stay again. Easy walking to vegan cafe as well

title: Great location and very pleasant
text: Great situated hotel the location was near to lots of touristy areas and places, close to a lot of subways which are easy to use if you take the time to understand them prior to your trip, room had a brilliant view and very comfy and big bed on the 19th floor. Only thing to let it down was - room didn’t get cleaned on the first full day, phone to call reception was broken, only had one towelling robe and asked reception three times for another but didn’t get one till the final night, no coffee for the coffee machine which also didn’t work. Other than that it was super trendy and exactly like it’s pictures online.

title: The staff make this place
text: I love this place. The staff are great, “really good people” as they say in NY.  I’ve just had my 3rd business trip there in 3 months and I plan to keep it as my regular. As NY hotels go it’s pretty quiet and the location works well. It doesn’t have the trimmings of the 5* hotels - you kind of have to take it as it comes. But it has grown on me and - again - the staff are awesome. They give it almost a family feel.

title: 5 star service!!
text: This hotel is good hotel for NYC. Clean and safe. However, their people is where they shine! The manager Rachel in particular made this a standout stay. She and the rest of the staff went above and beyond consistently. I'll definitely come back just because of them.

title: Gute Lage, gutes Zimmer, aber enttäuscht von Freundlichkeit, Kommunikation, Frühstück und Sauberkeit.
text:
Nicht gehaltene Versprechen!
Bezüglich der Freundlichkeit muss sich mindestens ein Teil des Personals noch entwickeln. Dies gilt auch für die schriftliche Kommunikation. 
Ich habe in diesem 5-Stern-Hotel (via Booking.com) mit „Breakfast included“ gebucht. Es gab aber kein Frühstück im Hotel, „…das Restaurant ist vorübergehend geschlossen.“ Man speiste uns mit einem 20-Dollar-Voucher ab, den wir in einem Frühstückslokal auf der anderen Seite des gleichen Blocks einlösen konnten. Aber für 20 Dollar kann man sich in New York nicht mal für eine Person ein Frühstück kaufen! Die Politik des Hotels ist in diesem Punkt inakzeptabel. 
Wir hatten vorgängig keine Information oder Warnung bekommen, sonst hätte ich auf jeden Fall das Hotel gewechselt. 
Auch mussten wir feststellen, dass es den auf der Website des Hotels als gratis innerhalb eines 15-Block-Umkreises den Gästen zu Verfügung stehend angepriesene Hotel-Wagen (ein Lincoln), gar nicht existiert. 
Ausserdem waren wir von der Sauberkeit im ansonsten schönen Zimmer nicht restlos überzeugt. Und, sehr störend, die Heizungslüftung setzt sporadisch ein und ist dann so laut, dass man jedes Mal aus dem Schlaf hochschreckt.

title: Ruim
text:
Hotel horrível. Não tem café da manhã, sempre fazemos questão de nos hospedar em hotéis com café da manhã, esse dizia que tinha, portanto pagamos por isso. Foi uma surpresa quando nos informaram que o café era servido em um restaurante na outra esquina, com um voucher de 20 dólares por dia, e uma cidade onde uma xícara de café custa 5 dólares… dá pra tomar dois cafés e uma torrada em duas pessoas…  Quarto apertado, carpete sujo, banheiro que cheirava a marijuana em alguns horários do dia, janela do quarto que não fechava, ou seja, vento frio entrando a noite toda…
Péssima experiência, não recomendo a ninguém… não é 5 estrelas de jeito nenhum!

title: Great experience at The Mondrian Park Avenue
text: Fantastic experience at this property! Specifically Gabriel, Marshall and Justin provided consistent high quality service along with Jacob on front door service. Great location as well, we will use this property again.

title: Great hotel, great location, great staff!!
text: Perfect location for a trip to NYC! So easy to get to all uptown and downtown sights! I was very pleasantly surprised at how spacious the rooms were for such a centrally located Manhattan location. Special shout out to Jacob, Lee, Gabrel and Sarah for their hospitality :) !!

title: Wonderful experience!!!!
text: My best friend and I did a girls trip we stayed here for the weekend. The room was clean, the service was great! Gabriel was so helpful and polite. Great staff and a restaurant downstairs. Wonderful location we got breakfast at Lennwich across the street for breakfast. Lots of shops and food near by. Subway entrance nearby. Can’t wait to go back!!!

title: Not a five star hotel.
text: This is not a five star hotel. I had a "deluxe king" but there was nothing deluxe about it. The room and bathroom were tiny, even by NYC standards and looked nothing like the website picture, nor does the lobby. AC reved up like an airplane taking off and smoke alarm emitted a constant strobe light. Neither good for sleep. Bed cover was two sheets with a mattress cover in between them. Rug was soggy from minibar leak. Rug in hallway remained dirty for all 3 days I was there. Towels were thin and small. No food was available in the hotel. They offered $20 vouchers for breakfast at a cafe about a block away. Cafe was pleasant but required a 15 minute wait in line to order OK food. Way overpriced for value.

title: Very disappointed.
text:
Where do I start?

The only positives were the front desk staff and the location.

The negatives.

The room is very small, the website pictures are very deceiving. 

The whole hotel is very tired and neglected.  The walls are covered in marks, there was a water leak stain on our ceiling, the wallpaper in the hall was falling off, the carpets were stained and not vacuumed for the four nights we stayed there.
Of the 4 nights we stayed one of them the 15th floor terrace was closed for a private function and it is closed on Sundays and Mondays. This left one day.
 
There were no coffee making machines in the rooms as the hotel cannot buy the coffee pods as they are not available???
The free breakfast they advertise is a $20 voucher per couple to use at a coffee shop a block away. If you have one coffee and virtually nothing to eat it might cover the cost.
We were told it was not served in the attached restaurant as it had been refurbished and had only been open two weeks???
We arrived at the hotel early and were hoping to decorate the room for our son's birthday and marathon run. We were told it hadn't been cleaned and they would call when it was ready. This never happened. 
We couldn't sit in the lobby and relax as what looks like a spacious lobby on the hotel website is tiny.
At ten past nine on our departure day the cleaner wanted us to leave so she could clean it. This she communicated to us using a translation app on her phone as she didn't speak English. 
With no facilities whatsoever and the state of the place a 3 star rating is more realistic.  Unfortunately they charge 5 star prices.

title: A very happy Halloween
text: So I stayed at the Mondrian Halloween weekend, it was a last minute stay and I wasn’t expecting much but my visit here gave me high expectations for every other stay I ever have in New York. I want to mention that the staff was the best part about my stay, Justin, Iliana, Jason, Jacob, Gabriel, Shian, Sarah, Marshall, Moises and Leeangie made my stay smooth between their knowledgeable  suggestions for places to visit to their amazing conversations it felt like I was right at home. Thank you Mondrian I can’t wait to visit again!

title: Disappointing
text:
Booked this hotel under the belief this was of ‘The Mondrian’ quality having stayed in several of their properties previously.
Learned (unfortunately) that this is a Mondrian franchise hotel - it operates under the umbrella of ‘The Mondrian’ brand but clearly is not beholden to the same standards in any way  shape or form. 
 
Highlights
- Rachel, the manager on reception, was outstanding - a true credit to this business. Without her, I suspect that the TripAdvisor reviews would be awful. I sense that she’d previously dealt with guests expecting ‘Mondrian’ standard to find ‘Mondrian franchise’ standard. She was courteous, generous and extremely friendly under very challenging circumstances not just from me, but from many guests.
- Rooftop Terrace Bar - great vibe, great views of NYC from Floor 14. Well worth the visit.
- Location / excellent - on Park Avenue two blocks from 28th Street Metro so easy to get everywhere. 

Lowlights
- No reception / foyer area to relax /meet visitors over a coffee /drink outside of the hotel room
- Rooftop Terrace Bar - not open Sunday/Monday.
- Breakfast - life has moved on post-Covid yet there is no restaurant for breakfast. They ship you off with vouchers to a cafe round the corner. Be aware - obviously the daily voucher does not cover the full cost of breakfast.
- Restaurant - forget it. Rarely open. Seriously underwhelming menu.
- Rooms - for the money being charged they were pretty underwhelming (tired, grubby, needing redecoration). We complained and in the end were moved to a great corner room. Eg there are good rooms but not the ones that are given on arrival 

Nevertheless - Rachel, Front Desk Manager, made the stay for me and my guests from the UK tolerable. However, having booked the hotel at a not inconsequential cost, I expected significantly better. Whilst I would never book here again, I have to say Rachel, the Front Desk Manager, turned a nightmare scenario into an acceptable experience. She gets 5+ stars; however the hotel is no more than a UK 3 star

title: Great Manhattan Location
text: This is a perfect location if you want to visit NYC but stay outside of the craziness of Times Square. It’s super easy to get to all major trains and walkable to midtown. Comfy bed, stylish decor and good service. Definitely want to stay here again!

title: Nice hotel in good location!
text: We stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue for 4 nights. It is a nice hotel in a good location in Midtown. We walked everywhere very easily. The neighbourhood is convenient with some nice restaurants close by - especially for breakfast! (Penelopes, Blank Slate, and Friedmans!). The hotel staff were very nice - especially the two guys who worked at the door. SO friendly when greeted upon leaving or returning to the hotel or helped with any questions - truly made our day! The hotel seems to need some attention to detail as there were a few issues in our room - such as the toilet running constantly - we let the front desk know after the 1st night - it was never fixed. We had to close the bathroom door as it was sometimes loud at night when sleeping. The window to the outside wouldn't lock but if you leaned against it, it would swing open and there was no screen or barrier. A safety risk for sure which we let the front desk know about. The room was nice and the king size bed very comfy - but the pillows were very poor quality. So it seems there is a need for attention to detail with this hotel - people were great - but needs some improvement!

title: Gabriel is the best! Great service
text: Gabriel at the front desk is amazing! Kind, patient, polite, attentive, servicing and welcoming. Would definitely stay here again, Especially thanks to his incredible hospitality. Definitely ask for him during your stay.

title: Not a 5 star hotel physically but YES in service
text: The hotel is not a 5 star hotel and rooms are small. Stating the evident, I give a 5 star review because the staff of this hotel, from Issa at front desk to everyone in the team are very helpful and whole hearted people. Location is fantastic and the fact they build partnerships with other local businesses gives you the opportunity to support and get to know other places in the city. Having breakfast one block away at a great caffe and walking some blocks to use the gym (although equinox partnership would be way better 🤭). I will definetely keep staying most of the time I’m in Manhattan in the future due to their staff, location reasonable prices (most of the time).

title: Awful, don’t bother
text:
Stayed here for a 2 day business trip. Had heard of the Mondrian brand from London and thought it would be decent. Was apparently 5 star.
It is to be frank a bit of a dump:
- No facilities whatsoever, no restaurant for breakfast (voucher for round the corner place that opens at 8am!!), no on-site gym 
- Hotel has been shoddily constructed and poorly maintained. Dirty drapes over windows, raw plugs still stuck in shower tiles (like 10 of them) from something that was ripped out, chipped sanitary ware, missing security latch on door. Air con that sounds like a jet engine. Chair was falling apart. Hotel lobby totally lacking in ambiance, zero effort in making it look nice 
- Came back to the room on the first afternoon and room was not made up (despite Makeup My Room tag on the door), mentioned it to the desk at 5pm and still no housekeeping by the time I came back after dinner. So bed not made up, bathroom not cleaned, bins full of the rubbish still
- On the positive side, the bed was comfortable 

Seems like the owners do not care and have limited interest in spending on maintenance or looking after their guests. Well the only well to address that is not to go there and at some point they will catch-on.
Lots of other great hotels in NYC which make an effort. Avoid the Mondrian NYC at all costs!

title: Unhygienic.
text: I booked the suite room and it was located on the 17th floor. The room was spacious. The carpet was dirty and sticky but I wore flip flops. The bedsheets smelled weird but I didn’t pay much mind to it, assuming that it might’ve just been the laundry detergent they used. Their was something wrong with the pipe in the bathroom toilet, causing the toilet to not flush properly, and ultimately their was a leak in the toilet causing water to go all over the bathroom floors. I called the front desk and someone came and fixed it; along with cleaning the bathroom floors, but the flush was still an issue and wasn’t working properly throughout my stay. Housekeeping and room service is nonexistent. If you want your room cleaned you have to call the front desk. Not enough toilet paper or towels in the rooms, even in the suites. After leaving the hotel, I noticed my entire upper arm was covered in red bumps! I was appalled, and confused as to what may have caused this. Then today I checked the reviews for this hotel and a woman had left a review of the same thing happening to her after leaving this hotel. (She had also stayed in a suite, but on the 16th floor) I went to the doctor and he said that it could just be eczema but not sure; I’m guessing it might not be that, considering that this happened to another woman who stayed in a suite room at this hotel too. This lead me to believe that they either do not wash their sheets, or it’s the detergent they used that may have caused an allergic reaction. So far I haven’t seen any reviews of this happening to people that stayed in any of the other rooms, only the ones that stayed in the suites; so it can’t be the detergent, assuming they use the same detergent for all their rooms. Like I said, the bedsheets did smell very weird and gross. Unbelievable, unhygienic, and unacceptable. Do not stay here!!! The only good thing about this place was the friendly staff at the front desk, the views, and the location. Other than that, it’s very unhygienic and unkept. I also never received the breakfast voucher each person is supposed to get when they stay. No concierge or doorman either! Terrible stay. You can stay at a much better, CLEANER hotel in New York.

title: Colazione e pulizia
text: Non prenotate questo hotel con colazione perchè è una frode. Non è del tutto inclusa ma danno dei ticket di valore pressochè esiguo, non fanno fare colazione in hotel, ma si appoggiano ad una struttura a circa 200 metri. A noi personalmente in 4 persone non calcolando il ticket la colazione ci è costata per 6 giorni più di 500 dollari. Nelle stanze la pulizia male, male, nel bagno non ci davano i ricambi dei teli per la doccia, ogni sera al Ns rientro dovevamo puntualmente chiederli. Tour operator che si lava le mani e non accetta richieste di rimborsi, occhio ad essere frodati come noi

title: Totally sux
text:
I booked this hotel as I’ve stayed at many Mondrian properties 
On arrival I was surprised to find no soap in the bathroom. I had to call up for it. 
Then no water. I complained about the water only to be told that their water delivery hadn’t arrived. I don’t care frankly. At $480 per night you go find water. 
Then no breakfast room and instead one is given a voucher for a local cafe 5 mins around the corner.
Needed some local advice and was surprised that there is no concierge. 
Terrace bar is nice but closes early so what’s the point. 
What a joke have stayed at better youth hostels. 
Cut my stay short and have booked another hotel for the weekend.

title: Worst Hotel Ever-
text:
I've visited New York several times, and this is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The Service and Staff were terrible, and the rooms were so small...I'm talking 5x5 sq. ft. What is seen on the internet is absolutely not realistic. The hotel is in need of a paint job, and there is also no place to dine throughout the property. The front desk staff were extremely unprofessional and also very unhelpful. The owners and shareholders should rethink this current model that they sell to the general public and clients from all over the world. 
If you're a potential guest, rethink your decision about staying here. It was a nightmare. 
0/10 never again!

title: Frustrated and disappointed
text:
Yesterday morning I checked out of the Mondrian Park Avenue. I had noticed some itchy bumps on my arms and legs that arose during my stay - some kind of bites. On the plane ride home I realized it might be bedbugs. (I’m attaching a couple of pictures; you decide if they are or aren’t that.) I contacted the hotel to let them know they need to check Room 1601 for bedbugs and, if any were found, to ask about a partial refund as reasonable compensation (and for letting them know about the potential problem). I was told no partial refund was available because I had not “complained” during my stay. Pretty frustrating, given that I didn’t realize the possible problem existed until after I had checked out, and very disappointing. I hope they will at least check the room!!

On the plus side, it was nice to have a room with a balcony, and the housekeeping staff was very friendly. Location is convenient to most of Midtown and to the subway. 

A few other minor detriments (besides the possible bedbugs): The room did not have body lotion, only shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel. The restaurant was closed during my stay, and there are no ice machines on the floors. You have to call down and have ice brought up each time.

title: Not a 5 Star Hotel, dirty
text: Expected a 5 star hotel because it’s rated a 5 star hotel but come to find a room with a bathroom that was barely cleaned, cracked door, and a phone that doesn’t work. The hotel is in a great location but would not stay here again because they can’t do the minimum basics.

title: Great hotel
text:
Nice hotel. The staff was amazing, very helpful and kind.  Gabriel,Shianna and Justin made check in and check out easy. 
Very good location. Close to K town and Penn station.
You get a voucher for breakfast at a close restaurant and the  place was delicious.

title: Gradúe de hotel de 5 estrellas
text: Hotel bien situado pero de servicios muy malos, front desk desagradables, muy fríos y nada atentos con los clientes, ni una pregunta turística ni una recomendación, no pasaría de un tres estrellas en España, no tenían desayuno y nos daban un ticket de raciónes muy escasas en un bar de al lado. Éramos tres personas y todos los días había que reclamar toallas, no tiene apenas armarios con lo cual la ropa en maletas , la limpieza deja mucho que desear, ni de lejos es un 5 estrellas , no se como hacen esas clasificaciones, en fin lo desaconsejo y no volveré .

title: Equipe nota 10
text:
Hotel bem localizado com quarto grande  para os padrões de NY. Mesmo sem o restaurante funcionando, o café da manhã oferecido no Blank Slate foi muito bom,  com produtos de qualidade. 
E a melhor surpresa foi a equipe,  super prestativos,  simpáticos e gentis todos que nos atenderam,  o que, infelizmente,  não é o normal na cidade.  Parabéns para o grupo e seus lideres: Justin, shian, hosam, jacob, iliana, lee, rachel, marshall e moises

title: Bad start but then a fantastic stay!
text: We booked online and got a great deal on the website. Called them to confirm the details. Then when we arrived in the US, called again to confirm our booking. Then suddenly the night before we were to arrive in NYC, Rachel from the hotel send an email saying part of our reservation is canceled. We call her, she says she doesn’t know how this booking was done. It’s not a good rate. So she’s cancelling one of our rooms and booking it for someone else. Eventually it was sorted out and we got a second room…not connecting like our initial booking but the at least the same category. That night was really stressful. However, Moises from the hotel, who had taken the initial booking, was more than wonderful. As was Shian from the front desk. Our rooms were fabulous. The hotel is well located, rooms clean, beds comfortable. A couple of things to mention: 1) breakfast currently is at blank slate close by, for which they gave vouchers. However, the vouchers are $10 per person (we got 5 for 4 of us). And everything at the cafe is a min$ 13-14. Plus a coffee and it’s $20. 2) the Wi-Fi didn’t work the entire time we were there. And every time we sat down peacefully, someone would come to try and repair it…5-6 times.

title: A special staff
text:
I travel all over the world, and often. This group of awesome humans are absolutely the best I’ve experienced in a long long time. 
I felt like I was staying with old friends and it’s exactly what I needed after an intensely exhausting month of ups and downs personally and professionally. 
Thank you Justin, Gabriel, Shian, Iliana, Lee, Hosam, and Jacob for making me feel so comfortable and pampered. I can’t wait to get back to see these guys and celebrate the opening of their restaurants with them! 
Park Avenue Mondrian is a must-visit hotel group in NYC. 
The coffee is also on point;) 

Xoxox

title: Mejor de lo que pensé
text:
Reservé en este hotel debido a una promoción, posteriormente leí varias reseñas en esta página que me hicieron dudar de que era la elección adecuada.
Decidí continuar con la reservación.
El hotel tiene una excelente ubicación y da la sensación de ser un hotel boutique, sin aglomeraciones; la habitación perfecta en cuanto tamaño y diseño además de muy limpias; muy buenas las ameninades del baño; el personal de recepción siempre muy amable. No me tocó vista a la calle, pero entiendo que mi tarifa era la más baja.
El restaurante permanece cerrado, pero los vouchers que dan para la cafetería de la vuelta alcanzaron perfecto para un desayuno.
Por el precio que pagué se me hizo una excelente relación precio-calidad. 
Eso sí, no debe de promocionarse como hotel de lujo, pues le falta para esos estándares; pero como hotel de categoría media cumple bastante bien.

title: Awesome staff
text: I stayed at the Mondrian for 3 nights and as amazing as New York was it couldn’t have been made anymore amazing if it wasn’t for the staff here. Illiana, Hosam, Gabriel, Jacob and Justin greeted us so kindly. Check in and check out were so smooth and that breakfast place they sent us to was very tasty! The terrace’s view is out of this world as well. I swear this place is like NYC’s hidden gem, will definitely be visiting again.

title: AMAZING
text: The Mondrian hotel were absolutely phenomenal. The accommodated all of our needs as well as being so nice. Gabriel, Illiana, Justin and Jacob were particularly nice in holding our bags for us after check out. Cant thank them enough. Fantastic hotel.

title: AMAZING!!!!
text: I had THE BEST experience! From before I even arrived all the way up until I left. I had two rooms booked so I requested an early check in as well as the rooms being on the same floor. Not only did they make note in my reservation and honor my requests, the rooms were connected with a joining door which was perfect!!!! I even had a package delivered and they held it for me until I arrived. Secondly, the customer service at this hotel was PHENOMENAL!!! From check in to check out! I really felt like the employees were family. Rachel is AMAZING!!!!!!!! The entire staff was great. The hotel was clean. The rooms were nice. If you needed anything in particular, the staff didn’t hesitate to bring it to you or provide it for you. Yes the rooms are smaller than normal, boutique size, but that’s majority of the hotels in NYC unless you’re booking presidential suites for the big bucks!! Anddddddd it’s one of the few hotels that provide double beds in some of their rooms. The double room was actually pretty spacious. Nice Most NYC hotels are king beds only. Nice size bathrooms with the walk in showers which I prefer!!! Also, this hotel was in the PERFECT location. Close to everything. I will definitely be staying here anytime I’m in NYC. Best birthday trip ever.

title: Helpful staff
text: We checked in at the Mondrian after our Airbnb host let us down. We were stressed and in shock from having nowhere to stay after a long day of travelling. Hosam and Rachel found us rooms near each other and did everything they could to make sure we were comfortable and happy in our stay. Next time we come to NYC we would happily stay at the Mondrian.

title: One of the few hotels with a balcony option
text: If you're looking for a hotel with a great view, the Mondrian Park Avenue is a great choice. I booked the Balcony King for a weekend staycation. The room was on the smaller side, but the balcony more than made up for it with its incredible view. If you need more space during your stay, the hotel lounge on the 15th Floor is one of the most spacious I've seen. The lounge is also a great place to relax during happy hour with their super friendly bartenders Koko and Luke. Rachel, the front desk manager was extra accommodating when I needed to swap my room. Great customer service, great bartenders, great view. It checked all my boxes for a great stay.

title: Formidable
text: Hôtel moderne et bien situé, près d’une station de métro. Les chambres sont propres et les lits sont confortables. Le personnel est accueillant et professionnel. Étant donné, que le restaurant était en rénovation durant mon séjour, l’hôtel nous a offert un crédit pour un restaurant de déjeuner près de l’hôtel à chaque jour. La nourriture était excellente. J’y retournerai sans hésiter!

title: A Disappointing Experience...Would Not Be My First Recommendation...
text:
I don't ever really leave reviews. However, I think it's important for other potential guests to recognize the potential experience(s) they may face when staying at Mondrian Park Avenue. Please note, I am speaking to my experience at Mondrian Park Avenue. However, based on the reviews I've just come to find on here these issues are not new.

Let me start by noting that the pandemic has certainly brought about unprecedented difficulties, from staffing shortages to supply chain issues. As travel bounces back, I think it's important for guests and hotels to understand that things are being adjusted and improved each day. However, I cannot excuse my experience at Mondrian Park Avenue.

Please note, I really wanted to like this place.

I completed pre-check in before my arrival and checked in a little after 6/7 pm. Upon my arrival, another guest was having a conversation with who I believe was the on-duty manager about room issues. I thought nothing of it because it was not my business, and sometimes guests make mistakes, and sometimes hotels make mistakes. After a long day, all I wanted to do at this point was get up to my room and wind down.

Check-in was easy. When I finally got upstairs and opened the door to my room red flags began to pop up everywhere. First red flag - I requested a room with some view besides the side of a brick building. Looking back, I should have asked for a room on a higher floor. However, I wasn't notified until AFTER I called the front desk to voice my other concerns that they didn't have a room available in my room category with a view. Why wasn't this expressed to me before I checked in or after I booked the room? The images online and on social media tell me otherwise.

I want to note before listing all of the physical issues in the room that the front desk associates, when I voiced my concerns about the room, tried to offer me a paid upgrade. This was extremely disappointing that this was their initial solution to an in-house issue. After profusely expressing my disappointment and concerns, the on-duty manager, Moses, who was kind during the experience, finally got on the phone with me and offered a complimentary upgrade to an ADA room, but it did not have the view I initially requested. I get he was doing what he could considering they told me they were completely sold out besides the penthouse. It was the fact that I was initially offered an upgrade at charge because there were issues in my room because of the property's lack of attention + upkeep. It’s just bad customer service, especially when I went online to find that the next category of the room was going for a lower price the two nights I was staying there than what I was already paying. So when I refer to both rooms, I am referring to the initial room I was sent to and the one I was ‘upgraded’ to.

Now for the room + hotel - sharing a list below of *some* the concerns/issues noticed:
- Severe scuff marks all over the walls in the first room.
- Wallpaper pulled off the wall near the framed photos on the wall
- Streaks all over the glass in both rooms
- What looked to be either excess grout or mold in + near the shower in the second
room
- The minibar wasn't fully stocked (regardless of whether someone uses it, it's just general good business practice to offer your paying guest a fully stocked mini bar) in both rooms
- The doorstop was unscrewed, flipped upside down, waiting for someone to step on
it in the first room. The engineer did come up and fix it after I mentioned it to the front
desk associate.
- Both rooms were extremely dusty; there was a film of dust on the duvet cover. I ran
my finger over the duvet and pulled a layer of dust up. Things look like they had not
been dusted or vacuumed in a while.
- The shower heads had crusted over hard water on them and were desperately in
need of a scrub.
- The rooms clearly had a slight wet smell to them, which no explains the sore throat I
got with the AC running.
- The room had two different brands of toiletries (Malin + Goetz and Ciel spa) - pick a
brand and stick to it. It looks half-assed and piecemeal. Not very 4/5 star energy.
- It seems like there was decor missing from the rooms. (Based upon Google review
images, socials, and even the property site, some decor is missing from the property.)
- Wifi is EXTREMELY slow (essentially unusable) + no cell service. I’ve stayed in many
hotels in the city and have never had an issue with cell service.

All in all, I could have gotten a better experience elsewhere. Responding to these TripAdvisor comments is great, but this hotel is extremely flawed and needs a lot of work. I’m floored seeing a similarity in complaints that date back a while.

I wish I could say I would try this hotel again, but I know that there are better places to stay in the city. Funny thing is, people were raving about this hotel when it first opened.

title: Amazing stay and incredible staff
text:
The staff at Mondrian made my stay incredibly special and enjoyable. Their sincerity, sense of humor, and high level of hospitality made for such a pleasant stay; they reminded me how good vibes and positive energy are contagious and so very much needed in our day to day and in life, in general. Location is in the heart of Nomad, an easy walk up and down Park Ave or 5th Ave depending on where you need to go. Room was spacious for nyc, bathroom and showers were clean, AC was awesome, bed was comfy, and interior design was unique and artsy. Access to public transit was easy to get around the city.

Huge shoutout to Julia, Gabe, Justin, Lee, and especially Hosam! Thank you for being you! Thank you for making my weekend that much more special. Y’all are the best! Xo.

title: Do NOT stay here
text:
Do not stay here, horrible customer service! Upon entering our room the trash was full and there was a black mold/musty smell coming from the AC. There were left over hairs in the shower and on the bed. When we asked to switch rooms they moved us to another room with similar mold issues in the shower. AC also did not work. Rooms are of very poor quality here.  There was also used floss on the hotel hallway floor. (see attached pictures).

The TV had multiple advertisments for pornography and provided directions on where to order directly on the home screen of the TV. Do not bring your children here if you want them to remain Innocent!

All the rooms are covered in dated mirrors with a pink hue that really drive home the trashy hotel feel (see pictures).

The terrace had a good view but the floors were sticky and the drinks were just ok. Don't stay on the  14th or 16th floor as they are directly above and below the terrace. The vibe is a bit more intimate which was nice but still overall not a great experience. The bartender was very friendly though.

Check out was uneventful and relatively painless.

The only shining light during our stay was the customer service provided by Justin and Marchal at the front desk and the bartender on the terrace.

If you are planing on spending your hard earned money to stay here it would be best to stay at one of the 100 of other hotels in NYC. I would recommend Soho Grand Hotel as it was worth the money and had excellent customer service.

Despite the above, the location is ok (again better hotels around the area) if you are looking to stay around the midtown area. It's about a 20 min walk to Times Square and about 35-40 min walk to Central Park.

This is not a 5 Star hotel, it's a glorified best western at the most

title: Convenient location
text: Just stayed two nights here for a business trip. Overall a good experience, the rooms were your usual nyc hotel room size and the staff was friendly/helpful. I will say the rooms were a bit on the older side but have been pretty well maintained. The location was convenient to reach different points of the city. I was concerned I’d hear a lot of street noise since it’s on park but didn’t hear much in the rooms which was great. Also, they had breakfast vouchers for a cafe around the corner that had really great food and coffee, I’d say that was a highlight of the stay and recommend checking out. I didn’t have a chance to check out the rooftop bar wish I did.

title: Great stay....
text: So,came to NY for 2 nights and stayed here on my nieces recommendation........the rooms are small but that didn't bother us.....the room and bathroom seemed to be recently  renovated and they did a great job!!....lots of mirrors so, it gives an appearance of a larger room....there is a fridge full of soda and liquor to buy...a safe and hair dryer also...for some reason the rooftop was closed.....also,the Restaurant is closed for renovation but that was ok with us cause when I'm in New York, I want great pizza and Chinese food which is lacking in Florida 😄.......there is good complimentary coffee from like 7:00am till 1:00 pm in the lobby.....so breakfast is included but since the restaurant is closed they  give you a $10.00 per person voucher to have  breakfast one block away  at "Blank Slate" (read their reviews!)......it's a super cool breakfast place.....I have to say the friendliness and professionalism of "Tea" and "Hosam" at the front desk was beyond words .....they are a big asset to the hotel!.......check this place out, you will not be disappointed......👌

title: Hotel Mondrian non all'altezza
text:
Ho appena trascorso una settimana all'Hotel Mondrian Park avenue di New York. Si qualifica come un hotel a 5 stelle ma in Italia al massimo potrebbe essere un due/tre stelle.
Vi dico solo che la prima colazione deve essere fatta in una struttura a circa 300 metri dall'hotel. Alla reception ti viene consegnato un voucher del valore di 10 $ con il quale puoi avere al massimo un capuccino e due brioches. Oltre devi pagare. Non c'è la colazione continentale e spesso fai la coda per poter trovare un posto libero. Impensabile per un hotel a 5 stelle.

title: Nice bed, no hotel services
text: If you are looking for just a bed in NYC, the Mondrian on Park will do.  If you are hoping to stay in a full service hotel, definitely look elsewhere.  The restaurant is closed for renovations and both other hotel venues were closed for “private events” for the entire multi-day length of our stay.  Also, if you want ice for your room, or room service of any kind, forget about it.  Asked for ice and towels to match the size of our family of 4 and after 3 calls with the front desk and one trip down 20 floors, we got ice and two more towels about one hour after we placed the request.  The next night I tried to get ice from the front desk, or delivered to me at the front desk — the staff said that was impossible.  I even asked a second time as i wanted to avoid another hour wait in my room.  No dice.  It would seem as if management has fully checked out of this hotel.  Too bad for what used to be a really solid hotel brand.  You can do far better in NYC.  As for service and caring about guests, it might be hard to do worse.

title: Exceptional on all levels
text:
This was my first time staying at Mondrian Park Ave. I had booked it through a third party- not my norm. That meant I did not initially receive my request of two beds. 
The hotel was booked solid on my arrival day.
Julia, Moses, and Justin are now my Rock stars. 
They went above and beyond to satisfy my needs.
My expectations were not only met, but exceeded by the stellar accommodations. 

Here’s the thing though, a beautiful space becomes even more beau because of the people who steward it. 

And so now this area of NYC that was not my go to (usually I stay by  Central Park), will be my first choice because I truly was taken care of.
This crew at Mondrian;
Julia, Moses, Justin, Jacob, Jordan, Hosam, iliana, Drayke,  Téa and Minerva- I give you a thousand thanks!

title: CUSTOMER SERVICE EXCELLENT
text: The front desk customer service was really good. Tea, who helped us really gave us good insight to hotel and nearby neighborhood. The rooms were nice size for NYC and  very clean. All employees of the hotel were excellent.

title: What $700 A Night Will Buy You
text:
I had never stayed at a Mondrian before but they had a good reputation. We got a small suite which for NYC was spacious and quite usable. That is where the positives end. I wouldn’t stay here again. There are clearly some serious issues. 

 The room has some issues.  The carpet has many stains and in the words of my significant other is “disgusting”. There is a door between the bedroom and living room but it doesn’t work. The towels are very small and reminded me of those we got in high school gym class. I tried to work using the Mondrian guest wi-fi which is standard for guests but it was too slow to process normal data, a problem I haven’t had in other hotels. My significant other had the same problem. If you ask, there is better wi-fi, but you have to ask.

We asked for housekeeping one of the days when we left the room. We came back 4 hours later and the room wasn’t done. When we complained, the front desk said they were understaffed and offered to have someone empty the trash only. Housekeeping did come later.

As I sit here, the hotel booked a party with an extremely loud DJ from 3-10. It is also extremely loud in the room. It is forcing us to temporarily evacuate and management is not willing to offer us anything for the inconvenience. We were offered another room, but not nearly as nice.

This is a hotel with significant problems. Guest beware….

title: Double check your bill!!
text: On check-out, I was stuck with a $30/day facility fee. I asked what this was for and was told that it was for third party booking charges, gym use and breakfast. I booked my room on the Mondrian website, the gym use is complimentary (according to their website) and the restaurant is undergoing renovations and is closed!  When I brought this to the attention of Tea at the front desk she pointed to a small  table in the lobby that contained a giant percolator of coffee and told me that’s what my facility fee was for. Look, I know times are tough but this was a pure cash grab by the hotel. They did reverse the charge but it left a very bad taste in my mouth and I will not stay there again. Please don’t think that just because we are tourists we won’t take the time to read our bill.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé sur Park Avenue, proche de métros et de Manhattan à pieds. Chambre joliment décorée et bien équipée et calme. Dommage qu'il y ait aussi peu de rangement mais les m2 à New York sont chers..
Un GROS bémol sur la restauration : pas de salle de petit déjeuner bien qu'il soit inclus dans le prix de la chambre, à la place une petite box à venir prendre dans le lobby avec thé et café dans des gobelets en plastique. Aucun choix possible (yaourt sucré, barre chocolatée, pomme ).

title: Exellence Service
text:
I stayed for 4 nights in the middle of May.

The room is new and well decorated.

House keepings that cleaned my room did a serious job.  I left a tip for them everyday.

Front desks offer a cut above level services that made me happy. 
I stayed in 3 hotels in Manhatthan during this half a month trip, others are big chains that located around Centeal Park and SOHO. Not that they are bad, but this hotel services are just better. I remember Juliana always stepping in to help me whenever I am down in the lobby area. Thank you! (I like the friendly black tall guy that show me the weather app and white man that help me did looking for my forgot item too)  Oh, if you happen to found my brown envelop with my picture inside, please email me at pekky152@gmail.com. Thank you for all the good vibes. I love you guys service! Exellence job!

title: Save your money
text: This is my first review after using TripAdvisor for many years.  I feel compelled to write this review to warn other potential travelers looking into this hotel.  This hotel is far from a 5 star hotel as it claims to be.   It’s currently 4 am and my husband and I have been woken up by loud party goers next door.  The walls are paper thin.  When trying to call down to front desk we realized the phone in the room doesn’t work!  The wifi is extremely slow and the the tv works sporadically.  The negative reviews of this hotel are all true.

title: Good city hotel -- better if you don't face Park Avenue
text: Our family stayed here 2 nights as part of a staycation. The location is convenient to Murray Hill and NoMad districts. The rooms are fine for a mid-range hotel. We had requested connecting rooms and the hotel was at high occupancy so someone arranged us rooms on the same floor. I'm not sure that calling the hotel earlier in the day would have made much of a difference. You can extend your checkout at $50 an hour till 5pm which is a nice service. Room came with breakfast coupons at a nearby coffee shop which is excellent. You can use a nearby NY Sports Club or there is an Equinox nearby if you are a member. Lighting, air conditioning and shower were all very good. Only thing is that if your room is facing Park Avenue expect some noise but it did get quieter after midnight. The hotel tells you about this rooftop terrace but most of the time we were there it was closed for private events. Elevator can get very busy at peak times; there are only 2 for about 15 floors. Other than that, we found the front desk personnel friendly and response was very prompt; request for towels was fulfilled in just a few minutes. If we were tourists here looking for a mid-range hotel, this would be a fine hotel to stay at. If connecting rooms is an absolute must with kids, you might not be thrilled here though if the hotel is busy.

title: Excellent service; ideal location
text: My stay at the Mondrian was great. Loved the heated bathroom floors- I now definitely want that in my dream house. Location was perfect in the heart of midtown. Julia and Tea were extremely hospitable and helpful. They helped with recommendations and extra accommodations, and really made my stay run smoothly. Views are meh but when you’re high up anywhere in Manhattan (with maybe Central Park as the exception) you’re just going to be looking at ugly rooftops, so don’t expect much there. Rooms sizes are standard for Manhattan as well. Was pleasantly surprised by how large/nice/comfortable the bathroom was. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Terrible
text: Cecked in….breakfastrestaurant was in renovation process. Closed. Takeway breakfast in reception. Ordered delux room 28 square m, paid extra to get a larger room, got a much smaller room when checked in…was told you can get a larger room…but with extra cost of 50 usd per night. Very dirty and unpleasant in reception floors. Unpleasant people in reception. No place to meet…if you are several friends staying in hotel. 2 chairs in reception only. Never again…learned you get a lot more value for money in other neighborhood hotels.

title: Nice Service
text: It's a cool hotel. Located in a nice part of the city and has restaurants/bars nearby. Came in with the family and we were all very well taken care of. Shout out to Tea, Hosam, and Justin for taking care of us for the week or so we stayed for.

title: Excellent stay with the most friendly staff
text: Just stayed here 4 nights and I can tell you that the stay was excellent. Especially had an amazing experience with Téa at the front desk when checking in. She was super attentive and showed us a few different room options including what we had booked and some upgraded options. In the end she got us an amazing room with a nice view and brought our bags up to us once we had chosen the room we liked the most. She hooked us up with a bottle of surprisingly pretty good white wine and started our trip out really well. Would definitely come back here again, the location is convenient to the 33rd st subway station on the green line and it's easy to get around by transit or walking.

title: Amazing stay at the Mondrian for my birthday!
text: My husband and I stayed  at the Mondrian for A night on April 23rd 2022. I have to say it was an amazing stay. The location is perfect, the rooms are nice and clean. And most importantly the STAFF was by far my favorite. JULIA at the front desk was absolutely terrific!!! I got in from my flight early morning and called and spoke with Julia…. Although check in isn’t until 3 Julia did everything she can to try to get us in early so I could get some rest before my birthday celebration that night. She took care of me from start to finish. She deserves 5 + stars. I will be coming back and I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a high class stay in NYC  with amazing customer service.

title: Not a 5 star by usual standards
text: This hotel is fine but not what I expect from a 5 star. Limited amenities such as no shower cap was a touch frustrating but most of all it was just tired and lacked the generous lobby area or anywhere to sit either in rooms or in communal areas. Breakfast was a $20 voucher for a pleasant local cafe but not ideal. It’s cheaper than any other 5 star and I can see why! That said it was clean and quiet even though my room was only 5th floor and overlooked Park Ave.

title: Awful room and shoddy hotel.
text:
Only good thing about this hotel is location. Check in desk wasn’t very welcoming at all. Hotel bar was being refurbed so couldn’t get a drink (wasn’t told before hand or at check in). Room 311 - avoid at all costs. View was of a brick wall (see pics) room was dirty and covered in dust, bed sheets were vile and heavily stained. Bathroom sink had chips in it, shower door banged shut at the slightest push, room was small and very dark. “Breakfast included” - what a joke! A $10 voucher per person per day to spend at the coffee shop round the corner. This was barely enough to get coffee and a pastry. 

Overall a grim experience. We only booked for a few nights so decided to spend as little time as possible in the depressing room. Would not recommend at all and would never stay again. Will be seeking a full refund.

title: Restaurant not on site, no gym on site as claimed however a nice hotel.
text:
A nice clean hotel, nice rooms with a good ensuite. Only downside is the restaurant is being refurbished (not actively) so for breakfast you are given $10pp voucher for a cafe called Blank Slate which is a two minute walk around the corner, it's a lovely cafe with in and outdoor seating and the food and drink options are spot on, however the voucher only covers half the bill by the time you've ordered yourself a breakfast and coffee. For us we booked a hotel that included breakfast and it's not fair that the voucher doesn't cover this. They also claim to have a gym on site and there is not one, they mentioned its local tho however don't advertise facilities you don't have.

Would I stay again? If they sorted out the above two points then yes I would return, the hotel is in a good location, we felt safe there and rooms are clean so a nice place to come back in between exploring NYC.

title: Nice hotel. But know this first…
text:
This is my honest review for this hotel. I can’t say that it was bad but my expectations going in were higher for this hotel. 

The hotel is much much smaller than what it looks like on the website, and that’s including the rooms. Our one king bed room could fit one big luggage, and I used my carry on as a night stand since the room was too small to fit two night stands. 

My first advice would be to check the size of the room when booking. If you just want a bed then you’ll be fine, but know that there is no place to lounge or chill in that room other than the bed. 

Second advise, if you don’t like loud noises don’t stay in a room above the terrace. Our room was directly above the terrace and the music was blasting every night which made it hard to sleep. (You may like music over sirens though so just keep that in mind 👍🏼)
Our room was on the 16th floor, and the terrace is on the 15th. 
Our A/C wasn’t working great so we opened the balcony door which was fine for April weather but we got the loud music until midnight. 

Another thing to know is that there isn’t a coffee machine in the room, so you will have to go downstairs to the lobby to get your coffee. 
We ended up walking one block down to a Starbucks so that wasn’t an issue for us and the walk was great.

There is no room service and the only restaurant attached to the hotel was never open. I swear I never saw that place open once! So make sure you find a near by restaurants for breakfast. 
The hotel did say that if you can have a buffet style breakfast at the Cleo restaurant for $20 a room, we just never saw that place open 😳

All and all the hotel was clean and in a great location. Do remember that you’re paying for the location and not the luxury of the hotel. 

If you keep all these points in mind you will most likely enjoy your stay, so adjust those expectations 👍🏼👍🏼

title: Below Average Experience
text: Lured by the photos of what seemed to be larger than normal rooms for Manhattan, I was quickly disappointed at check-in. Very small rooms with a tiny bathroom. While seen in everyone of the website photos, there was no possibility to fit a chair in the room. The King Deluxe room has queen size beds. A/C did not work (this was the same for another guest traveling with me as well). Below 1mb wifi speed. Room smelled strongly of cigarette smoke as well. Was definitely hoping for a better experience and I will plan to look elsewhere next time, unfortunately.

title: Non è più l albergo del 2019
text: Ho prenotato questo albergo perché avevo soggiornato tre anni fa due volte ed era stata un ottima esperienza. Questa volta già all’arrivo ho avuto problemi: mi hanno mandato una mail con la possibilità di avere il check-in dalle ore 10,30 per cui sono arrivato alle 11 per sistemarmi in camera. La risposta in tono molto maleducato è stata che c’era stato un errore e che la politica dell’albergo era check-in alle 15. Dopo aver sollecitato il personale alla reception più volte ho parlato con il manager di turno ed ho ottenuto la stanza: letto con lenzuola non stirate (pulite?) senza asciugamani e prodotti da bagno. La richiesta alla reception per avere quanto sopra è stata ignorata. Ho dovuto cercare nei piani un addetto e chiedere la cortesia di avere la dotazione da bagno. Giorno successivo dopo il rientro nel tardo pomeriggio: stanza non rifatta! Altra discussione con housekeeping e manager di servizio!!! Solo allora ho ottenuto quello che un albergo a 4 stelle dovrebbe fornire senza problemi.

title: Very nice place
text:
I was disappointed when I get in because we reach at night. Indeed it is a very good  place , very nice people good bathroom and clean perfect. 
and good ratio location price. I highly recommended this place.

title: STOLEN JEWELRY
text:
This hotel STOLE a bag of jewelry I had in a safe. I forgot to take a bag of jewelry out of the safe in my room when I checked out because I was in a huge rush. I later called to retrieve it and they claimed they do not have it and no one ever called for the safe to be opened after me. They made me feel like I was crazy and the staff was pretty indifferent and kept giving me mixed information on protocols at the hotel. I had to keep calling for updates and kept getting the run around. I had to file a police report and am yet to get any update. 

This on top of the terrible housekeeping. I walked into my room to a bunch of hair all over the floor in my bathroom when I checked in. Their blankets are old and the down inside is clumpy. When I would ask for better blankets, housekeeping would bring me the bare blankets without covers or sheets and expect me to make the blanket myself. I would also ask for things and they would never come back with them. 

I still have not gotten my jewelry back and it seemed to have mysteriously "disappeared". Do not stay here. No one cares about you or your belongings and you don’t get a straight answer on anything.

title: Lovely for a short stay
text: We stayed for three nights, and unfortunately the restaurant and club were still closed but we had a very enjoyable stay. The king size room was small (but perhaps decent for NY) with just enough space for the two of us, although we couldn't fully open either suitcase on the floor away from the walkway. The interior is artistic and pleasant and the views good too. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and kept our luggage safe after check out in the morning as our flight was not until the evening. Everything was clean and elegant, the room was surprisingly quiet, and the location of the hotel is super practical - easily walkable to Time's square and midtown. The only downside was breakfast. You get 20$ split between the two of you at a nearby café, which just about pays for two coffees and one croissant. We paid at least $10 more every morning for two small breakfasts. There was filter coffee in paper cups at reception every morning, although it had run out usually by 10am when we left. Overall we were very happy with our short stay, but would look elsewhere if staying longer than a few days.

title: Great Visit
text: My wife and I recently spent a weekend at the Mondrian Park Avenue.  I must say that recent reviews had us more than a little concerned before our arrival.  However from the time we checked in with Te'a at the front desk, our stay was seamless.  Our room was ready on time and as described.  Clean and comfortable.  The hotel location was perfect.  Every interaction we had with the staff was positive.  In fact, we had several more interactions with Te'a and  she was always incredibly friendly and helpful.  All in all a very nice stay and we will definitely not hesitate to return on our next visit to NYC.

title: Great location and service
text: Perfect location for a fun night out in NYC!  Great rooms and friendly staff who was more than happy to help coordinate parts of our visit for ease.   Tea, at the front desk, was very engaging and helpful!

title: The Real Deal says just nice
text: Mondrian have style. LA is the epitome of the look. NYC is the plain sister. It is an ok room, decent size, quiet and a nice bed. But it is the sister who hides in the back of the family photo.  A few touches,  a shower only option,  basic bed and TV. But if you are in nyc and want a reasonably priced clean quiet room with nice puerile this is your hotel.  Good location only 10 rooms per floor.  Try it you might like it.

title: Not Terrible, But Not Good
text:
Where to start.....

This is not anything close to a 5-star property. Maybe around 3.5 stars instead. It isn't horrible but it isn't great.

- Rooms are tiny (yes, I know that this is the case for NY, but at £400/night I still expect a bathroom slightly larger than a closet), and dirty. Dust everywhere and clearly they are not properly deep cleaned between guests. This is not COVID secure at all.

- Bathroom kept flooding from the shower and this was not fixed during our stay.

- Housekeeping staff were useless. They came in without knocking, when told to come back in 20min they chose instead not make up our room, and they leave at about 3pm so you could not get them to make up your room later in the day once it became apparent they had missed your room. FYI Mondrian, you can't call yourself a 5-star hotel if you dont have 24-hour housekeeping! The housekeeping staff also stole sleeping pills from our room, and often moved things around in a reckless way (e.g. tv remote hidden under the bed cover, charging cables thrown under the bed etc.)

- Front-desk staff are fresh out of hospitality training, are all about 20 years old and have no idea what they are doing. They could not even recommend where to get a pre-departure covid test for travel. How this is possible in a hotel catering to international guests during the COVID pandemic is beyond me!

- There is no breakfast served on the property, so if you have a room with breakfast included they give you credit at a cafe down the street. Why not just sell rooms without breakfast included then???

title: Fuyez !!!
text:
Lamentable , rien d’un hôtel 4 étoile ou 3 étoile et meme pas 2 étoile…
Bref a fuir 
La connexion internet est inexistente, les chambres sont ridicules et vieilles. 
Le bruit est insupportable nous avons changer des chambres mais meme au 20 l’insonorisation de l’hôtel et catastrophique impossible de dormir.
Le petit déjeuner vous devez aller au bout de la rue avec une carte qui vous donne droit à un donut et tout le reste est simplement … donc tartines et chocolat chaud pour deux vous paierez 20€ en plus … du vol 
Fuyez

title: Rien d’un 5*
text:
La chambre Deluxe n’a rien à voir avec les photos. C’est vieillot et en mauvais état (poignée pour la fenêtre cassée, idem pour la porte de douche et les prises). Le personnel n’est pas sympa (sauf le jeune homme qui travaille le matin, merci à lui!). Quand on parle du matériel cassé à la réception, on a l’impression de déranger et rien ne se fait. Le petit-déjeuner inclus n’en est pas un (Bon de 10$ par personne dans un café où vous n’aurez rien pour ce prix-là, mais c’est tout de même très bon). 
L’emplacement est par contre super! Les lits sont confortables et la salle de bain est spacieuse.

title: Underwhelming and uninspired
text:
To call this hotel a five star hotel is a stretch. This place both lack the facilities and the service mindset to be able to claim five stars. I have been in 4 star accommodations with superior facilities and level of service compared to the Mondrian.

First of all, the hotel doesn't have a functional kitchen. That means no room service, and NO breakfast. Although I was supposed to have a continental breakfast included in the USD400 room rate, they only offer coffee and tea in the lobby. You receive a voucher for 10 dollars that you can use in a breakfast joint around the corner. Only problem is: 10 dollars won't get you very far. It only covered a cup of coffee and an orange juice in my case. 

The room itself is big for NYC standards, but very underwhelming when it comes to level of "luxury". The first thing you will notice is that the nice hardwood floors from the pictures on BOOKING.COM are in fact carpet. The bathroom is unpractical and gets soaked every time you take a shower. The towels are small and not the luxury bath towels you come to expect at this price level. The room comes with a minibar, but no glasses to enjoy your drinks. During my 3 nights staying at the hotel, the minibar was never restocked. At this price level, I expected to find a coffee and tea maker, but there are none. No ironer either. 

In it's marketing, the Mondrian will let you know that hotel include a roof top terrace bar, a club in the basement and a restaurant. The restaurant is out of business and the nightclub and terrace are not accessible from the hotel itself. When you check-in, the uninspired staff will offer NO information about the hotel's facilities. I asked for the terrace, but was told it was closed. 

All in all, I recommend the Mondrian to update their marketing to reflect that the hotel doesn't offer ANY facilities other than the room itself. To pay around USD400 for a room at this hotel is simply outrageous.

title: اسواء فندق بالعالم
text: اسواء تجربة فندق استغلال مادي وعند تسجيل الدخول عملوا لنا ترقيه بدون طلب مسبق واخذوا مبلغ 20 دولار باليوم دون موافقتي والانترنت سيئ والافطار بمطعم خارج الفندق وكان مغلق يوم الكريسمس وزيادة على ذالك ادرجوا في الفاتوره رسوم النادي الصحي رغم انني لم اطلبه لانه لا يوجد لديهم بالفندق وعند تسجيل الخروج اتفاجا بمبلغ 400 دولار فوق الحجز وتم سحب مبلغ الاقامة عند التسجيل الدخول  كامل وعند الخروج كامل بعد النقاش طلب ان يسحبوا الفائض فقد 400 دولار ولكن رفضوا بحجة ان المبلغ الاول سوف يرجع لك وجلس معلق حوالي 15 يوم . وعند النقاش مع الاستقبال قالوا اننا ليس فندق خمس نجوم بعد الجائحة وان عليك الدفع او الاتصال بالشرطه !!!! فندق سيئ للغاية ولا انصح به .

title: Nettes Hotel mit einigen Abzügen…
text: wir waren vom 26.12-01.01.22 im Mondrian. Wir wurden empfangen von Fjolla und von Samir welche immer sehr freundlich und professionell waren und immer ein lächeln bereit hatten und auch mal mit uns geschwatzt haben und Tipps gegeben haben. Leider waren andere Mitarbeiter nicht so professionell, Gäste wurden nicht begrüsst und man hatte lieber miteinander gequatscht als  Gäste zu begrüssen. Das Zimmer war von der grösse her sehr gut. Wir gatten das Zimmer 1210, leider haben wir eine Wand vin einem anderen Gebäude angeschaut und es war immer dunkel im Zimmer. Late Checkout war nur bis 13:00 Uhr möglich und sonst hätte es 50$ pro Stunde gekostet, was wir als ziemlich frech empfunden haben. Leider wurde die Maskenpflicht sehr oft im Lift und in den Hotelgängen von Gästen nicht eingehalten wurden, hier wurde nie etwas unternommen noch wurde etwas gesagt. Was ich als extrem unverantwortlich empfunden habe.Wir werden in Zukunft eher wieder unseren alten 5*****NYC Hotels Favoriten zurückkehren und dieses Hotel gehört leider nicht dazu.

title: Subpar
text: I would say the room is decent, but the rest of the hotel certainly isn’t five stars. The lobby and reception are underwhelming, there is no gym and even though we called and asked about certain parts of the hotel being open after booking they were closed. And when we brought this up, all we got is a “sorry guys”, no remedy or even a discount offered for the inconvenience. I think if you want a reasonably nice place on a good area this would be fine, but if you want a special place or special service this certainly isn’t it.

title: Great spot for a holiday trip to NYC!
text: We have been staying at the Mondrian Park Ave. for going on 7 years now for a reason. This hotel's commitment to hospitality and customer service continues to set it apart from other hotels in Manhattan. This is especially noteworthy given the fact that we are still in the middle of a pandemic. The general manager, Kumar, was kind and helpful. Tyler Torchia, the director of Housekeeping, welcomed us with a lovely note and a bottle of wine. He quickly also sent two bathrobes upon our request. Our corner room was spacious and clean and housekeeping left it in great condition each day of our  6-day stay. While Cleo is not currently open, we were not left wanting. We highly recommend you take advantage of the breakfast vouchers provided for the spot around the corner. Absolutely delicious options and far better than any "continental breakfast" hotels typically provide. Will gladly stay here again during our next trip to NYC. :)

title: If it were rated a three-star hotel I would give it a four-star rating.
text:
I rated it a 2 star because it's considered a 5 star hotel. I asked them at the desk how many stars the hotel was and they said it was considered a boutique Hotel. But on Expedia it wreaks it five stars.

The walls are paper-thin and you can hear every word spoken by all of your neighbors. There is a constant intermittent banging 24/7. At least from my room in 1907. The showers are low flow and the hot water is not as hot as at least I would like it. Also, it runs out before I'm done with my shower.

title: room never cleaned and shower broken entire time
text: When I arrived no one had masks on. I couldn't tell who was staff because they did not all have uniforms. My shower door almost fell on me when I was in the shower. I left voicemails and spoke to hotel staff and no one ever fixed the shower. No one ever came to do housekeeping. I was there from Thursday - Sunday. The only time anyone ever came to clean my room was at 6:00 pm at night a man was in my room (im a single 30 something woman) using my phone charger and slowly making my bed and talking to someone romantically on their AirPods. This was a Saturday night and I needed to get to a wedding. He complained that he was just trying to get off work. I told him he could leave and I showered the entire time with the shower door open. When I got back home I got very sick and missed a week of work. Also no one asked me for proof of vaccination. I gave up asking anyone for help because I felt like no one cared to the point that it stressed me out to even go through the lobby.

title: Not a 5 star hotel
text:
As many other reviewers, we were truly perplexed as to how the Mondarin classifies itself as a 5 star hotel. That's like the Olive Garden comparing themselves to Scarpetta. The Mandarin Oriental in NYC is a 5 star hotel, the Mondarin is not and I think this is where most of the issues begin for this hotel. 

We checked in at 6:30pm on Friday and were told our room wasn't ready. Apparently they had an issue with the linen delivery that day. Not the hotels fault and we were in our room by 7ish. 

As others have stated, the rooms are in need of some love. Our bathroom sink was chipped and the shower head looked caked in mold. The deluxe king we had was otherwise a typical NYC hotel room, small. It came with a minibar fridge and a little area to hang up clothes. The bathroom door was right next to the bed and was a barn door style so it didn't close fully. Our phone also didn't work, so each time we needed to call the front desk we would use our cell phone to call the main line. Also, the $30 facility fee is perplexing. The restaurant was closed, we had to walk a block to the partner Cafe where breakfast coupons were good at and wait in a very long line for food. I was not aware of a gym on site or other amenities, perhaps due to COVID, so not sure how this charge is at all justified. 

Check out on Sunday was very crowded. There are only 2 elevators and the wait can be very long at times. We also learned they outsource the valet parking and it took the company nearly an hour to get us our car. So we were upcharged by the hotel and had to wait an hour. Definitely consider self parking if you stay here. 

Despite the hotel being quite full, it felt perpetually understaffed. The staff that we did interact with, however, was extremely friendly and accommodating. Five stars for the staff all the way.  

Word of advice to management. Please reclassify this hotel accurately...as a 3 star establishment. You're setting your guests and staff up for failure by trying to say it's 5 stars as the expectations that come with that were not fulfilled from our experience.

title: Checkin Nightmare
text:
Absolutely ridiculous! Arrived for checkin at 630pm to checkin only to be informed they were having an issue with linens and the rooms I booked were not ready. At 730pm was informed one of our rooms was ready, went to get the key from front desk to be told the room had just been given to another guest who had been waiting for 7hrs! 
Why in the world would there be any reason for anyone to have to to wait that long for their room to be turned around by housekeeping. I immediately asked them to cancel my reservation and took my buff so money to another hotel close by that offered far better service for less money! 
Stay far away from this hotel, something is not right, with their management, fiscal health, or both. Staff were respectful and clearly trying to do their best / but that doesn’t cut it if your brand is supposed to represent luxury hospitality.

title: Don’t stay here
text: We arrived at the hotel and from the outside and reception it seemed really nice …after seeing our room it was tiny for the 4 of us and we tried to change but no one wanted to help….. they wanted 460 dollars per night for us to add an extra room which we declined …. A deposit was paid of 200 dollars when we first checked in and we were told that this would be put back into my account after I left ….since then the hotel has taken the 200 dollars plus extra money off my card…I have reported this to my bank …. This place is run by criminals…no one should be able to go into your bank and take money as they want…brilliant trip in New York spoilt by this hotel ..shame it ended like this and hopefully I will see my money back soon

title: Lazily taking advantage of customers
text:
No restaurant for breakfast. You get vouchers for a local cafe which doesn’t open until 7:30. Long queues, slow service. The vouchers don’t cover much beyond pastry, coffee and OJ.

Also charging a $30 per day resort fee, despite there being no facilities. Underhand and lazy.

Rooms are fine. Won’t go back

title: Disappointing
text:
This hotel advertises that its king rooms have a “writing desk”. Not only did our room not have such an amenity but there was literally no place to put one. It was tiny with one oversized chair jammed between the bed and the wall which we had to squeeze by to access one side of the bed. When we inquired of the front desk, we were told that very few rooms actually had a desk. In addition to no desk, there was no space to put a suitcase, virtually no place to unpack and the tiny cubbyholes which were where we were supposed to put our clothes had only two sides so some items fell to the floor.  The bathroom had no place to hang a towel except for one hook. When we arrived for a seven night stay there was one hanger provided. Stylish? Perhaps, but the lack of items a traveler might want made for a disappointing stay. 

Our emailed confirmation when we made the reservation said checkout would be 2pm. The day before checkout we received another email citing a noon checkout time. The front desk apologized and offered a “complimentary” 1pm checkout. 

These folks need to get their act together.

title: Mondrian Park Avenue is a no go
text:
I stayed here for 3 nights in mid October.  On the plus side, the room as not as small as many NYC hotels.  

Everything else was bad.  Here is the letter I wrote several days ago to the hotel manager, after leaving her 3 messages and a previous email asking for a call back.  As yet, I have not gotten a reply.  Typical for my experience at this hotel.

Hello.  I stayed at your hotel last weekend (10/14-17).  Many things went wrong.  It is frustrating that every effort I have made to get issues resolved required multiple attempts.  I have left 2 messages through Samir at the front desk and a previous email to Alysa (sp?) to discuss these and I have not received a reply over the past 5 (at least) days.

Here is what went wrong:

- housekeeping did not remove a BRA that belonged to a previous guest from the room.  I stopped at the front desk twice on Thursday and Friday of my stay and then called 3 more times before someone came to remove it.

- the front desk person who came up to take care of this brought a small can of a warm beverage.  I don’t know what it was since the label with the Mondrian name obscured the contents but I believe it had rum in it.  As I said it was warm, there were 2 of us.  We did not drink it…left it in the room.  I assume he thought it was a gesture of good will for inconveniencing us but it came across as an odd choice.

- I asked for clean towels, in part because housekeeping took dirty ones away on Friday morning (including a bath mat) and didn’t replace it.  Two calls yielded no results.  I asked the housekeeper on Saturday and she accommodated the request.

- housekeeping didn’t empty trash when they cleaned the room.

- we were not advised that 1 elevator was working the weekend we were there.  It took a 10 minute wait for an elevator that had some space on more than one occasion.  There was no sign on the elevator that it was out of order either.  

- I NEVER take anything from a mini bar.   Never.  Never touch the door.  I even took pictures of the contents through the door on my day of arrival (in part because a bottle of liquor was on an angle).  I spoke to the person who checked me out (no I didn’t ask for his name…clearly I should have) and said I didn’t use the mini bar, he said he’d make note of it…nothing to worry about.
