I got charged a few days later for $5.44 for a mini bar charge.  It took 2 calls to Samir and then 2 calls to Stacey (in Accounting, I believe) to get it resolved.  She did issue credit.  She also made me feel like an idiot for bothering her with a $5.44 charge.

I would not recommend staying here under any circumstances.  They also charge an “amenity fee” of $30 but give you coupons for $20 for breakfast at one place.  It was decent and around the corner.  But I got no amenities at this property.

I also asked 3 times for them to refill the hand sanitizer dispenser on my floor.  It never happened.

title: Do not stay here (unless you want to vacuum your own room)
text:
I stayed four nights at the Mondrian Park Avenue; the entire experience was a disaster. We had myriad issues in this hotel - so much so that the hotel adjusted the first night off our bill without being asked to do so. Despite this, the issues continued throughout our stay. I simply elected to stop complaining as I did not want problems with the hotel to become a focus of the trip. 

In our original room on the 19th floor, we had issues with the air conditioner and the room would not cool. I had to call down to the front desk multiple times before an engineer was sent to to room. After he eventually arrived, he was unable to repair the issue, and I requested to be moved to a different room. 

The new room had many other issues. While the room had functioning air conditioner, it initially only worked with a single speed: a gale force wind; no low, medium, or high. This was remedied after the first night but you essentially had to settle on one temperature in the room without variation and had no fan. 

I advised the front desk that the door in this room only closed fully if pushed and thus could be easily left ajar inadvertently open by housekeeping or the guest. Although no one had warned about this issue, the front desk advised me that this was the case for all rooms in the hotel and there was no way to remedy the issue. However,  I discovered this was false and apparently the front desk simply did not want to be bothered. Following an email to management about some of our issues, the door was repaired so that it closed and latched properly.  

Following our report of these issues, the manager on site sent me an email advising that he had personally inspected the room. With that in mind, I returned to find the floor dirty with food residue. See pictures below. I called the front desk and was advised that housekeeping was no longer available for the day. Given this, I asked them to bring me a vacuum and proceeded to vacuum and clean the floor myself. The person who brought the vacuum agreed that the floor was gross but - like the front desk person - never offered to do anything about it. He did say he would leave a note and we would hear from management the following day, but we never heard anything. I emailed about this issue with pictures after checking out as well, but received no response from the hotel. 

Given COVID-19, the cleanliness issues were particularly frightening as I was concerned what else had not been properly cleaned. I also note that the hotel staff is extremely poor with respect to wearing masks and generally never wore masks anywhere on premises (including elevators, lobby, entering guest rooms, etc.). 

Any request made of hotel staff seemed to be met only partially, if at all. E.g., I requested laundry information and bags and a shower cap. The bags were delivered, I had to call down for someone to bring the price information, and the shower caps never came. 

The rooms also are not equipped with basic items, such as a garbage can in the room, luggage racks, etc. it also appears that there is no way to turn on/off individual lights. They either all have to been on or off. 

These are only an abbreviated recounting of our troubles at this hotel. There were other issues, too. I don’t understand how this hotel is rated as 5 stars by any reputable agency and I strongly urge anyone considering this hotel to avoid it at all costs.

title: Liked it but some things could improve
text:
First, I have to say that the staff was very nice, service was fast, the room was beautiful and that bathroom was amazing! You could easily fit 4 people in the shower. I recommend getting a room with a balcony because the view was spectacular and that made the entire experience better.

I stayed at the Mondrian for 3 days and even though my overall stay was great, it could’ve been better. Upon check-in I tried using the remote, no contact check-in option but that kiosk was not working. There is currently no room service or any other food options at the property. They do give guests a coupon for the breakfast place next door though. 

Cleanliness is the most important thing right now and this property was lacking in that department. I understand there is a nationwide staff shortage but still, cleanliness should be a top priority. Once I got to my room, there were dirty glasses in the bathroom that had not been changed. There was no toilet paper in the bathroom either so I had to call the front desk for that. Thankfully, service was quick and painless. The overall state of the property was great, cleanliness could improve but it wasn’t horrible. 

I would stay here again! Also, thank you for the wine amenity that was waiting in my room, it was a nice touch.

title: Look elsewhere
text: The hotel is not as it appears in photos. It’s also not kept up well. Rooms are not cleaned well and are stuffy. Furniture could us a refresh; it is dated and worn. Poor value. Staff tried to address but only so much they can do. You can find much nicer, less expensive rooms elsewhere nearby. Breakfast down the street (where they provide vouchers) was delicious and delightful.

title: Don’t trust the reviews
text:
The reviews completely duped me. Was going to stay at a higher end hotel, but saw the Mondrian (envisioned the Miami hotel) and trusted the brand. 

Do not be fooled. Gives me the vibe that it had been a different brand before and was purchased by Mondrian. It’s not nice (feels low rent), no valet/doorman, one of the Teo elevators wasn’t working, and although I reserved a king room - was given a double with A/C that didn’t work. 

Apparently all sold out and didn’t have another room to switch. Engineer came and he said he fixed it temporarily and would find another room (never heard back). Had to call down on my cell because the room phone doesn’t work. Was told they finally found a room that had been “out of service” but it’s ready now. Def wasn’t taking my chances on THAT one. 

The A/C seemed to hold and I gave up. Exhausting and won’t be back. Too many other good hotels in NY to deal with this.

title: Disappointing experience
text: My room looked out onto a wall. It was dark snd dreary. There was no desk to work at and I had to move the chair to try and find an outlet. Behind the chair were used tissues , crumbs and other detritus. When I pulled the sheets back there was a dead insect in the bed. Amenities are sparse in a tiny bathroom. Towels were threadbare. One elevator was broken so long waits in a small lobby were necessary. Checkin was good but I couldn’t wait to check out.

title: Great location, quiet, attentive staff!
text: We loved our stay in a Premier King room. It was quiet, clean and very comfortable. All staff were extremely attentive and personable. We called up for an iron and in less than 5 minutes, it was at our door. Also, they’re offering early check in and late checkout right now, which is amazing. I can’t recommend this hotel hotel enough! Thank you for the fabulous stay.

title: Thank you Brittany!
text:
Brittany at the Concierge desk was awesome! I spoke with her before we arrived and she took care of all of our requests. Would definitely stay there again.

Apart from that, the room was also very nice. Clean, comfortable, very modern and hip.

title: Home away from home
text:
I stay in the city quite often instead of commuting home and Mondrian has been my go to place to stay. The staff is excellent, warm and welcoming. 

On my last visit, I asked if they happened to have any makeup wipes down at the front desk as I left mine at home. At the moment they did not which was of course not a big deal but what I was not expecting was to return to my room with an abundance of skincare items & makeup wipes :) talk about customer service!!

Thank you Esther and team for always taking such great care of me time & time again.

title: Excellent Location
text: This property is convenient to everything.  While it's showing its age just a bit, the rooms are clean and quiet for being in the heart of the city.  Balcony rooms offer a great experience at a very reasonable rate, and the best part of our experience was LeeAngie at the front desk - she helped us with early check-in, additional rooms at the last minute, advice on the neighborhood, and more - she absolutely made the stay.

title: Great Location
text: Had a quick overnight stay at The Mondrian -- location is great easy to walk to Union SQ or Midtown. We went to 20th St for dinner and there were a bunch of cute restaurants to chose from. Hotel is  great value for the price -- easy breezy in NYC!

title: Inaccurate Room Photos
text: Arrived at the hotel after booking a Duluxe King room, checked in and went up to my room, only to find out it was much smaller and with no furniture as shown in the photos for that room class on the website. The director who was at the check-in desk gave me a new room, same issue again, then another room, same issue again. She denied that they were not a Duluxe King even after showing her photos I took of the room and comparing it to the one of the website which clearly showed it was smaller with less furniture (no chair and or table) compared to the website photos. She offered me an upgrade which I would have had to pay just to get a room as large as I had booked. Clearly I was not happy with that, so she offered to cancel the reserveration and get me a room in another hotel. I just took the cancelation and booked a new hotel myself. To be frank, I stay in many hotels, and it's extremely annoying that hotels think putting a great room photo on the website and then giving a smaller room to guests whilst trying to pass it off as the correct room is just extremely deceptive. Of course this works on many occasions and people don't bother to complain, but it's simple a way for hotels to pack in more smaller rooms whilst claiming they are all as large as the ones shown on their websites. This practise has to stop!!!!!

title: Totally disappointing
text: We thought it was odd at check in, on the check in podium right as we were checking in was a big bag of Popeye's chicken delivery. We actually had to slide it aside to get to the desk and hand our credit card over. Downhill from there. This hotel has nothing. No room service. No coffee in the morning. No glasses in the room for a drink.  Air con cycles on and off and doesnt really work. Went from cold to hot all night. Bathroom floor was gross and dirty. Under the sink was a used kleenex left from last guest. Shower could be good with two big heads but you can only turn one on at once.

title: Bathroom and Location
text: The location and the guest room bathroom were the two best parts. The staff really needs to learn how to give directions, from how to use the breakfast voucher (didn’t mention it had a $10 value) to where the gym is located. A small map the size of a business cared would help. I almost felt like they didn’t know what their hotel really offered. The rooms were clean but the AC was broken and only worked if I woke up every few hours to reboot. It was a big inconvenience when they offered a move at 11.30 pm  (no upgrade… lame) so we refused. Very very nice bathroom.

title: Location!
text: Its been a few years visiting NYC on business and this hotel did not disappoint! Warm greeting, easy check-in, elevators close to the main entrance. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants, attractions, and subway!  It was also easy to grab a cab! My guest room was spacious, and the bathrooms....LOVE!  The terrace was a nice spot to grab a cocktail (live music) or work during the day with a beautiful view! Thank you for your hospitality!

title: Luxurious and Hip hotel stay
text: The Mondrian location was perfect for business or pleasure.. ideally both in NYC! I felt welcome from the moment I arrived, like I was “in the know” by being their guest. Staff was kind and engaging. Esther Song made everyone in the room feel like an invited friend. I loved the big windows and city views. Rooftop Bar and Terrace are a respite from the city at quiet times and alive with an early evening buzz after work. Also a shout out to Lawrence in engineering for his help with the AC.  Make sure to check out the Crooked Knife Around the corner as well. Mondrian will ensure you feel like you are part of the NYC life.

title: Perfect Location, Perfect Trip!
text:
As this was my first time back on the road, I had all the worries one can think of. 
The team at Mondrian Park Avenue was so fantastic, those worries were all gone by the time I arrived at the hotel.  I took the train into the city and got there at 10am - they offered to put a rush in getting a room ready for me.  How awesome is this?  I didn't need that as I was dropping my bags off and heading to a meeting right then, but just the peace of mind they created for me right then and there was fantastic.  The sleeping rooms are roomy, clean and beautiful. The location of the hotel is unbeatable.  And their sales team, especially the Director - Esther - is AMAZING! She took such a great care of me and my group.  I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

title: Avoid at all costs.  Absolute disaster.   Even an employee said they are driving it into the ground….
text: We booked the Mondrian Hotel as it looked so modern. Unfortunately the hotel must have used an inexperienced design team. The door between  bedroom and the living room in our suite was stuck halfway and not budging. So, as one sleeps and one is awake, there is no sound barrier for the tv. Also the drapes don’t cover the far corner, so there’s lots of light in the morning. ( which was why I tried to close the sliding door between the 2 rooms!). We’ve been told it won’t be able to be fixed during our 3 night stay.  One of the sinks faucets cannot be accessed as it gets wedged into the shelf above the sink.  The televisions do not work if it’s raining!  And then when one worked the other did not.  There are too few elevators for the amount of rooms.  And now we are trying to figure out the bill and how they added $600 to our stay. DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS HOTEL.

title: Cool place
text: Room was super clean and service was excellent. Thank u guys!!! Will be back for sure. It was very close to Koreatown which is where we were heading for the night. More than affordable for the location.

title: Perfect location, easy to everywhere!
text:
Mondrian was an excellent hotel for getting around Manhattan. it was clean, staff was friendly, and the upstairs bar was great.

Being just a few blocks from Penn Station was also convenient because I was able to walk to/from my train without having to add the expense of another two taxis.

title: What a great NYC Week
text: Last week I stayed at Mondrian Park AV and it couldn´t be better. Even things have changed due to COVID I was impressed and how prepared and ready are all members and staff and the hotel. My room was perfect and location was amazing, it was my first time traveling back in a business trip and everything was perfect. If you're looking for a great option to mix both leisure and business then you have to choose this hotel. Esther made the difference having a 24/7 service, always ready to help and having the best attitude ever.

title: Great service at the rooftop bar
text: I met up with a friend at the rooftop bar and the staff couldn’t have been more friendly! Esther and coco were so sweet and overall made our night so much more fun. There was live music (maybe could turn down the volume a bit) and good decor. The only thing that could be improved would be the glassware. We got champagne in a plastic flute which wasn’t what I expected at a park Avenue rooftop bar (no pool insight or anything). But definitely would come again or rent it out for a work happy hour!

title: Great experience
text: Work in the area and needed a hotel room 1-2 nights/week for the summer. Esther was super-helpful in getting everything booked and sorted.  The rooms are decent size for NYC, bathrooms seem larger than most, very clean, friendly staff, fast elevators and awesome location for restaurants. Highly recommend.

title: Great stay
text: It’s close to penn station, with good bars and food in the area. The room was beautiful and clean, with lots of artwork, storage space and mirrors. The bathroom was also really nice, with a beautiful glass shower.

title: Lovely Stay!
text:
I've stayed at the Mondrian twice now, and both times have been great. The bathrooms are so clean and modern. Staff is nice and the rooftop terrace has great views and drinks. Overall lovely stay and would recommend to anyone needing a night in the city. 
Also location is great, about a 15 minute walk to Penn Station and just around the corner from Korea Town and close to subways

title: Best hotel in Manhattan, hands down!
text: I’ve been coming to the Mondrian for a few years now and will only stay here when I visit New York. I’ve been for business, anniversary’s, birthdays.. and the Mondrian is very welcoming and accommodating. My boyfriend and I love it here! Our recent visit we stayed in one of their balcony king suites and it was an amazing experience. The Mondrian is also very clean, and they offer a breakfast voucher at this amazing cafe just around the corner that’s delicious! I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York! Their friendless and warm welcomes will make you want to stay with the Mondrian again and again!!

title: Great Vibe and Location
text: Such a great experience! I truly enjoyed the wonderful customer service and terrace bar. Central location made it easy to get around to sight-see. Plenty of eateries nearby and the staff were very polite and professional. Highly recommend.

title: Great Location
text: My wife and I took some family into the city and we had a great stay. The rooms we clean and had a modern touch to them. The terrace on the 15th floor had a bar with some great mixed drinks and a nice view of the cityscape. The staff at the front was helpful and friendly the entirety of our stay.

title: Fun relaxing in NYC
text: We had such a relaxing time at the Mondrian! We were greeted by friendly faces as soon as we entered the lobby. The drinks on the rooftop was delicious, and the views awesome. The rooms were clean, decore modern and sleek! I will be coming back to stay here bc it's in a great location near Penn Station. Hotel is super close to Korea Town, and other great eateries as well. Thank you Mondrian for a great stay with my friends and family!! Here's a picture of my cousin who just happen to write his new song Slide on the rooftop before checkout!

title: Beware - avoid this hotel if you can.
text:
I cannot express how extraordinarily disappointed I am in this hotel. If you like a clean hotel room and decent customer service this is NOT the hotel for you. 

I paid in advance for a “deluxe” room and the woman at the desk either didn’t care or purposely tried to charge me extra to upgrade to a room I prepaid! 

When I went to the desk to share that there must be a misunderstanding as I prepaid and was given the wrong room, I was directed to a new room that was dirty - items in the toilet, hair on the floor, sink, toilet and the tissue holder. I asked a woman claiming to be a “manager” to please send someone to the room to clean, and if possible to remove the hair, and provided photos via email per her request. Yet, after two hours, no one came to help. When I again requested the desk help, after the “manager” said someone had cleaned the room that was still dirty, I was offered my third room of the day. This third room is missing toilet paper, towels and soap. 

Needless to say, I will never stay here again. I hope others traveling to NYC don’t make the mistake of booking at the Mondrian on Park.

title: Continued Great Experience
text: I hadn't been in NYC for over a year because of COVID, but upon my return, I was excited to get back to the Mondrian.  While certainly COVID has left an imprint on the city, the Mondrian staff are still top-notch and the hotel one of my favorite in the city.  The rooms are clean, staff goes above-and-beyond and the location is perfect.  As I did before COVID, I will continue to return to the Mondrian for all of the above reasons... But if I had to pick one, it's the amazing Mondrian Suite.  Any vacation or work trip can only be enhanced with this suite - that might as well be an apartment.  I find the Mondrian a  fantastic home away from home.

title: Thank you Esther Song and Samir this my new home way from and great location
text: I was so impressed by Esther, Samir, and Bryan Fox, and the front desk team for their kind hospitality and smile.  The location is the perfect walk-in distance to all the great restaurants, nightlife to park, and shopping area 5th ave to Broadway.  You're only six min away from Soho if you take the 6 train

title: Nope
text:
The Mondrian is in a good location, the rates are reasonable (for New York City) and it has a very nice outdoor terrace on the 15th floor. What it doesn’t have is good customer service.

We recently spent two nights at the Mondrian Park Avenue in a suite on the 14th floor. The views from the corner living room were great and we liked the fact that you could open the door for fresh air. The small bedroom and bathroom were a bit tight for two people. The bed was not the most comfortable and the sheets – not fitted – kept coming undone, making sleeping difficult. The room was quiet at night and the ac worked well, even though it was a bit noisy.  

For us, the problem with this hotel is the service, or rather, the lack of service. Check-in consisted of a disinterested front desk person in a black t-shirt handing us room keys. No warm welcome. No explanation of the hotel services, no description of what’s open and what is not open on the premises during the pandemic. No information about our rate and what it included (such as the breakfast credit noted in our reservation). Not even directions to the elevator (which is in a dark hallway around the corner from the front desk and tiny lobby). We learned later – when we received no housekeeping service the next day – that we had to opt-in to receive housekeeping. It would have been nice if they had explained that to us. We did appreciate how quickly staff brought up replacement coffee for the very nice Lavazza coffeemaker in our room. 

For some unexplained reason, the hotel restaurant is not open (the doors are chained shut with a padlock) and the hotel has no breakfast service (although the very nice Terrace bar is open and serving food). We learned from another guest during an elevator conversation that breakfast – which was included in our room rate – was only available a block away at a local coffee shop. Again, it would have been nice if the front desk staff had told us that when we checked in. We asked at the front desk later, and received a card we used for the $20 breakfast credit at Blank Slate coffee on Madison at 30th. 

The hotel is not bad, it’s just not good. Basic service levels should be possible even during a pandemic. We understand how tough the past year has been: that’s part of the reason we wanted to visit NYC and help the city recover. But we’ll be staying elsewhere on our next visit to NYC.

title: Most accommodating + hospitable staff -- Ester Song!!!!
text: I'm a college student working in the city for the summer and the sublet I had lined up fell through last minute so I was essentially left homeless for a week in NYC. It was such a stressful situation as I had just started a my new job while simultaneously trying to scour for an apartment... but in the interim, my stay at the Mondrian was INCREDIBLE. It honestly alleviated so much of the stress I was feeling at the time. I had explained my situation to the staff at the Mondrian upon my arrival and the subsequent service, welcoming, and hospitality I received was impeccable. I felt like the hotel community came together to help me out and take me in as their own. They are truly incredible. Ester Song (now referred to as Auntie Ester) in particular was an absolute GEM. She truly was the glue of it all.  The rooms were dazzling clean, trendy,  comfortable, and made for a great home for a week. Could not have asked for a better experience, especially during such a hectic time.

title: Fabulous Rooftop, Location, Staff and Rooms
text: I booked the rooftop for a corporate event and the venue was gorgeous, staff amazing and food fantastic! This was our first get together due to Covid and the staff at the Mondrian couldn't have made it easier! I also stayed overnight following the event and was delighted with the room! The rooms are spotless, chic and comfortable. They even have rooms with balconies! The staff is so helpful and welcoming. I recommend the Mondrian to anyone looking to hold an event or just a wonderful place to stay while in NYC!

title: A little disappointed.
text: I am quite disappointed at the whole check in experience. I chose this hotel out of many in the area because it looked really nice and wanted to try something else besides The James where I normally stay. I will be here for 10 nights and asked for a quiet high floor room. I was told it was completely sold out and if I wanted an upgrade next time to book directly with them instead of booking.com. So I was put on a low floor right next to the elevator and can hear people in the hall. I wasn't told any info about the hotel, not the wifi info not about the bar or if there was food on site. Just a simple here is your key and there's the elevator. The room is a nice size and clean.

title: Great Terrace Bar and Cocktails!
text: Really lovely staff. Had afternoon cocktails for a work event on the terrace. Great views, lovely people, strong cocktails. Highly recommend asking for a mezcal margarita! They also have a decent beer selection, which I feel is difficult to find at more upscale places for whatever reason

title: Welcoming Atmosphere
text: I visited NYC for the first time to see family, and they insisted we visit the Mondrian, specifically the rooftop terrace. I LOVED the artwork in the elevator, even the bathroom was incredible! Bernard was charming and facilitated an incredibly hospitable environment. Koko,  Kristen, and Tanner were very professional and were there to service our every need. I would be remiss without including our visit from the lovely Esther Song. She was such a welcoming presence and made us all feel like family. 10/10 experience.  I cannot wait to return to NYC and the Mondrian Terrace is definitely on my list of places to be.

title: Back and Better!
text: The Mondrian Hotel is back and better than ever. After a crazy year the Mondrian is back with even better experience and service than I remember pre Pandemic. If you are looking to host a cool event or just have a nice evening out the Mondrian is for you!

title: Amazing views + service
text: I had a wonderful experience at the Mondrian. Every staff member I encountered, from the front desk to the bartender were delightful and eager to help. We stayed on a great night - they had a very nice string quartet playing and that really elevated our experience on the terrace! Rooms were super clean and modern. Would definitely recommend to my friends and family. Thank you!

title: Clean, chic, and 5 star service!
text: I had the opportunity to stay at the Park Avenue Mondrian last month and it was AMAZING! The staff was super friendly and accommodating, the room was nice and clean and the rooftop bar/lounge was SO NICE! There was a string quartet performing the evening my partner and I went and it was beautiful with the NYC views! Also, it's conveniently located walking distance to mass transportation and Korea Town. A++++ definitely would come back!

title: My favorite place to stay when in NYC
text:
The Park Avenue Mondrian is the best .   I visited on 6/3/21 for my birthday .     The staff  was very helpful , professional and went above and beyond to ensure my stay was nothing but great .  The rooms are cozy and I  Iove the  decor.  I was skeptical staying because if Covid precautions  however the rooms were extremely clean and mask were worn by staff members and guest . The location was in close proximity to  lots of restaurants and lounges.  We walked most of the places we visited.  Although We did id venture out I spent most of my time enjoying the rooftop terrace.   A beautiful view, the food and drinks were so good! A great place for a date night or enjoying tome with friends.   

Something that stood out to me was the manager introducing herself and wishing me a happy birthday .  I was also greeted by a staff member as soon as I arrived .  

The Mondrian will definitely be my hotel of choice whenever I visit the city!

title: Best service!!!
text: Had the chance to stay here for Memorial Day weekend! I Love this hotel! Best customer service! Everyone was so polite and on point! Everyone was so sincere and friendly. It Was super clean. The terrace is open for the midtown views. I can’t wait to come back! Thank you!!!!

title: Not so good, wouldn’t come back
text: Have stayed all over NYC, tried the Mondrian to be near family for a visit.  I was underwhelmed by this hotel.  Staff are nice, elevators work well, bed comfortable, but otherwise a disappointment.  Our room was very small (even by NYC standards) though the bathroom was large and nice.  Furniture and carpeting were scuffed and old. There was a coke and snacks left from a previous guest. The phone did not work, had to to be fixed twice.  The hotel restaurant is closed. They have a nice terrace, but its not open during the day. No coffee service (though they did offer us a coffee maker).  So while we made the best of it, there was nothing that made me want to come back-just meh.  If I wanted to stay in that area again, I might try the Hotel Giraffe nearby.

title: more than expected.
text: Mondrian Park Avenue has great location, prime service, amazing room and large space. The overall experience was wondeful .  The bathroom size it´s really generous for NY patrons.   varied Minibar, 24h service, close to near M stations

title: Incredible experience
text: Beautiful hotel and incredibly clean. Esther was so incredible, the room service was fast and delicious and the view was spectacular!! I could recommend a better stay. 10/10 would not hesitate to come back. -BB

title: Amazing staff, location, and room!
text: The room was so spacious, and beautiful. The location was very close to the subway so it was easy to get around the city. The staff accommodated every request we made, including a last minute late check out. I was also impressed with its immaculate cleanliness. Not to mention the bed was SO comfortable, and I love the shower with 3 shower heads. Our stay was a 10/10 and will 100% return!

title: Underwhelming
text:
This hotel looks so much nicer in the pictures than it does in reality. It seems elegant, but everything in the room felt cheap and shabby. The "deluxe king"room I booked  was dark, with a small window looking out onto a nondescript building right next to the hotel. The air conditioning rattled loudly and the shower door was wonky. 

It was clean, quiet and everyone I interacted with was nice, so it wasn't all bad. But there are so many hotels in this price range and area that are much, much nicer.

title: Astounding ambiance during intimate night of performing
text: I went to the Mondrian's Broadway night. I was seated in a extremely comfortable lounge area which faced the stage area. Their Managers Esther and Bernard were so welcoming and helpful. Their menu recommendations did not disappoint.  The Pineapple Stinger was amazing and I can not stop thinking about their hummus. The Margherita Pizza combined with the breathtaking views made this the perfect New York City evening.

title: Find Another Hotel
text:
I can't recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. I was excited about staying at this hotel for my birthday but this hotel does not deserve to have a five-star rating!! I wish I read the other Yelp reviews before staying here. I've stayed at many other hotels that operated at a higher standard! So many things in our room were stained. The curtains, the comforter, and the shower curtain were all stained as if they hadn't been cleaned and needed to be replaced (pictures attached). It looked gross. We asked three times for housekeeping or management to come to see the stains. No one came.

In the shower the foundation of the floor being flat caused the water to not drain properly. We had water under the sink and by the toilet. All of our towels we ended up using on the wet floor. Also, when we checked in we weren't informed that continental breakfast wasn't being offered. Our reservation included breakfast so on our last day we inquired and found out that breakfast vouchers could be used at a coffee shop down the street! On our last day, we were told check out was 12:00pm and then later that check out was 2:00pm. Everything was inconsistent and not managed properly. I appreciate the small price adjustment for our room given by the Director of the Front Office but I can not recommend this hotel at all!!

title: Weekend at Mondrian
text: Another beautiful weekend at the Mondrian Park Avenue. Clean, sophisticated, chic all in one. Nice bright room with lots of natural light overlooking the city. It was the perfect night away for my husband & I. We did valet service which is offered at an extremely fair rate especially for NYC. Esther in Sales took excellent care in ensuring we had a great time from start to finish. Can't wait for my next stay.

title: Weekend at Mondrian Park ave
text: I was amazed of how nice and clean the room were . The hotel located in center of manhattan actually easy walkable to 5 th and herald square. My trip was amazing and recommend this hotel for a weekend or a stay as you will be taking good care from the team and also get to have later check in which I love.

title: A Park Avenue Find
text:
The Mondrian is like finding the perfect hotel in the midst of the city. It is ideally located so you can be everywhere but never feeling its too busy. A lot of nice places to eat nearby and you can be in Chelsea and NoLiTa in a 10 minute walk; 15minutes to 42nd Street and the Broadway area. 

This is a modern hotel that shows off how comfort, style and modern can be a good mix. Rooms a re very nice and well appointed. The 15th Floor lounge has become a place to be for music and lite fare. 

The staff is warm and engaging and the whole experience feels very clean and safe . 

Strongly recommend

title: Midweek break
text: I surprised my boyfriend with an overnight stay at the Mondrian and we went to the broadway live performance on the terrace. It was a beautiful hotel and wonderful experience. The staff was delightful and the views were spectacular!! Would highly recommend

title: Disgusting, Trashy, GHETTO
text: Traveled to NYC for my sister's birthday only to be mortified with my experience. First, the front desk staff is UNDER STAFFED. I waited in a tiny lobby to check-in and the employees were taking calls, helping guest that walked up and I just waited until whenever they were free. Unacceptable. The room was tiny and there was hair in my bathroom on the toilet seat. The curtains were dingy, haven't been washed in years. Window panes were dusty. Next, the first night after hanging out  for dinner, I arrive back to my room to find the elevator and my floor reeked with marijuana. Mondrian NY is horrible. The fee should be $99 for a night, that's generous. Location great. Staff no where to be found, just a clown show.

title: Clean
text: Clean hotel but what isn't during these pandemic times. It's a nice hotel. Plain. Simple. Easy to check in. Hardly any amenities in the room. No coffee. Phone didn't work. Small room but typical of New York City. Nice people. Fine service when I called but needed to do so on my mobile to get support. It wouldn't take much to provide some amenities or at least offer them upon check in.

title: A Gem on Park
text: This is a great hotel with everything you need to enjoy your trip to NYC. I stayed here while attending to business in the area and it's in a great location right on Park Ave, just minutes from my train at Gran Central. Wifi is the room is strong and allowed me to work from my room for a few hours. The rooftop has beautiful views of the city and is a great place to unwind at the end of the day. I will definitely be back!

title: Great NYC night event
text: Had the best time throwing a surprise birthday. The hotel was EXTREMELY accommodating every step of the way. Esther helped out tremendously with all our needs. Will absolutely be recommending this hotel to all my friends along with planning future events!

title: BEST NYC HOTEL
text: Best hotel and team its a hidden gem, Esther made the stay and experience great. Felt very safe and COVID compliance was in order- the staff is very accommodating. Beautiful views of NYC from their balcony rooms and the rooftop bar has amazing food and live music :)

title: Mondrian Park Avenue
text: Came to NYC to celebrate a birthday and stayed here. Everyone was nice and accommodated us with whatever we needed. Lovely staff, nice rooms, comfortable beds. Also had a rooftop “terrace” that had a great video and great drinks. 10/10 would recommend staying here!

title: Very clean modern hotel with great staff
text:
Stayed here for a weekend. It is very clean and the room was great. Bed was very comfortable and room was nicely decorated. I didn’t get a balcony room just a regular one, but the balcony rooms look gorgeous. Their restaurant was closed so they provided a voucher for a nearby cafe which was very good. Staff were very accommodating. 

During the spring, the hotel has a candlelight concert series on the balcony with classical music. The balcony is great, and has a beautiful view of the city, and comfortable seating. You can have drinks and food on the balcony. 

I highly recommend this hotel.

title: February NYC date night
text: My husband and I had a date night here - we live in Queens - but wanted a break from staying at home with our 3 year old most days for the past year. This hotel was gorgeous! From the modern lobby to the clean and comfortable rooms - I was really impressed. Location was great and easily accessible, especially w/ valet parking available! Cozy bed, large TV, fun views of NYC lights - we will be back!

title: Great staff, incredibly clean
text:
Incredibly clean & safe.
Great staff here that puts in the extra effort across the board. Charlie Katz, Antoinette, Adam & Ester at night (thanks for letting me know about the pizza place instead of McDonald’s.) all look after you like your like a friend, suggestions for food with all the constant changes in NYC has been great. Blank slate is tasty and efficient w service for lunch and breakfast. 
 This is my go to in NYC. Safe and central to everything. They are pet friendly hotel and know where to send you if there is a animal emergency. They act with compassion. Any employer is lucky to have this group.
 Pillows are great and many balcony rooms to give full NYC hotel experience.

title: Beyond Amazing!
text:
This is probably my 7th stay in this fantastic hotel!  This really feels like my home away from home:)

I'm writing this as I am checking out today. You cannot go wrong with this amazing hotel- the property, the location and the rooms are impeccable. Rooms are are clean, cozy and beds are super comfortable. Spotless bathrooms. Love this hotel! The location is so central and you feel so comfortable being here. 

As beautiful as the setting  is, I feel that it is the staff that has always made my stay worthwhile - especially the manager, who was instrumental in securing my room. The manager,  Esther Song  is extremely professional, friendly and very responsive.   I had an issue with the initial room booking in that - my flight was canceled the night before and had to change the booking to the following week, and this was swiftly and  efficiently resolved by Ms. Song..I am beyond grateful. I had my documents delivered a week prior and this was also taken care of by the team. Thank you  so much for your hospitality, Esther!

Will be back in the summer!

title: Amazing hotel & location!
text: I recently stayed here and it is truly an amazing hotel. The room sizes are great and the staff and service was incredible. The location is perfect, close to bars and restaurants, all in walking distance. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: I recently stayed in this hotel and have nothing but positive things to say. It is beautiful, extremely clean,  close to great bars and restaurants they even had a no contact check in which was great during the covid pandemic. All staff members were extremely kind and eager to help. I will definitely be coming back to stay again!

title: Great rooms, unbeatable location, terrific service
text: We just stayed there for a very small Covid safe wedding. Incredible experience. The space is beautiful, the location is perfect, the staff was absolutely incredible. Cannot overstate how impressed I was with this place. Highly recommended!

title: Booked for a Week, Stayed for 2 Months
text:
Above and Beyond!!

Every staff member and I mean every staff members made my extended stay here during the pandemic absolutely amazing. Having sold my condo and in the process of renovating my new home, I needed a place to lay my head that wasn’t constantly covered in dry wall dust for what I thought would be an extended weekend birthday staycation. Well that extended weekend turned into two months and those two months were so restorative and peaceful especially with moving during a pandemic and overseeing a gut renovation. 

Ester, Antoinette, Tyler, and everyone else that is employed by the Mondrian Park Ave went above and beyond to make me comfortable. Not only was I completely at peace but so was my dog. They are one of the few luxury hotels that truly mean it when they say they are pet friendly. When I forgot my dogs water bowl and the local Petsmart (via Instacart) failed not once but twice to deliver one that I had purchased, I happened to mention this to one of the housekeepers and literally five minutes later there was a Barkbox filled with food bowl, water bowl, snacks, and toys outside my suite door!! 100% Tucker Approved. 

I recommend the Mondrian Park Avenue to everyone and will be staying here again for my upcoming staycation.

title: INCREDIBLE
text: I love visiting Mondrian Park Ave every month. I feel very safe. Its a BEAUTIFUL hotel with amazing service and perfect, central location. I miss the restaurant but I love the bar and terrace on the 15th floor. I wish I could live here! Check in and check out are very easy and fast. Service was great. Rooms are super clean. I had a beautiful balcony room. The staff did everything I asked and very quickly. Cant wait to visit again in two weeks!

title: Home away from home.
text: My Girlfriend and I stayed here for a whole month while working in NYC. This hotel has become our second home over over the past few years with traveling back and forth for work. Last month when Buffalo NY was closed due to covid restrictions, we went to NYC for work and spent an entire month at the Mondrian. Everyone at this Hotel makes you feel at home and went above and beyond for us. We will never stay anywhere else when in NYC. You would think after spending a whole month in a hotel you would notice something that you didn’t like but I can honestly say, there was nothing unpleasant about our stay.

title: Great guest services, comfy rooms
text: We booked connecting rooms for my daughter's outpatient surgery at NYU Langone.  This hotel is well situated for easy arrival and departure from the hospital.  What made this stay easier was the staff's assistance for our post surgical requests.  They sent up an extra fridge, a tea kettle, a portable coffee station, ice on request and whatever else we asked for.  They were always friendly, knew our names by the second morning and remained responsive throughout our several days there.  The rooms are comfy with amazing huge double showers.  The bathrooms are so spacious.  They offer thick, absorbent towels and more on request.  For NYC, the rooms were surprisingly quiet.  Each room has its own thermostat for comfort.  There's an arrangement for breakfast vouchers from a cafe around the corner (delicious!) until the hotel's restaurants open back up post Covid.  Esther runs a tight and service oriented operation at the Mondrian.  I will be back!  Highly recommend!

title: Visiting NYC
text:
I go to NYC often, and when I go I ALWAYS stay at The Mondrian on park ave. I would never even think about staying anywhere else! 
This hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are really spacious.
They’re always SO clean, and right now with covid I don’t know if you can stay anywhere cleaner. 
I have been coming here for months and the staff has treated me like family ever since day 1.
If you stay here you will not regret it!! It’s a great hotel and the price point is great for what you’re getting.

title: Great experience, highly recommended!
text:
I stayed at the Mondrian Park Ave several times in the past few months and enjoyed my staying time after time.
The level of service is high, all staff are super professionals and attentive; the facility is super stylish with beautiful well equipped rooms and a perfect bathrooms.
The location of the hotel is unbeatable- 30th/Park Ave, steps to great restaurants, parks, and everything NYC has to offer.
I will definitely continue coming here for business or otherwise, and am looking forward to visit other locations of the Mondrian around the globe.

title: Never going back
text:
We had to go to NY for two nights. Checked in to the Mondrian with high expectations. Contactless check in was great.   We got to our room and the bathroom was not clean.  There was leftover “stuff” in the toilet bowl.  I almost threw up.  Horrified in normal times and now especially during covid. Called downstairs and they switched me immediately but did not apologize or make any efforts to compensate us. Instead we got moved to a smaller room.  The room was just ok.  It definitely needs some refreshing or upgrading. The feathers in the pillows kept coming out.  Asked for housekeeping and didn’t get it. Had to ask for clean towels twice before they brought them up.
Really disappointed.   We didn’t leave because it was such a short stay we didn’t feel like another hassle. 
Won’t be returning.  Ever.

title: Incredible Design Amazing Service and VERY SAFE + SANITARY
text: Stayed at Mondrian Park Avenue when they reopened during the pandemic and the hotel is spotless in both cleanliness and service. Anderson Adam and Antoneta are very hospitable. Mondrian Terrace is a gorgeous place to take friends or a date for an evening out on the town. They have this beautiful outdoor concert with classical musicians providing beautiful music for the soul during this time. Rooms are very clean and while they do not offer housekeeping service as usual during this time, any requests for additional bath amenities are promptly answered. Highly recommended and I will be back!

title: Friendly accommodating hotel
text: This hotel is spotless and has the best scent in the lobby . Anderson at the front desk is extremely friendly and makes all the guests he seems to encounter feel at home . There are plenty of hand sanitizers everywhere which is great during these times . Highly recommend.

title: My New NYC home
text:
Came here on a Referal by a good friend and was received with the highest standard of hospitality you could imagine. From the hotel staff to the bar staff and the managers who always made sure me and business partner were accommodated. I have to be in the city two weeks at a time, so I am making this my new go to place for my NYC trips.

Thank you guys so much.

title: My favorite hotel in the city
text: This is my favorite go to hotel in the city for all occasions, the staff is amazing Esther & Antoneta always assure a perfect stay! The service is like no other & it  has the best view of the city definitely recommend it

title: Hospitality at its best!
text: Visited a few times. Have to say I highly recommend Mondrian for a nice staycation and convenient location to all things Manhattan. Very accommodating during this Covid pandemic and prior. Hotel staff are always friendly and helpful. They have a beautiful rooftop with view of the city, comfy furniture, nice restaurant, and keep it classy. Shout out to Esther for her dedication.

title: Simply The Best Hotel
text: Mondrian Park Avenue is amazingly beautiful with a very soothing interior throughout the hotel.   It is a  beautiful place to relax and makes me feel -at -home as the Mondrian is the only hotel I stay at while in NYC. The experience is always first class without any exceptions.   The rooms are very classy and welcoming and you will find yourself extremely comfortable.  I have to thank Antoneta and Esther who are absolutely amazing making the Mondrian a sophisticated relaxing hotel.  Do yourself a favor when visiting for business and pleasure stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue.

title: Great Hotel and Great Experience
text: The experience at Mondrian was superb. My girlfriend and I rented the penthouse for the night during Halloween and we are very happy we did so. Very clean, sanitized and stuff was extremely nice. Esther was very accommodating during our entire stay and was able to help us with every request. I highly recommend staying at the Mondrian.

title: My Love of the Mondrian Park Hotel
text: For many years now the Mondrian Park hotel in NY has been my go to hotel. From the rooms to the service the hotel has NEVER disappointed me and my music clients have never been unsatisfied, ever. I can't wait for us to get out of this Covid-19 pandemic so that I can experience the amazing food from the restaurant again but until then when I do visit the hotel for various meetings and a quick bite, the pizza on the terrace during the summer was simply fab. Love this hotel and love all the people who work there!

title: Full Lux experience

Thank you again to all of the staff. ❤️

title: Amazing stay!
text: Great views and excellent service. The hotel is in a central location, with everything you need near by. It is Luxury at its finest. The Piet Suite is bigger than what it looks like on the website. I highly recommend it!

title: Above and beyond
text:
My stay at the Mondrian went well beyond what I would have expected. Esther’s level of service and attention to detail made this one of my most memorable hotel stays.

If you’re visiting Manhattan, you can’t go wrong at the Mondrian

title: Perfect NYC Oasis
text: I have stayed at Mondrian Park Avenue 5 times - 2 pre COVID and 3 times since.  The hotel’s COVID safety protocols combined with its pristine cleanliness provide great peace of mind.  Its charm and positive energy remain very much intact while the staff is extraordinarily helpful.  It is the perfect NYC oasis.

title: Service above and beyond on every level!
text: This is the sixth time I have stayed at the Mondrian in the last three months because their service and cleanliness has been above and beyond throughout Covid.  I have an injury and they brought me up many buckets of ice. They were even so thoughtful at the front desk to have an employee bring my food to my room, as I have a cast on my leg, without me even asking. The last time I left it was raining and the nice manager helped me carry my bags to my car and held an umbrella over me. I will absolutely stay here for all of my New York trips, which is at least once a month. I have stayed at many five star hotels in the city and have lived in the city for 13 years, however this place has truly felt like home in the craziest of times.  Also they are extremely flexible with late check outs and work very hard to accommodate early check ins too.

title: Love this hotel!!
text: What a modern, clean, beautiful hotel.  We stayed at Mondrian for a wedding this past weekend. Not only were rooms a nice size, super clean and nicely decorated, but the staff of the hotel was amazing.  Let’s not forget the views of NYC. The staff of rooftop bar was THE BEST!!! Thank you all for your great work.

title: Excellent location and safety precautions
text: We stayed here for an evening for a quick staycation and I was very impressed with the precautions (hand sanitizer everywhere), their contactless check-in and super friendly staff. The location is perfect for exploring the city. Whether you live here and just need a change of scenery or are coming from out of town, I highly recommend.

title: Perfect
text: Thank you so much Mondrian Park Ave! Looking forward to my next trip next month. I had the best stay even during Corona. Everyone had appropriate PPE and practiced social and physical distancing. I felt very safe and comfortable. I love the clean and sleek rooms and big bathrooms; Not to mention the beautiful view of the Empire State Building. So rare in NYC. The staff are always accommodating. Perfect location. My home away from home. My FAVORITE hotel

title: The best hotel and price
text: This hotel room is just amazing they have the best customer service so attentive friendly clean out of every hotel room I’ve ever stayed at this is my favorite and Iv stayed at some of the nicest hotels in the world this one wins I swear to god I’m always traveling the size is perfect you can’t beat the price and size clean location and view xo ester was so lovely at the front desk she really is a team leader!!! 10000 percent best customer service.

title: Weekend in Fall 2020

title: Must Stay!!

title: Awesome time in NYC!

title: Exceptional Hotel in NYC
text:

The Hotel and the Restaurant/Terrace staff are very friendly and make you feel at home away from home. I DO Recommend this Hotel to all my friends and family, because Mondrian will not let me down.

title: Favorite Staff and Hotel in NYC
text:
Centrally located and nestled in the heart of town this hotel has everything you need and more. 

While entering the hotel you are greeting by a doorman with a smile.  Who then takes your bags as you go to check in. I was Immediately offered refreshments as I checked in.  I came to the hotel before my check in window and the staff did everything and more to help me secure a room at 10 am.  (I was tired and needed a shower. title: BAÑO ASQUEROSO
text: En el baño la puerta de vidrio de la ducha  tenía problemas para abrirse daba la sensación de quedarte encerrado y cuando intentabas abrirla parecía que se iba a romper mientras los hacías, el inodoro dentro tenía una mancha oscura que parecía materia fecal,algo sumamente repugnante y desagradable, lo peor de todo es que luego de hacer el check out y dar la queja en recepción sólo me dijeron que iban a revisar, pero no obtuve ninguna disculpas por parte del personal, un servicio y atención horrible, al reservar y ver las fotos del hotel estaba muy entusiasmada pero mi experiencia fue decepcionante.No lo recomendaría a nadie este hotel.

title: Mondrian Terrace - Take in AWESOME NYC views
text: The hotel's rooftop terrace is quaint and great during Covid. Open air and spectacular views of midtown - both east and west - are great while sipping superbly curated cocktails. Great drinks, views, service with friends/family is a must! Food was super tasty too!

title: If you need a NYC getaway
text: The hotel staff was incredibly nice and accommodating. Protocols were followed and put in place for guest safety. Esther was just wonderful!!! Loved the hotel!! Wish I'd stayed here before March but glad I choose to have a short staycation at the property.

title: Disgusting dirty room during the pandemic
text:
After a tropical storm left us with no power, hot water, and destroyed our property we decided to come into the city.  I specifically wanted to stay at a 5 star hotel because I am very paranoid about cleanliness and wanted a hotel that was really abiding by cdc guidelines.  When I read the reviews on how this hotel was handling this situation I was sold and it didn’t hurt that they also supported front line workers during the pandemic. And I wanted to support a hotel that supported them.  

I was so wrong. We were given a room that was disgustingly dirty.  Even during normal times this is unhygienic and unsanitary but during covid times it’s just plain old unsafe.  Bathroom was used, streaks on the shower, toothpaste in the sink, bed was completely disheveled.  

When my husband brought this up to a front desk staffer (I will not mention his name, because at the end of the day he just works there and this a problem with the management) he said housekeeping had left and there was nothing he could do. When I spoke to him he said the room was clean it just needed new sheets and toiletries. (I have posted pictures, you be the judge of this) They also say that they fog their rooms and keep them unused for 48 hours.  How do I know that’s true when they can give us a room in this state?

Then to make matters worse this front desk person told his manager that my husband refused to leave the room when in fact he told my husband that someone would come and show him another room. So my husband just sat with his mask on for one hour in the room waiting for someone to get him.  

Turns out we were accidentally given the wrong room but our room was now occupied. Why not just tell us this and apologize instead of giving us a bunch of excuses and then making us feel worse by insulting my big teddy bear of a husband? This is what actually hurt me the most, adding insult to injury. 

I am writing this review while still checked into the hotel.  (So I hope this doesn’t impact our stay even more negatively) We checked in on Wednesday, so I expected on Thursday or Friday I’d hear back from the manager with at least a sincere apology because I know Wednesday was a stressful day for everyone but alas, I have not even heard a whisper from him. 

I am shocked that a hotel group so well known for its hospitality has treated their patrons this way.  And unfortunately this unsafe situation, trumps all the good we’ve encountered at this hotel during our stay and other sbe hotels we’ve stayed in abroad and around the country.

title: Great views, great rooms
text:
I was really worried how they would be handling guest experience with COVID, but everything was done perfectly.  Masks/PPE provided in room, contactless delivery of towels and amenities (order it and they'll leave it on your door, knock, and leave like COVID ninjas), signs providing social distancing instructions and hand sanitizer everywhere, and their beautiful terrace is open with socially distanced tables.  

Esther was wonderful in providing accommodations and being welcoming, Antoneta was patrolling the hotel ensuring that all staff and guests were properly following guidelines, and Coco was lovely in ensuring my experience on the Terrace was immaculate.  The cleanliness and attention to detail here is unbeatable!

title: Perfect home away from home gem
text: Stayed here for a 2 week staycation. Little oasis in the city. Hotel Staff were super friendly and efficient! Lovely terrace with a quaint seating area - a private getaway when I didnt want to step out of hotel and have a proper cocktail. Felt extremely safe and clean during my stay and for the rate, location and quality the current rate is a rare find. Perfectly located going either uptown or downtown- I’d take an occasional exercise run to Central Park or quick citibike ride to Soho. Looking forward to coming back to eat at the hotel’s restaurant, Cleo, outdoor dining!

title: One night Mondrian stay
text: I was not impressed by this hotel.  I definitely wouldn't rate it a 5 star hotel. The rooms are very small and underwhelming. The pictures on the website make it look much better than it actually is.  The staff was nice and friendly.

title: Top-notch
text: Always my go-to hotel whenever I'm in town only because I KNOW how spotless they keep their space - from disinfectants in every corner to their sanitizing wands! Rest assured they take their cleanliness to the next level.

title: Perfect in ever way
text: My family of four stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was the nicest room and hotel that I’ve ever stayed in in NYC. I’ve stayed in all of the 5+ star hotels and the service, room and location surpassed them all. The room was large which is an anomaly in NYC. It fit our family of 4 comfortably. The service was impeccable. The location is ideal. I walked to Barry’s in the morning. We walked to brunch and dinner. Couldn’t have been a better experience. Highly recommend.

title: post quarantine birthday
text: had a seamless and touch free check-in with hand sanitizer EVERYWHERE. left a note on my booking that i was celebrating a belated birthday and came to a cute surprise in my room. i was able to get in touch with sales and ESTHER helped book a small table at their rooftop bar. its a very intimate cozy bar.

title: Recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC
text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC the staff was amazing. I had an amazing time i am glad i chose this hotel to have a great night.  Some of the greatest views in Manhattan.  Great experience.

title: Excellent accommodations and service in a central location
text: I visited this hotel at the beginning of March and was blown away by the service of everyone that worked here, but especially Adam.  He went out of his way help make our stay extra special.  His patience and professionalism is what people should strive for.  Thank you Adam for making our stay so special!  The hotel itself was also very clean, comfortable and in a fantastic location.  If the weather were warmer and wasn't raining most of the time, we would have been able to walk to most of our destinations.  I would definitely stay here again the next time I visit NYC.

title: A pleasant stay
text:
I stayed at the Mondrian for 2 nights. Nice hotel, well designed and comfortable. Service was good too. I requested extra pillows and they were promptly sent up. 
The rooms are small so book a larger one because when I asked for an upgrade to a suite they told me all the suites were under renovation. Not sure I bought that but that’s ok. 
The location is great too. I would definitely return

title: A hidden gem
text: Very stylish hotel and very trendy. Very beautiful inside and staff made sure all my needs were taken care of. My stay was perfected with all I needed: great location, great staff, amazing design and decor, loved the bathrooms, very clean and spotless, easy check in and check out. VERY cool bar which ended up being a great place to chat with friends. This place deserves a 100/100.

title: Low key and perfect
text:
I stayed at the Mondrian for a 4 day business trip. Location was convenient to walk places, eat or hop on the subway. It's a no fuss type of hotel which I appreciate. No lines, no waiting for elevator, quiet lobby. The terrace on the 11th floor is a great place to hang out and do some work during the day, socialize later in the day. Next door is Felix coffee shop which has the best coffee ever. Standard rooms are small but normal for NY. Well appointed.
But best of all was Ludo at the front desk who took personal interest in making sure my stay was pleasant.

title: Fantastic
text: I have to say that this is by far my favorite hotel to stay at when I visit NYC. I was greeted by a friendly and very helpful staff. I absolutely loved my room. It was so comfortable and immaculate. The balcony view was an extra delight. The bar and restaurant were fun and food was delicious. I cannot wait to stay there again.

title: Loved the Smell
text: The room was really small, but compact, However the best thing about the hotel is the smell. I literally begged the employees there to tell me the brand of the perfume they are using in the hoteli they never did.

title: Shameful Service
text:
We are disappointed and feel it is important that management reads this review. When your room is not made while you are away all day!! and we had the tag : Make our Room" at the door.  Upon calling them at 5:30 PM upon our return, you get the run around!!.  We have been short handed, busy, !! can we do it Now!.  

Next to top off It has taken them over an hour to deliver towels in the morning since nothing was replaced yesterday.  Called them 3 times!!! since 9.30 AM. Really SAD and UnProfessional.  Get MORE HELP in your hospitality group.

title: Only Decent if you get a suite - even largest regular room is claustrophobic
text:
In summer, I stayed in a suite at the Mondrian, which was decent, if a tad on the small side for a suite (with limited closet space, but since I was there in summer without  coats and boots, it wasn't an issue).

In fall, I returned and opted for the largest size regular room -- the Premier King, which is allegedly 375 square feet. The Premier King looks nothing like the picture on the website and is actually claustrophobic, with nowhere to work and nowhere to put a large suitcase. I was so surprised by the size of the room that I went down to the front desk since I assumed there must have been a mistake and I wasn't given the category of room I booked. The desk clerk claimed I was in the correct room and allowed that perhaps some Premier King rooms are larger than others. I can only imagine what the smaller rooms are like.

The bathroom in this room was also so narrow that the only way I can describe it is that when you were sitting on the toilet you felt like you were in a MRI machine. You really have to shimmy in.

I personally would never stay at this hotel again unless I could get a suite. If you are the kind of person who travels without luggage and who is never in your room when in New York City and just wants a place to sleep, your mileage may vary.

As per my prior review, the location is nice and it is fairly quiet.

title: Amazing - thank-you
text:
Fantastic location, brilliant staff and all round very happy with the experience. Could do with room service upgrade, but when you have Uber Eats who cares!

Only criticism is the bars close way too early, like 10pm to 10:30pm (this needs sorting ASAP) - other than that great stay - we only chose as we couldn’t  get into another hotel, but had frequented the Miami Mondrian and so for me, my wife and 11 year old daughter was great.

Would def stay here again!

title: Worst customer service ever.  Still can not believe it.
text:
Without wanting to go into much detail, I made a direct booking for which I did not receive any confirmation. Since then I called 5 times to ask for it. Each time they assured me they would send it and that my email was spelled wrong. Each time I would give it again like a moron spelling my name again and again. Then during the last time they did send me the confirmation  which was a completely different number from the one I was told over the first phone call and much higher prices. I communicated as again via mail to ask for correct confirmation and received no reply.

In the end I called one last time to cancel my reservation. That phone call lasted one hour and six minutes. Seriously I can not explain the frustration.  During the last one hour call I asked the agent to email me confirming that there are no pending reservations to my name and she agreed to do this but ofcourse she didn't. If my credit card gets charged, I will follow a legal route. 

This is a five star hotel. This is not a proper customer service. I since booked with another hotel and I have received the confirmation and everything.
Such frustration.

title: Comfortable and centric
text:
Location, quality, and Johnny! ;) He was very helpful and really nice! Was cool to always find him on the door after work.

Great place to stay for business for a week! Close to the most interesting attractions in New York.

title: Amazing Stay!
text:
I have been coming to the Mondrian Park Avenue and Los Angeles, for many years, now. It is, quite simply, the best hotel! The location is so time! The rooms are so comfortable, the rooftop is great - their in house restaurant Cleo is superb! The service is sublime. From the doorman, the reception to housekeeping. I’d  like to give a Special shoutout to the manager, Antonetta for always going the extra mile to make my stay special! No matter how busy the hotel gets, the team always take care of you! 

For me, The Mondrian Park Avenue is actually a New York landmark and beats with the life of the finest city in the world.

In a city that has fabulous hotels, I don’t think I can stay anywhere else.

title: Top notch!
text: I just want to thank Nicole for the kind help you gave. You are so very kind. The room was so quiet. I would like to buy a bed like that for myself. Is that a feather bed? Location is perfect! Chapeau for customer service. Happy camper here.

title: "Separate seating area" Not!
text: Beware - the Premier room is stated to have a "separate sitting area". The use of the word "separate" is deceiving. I can only conclude what they mean is the sitting area is not attached to the bed! What it is is a small table (about 20x20 inches) with a single chair crammed between the wall and the bed such that about 12 inches separate them. I can't imagine the management would expect such a "separate sitting area" if they were checking into a hotel room.

title: false advertising
text:
the hotel charges a secret resort fee $31.50 a day so WI FI is not free as advertised 

they charge for coffee/gym/wifi whether use these or not 

its a scam and puts a bad taste in your mouth when you see the final bill

title: NYC Gem
text: Great location, close to all the attractions, comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast. The staff are really helpful with all the needs. Cleo restaurant is really good, the brunch is amazing and different options to order. For business travelers is really a great option.

title: Home away from home !
text: I absolutely loved my stay at the Mondrian. The hotel staff was amazing and provided a high level of customer service. The food at Cleo was the icing on the cake. I'm looking forward to my next visit!

title: Amazing HOTEL
text:
We could not have asked for better service. With HUNDREDS of hotels to choose from, we selected the Mondrian hotel on Park Avenue. 

Of all the GREAT service we experienced, we must call out the excellence of Johnny, Jamir, and Rosanny. They were there every time we came and left with such warmth and willingness to help!

The hotel is well equipped with everything you need as a tourist. The breakfast is amazing - but ENSURE it is part of your package. 

The service is top notch and everyone there is very willing to assist in making your stay among the best in New York!

While the hotel is on a busy street, the noise was minimal. Also, CLEO, the restaurant has a delicious menu. 

We would stay again without reservation!

title: Amazing bell man
text: The stay at this hotel was amazing!! The bell man was extremely professional and always wanted to go the extra mile to help and I’ve been around the world never had this type of service before. Johnny is the name of the bell man

title: Great service!
text: My family and I went to New York City for the weekend, and had a lovely stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue. It was a great location, and had wonderful service. Johnny, the doorman was very helpful and friendly. I recommend this hotel to anyone going on a trip to the big apple. P.S. Love the decor!

title: Excellent choice in midtown - I will come back
text:
Good location, close to the subway in the southern part of midtown
good room with comfortable bed
Small but well designed bathroom with double headed shower
Excellent mini-bar and selection of pre-mixed cocktails
Excellent front desk staff, friendly, helpful and professional- the real 5* thing of this hotel
The 15th floor bar and heated terrace are very cool
Price was good compared to quality of the room and service

Disliked · few glitches that you dont expect in a 5* hotel
Room cleaning : on Sunday I left the room at 10am and back at 5PM it still hadn't been cleaned. I had to call twice the front desk. Also the cleaners should use hat or bonnet - I found several hair which is a bit annoying thing
The wifi is a bit unstable and it doesn't connect automatically- you need to reconnect almost every day

Overall a very positive experience

title: Tiny room, nightclub in basement, no housekeeping provided - AVOID
text:
First....beware that there is a nightclub in the basement of this hotel. On the weekend, the line for the nightclub flooded the entrance and lobby. Very unwelcoming.
Second....when we returned to our room at about 3pm, our room had not been made up. Nor had the room of our traveling companions. We called and it was agreed that our room would be made up when we left for dinner at 5:30. They ask that we stop at the front desk to 'remind' them. We did as they asked. When we return to our room after 11pm, our room was still not made up. I then went to the front desk and asked to speak with the manager. I had to wait for him because he was - guess where? - in the nightclub! He apologized, agreed to send up clean towels only when I asked, and offered a free breakfast the following morning. Honestly - I think they need to decide if they are running a high-quality hotel or a nightclub. They are certainly failing at providing basic hotel services and barely seemed to care. 
Third - the room sounded small in the online description so we booked a slightly larger room for two with one bed. The room was VERY small. We had been guests at the Loews Regency two weeks prior and our room was large, the service was impeccable and the price was the same (albeit a different week). At the Mondrian, we paid $919.72 for two nights in a tiny room with no housekeeping and other service was amateurish at best. AVOID THIS HOTEL. To management - BRING IN AN EXPERIENCED TEAM to straighten this place out if you want to stay in business.

title: Lovely urban experience.
text: Room was good sized for mid-Manhattan, and nicely furnished.  Hotel is fairly new so everything was in excellent condition.  Great location for getting anywhere, east or west side, and neighborhood has been coming up so more restaurant choices nearby than in the past.  There is no fitness room on site, but the gym a few blocks away had many more machines and equipment than a typical fitness room so worth the short walk.  View was of the side street and Park Avenue, pretty typical for midtown.  Altogether was a very pleasant place to stay for three days.

title: Great location, great property and stellar staff
text: I’ve stayed at the Mondrian several times on business trips but felt compelled to write a review this time due to a particularly wonderful experience with staff. I stayed for a week and happened to have a flare up of an ankle injury (not on the property) — Ludo at the front desk (as well as Johnny) went beyond what was required to offer medical assistance, make sure that I was able to get food and fluids and generally treat me as if it was family and not a guest at a hotel. Good service requires being practical, conscientious and accountable— great service is making things personal. All the boxes were checked and I can’t say enough about the staff.

title: Top notch!!
text: Had a wonderful stay after seeing a show !! Warm welcomes and a comfy bed are the reasons why we are coming back. The heated bathroom floor was an nice touch after taking a rewarding hot shower in the spacious two head shower! Look forward to our next staycation !

title: Perfect
text:
Attentive and friendly staff, comfortable and quiet room, seamless check in, subway two blocks away, out of midtown, contemporary without being obnoxious.  Great price.

This was my fifth stay. I’ll be back.

title: Angenehmes Hotel
text:
Sehr angenehmes Hotel, mit sehr zuvorkommendem Personal.
+
Lage
Sauberkeit
Bett
Grosses Badezimmer
Balkon mit wunderbarer Aussicht
Zimmerausstattung
-
Grösse des Zimmer
Preise des Frühstück, Kaffee 7$

Wir haben uns von Anfang an willkommen und wohl gefühlt und
eine schöne Zeit an thanks giving und black friday verbracht.
Viele Attraktionen und gute Restaurants sind gut zu Fuss erreichbar.

Haben es genossen.

title: Disappointing all way long
text:
I booked this hotel for one week for New Year’s Eve... when i saw the pictures and «  park avenue » I thought it would be a top class hotel I would enjoy for the year end...when I walked in, i understood my mistake. The reception is small and crappy, and the so called King Size Deluxe room appeared to be a normal room hardly equipped to welcome two people. All rooms only have showers, none has bath tube. Most are back facing. If you want a view on the city pay attention to your room category and ask for one with view on the streets. And if you are in couple, the closet hardly fits for one. On this matter the premier king size room I visited appear to be slightly bigger and comfortable but not tremendous either.
My room was dusty so I mentioned it to the reception on the first day, then twice , then 3 times and had to call for the manager to get the cleaning done correctly. 

The good points: the bed was very good and the location is convenient

title: Disappointing room
text: We just checked in to a premiere king room and I am so disappointed.The room is tiny. There is no way this room is 300 square feet and does not resemble the hotel photos. The bed is not quite a king, small. This is the most we have paid for a nyc room and it is the smallest we have ever stayed in. We average about 6 trips a year to nyc so we are familiar with the typical rooms. Maybe they put us in one of their worst rooms, we did call the front desk to confirm our room size. Very unhappy!

title: Loved it!
text: Very cute & modern hotel! Had a short stay but everything was perfect. My room was always clean, bellmen were very friendly & Donika at the front desk was super helpful with suggestions in the area! Will definitely be back again.

title: An excellent experience from start to finish
text:
Absolutely loved staying here. Check in was quick and painless, the staff at the front desk were always helpful and friendly. 

We stayed in a higher floor room with a balcony, and loved the views out to Kips Bay. Our room (1803) was dual aspect, light & airy, and really spacious. The bed was comfy, the bathroom had plenty of room for toiletries, and the minibar was reasonably priced.

The location itself is excellent, so easy to get to the metro or walk towards the Flatiron district. There’s also a luxury house car, which can take you up to 15 blocks.
