On a weekend, the terrace bar can be a bit noisy, but what else would you expect from NYC? The bar was great with a good selection of drinks. It does get booked a lot so space can be at a premium but the staff were accommodating. 

We’ve stayed in NYC a few times but this hotel is definitely our favourite, we’ll be staying here again that’s for sure.

title: Fantastic location, spacious room, great service.
text: Mondrian Park Avenue is my favorite place to stay when in New York - the location is fantastic and the staff is always eager to provide a warm welcome and thoughtful and prompt service throughout my stay. Best of all, the rooms are spacious and beautifully designed.

title: BOD Meeting
text: Great overall experience with all phases. From the very start the Bell Man team handled a difficult check in with many extras that needed be delivered to both the restaurant and my room with a total "no problem" attitude that was a big relief. I then received tremendous professional support by housekeeping to set up 20+ rooms with special welcome package of products. Danny Kolis and his team of Shavonne, Zenaida & Ada all pitched in and executed flawlessly. The Restaurant manager, Chris and his team also did a tremendous job handling our large group. Great place to stay!

title: Excellence in quality and customer service
text:
One of the many extraordinary stays at the Mondrian Park Avenue.
 On this visit, the hotel went above and beyond even their usual standard of excellence in customer service. Leonela offered valuable suggestions on places to have dinner and things to see around the city and even helped us with transportation. Housekeeping was very accommodating as was room service as well.
 When I returned home I realized that I had left all of our passports and valuables in the hotel safe.  I contacted Leonela who immediately took charge of the situation. There was another guest staying in the room at the time but she had security go up the moment the guest checked out and gave me a call to assure me that they had located the items. She took leadership of the situation to secure the items- took inventory of them and even sent them back by overnight FedEx.
Thanks to Leonela’s diligence & commonsense what could have been a disaster was only a short lived mistake.
She is always one of my favorite people when I stay at the Mondrian.
Thank you to everyone for their courtesy and their  genuine kindness.
You are absolutely the best!

title: Love this hotel
text: I was here for four days with my daughter and granddaughter helping her find an apartment in NYC. The front desk staff was fantastic. I will definitely go back. Clean facility. Restaurant has great breakfast.

title: D0 NOT BOOK!!!!!
text: Myself and my hubby came back from the most hideous hotel we have ever stayed in! Yes this one!! We have been to New York twice this year and book this based on staying in a different area to explore at Christmas. On check in the staff didn’t even raise their eyes to look at us! Once checked in to one of their grand with balcony premium rooms we couldn’t even swing a cat! No basic facilities I.e tea coffee or water! Room service advertised but when we asked it was not available! More shocking than that we stayed based on their roof top bar and restaurant, for two nights out of three the roof top bar was closed to residents due to private parties and the restaurant was fully booked! Staff were rude un Helpful and finally when we checked out we were then charged $105 for facilities we neither knew about or used! The water that we thought was complimentary was a charge of $15 and apparently a complimentary car to see the city!  We are well traveled and have stayed in many hotels and this one I CANNOT state enough was beyond BAD! I can only say a couple of doors up is the ROYALTON with an amazing roof top bar friendly staff and a great DJ to boot! Please don’t be lulled in to the description of this hotel as you will not get anything that you expect for the premium money they charge! Throughly disappointing all round!

title: Loved mondrian park Avenue
text: This hotel is wonderful. My friend Judy and I were meeting up in new York haven't seen each other for 20 plus years. She happened to have this hotel pop up as she was confirming her flight.we immediately changed plans from staying at a hostel. This is a great location and the people that work here are over the top. Extremely courteous and friendly. Our room was beautiful and large for New York. Our house keeper, Isatou was fantastic taking care of our needs and cleaning our room. We could not ask for better service. Such an elegant hotel. We would definately recommend this place as a perfect hotel to stay.its very clean and hospitable.the doormen grabbed us a cab and helped us get in during a rain/snow storm. I just can not say enough about this remarkable hotel. Hands down..A+++++ rating. Thank you

title: Great Experience
text: My husband and I visited New York for the first time this year and stayed at the Mondrian hotel for three nights. The experience could not have been any better! Great friendly service. Ludovico checked us in at the front desk and was extremely friendly and helpful when we asked for advice about the city. Our room was a little smaller than we expected however, it was very clean and the view from our window was beautiful. We hope to stay here again in the future!

title: Mid town location assures mobility and many dining choices
text: We chose the Mondrian for its excellent location on Park Avenue South at 30th. Two subway stations are just two blocks away, and with Lexington and Madison Avenues on either side, a wide array of restaurants, including breakfast favorite Penelope's. We asked for a quiet room and went to floor 20, which is a modern add on to the older building below. The room was standard NYC small, but adequate, plenty of toiletries and towels. Can't speak to the rooms in the older part of hotel, but we liked ours. Got a good rate for the weekend and pretty good rate for midweek. We would stay here again. Only blip was spotty service in the hotel restaurant for breakfast, but hotel did the right thing and comped us for that meal due to being late. Classy move.

title: Mondrian Park Ave
text: Mondrian is my home away from home. I travel to NY at least once a month and love the care the staff takes with repeat customers. Thanks Oliver for always taking looking out for me and Linda for making my room so relaxing after a long day.

title: AMAZING HOTEL
text: A week ago i stayed here for a birthday celebration. The hotel was clean. The staff in the front were extremely nice and helpful. Donika helped us with our check in. She made sure we got everything we needed, she even personally brought ice to our room. The room was amazing and so clean. My favorite part about it was the balcony !! You can't find a hotel in the city with that price and a balcony. We stayed for 2 nights... Leonela helped us with our check out whom also made sure to ask us if our stay was comfortable and if there was anything that they could have done to meet our standards but truthfully I was very pleased with everything and will be returning soon for future celebrations ;))

title: Spectacular! An Unlikely Turnaround!
text:
Last month I happened to be in the Big Apple for a friend's wedding. Long story short... our airbnb host backed out on us and we were in a complete full-blown last minute panic. Wedding was in 2 days and we had nowhere to stay and a bad yelp review wouldn't have remedied the fact that we were stranded without any immediate accomodation. Naturally we had to scramble for a quick alternative but luckily we happened to stumble upon this absolute gem of a hotel. Big shoutout to George with the last minute rescue. My s/o and I ended up in this spectacular balcony-suite with an amazing view at a great deal. Sufficed to say, stability is totally underrated when you have someone as resourceful, hospitable, and understanding as George who completely went out of his way to help us in our time of distress. If you're ever in the city I would highly recommend this booking. George and his team definitely deserves stellar credit as part of the equation to our fantastic weekend. 10/10

Chris

title: November at the Mondrian
text: The Mondrian of our experience was excellent. The room was comfortable and quiet at night. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. The location was convenient. It was a win-win! We have already recommended it to friends in the city who have out of town guests visiting. Ask about the services as there's a 175.00 service fee--might as well use that gym and take those yoga classes!

title: Everything you'll need
text: Location is ideal for walking around Manhattan and staff is very friendly, especially housekeeping attendant that helped us throughout our stay. The 15th floor extended lobby is a cool addition to the property. Thank you for the hospitality!

title: Mondrian Park Avenue
text: The rooms are very small and they are way overpriced. They do not respond to customer requests (for more towels, to clean room) in a timely manner. Even when we complained, they did nothing for us and charged us just the same even though our room was never made up.

title: Horrible
text: Manager Anderson is rude, disrespectful and dismissive. I never write reviews but I have never had a worse experiences in a hotel. There was no placed shower rug to put out after shower. Shelf above sink was filithy.

title: Perfect
text: I was in NYC on a vacation with my girlfriend. We stayed at Mondrian Park Ave for its extravagant location!!! Everything is walking distance and the hotel car option is Amazing!! It can drop you off within 15 blocks from the hotel. Check in was very smooth and we felt like we arrived at home. Rooms are decent size and super comfortable beds! The rooftop bar on 15th is very cozy and fun with beautiful views. It is covered during the winter time so you do not have to worry about the snow and rain. If you are planning to go to fun places and restaurants, George at the front desk can give you really great recommendations! He helped us a lot during our stay. We will come back next year! Highly recommend to stay here! Thank you for the amazing stay!

title: Highly Recommed
text: Tell your friends, from the check in process to the rooms, can't miss this opportunity to experience this wonderful hotel. The rooms were larger than most, The lobby is enough and the greeting at the door. Great stay.

title: NYC
text: Quiet, clean, modern look with friendly staff. Rooms were a bit small but I guess that's NYC hotels in general. Location was OK, a bit far for a walk into Times Square or mid-town but subway 6 was 2 blocks away and easy to hop onto to head downtown. You just have to figure out how to navigate the subway system.

title: Nice stay
text:
Stayed here for a few nights in November since my fiancé was staying here for work.

Pros: 
-Huge shower with two different shower heads/pressure
-Great location - you can catch the 6 train from 28th or 33rd

Cons:
-They don't change your sheets. You have to ask. I get the whole conserving water thing but even when we asked, they didn’t change it
-Pillows are a bit high

Overall, great stay - nothing amazing, but nothing bad.

title: Wonderful hotel for a long weekend
text: We were 3 adults sharing a double room and were really impressed with the room size for NYC. All the staff we interacted with were lovely. Guest services promptly responded to and took care of an issue we had with one of the beds. Everyone in my group would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Amazing Stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue!!
text: This hotel is amazing.  It started out when I checked in and the staff asked me wait shortly for my room to be ready.  A few moments later, I was called up and offered an upgrade for free!  Hector offered to buy me a free drink in their bar for the inconvenience.  Once I was able to get into my room, it was very comfortable and clean.  There was a view of Park Ave.  The location was fantastic.  The hotel has a Cleo restaurant inside which happens to be one of my favorites.  I used the dry cleaning service available and requested a day turnaround but the clothing came back in just a few hours which really surprised me.  There was no iron or ironing board in the room when I checked in but I called the front desk to request one, it showed up very quickly and I was able to keep it for my entire stay.  The staff were extremely helpful.  I would highly recommend this hotel to any tourist or business traveler in NYC!

title: Grubby
text:
Hotel gone downhill in recent years, in our opinion.  
Dust covered furniture, dirty and damp cleaning cloths in room, torn bedding, broken toilet.  Not what we expect from a hotel at this price point.
Excellent service from Cleo barman, less excellent from Reception despite being asked specific questions about facilities and rooms.

title: 3 Stars On a Good Day
text: This hotel is just decent.  By no means is it a 4-5 star hotel.  My company booked me in this hotel for two weeks, so I got a pretty good feel for how well it operates.  The lobby is small and cramped during check-in.  The rooms are small, with very little room to store anything.  The amenities are poor.  No alarm clock, pens or notepads.  To leave a tip for the housekeeper, we had to tear a page out of our notebooks to leave a thank you note.  Housekeeping is inconsistent and inattentive.  The shower door does not seal and water runs out all over the bathroom floor.  The bathroom has very little room to situate any of your toiletries and a musty smell comes from the shower.  We called several times for a bucket of ice.  Sometimes it would take 45 minutes, sometimes it would never show up.  One night, I returned to the room to find a bucket of ice and an ironing board that I had not asked for. There are only two elevators, which you often have to wait several minutes for.  There is no in-room coffee, though you can go downstairs to the restaurant for free coffee, but not if you have to get up early, as the restaurant doesn't open until 7.  Half of the channels on the TV never worked and the internet wasn't great.  NYC is loud, but the windows in the room did very little to seal out any of the noise.  The rooftop terrace is nice, but service was poor.  There is a late night dance club beneath the first floor, which makes for many noisy nights.  I could go on....  Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else, especially for the premium prices this place commands.

title: A STAY AT THE MONDRIAN NYC
text: Location was good, However we paid for an upgrade in our room including great views of Park Ave. and NYC: Neither came to fruition:  Your front desk personnel needs more training in recommending restaurants, and places to visit in your immediate area: The Housekeeping was excellent: Your on site car  service a pleasant surprise:

title: SUPERB EXPERIENCE!  My favorite NYC Hotel!
text:
This was my 3rd visit to the MONDRIAN PARK AVENUE Hotel.  And once again I was thrilled with the accommodations, service and quality.  My room was a King suite with a balcony view of the city.  After an unpleasant airport experience, my spirits were immediately lifted when I walked in and saw the beautiful room, view and especially the unique, colorful, designer chair (wish I could attach a photo).  That chair really brightened my day and the entire visit.  It is the Mondrian's attention to details such as this that make it stand out from other hotels.  They create an uplifting & inviting atmosphere! The personal attention given to me by all of the staff was exceptional.

I'd like to also point out that their beds are the most comfortable I've ever experienced in a hotel.  And the food at the CLEO restaurant is excellent!   Again their attention to detail is what makes them  stand out from others.  Truly this hotel is at the top of my list!

title: King Room?
text: False advertising at its worst. My reservation said King bed, the front desk said king "room". The bed was somewhere between a queen and a full. Why did I pay more for a king? Room said "view", I'm not sure what the rooms without a view had, but it couldn't have been much worse than mine. I paid a "resort" fee which included the "house car" which is only available from 9 - 5 Monday to Friday (and will only take you 10 blocks). I was there for a weekend!!!

title: Already booked it again for my next trip!
text: Very spacious room with great balcony and views.  It’s my favorite place to stay in Manhattan with very reasonable prices.  Check in and check out was flawless.  Food was incredible! Great location.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Stay
text: Check in was nice and easy. The rooms were just the right amount of space. Modern looking room with a vert comfortable king size mattress. The front desk and overall service was very attentive and easy to contact.

title: Great location & Staff
text:
So many choices in Manhattan and the Mondrian is a fun option. The location is perfect for many different  types of travelers.

The staff is very helpful and friendly. Quickly took care of any special request.

The rooms are average size by NYC standards. Good sized bathrooms with multiple shower head options including rain shower.

The bed and bedding are wonderful! You do not want to leave your bed it is so comfortable.

title: 5 star quality rooms in a 4 star building
text: If you just want a well-located place to sleep with very high end rooms (top-quality bedding, stylish, very clean, high-end bathrooms) and the price/value is right for the time you are shopping, this hotel is a great choice.  The drawbacks:  no lobby to speak of, very small rooms, no desks in most rooms.  The pros:  the furnishings, decor, bedding, TV, etc in the room is very high end.  So if you like a high-end in-room experience, and are willing to trade off space and lobby, it's a great place to crash in that neighborhood of NYC.

title: an average stay
text:
this is the second year we've come to the Mondrian, our memory was positive.
This time it was a little different. 
the welcome was very pleasant, we had to deal with a very professional and smiling Albanian girl.

at the restaurant it wasn't very welcoming, except for two waitresses.
waiting for drinks 1 morning and then the next day plus 15 minutes to have espresso, we left because we still had not received them

title: Good location
text: The room was small but to be expected in NYC.  Check in went smoothly and we were offered a bottle of water on arrival. The lobby is small and consists of large uncomfortable rocks which aren't conducive to sitting on. If there are several people waiting to check in/out be prepared to stand. The car service only applies on weekdays so paying an extra $30 resort fee is a joke. The room decor is dated with mirrors on every surface.  The shower stall was large, towels were thin and the AC fan was noisy. Location is great.

title: Very, very small rooms.
text:
The hotel was pretty standard, across the board. The hotel is not worth $500 per night not even with the phenomenal (complimentary) car service.

The rooms (including the bathroom) are so small that they're nearly claustrophobic.

title: Not worth the price
text: Paid $370 for room that had towels with large holes in them, half full amenities which made me question the overall cleanliness of the room. Location is great near gramercy park. Room size is typical for NYC hotel.

title: Comfortable and clean room but noisy
text: I stayed here for a business trip.  The location was 5 blocks from the office, so very convenient.  The staff at the reception desk were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable.  However, the room was very noisy for two reasons.  1.  The air conditioning was very loud when it started up and 2. The windows did not do an effective job of blocking out the noise from the road and, hence, I was disturbed in the early morning by the noise of garbage trucks and service vehicles on the road outside from the 5th floor room.

title: Horrible experience
text: Horrible room staring at a brick wall.  No iron in the room.  Small and non descript.  Not interesting.  No lobby or common area. Marketed as a 5 star but I’ve stayed at better 3 stars. This place was so bad.  Stay away as you have better choices.  Almost anything.  Completely sucked.  Tried to change rooms every day.   Wouldn’t accommodate.

title: Delusione
text:
Ero stata al Mondrian di Miami dove tutto è favoloso per cui mi aspettavo di trovare un bel hotel.
La reception è minuscola, ci sono solo due enormi massi neri che forse servono da seduta.
Camera piccolissima , mancavano praticamente  tutti i set  di cortesia che un hotel di quel livello fa trovare ai clienti: dalla penna con blocchetto, calzascarpe, ferro da stiro etc.
In bagno abbiamo trovato  la saponetta e la scatoletta con due dischetti di cotone che abbiamo aperto il primo giorno e  che non sono stati più rimpiazzati. Siamo rimasti 7  notti e non ci hanno mai sostituito la saponetta ne’ mai lavato il bicchiere dove mettevamo gli spazzolini.
Asciugamani ed accappatoi non venivano mai rimpiazzati, abbiamo chiesto gì accappatoi praticamente ogni sera al nostro rientro.
Camera per tre con due letti  Queen comodi ma con un solo tavolino tra i due letti, ho appoggiato occhiali e telefono alla valigia che ho dovuto usare come comodino.
Insomma mi aspettavo molto ma molto di più.
Non ci tornerò sicuramente

title: Certainly not what I expected
text:
I travel a lot and decided to bring family and friends to the Mondrian Park. We arrived at 6:00 PM after a long day and were told the room was not ready (hum?) and we had to wait 20 minutes to have it checked. Ok we were not happy but waited. What a big surprise when we arrived at the room on the second floor. It had relativity no window!! As you can see on the pics this room has only one small window which most of it is has a frosted film on it. In my last 30 years traveling this was the worst ever room and I felt trapped. We went back to the lobby and they told us the hotel was full and this was the only room left. I had to argue for 30 minutes stating I had booked my room 2 months ago and the room was not as described on their web site!
They finally opted to give me another room.
First and last stay at ANY Mondrian!!!

title: DESIGN TAKES PRECEDANCE OVER. FUNCTION     Delightful Hotel...for Swingers and Young singles -
text:
On Park Avenue howevert down on 30th Street.  If looking for fun bar(s) aimed at singles and young with visibly well designed but small rooms this is a goodt choice.  It is a hotel where design preceeds function.  The 16th floor bar "club" works for the afterhour swinger.  As a 70 year old I was told no to sitting on the terrace with cushions - "reserved".   I was.shuttled to a side terrace after collection my own cocktail by a overly pompous grandiloquent young manager.   
I was probably the oldest guest at the hotel....the front desk staff were excellent,  professional and helful as were the valet and housekeepers.

title: A wonderful New York experience
text: This hotel is central and clean and service amazing. This will be our go to hotel from now on when travelling to NYC. The staff did an outstanding job at making little things special for our sons birthday the shuttle service is exceptional.

title: I used to like this hotel
text:
I returned to the Mondrian on the basis of an excellent visit in late 2017 -- this stay was VERY disappointing and i share many of the comments of other guests who were unsatisfied.  Most significant was the indifferent attitude of the front desk and door staff when they were there. (hardly saw anyone at manning the hotel entrance).  This was a big change from my last visit when i specifically commented that the staff were especially friendly and recognized their customers.  Other comments:  The shower spilled water all over the bathroom floor and i had to keep asking for more towels to mop up the lake of water.  The room and bathroom were unacceptably dirty / dusty for a top tier hotel.  No paper and pen in the room.  No Sunday papers available (seriously???!!!).  I had a room facing the light well which i thought might be quiet -- but unfortunately there was a huge saturday evening party in the apartments next door until 5am.  No one at the front desk / door to offer to help with taxi, luggage, directions.  As other guests have mentioned, the hotel no longer offers access to the Equinox fitness club and instead offer access to New York Sports Club.  NYSC is ok, but not particularly clean or inviting space.  Oh and don't forget you will be charged and extra $35 + tax per night for the "free" internet.  Put that charge in the headline room rate and stop trying to annoy customers.  I will stay at the Royalton hotel next time, just 1 block south

 For a hotel that aspires to be 5*, they have a lot of work to do to up their game

title: Disappointing
text:
Stayed here during a trip to visit family in the city - chose the Mondrian as I know the brand and it was well located for being close to family and friends.

This is a 5* hotel but sadly lacking in service... I did not find the front desk staff particularly helpful and when trying to organise a car to the airport had to ask multiple times to see if it had been arranged. 

In room dining is supplied by the independent restaurant below... service takes a very long time and is delivered as take out in boxes with plastic cutlery. Not something I expected from a hotel of this standard.

The room was wonderful and spacious with a brilliant view and the house keeping staff were hugely attentive

Will not be recommending for family for future visits unfortunately as I felt overall the service did not merit the price tag.

title: Great Property! Great Staff!
text: We stayed here for my girlfriend's birthday and were upgraded upon arrival and received a bottle of champagne from mgmt which was a great touch! Great view from wrap around terrace! Would definitely recommend the balcony suite!

title: A Welcome Reprieve
text: Not only was it perfect for a restful night, but the location was conveniently central and the staff was helpful at every turn. Will definitely be staying here again on business trips and I am already looking forward to it!

title: I will definitely return
text: The staff is so attentive.  They greeted me with champagne and were just delightful at every turn.  The room is not big but you don't need more really-unless you need a desk.  Great shower and mini bar.  The rooftop bar was nice. The balcony was my favorite!

title: Ottima posizione e accoglienza
text: Consiglio questo hotel per la cortesia del personale molto disponibile e sorridente e per la posizione. La stanza al 7 piano era molto comoda sia camera che bagno con bella doccia spaziosa e una bella vista sulla park avenue! Pulizia accurata ogni giorno. La posizione e’ ottima, in circa 30 minuti si arriva a piedi a time square, Rockefeller center, Union square e in poco più di un’ora (sempre a piedi) si arriva al World Trade Center... a pochi passi c’è comunque anche la metropolitana. Hall dell’hotel very nice! Lo consiglio!

title: Love this place!
text: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue. We originally selected it due to its great location and reviews, but we continue to return because of the exceptional customer service. The friendliness of all the staff and personalized note made us feel at home. Sipping their biodynamic red wine on our balcony while overlooking Park Avenue and the city's skyscrapers was quite romantic. Moreover, the room was surprisingly spacious, considering not many things in NYC can be described that way. We look forward to our next trip to New York as it will surely include a stay at this hotel.

title: A good place
text: The hotel is a place we have stayed 4 or 5 times when it opened.  It was renovated well, is a great location and service is very good.  And it is next to the best coffee shop in nyc - Felix.  The big downside is they switched from access to equinox to nyac changing it from our go to hotel in midtown to an option to explore.

title: never sraying again
text: indifferent unprofessional employees , the worst room service all served in paper boxed and in paper bags, broken curtains. There are many choices in NYC and this is not a good one I will never stay there again. I travel all over the world and this is not worthy. my rate was 500 a night and it was a lame.

title: Post-wedding extended vacation from Washington D.C. excursion
text: Wonderful arrival and continued stay at the hotel.  Everyone was very accommodating, friendly and kind.  They went out of their way to meet any needs we had.  Dreamy sleep!  Never heard sounds/noises from the city that never sleeps.

title: One of the best hotels in New York
text: Moving to New York and was looking for a place to stay for a couple of weeks while I find an apartment. It was really difficult to find an available hotel during UN week but thankfully this place was available. George K. and Alex the manager were extremely helpful in extending my stay and the staff here are some of the friendliest and most helpful people. I can't recommend this place more.

title: Comfortable and accommodating
text: The Mondrian is perfectly positioned for your visit to NYC located in Manhattan. Only a 7 minute walk to the Empire State Building, Madison Square Park and Grand Central Station and a short cab or Uber to everything else. The staff is professional but down to earth from the door hosts to the connected restaraunt staff at Cleo, a Mediterranean restaurant in a fresh modern art vibe.

title: Great location and service
text: The hotel has a great midtown location near Penn Station, transportation and restaurants.  The service was quite friendly, proactive and helpful.  We  come to NYC frequently and would definitely stay again.

title: Don’t bother! Stay elsewhere - expensive mistake
text:
My mum and I have been to New York City around 20 times, and have stayed in many 4/5 star hotels around midtown. This time, after staying in the Mondrian in London and LA, I suggested we try the Mondrian. What a mistake! 

We booked back in February and paid extra for a double room (that’s one with two beds) and requested a high floor, quiet, with a view. On check in, there was only one room available, it was on the 5th floor and according to George, who checked us in, it was right opposite the elevator. There was nothing he could do, he said, and we had to take it. I totally get that preferences are not guaranteed, but we didn’t even get 1 out of 3! I think this may be because the hotel is actually very small and doesn’t have a lot of rooms to offer. 

The room was ok, small, no storage space. Dark and gloomy, not like the website. Large bathroom for no reason at all, would have preferred more space in the bedroom itself. No coffee facilities in the room, instead you get free coffee from 8am downstairs. What if you want a coffee sooner?! There is also no water in the room, apart from a bottle of Evian for $15. What hotel does not offer a bottle of free water! 

After the first night, we returned to find our neighbours having a party. I asked what could be done about it and the reception guy was less than helpful. He said he would give them a warning and basically made out like I was making a big deal of it. When I pushed back (the door was wide open, music blaring, screaming, 4 people in one tiny room!), I was offered another room, the only one we had left. A really nice guy called Seth helped us to move, which we appreciated. He had more empathy and concern. 

We actually were downgraded in the move to a standard king (we now have to share a bed), despite the fact we paid for a premier double which is a few categories up. The room faces a wall and there is a terrace underneath where people are partying til late. At 6am the bottles are collected and removed, right underneath the window. You buy a hotel room with the basic premise that you want to sleep. The mondrian couldn’t even get this part right so I don’t know why I’m surprised that the rest of my experience was so poor. 

The rooftop terrace is ok but a bit lifeless. Drinks are served in plastic glasses. It’s a bit tacky with insta fabulous plastic roses, very 2017, I suppose they think people will want to take selfies and tag Mondrian. Overall this hotel lacks style but more so substance. It shouldn’t be viewed in the same category as the Mondrian in London which is premium, stylish and fun. This hotel may as well be a cheap budget hotel - shame we’re paying Mondrian prices. Save your money and go elsewhere. We won’t be back.

title: Very nice place
text: Hotel is conveniently located in midtown Manhattan, which makes it easy to commute. Front desk team was amazing, specially Leonela, Donika and Alex K. I have not dined in Cleo, but night club was a lot of fun, loved the small TVs. All in all a very pleasant stay.

title: Stay somewhere else
text: 5 stars, they must mean 1 star. Air conditioning did not work, after numerous calls, someone came to fix it but couldn’t. Said he would be back with his boss but never came back. Taking a shower was not pleasant at all, hot water came on for 20 seconds, then freezing cold water...continued for duration of my shower. Room was very musty.

title: disappointing stay .. this time around
text:
Stayed in the hotel two times before last year.. and it was great. Came back a year later looking for same quality sadly wasn’t it.
The staff in front desk and door is great... they are informative and friendly. They and the location of this hotel is the beat thing about this place.
Restaurant in the hotel is good for dinner and questionable for lunch. Rooms vary, which is okay problem is the quality of cleanliness dropped. My toiled was not cleaned my sheets smelled funny, towels are old..:  in a five star hotel that is just odd experience. 
Hotel hopefully will get it together and go back to quality from a year ago

title: Very avergae Hostle
text:
The lady that is at the front desk failed to explain anything to do with the hotel when we checked in. We had no clue about teas or coffees she didn't even let us know when breakfast was or anything is. I had no clue that she charged my card a 200 deposit. She just made me sign a form and sent me on my way. The black guy and the other two white guys made my stay though. 

I will not be returning in October 
Thanks

title: Great mid-week break in NYC at the Mondrian
text: My wife and I visited New York in early September 2019 and had the pleasure of staying at the Mondrian. We booked the hotel as we have stayed at the Mondrian in London on a number of occasions and love it. Although the Mondrian Park Avenue doesn’t compare to the dramatic scale of their London counterpart it is a very comfortable hotel with a great central location. The quality of accommodation, level of cleanliness and professionalism/helpfulness of the staff team was as expected. We were very pleased. We stayed in a balcony king room on the 18th floor (view of Empire State) with rain fall shower. Very comfortable room albeit a little small however we only slept there so this was no issue. The house car was available for local trips, cabs were readily available and the hotel is a 2 minute walk from the nearest subway (6). Cocktail bars and menu were excellent. All in all a good stay and would happily revisit. Impressed that the fragrance used in the foyer and communal areas in the hotel is identical to that used in the London Mondrian so it felt like home from home!

title: Too expensive for what you get - even in mid-town
text: The rooms are small but serviceable; the bathroom is nice; the décor cute but with a bit too much kitsch; they are trying too hard to be cool; the wait for the car is ridiculous - 45 minutes! the desk staff were unfriendly.

title: Value for money
text:
The property is in a Great location with a wonderful
 Rooftop bar .advisable to make a reservation otherwise you are put on the side of the terrace. food is very limited upstairs but Cleo restaurant has a nice selection on the menu . Nice breakdfast menu with complimentary coffee .

title: 5 star service !
text: Great stay, rooms were a bit small but enjoyed the rooftop views and drinks. Food in Cleo was amazing. Check in process was great and smooth with Hector. Even though I checked in very late he was able to give me a late check out. Will definitely be back on my next work trip.

title: Super Clean. Luxury, Quality and Great service
text: Super clean and quaint, luxurious boutique hotel. Service was amazing and extremely accommodating. Beautiful hotel and great value. My room was small but that was not a problem at all. It had just the right amount of minimal striking details and essentials.

title: NY.
text: Great stay as always. Love the comfy bed and the awesome shower.  Close to everything. It makes it so convenient since the subway stop is a-block away for people who don’t like to walk. The perk of the house car to drop you off to your near by destination is greatly appreciated. You make sure you reserve it.

title: One night
text: Arrived to night clubbers having a screaming match outside and wondered if we were going to manage any sleep after 25 hrs travelling. Reception staff were brilliant. Went to the elevators and another hoard of drunken night clubbers fell out leaving drinks in the lift. Feeling weary and grimy we got to our clean small room and was pleasantly surprised at the lack of noise. Had a great sleep and left the next day. Lovely bed.

title: perfect location
text: very good hotel, but needs some extra maintenance: shower leaks on bathroom floor when showering, thermostat is a bit detached form the wall. The room was not serviced one morning, but I had not attached the "make up room" tag to the door

title: Amazing time at the Mondrian!
text: My girlfriend and I took a 7 day vacation out to NY and had an amazing time because of the Mondrian. One of the employees George K at the desk was the best! He always helped us with our needs at the hotel and he set up everything for us outside the hotel. Making reservations and handling everything. Felt like I was at home! Highly recommend staying at the Mondrian hotel when visiting the Big Apple!

title: Dirty room, festering room service in room after 2 calls
text: I arrived at 1am after a flight delay to a room that was not made up and had dirty sheets and towel on the floor. I was too tired to care but called in the morning to complain. I had to go to meetings, and after calling room service to ask them to remove my food, I left breakfast  in my room to be picked up. I came back between meetings and a late photoshoot at 4pm and my 7am food was still there and room was still unmade. I called again and they said they'd fix it immediately. I said I'd be back at 11pm but the room stinks, so please take the food asap. I returned at midnight to an unclean room and disguising eggs (we know how that smells!) still festering and the same stained sheets on my bed. I then waited 45 minutes for the only night housekeeping employee to  bring me a new towel and sheets and I helped make the bed out of sheer exhaustion.  Management was totally not responsive to doing anything for me, and never offered to comp either night. I asked if they could at least make good by sending me a robe. Two months later, only after I emailed them 4x did they finally ship the robe they promised, but they didn't even send a new one. They sent a crusty worn one. Skip this place and stay at the James Nomad, hotel Gansevoort or Ace hotel instead.

title: Super Comfortable, Classy & Great Value
text:
I stay at the Mondrian for work quite often when visiting NYC and have for years.  This is the best hotel I've stayed at in it's general area when you take into account the value for your dollar.  I don't even bother looking at any other options any more - this is the default.

The rooms are extremely classy and comfortable and the customer service is top notch - they really make sure you are taken care of and your needs attended to.  The ammenities are great as well - especially the restaurant.

title: 17 days at what I consider the best hotel in NYC
text: Exceptional Hotel in every sense.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Exceptional Room Attendants.  Restaurant has Excellent Food.  The beds and bedding makes for a great and relaxing night's rest.  Located near whatever you want to do in NY.

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text: Great hotel with super friendly staff especially George K at the front desk. It's a great boutique hotel with a luxury courtesy car that's really useful and a nice touch. The rooms are nice  with a great sized TV and comfortable bed. I don't understand anyone giving this hotel 1 star it's just wrong. I've stayed 18 nights and will stay here again. I'm a fussy hotel traveller and this is a good all round hotel. The lifts are on the slow side which is at times annoying. There is a beautiful roof terrace. Overall great place to stay.

title: Nice hotel, terrible customer relations
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the US Open. We ended up having a conversation with one of the managers, and she was great. We reported the issue we had with the hotel to her and she was understanding and listened to our concerns. We do think they should have better front line customer relations as that is who will regularly deal with guests, though. We thank the manager for her time and hope they will conduct a training in customer service or will hire new employees.

title: US open trip
text:
I loved my stay at Mondrian! 
The hotel staff is soooo helpful and courteous.George and Vanessa at the front desk were extremely nice and answered all my questions (which i had a lot)))) Also on the day of departure I was running late because of extended match and Alexander was kind enough to give me late check out.
The hotel in general is very cosy, rooms are very well appointed, and rain shower was just amazing! 
If i ever come back again in NY, i'll definitely choose Mondrian.

title: Pessimo in tutto
text: Non capisco come si possa dire che è comodo!!! Forse chi non è mai stato prima in New York: lontano e nella parte più brutta di Park Avenue. Sono stata 5 volte a Manhattan in passato ed ho soggiornato in hotel molto più centrali dove non ho mai usato taxi. Sono stata mal consigliata..lobby con due massi sui quali sedersi nell’attesa di parlare alla reception e alle 13.30 la stanza non era ancora stata pulita pur avendola lasciata da ore,non abbiamo potuto riposare e andare in bagno dopo ore di camminate! Quindi abbiamo aspettato sui massi. Stanze MINUSCOLE,sconsigliato!!

title: 19th Floor
text: Excellent hotel with great staff.  Bags were already in our room when we returned aftercthecroom was ready.  Anything we needed the staff took care of it.  Excellent view of Park Ave South from ur 19th floor corner suite!!

title: I’ll be back!
text: I arrived very late and the gentleman at the front desk made sure I felt at home. He upgraded my room to the 16th floor with a balcony and amazing view of the city. The overhead rain shower was so relaxing and the bed was dreamy. Only thing was the location, I had to walk a good few blocks or order a cab to get anywhere I needed.

title: Some issues, but would stay again
text:
Last minute trip to New York and found a good online deal on a suite at the Mondrian Park Avenue.  Had never previously stayed in that neighborhood, but decided to give it a try and ended up quite liking the neighborhood and being away from the madness of midtown.

The lobby wasn't much - just a small area with some fake rock looking thing that you can sit down on. Fine by me - a fancy lobby is most definitely not one of my requirements for a hotel.

The balcony suite was attractively decorated and actually looked like the online picture, so that was a relief.  Because it was a corner suite, there was lots of light during the day and there was a large table in the living room area that was convenient to spread out and work. I did go outside on the balcony, but being out on the balcony was not terribly exciting so I didn't use it during my stay. There was an espresso maker in the room for those who are interested - I'm not a coffee drinker so I didn't use it.

On the downside, the suite was on the small side for a suite with only miniscule closet space. It wasn't really an issue for me because I was traveling in the dead of summer and didn't have a lot of clothes with me and I was only one person, but something to note if you are two and/or you travel with a lot of clothes (as I do in winter when I bring various coats, different sets of boots, etc.).

The bathroom was large, which was nice, and had a lot of counter space to lay out toiletries which was great since no bathroom counter space is a pet peeve of mine. The towels were probably the worst I have seen in an upscale New York City hotel.  Small, scratchy.  Not great water pressure in the shower.

The room was quiet (always a treat in New York City), except for Thursday and Friday night when I could hear loud music coming from the 15th floor terrace restaurant at the hotel. Luckily the music ended at around 11:00 p.m., so it wasn't a huge issue and I just watched tv until then to drown out the sound.

There is a $30 resort fee, which was disclosed in advance.  It didn't bother me that much because it is becoming par for the course at every hotel in New York City and, as they say, you can't fight City Hall. They did provide free tea and coffee at the restaurant bar in the morning which was nice, as well as free copies of the New York Times and the Wall Street Journal (I'm a dinosaur and still like a paper in the morning that I can grasp in my hand). You also have the use of the house car, if it is around, and one afternoon when it was raining I was able to grab the car to take me to see a relative in a nearby hospital, so that was a nice perk.

The $30 resort fee also includes free Internet, which was a joke. The Internet was reminiscent of the old days of dial up and I had to go out to a cell phone store and buy a $250 hotspot (with monthly data plan as well) in order to be able to get any work done and to connect to my corporate network. If you're with Verizon, there is a Verizon store down the street (I marched over to a Sprint store which was further away). Word to the wise - if you need to do any work during your stay, bring your own Internet connection.

The bellmen were affable and helpful. The front desk was kind of lackadaisical -- not rude or anything, but, on the other hand, they didn't make you feel particularly welcome either.

Had breakfast a few times at Cleo. It was okay, not great, but I always like to be able to tumble downstairs and have breakfast without leaving the hotel, so I guess I appreciated it was there.

I found the neighborhood very convenient. A drug store on the next block where you can pick up anything you forgot to bring, or buy snacks. Around the corner from the hotel is Marta -- an Italian restaurant in the Redbury Hotel.  Love, love, love Marta. Really one of the best pizzas in New York City, good wine menu and attractive and comfortable atmosphere. I might return to the Mondrian just because of its proximity to Marta. The restaurant is definitely worth checking out.

The hotel is also an easy walk to the Union Square area where there are a lot of good restaurants, including my favorite place to have breakfast in New York City -- abcV restaurant at ABC Carpet.  Even saw the owner of abcV, Jean-Georges Vongerichten, at breakfast.

The hotel is also not that far from the new Hudson Yards shopping center on the West Side. Just keep marching west on 30th Street and you'll hit it.

You are also conveniently located next to the 6 train. And if you are a shopper, you are a hop, skip and a jump away from Dover Street Market, an interesting boutique at 30th and Lexington. There is a cafe for lunch at Dover Street Market, which I've been told is good, but I didn't try it.

I've done a lot worse in New York than the Mondrian and while it was not perfect, I wouldn't hesitate to return (toting my own hotspot for Internet connectivity).

title: Eclectic decor
text: Very flamboyant, a bit on the kitsch side (decor-wise). Nonetheless location is great, very good value for money and sufficient service. Went there for business and it was close to where I wanted to be, but also very central location with easy commutes to other parts of town. Get the junior suite, space is always worth it.

title: Looks cool but that's it. Don't look too hard at the details...
text: This is not a cheap hotel. But everything about it other than the looks will make you feel like you're in a cheap hotel. The room service is a joke and the front desk service isn't much better. There's no ice machine but they'll charge you a resort fee when there's no resort. they are more interested in having DJs on their roof for New Yorkers to go to than take care of the tourists who come to the hotel and stay there.  They also sponsor their doorman to scam tourists with transportation to the airport. Do not let them call a cab for you unless they're flagging it down on the street. The doorman said he had a friend cab driver who is on his way and we got in and that cab driver wanted to screw us by charging us an inflated flat fee to go to LaGuardia. It was only $10 but he was not happy when I wanted to use the meter. And your hotel shouldn't set up its customers to get ripped off. Especially not one who's rooms are over $300 a night!  on a side note they have bottles of Evian in their rooms that they expect you to pay $15 a bottle for.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The Mondrian is a great hotel in a amazing location in the city.  It is only a couple blocks from work so that is very beneficial.  The room is clean and the staff are very friendly.  The bed is very comfortable.  The service is first-class and they always take care of me and our company like family.  Cleo is the restaurant in the hotel and it’s a great place to grab a bite as well.  I would definitely recommend to both business travelers and tourists.

title: Small rooms, lacking accommodations, but nice location and staff.
text:
We booked directly through the website which stated we would get benefits like 20% off room rates, complimentary room upgrades upon availability, and waived facilities fee. Upon checking in I asked about the room upgrade and they said I already have the largest king room so the next upgrade would be a suite - and they don’t offer complimentary upgrades on suites. That was disappointing.

So we got to our Premiere King room which was advertised at 375 sq ft, but it was tiny. Much smaller than other NYC hotels I’ve stayed at. We ended up having to pay an upgrade fee (which was even more than the room rate we paid) in order to get the balcony suite. The balcony suite was spacious and gorgeous! Definitely worth the upgrade. However the fridge was packed with drinks from the hotel that we didn’t have any space for our own food and drinks. There also wasn’t an ice dispenser so we had to call for it and it took a really long time for them to bring it. On the second day someone was cleaning the windows outside... and since our room was all glass they can see right into it and it was really uncomfortable. To make things worse, one out of the two elevators were broken. We were on the 19th floor. It took us forever to go up and down.

Other than that the staff was very nice and the location was great but it definitely didn’t feel like a 5 star stay.

title: BIEN PLACE
text:
bel hôtel situé sur Park Avenue , piértonnisé l'été le samedi matin,  privilegiez les chambres donnant sur l'Avenue  car les autres donnent sur un mur en brique triste et sont donc sombres. les chambres sont très bien équipées et décorées  , literie très confortable et belle salle de bain..
beau roof top , personnel accuaillant sans plus.

title: Extremely disappointed
text:
I recently stayed at the Mondrian. Customer service - 5 Stars, hotel- lower than 1 star. I spent $215 and booked a deluxe king room, when I checked in, it is completely different from the pictures they showed in the website, it had a little window in the corner and not a NYC view at all. Luckily George from the front desk was very professional and nice to upgrade me to a premium king room which is exactly what I saw in the website pictures as the deluxe king, what a false advisement from the hotel website. At 10pm after spending a long hot day in NYC, I went back and took a shower, 3 mins later, the fire alarm went off, they said it was caused by my shower???? Seriously??? At 2am, couple of drunks started yelling and fighting on the street, it was so.loud that I stayed on the 5th floor and I couldn't it clearly. 
I am an international traveller and had travelled to so many countries, this hotel is by far the worst one I ever stayed. Again the staff is amazing, the hotel is the exact opposite. You would think that it was supposed to be a 4.5 stars Park Ave luxury hotel, absolutely untrue......will never go back again, very disappointed.....

title: Awesome service, great location!
text: Loved it here - awesome service, clean rooms, right next to a subway station. I recommend to everyone who wants a great NYC  experience. It's close to many great restaurants and main attractions. We will come back again.

title: Overpriced and lack of concern for customers .
text: Found a bug, ask for it to be removed and my room to be re-cleaned.  Left hotel for 8 hours upon return nothing I requested was done and dead bug remained in my bathroom garbage.  Knats in breakfast room on top of bad fruit plate.

title: Stylish hotel in great location
text: Stylish hotel in great location.  Room was impeccably clean, with a comfortable bed.  Complimentary coffee and tea in the mornings is a nice perk.  Staff were all helpful and courteous.  We could hear the music from the rooftop bar in our room, though not late into the night.  The bizarre decor of the lobby has large faux boulders but no chairs.  There is a $30 "facility fee" added to the advertised room rate.

title: My stay at Mondrian Park Avenue
text: What an incredible hotel! The staff, the food, the service the room. Everything was amazing. I highly recommend this hotel if you are going to NYC. In the center of everything and the customer experience and focus is amazing. Loved my stay! Can't wait to come back.

title: The amazing staff of Mondrian
text: Extremely well located, with amazing staff and a very comfortable room. I had a wonderful stay, the people who work for this hotel are extremely friendly and nice.  I do wish the upstairs lounge was a bit more up to the standards of the rest of the hotel and surrounding establishments.  A few live plants, more furniture and a touch of ambiance is all it needs

title: Wonderful Experience!
text:
My sister and I had a little staycation in a Premier King room. Upon check-in we were greeted by a bellman who offered us water and a complimentary glass of rosé. It happened to be during the heatwave so we mostly hung out and watched a bunch of movies in the room, but we did stop at the terrace for a bit - if you’re looking for great views and good vibes, this is the place! 

The room was a good size, very clean and the beds were super comfortable. Not to mention - great location on Park Avenue! Highly recommend!

title: New york mondrian
text: Excellent service from booking to leaving the hotel. Alexander was excellent! Great location great view. Balcony rooms are great and even though you can hear the music from the terasse with the door locked at least it stops at 11pm so you’re all good to sleep peacefully :)

title: Fun, Clean and Overall Amazing Hotel!
text: I went to this hotel for my friend’s 21st birthdays and it was an absolutely amazing time! The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable, and the hotel overall had many great amenities. There is a terrace on the 15th floor with a beautiful view and flowers hanging from the railings. Inside, there are 2 walls covered in pink flowers that are great for pictures. Downstairs, there is a club for 21+. Staff was so friendly and accommodating, and the restaurant in the hotel, Cleo’s, had great food, a DJ that got the whole room dancing and laughing, and the waiters are so fun! We were a group of 18, and the waiter was constantly checking on our party making sure we had everything we needed. Overall great experience, I would definitely recommend!!!!!

title: 21st Birthday Celebration
text: We stayed at Mondrian Park Ave this past weekend to celebrate my twin daughters 21st Birthday, and I have to say we had an amazing time. The hotel was great. The rooms were clean and everything was new. I have to disagree with a lot of the other reviews about the rooms being very small. I’m not sure what other people are used to but I found the rooms to be very comfortable and spacious. Granted they aren’t as big as resort hotels or even Atlantic City rooms but for New York City there is plenty of room. We booked 5 rooms in total for our stay and all of the rooms were perfect. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially dealing with 14, 21 year olds. They even sent birthday cakes to the girls rooms which they were so excited about. On Saturday night the girls went to the 15th floor terrace and took tons of pictures in front of the rose wall and out on the terrace. The staff on that floor were very nice to and also accommodated all of us for drinks. Sunday afternoon we had brunch at Cleo’s and all I can say is WOW to the amazing time my daughters and their friends had as well as myself and my boyfriend. Shout out to Tad our exceptional waiter who put up with all of us. He was a trooper and made the girls feel so special, he got every order right and kept the Drinks coming. They have a DJ on Sundays and all the girls were dancing and the other tables joined in. My daughters cannot stop talking about the weekend. They said it is the best time they ever had!!  Thank you so much Mondrian staff and Cleo staff all of you made the weekend so special for us. Sending big hugs!!!!

title: Best Boutique Hotel in NYC
text: I normally don't write reviews but I just had to regarding this beautiful hotel. The room had the right balance of room size, comfort, service and location. I had to attend a meeting and the sales manager Esther was so professional in helping me make a reservation. The amenities, the rooftop bar and restaurant was buzzing ! I would recommend for a business trip or leisure, couples or families.  Train station 2 blocks away.

title: family vacation
text: The hotel is very well located but the rooms are really below expectation. Very noisy in result of the old windows, and in some cases the beds are in front of the air condition which mas them very uncomfortable

title: JUST THE BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text: the Mondrian hotel is truly one of the best hotels in nyc-we were celebrating our twin girls 21st birthday party in nyc-we arrived on Friday night and of course our room was ready and they upgraded us to a bigger room at no extra charge-on Saturday the birthday girls and there friends arrived and all of there rooms were ready on time-they even surprised the girls with a birthday cake in each room-we all met up on the 15th floor which is called the terrace-what a great view of nyc and great drinks they made for us-the staff and the dj at the terrace was so nice to all of us-after dinner we came back to the hotel and the girls went down to there club in the basement-the girls said it was fun-on sunday all of us went to Cleo's for brunch which is in the hotel-that place was great-it had a dj-amazing food and the staff really caters to you-we were 18 in total and no issues at all-the staff at Cleo's deserves a special thank you for taking care of all of us-the Mondrian hotel really really takes care of all of there guest

title: The best hotel in the greatest city in the world...
text:
I’d like to preface my review by stating that hotels are one of my very favorite things about travel. That being said, when I find a great one, it often inspires me to return to that city as often as possible. 
The Mondrian Park Ave., situated in the heart of Manhattan, is the place I return to time and time again. NYC is my favorite city in the world. From the moment I walk through the doors, the warmth and generosity of the Mondrian staff always makes me feel as if I have returned home. This trip, I was particularly impressed by Vanessa and George K. at the front desk. I have always found the concierges to be kind, communicative, and accessible, and this weekend was no exception. Management is exemplary. Alexander K. is a bright light in the hotel industry, and I just can’t imagine booking a trip to New York without his assistance and endless acts of kindness. 
As for the rooms, they are beautiful, spotless, and spacious, with tons of natural light that stream through their massive windows. In seeking a hotel, I prioritize having lots of space and light, and in nyc, that can be challenging to find. The Mondrian is also one of very few hotels to offer balcony options on the upper floors, and it has been an absolute delight to sit outside and enjoy the spectacular views, day or night. 
I can’t say enough about this establishment, and once again would like to acknowledge the wonderful staff who always remind me that no matter where I live in the world, I always have a home here.

title: Great hotel, wonderful staff
text: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our anniversary and this hotel was a perfect choice. Not only is it clean and in a great location, but the staff is super warm and thoughtful. I had shared in the notes on my reservation that it was a special visit for my husband and me. We arrived to discover that our room had been upgraded and a bottle of wine was left for us to enjoy. Moreover, the bartenders in their restaurant, Cleo, were also so sweet. My husband and I stayed for drinks one evening and chatted away with the bartender for over an hour! Side note, if you stay, be sure to take their service car (for free) anywhere nearby! The Lincoln car has massaging seats and the driver was very nice. Never had a drive through NYC been so relaxing! There are many hotels to choose from in Manhattan, but quality and service truly set the Mondrian apart from the rest. We will definitely stay again.

title: Great customer service - immaculate
text: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff were well trained in delivering outstanding customer service. The restaurant and bars were great with excellent food, drinks and service. The roof top lounge is beautiful decorated and very comfortable with nice views. The rooms and common areas were immaculate and well laid out.  I will definitely stay here again and I highly recommend you try it.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: Visited this hotel for the first time relying upon their website and reviews. On arrival, no warm welcome from the reception staff. Call 1-8555323533 for review confirmation. I would suggest this hotel to everyone who is visiting the place, anytime.

title: Beautiful hotel, but the staff makes it special
text: I chose Mondrian Park Avenue for my stay last week due to my addiction to Rooftop Bars.  And it was lovely.  What made the stay memorable was the true Customer Service delivered by absolutely every staff member with whom I had contact.  Value for money was very good and the location was ideal for a lot of different options.  I will certainly stay again there just for the warm welcome.  :-)

title: Vibrant, clean & well-equipped rooms
text: My stay at Mondrian Park Avenue was comfortable, fun & welcoming. Rooms have an modern vibrant decor, staff is friendly & their outdoor patio is perfect in the summer. I had the pleasure of staying in a balcony room facing beautiful city & water views - I would highly recommend!

title: Glad I got cancelled elsewhere!
text:
First:  Service and courtesy.
On a business trip and had a hotel snafu and my room at another hotel was cancelled; they could not fit me in.  Checked my work travel app and found the Mondrian close by.
Reserved a room and called to make sure it was booked.  I spoke with Hector the manager, who assured me the room was booked and told me to ask for him when I checked in.  He was understanding, polite and helpful.
   Second:  Check in:  small line at check-in late at night.  Staff scrambled to get extra people to the front desk to minimize everyone's wait.  Check-in was fast and easy, and Hector again was understanding and helpful.  He put me in a very nice room since it was my first time at the hotel.
  BEST:  The room.  It was spacious, well appointed (robes, slippers, Lavazza machine, etc) and SPOTLESS.  It was by far one of the the nicest rooms and without a doubt the cleanest room I have ever stayed at in NYC!  The soaps were nice, the glasses were clean, the marble sink was immaculate.  The shower was clean and had good water pressure--no temperature problems at all.  The room was comfortable, dark and quiet, and after a hectic trip in, it was a perfect oasis.  
  The less-than-great:  no free waters, the hotel bar and restaurant closed early so had to walk to the deli down the street for a bite.  
  I had a very good first stay and will stay again!

title: Could be so much better !
text: Visited this hotel for the first time relying upon their website and reviews. On arrival, no warm welcome from the reception staff. It would have been nice to have been asked was this our first visit to New York, and if so to welcome us to the city and to offer to be of assistance during our stay. Instead, they could not initially find our booking (and we noticed there were another couple waiting by reception who were experiencing the same problem). The bedroom was small but clean and comfortable, although the air conditioning unit was far too loud. Good bathroom facilities. No lounge for guests to sit in. The only seated area is at reception and the seating provided is a large rock (which resembles coal) and which is not comfortable and cannot accommodate a large number of guests. Beware if you are booking this hotel because of their roof terrace. When we visited, almost every evening it was reserved for a private function. Indeed, we got the impression that the staff were more concerned with accommodating those attending private functions or the Club in the basement, than in looking after hotel guests. The hotel restaurant is good but expensive. There is a Pret nearby for breakfast which we would recommend.Good location, but could be so much better. There were other issues, but not for this public site. Not Mondrian standard.

title: Small errors ruining the whole stay
text: My one-night stay was riddled with small, easily avoidable errors. We were sent to the wrong room with someone elses' luggage, then had to bring our own luggage to our actual room. The in-room Handy phone was broken and wouldn't turn on. The shower wouldn't stay at a tolerable temperature- only extremely hot or extremely cold, and it completely flooded the bathroom through the closed shower door. Valet service was inconsistent- told it would take an hour to retrieve our car, but it actually took 10 minutes, so we had to rush to get out of the room so my car wasn't sitting on a busy NYC curb for an hour. Front desk offered no help, advice, or apology when I mentioned all of these issues. Beautiful, expensive hotel- but such a disappointing stay.

title: Beware of their fake charges.
text: Fake in room dining and mini bar charges. Rude people In the restaurant. Rooms are tiny and a lot of hallway noise all the time. Will not go back. Ever again. And no gym so you’re stuck going to awful Nysc on 34th.

title: Great location, good service.
text: A nice hotel superbly located near Madison square. Room is quite small but to be expected in such a central location. Staff is very attentive and helpful. Rooms are clean and well appointed. They have a nice rooftop bar. A good choice if you want to be in this part of town.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
text:
I found staff very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are small, but this is NYC. Stall shower fabulous as was very large tv. For those who wake earlier than hotel’s coffee service, there is a Dunkin Donuts right across street. 

Special thanks to George K at front desk. Lovely and accommodating young man.

title: Not a friendly hotel
text:
Teach your staff to have a little bit of empathy, even if they have to pretend to understand. 
Better customer service is needed. 
I asked for water, and it was as if I had asked for a million dollars. I had paid for a room with a view, and was then "given" a room with a view but there was no view. I didn't feel like arguing but don't lie and say that you will give me a room with a view when in reality you are not going to.

title: Mondrian comments
text: Breakfast it is better to avoid , expensive and not really a fast service.... in the room they forget sometimes towels or shampoo etc. Rooms are nice and bed too location is nice , generally a nice hotel that could give much more with a more trained staff .

title: Great but
text: Staff was great. Location was good as well {depending on purpose of stay) room design was lacking. No desk to work at and bathrooms had limited shelf and counter space. Better for single occupancy. Overall good value when a deal is offered

title: terrible
text:
Terrible service. Loud AC. Poor security. No room service after 10pm. Rude staff. 

The worst is having mentioned how uncomfortable we were with our experience and it seemed like the lady at the desk didn't really care.

title: Not a 4 star hotel
text:
Poor service#
Poo amenities
Staff had no idea re how to run a hotel or treat guests- felt like a hostel with comfortable rooms but that's it. Too much to write but I'd highly recommend avoiding this hotel. Stay somehwehre which feels like a hotel and not a party hostel with students at the front desk.

title: Excellent service, Beautiful hotel
text: My husband and had a wonderful staycation at the Mondrian for his birthday this July. While the beauty of the hotel and its views are unmissable, the stand out for us was the service. George K. and Vanessa made our stay so special and even included a bottle of wine for us to share on the occasion of my husband's bday. Thank you! We will definitely be back for another stay.

title: Top quality boutique hotel
text: Wonderful, friendly  helpful staff.  Rooms were nice and  clean..( though not large but just fine)   The restaurant Cleo was Very good.   Happy hour everyday.   The staff was always happy to give directions or print them out.

title: Family reunion
text:
The hotel is nice, in a good location, close to subway.  Had a king room, very small.  They used mirrors on 2 walls to make you think the room is bigger.  The bed was very comfortable.  Room cooling system worked wonderfully.  It was very hot when we were in New York.  I read other reviews on the 35.00 charge per day.  This is complete crap Coffee is only in the morning, not for long in Cleo.  Also includes WiFi and use of a phone, ours was dead.  And a gym off site.  There is no POOL. On premise or at the gym.  I liked that the hotel was modern, but the choice of art in the room was ugly.
One day housekeeping called the room to see if the room had been serviced....really!!!
Staff at the front desk very helpful.  Big problem, no place to sit in the lobby.

title: Makes You Feel At Home!
text:
I have stayed at the Mondrian Park Ave hotel my past two (2) visits to NYC.  To be honest, I just don’t think I will ever stay anywhere else.  The customer experience I have received both times, has blown me away and the hotel itself is trendy, edgy and very well kept.  

The bell hop, George, is first to greet you and help you with your bags.  He not only is friendly but super helpful with getting your luggage to your room/suite.  Upon arriving to the front desk Alex (staff) and Mo (manager) are there with helpful smiling faces.  They really engage with the guests and make sure you know they are there for anything you may need.  

I dined in the the on-site restaurant Cleo, for breakfast every day I was there.  Izzy is the waitress and is cute as a button.  She provided excellent service and the food was honestly exceptional every time.  

Finally you will receive many “touches” from the GM herself, Karla Keskin.  There are notes personalized from her welcoming you to the hotel.  I did have the pleasure of interacting with her, and she went above and beyond to make sure I felt at home in her hotel.  She really gets how the whole hospitality thing works!! 

A little bonus, there is a Rose Lounge open to all the guests on the 15th floor with amazing views of the city.  Great spot to grab a glass before going out for dinner or for drinks.  

Overall I just felt at home while I was here.  All the staff remember my name and who I was and always were helpful and smiling.  I know I have found my new “home” away from home while visiting NYC at the Mondrian Park Ave Hotel.

title: BEWARE: 'SERVICE FEE' PER NIGHT
text:
They charge about USD$40 per night for: "use of cleaning service, coffee, etc." Stuff that's usually included by other hotels. 

Everything was great except for this little surprise which we found out until check-out time.

title: Hidden Fees
text:
We stayed at this hotel over the weekend while visiting family in NYC.  The hotel is very stylized which fits in with NYC.  Everything was clean and well taken care of.  The decor is nice (with albeit mirrors everywhere).  The bed was comfortable and staff was friendly enough.   There is a roof top bar which overlooks the city (views of the street and other high rises).  On Sunday they had salsa dancing and reduced price drinks. 

We stayed in a room with a king sized bed.  The room was small but well designed so that you weren't bothered by it. 

All in all I would have given it 4 stars BUT... As we checked out we were charged $35 a night luxury fee.  We were not informed of it prior to check out.  The lady at the desk claimed it was because we had access to a gym (4 blocks away), coffee maker in room (there was none), a very expensive minibar (we didn't use it), and use of an in room cell phone (it wasn't charged and we didn't use it).  I said all this but she said it was standard throughout the US.

We had just traveled 2 weeks through Maine and Massachusetts the week prior and no hotel charged us this.  We also go to NYC once a year and also have never been charged this anywhere else.  It was completely outrageous that they charged us with no prior warning. 

I  writing this to warn others.  Whatever price you think you are going to pay... There will be a significant add on in the end for services that are either not even provided (like the coffee) or used (minibar, gym, and cell phone).  It adds up.  We ended up paying and additional $105 at checkout for a 3 night stay.  I find this unexceptable. This is why I can only give it 2 stars (dishonesty in the actual price).

title: Loving the edginess
text: Stuck in NYC by canceled flight. 28 minutes from JFK I arrived at this very boutique hotel. Simple, clean, and small lobby, great staff, stunning decor - art work matches the theme of edginess. The rooms, for NYC, are sized OK. The decor, I repeat, wonderful for me. The breakfast restaurant staff and menu are worth the trip. It becomes the bar at night and is really cool. My new favorite place in NYC. Other than 33rd and Park is an convenient but unglamorous area. Again, My New Favorite Place.

title: Family Reunion 2019
text: lovely facility. Staff was friendly and helpful. Local restaurants were excellent (The Mason Jar- BBQ,  and The Blank Slate- breakfast) as was the hotel restaurant Cleo (breakfast was delicious - avocado eggs benedict)

title: Repeat Customer: Service taken seriously.
text: I've been traveling to NYC for a week per month for 20 years - give or take. Being away from home is hard and finding consistency has always been paramount. I've mostly stayed in the Soho Grand and The Palace over the years. I'm writing this review because the Mondrian on Park Ave takes their service to a new level. The receptionists, the doorman, the bartender, and the management (especially Esther) have gone far above my expectations to ensure that my stay is equivalent to the nicest hotels in the world. After a late flight from the west coast, they accommodate my delays, special requirements, and welcome me by name. The location is easy for access throughout Manhattan. On the downside, they don't have a gym however they do make arrangements with local nicer-than-hotel-gyms for free access. On the upside, the rooms are clean and well appointed. The Cleo has exceptional food and drink, and the rooftop bar has the right blend of chill, scene, and view. I've continued to recommend The Mondrian to folks from around the world as an exceptional example of how a hotel service should help us feel luxurious when away from home.

title: Great Stay
text: Had a great time at the Mondrian hotel. Great staff & service, everything was also very clean. One of the employees George helped us out a lot. We got to see all the best attractions of New York, and had an amazing vacation because of him. The hotel also has a great roof top and club. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if your are in New York for vacation.

title: Excellent hotel in mid-town
text: Friendly staff; well appointed rooms with keen attention to detail. The beds are very comfortable. The food and bev options are good too. Nice terrace bar and restaurant on the 1st floor. Highly recommend to the business traveler or vacationer looking to stay in midtown.

title: Sexy and Hip
text: Stayed at the hotel this past weekend and it was an amazing experience. The location, perfect, the staff went above and beyond, so helpful and kind, the room was very spacious and the shower was amazing. Spectacular views, rooftop expereince and all in all a perfect stay. One of the best in NYC !!

title: Very good service but an underwhelming stay
text:
I've stayed at Mondrian Hotels in the past and have always enjoyed them. However, this stay was underwhelming.

I want to start by saying that the service was very good at just about every encounter. Also, the food quality in the restaurant was good and the club downstairs was enjoyable. The rooms were also very clean, and while small, organized nicely.

My big issue with this hotel was the sleep quality. The beds were uncomfortably firm and the air conditioning was simply terrible (it wasn't even that warm outside, being in the high 70s and low 80s). It left the room lukewarm at night and damp.

The reality is, in my opinion, this hotel needs a major renovation.

title: Great location, quality and value
text: This lovely boutique hotel is centrally located, beautifully appointed, reasonably priced, and staffed with incredibly helpful and gracious front desk representatives.  We highly recommend it if you favor an artsy boutique experience vs. large chain hotel.

title: DONKIA ROCKS!!!!
text:
