Donika at the front desk was amazingly accommodating to a few guests I recommended to stay at the property. The guest arrived fairly early to the property after a sold out night however, Donika and the front desk team ensured a stellar arrival and welcome experience. 
The hospitality industry can be a thankless one however, I would like to highly recommend the Mondrian Park Ave because of their most priceless resource; their staff. 
Thank you again Donika for everything you've done to make our clients stay special.

title: Overprice, Unclean Room, Poor Service
text:
1)  Poor service at check-in - wasn't greeted by anyone on my way in, and no doorman to open door for me or help with bags
2)  Dirty bathroom floor - saw numerous loose hairs that I had to clean off the floor myself
3)  No gym in hotel - was directed to a nearby NYSC to work out, with the promise that it was "just like an Equinox"... I recently stayed at the Four Seasons in San Francisco, which has a partnership with a nearby Equinox... the NYSC where I worked out during my stay at the Mondrian was no Equinox... in fact, the first NYSC to which I was directed by your staff was actually closed for maintenance on the day that I showed up... so I had to walk another 4 city blocks to a NYSC that was actually open
4)  Poor service at check out - staff was unwilling to provide me with a late checkout, and instead offered to "hold my bags at the front desk" as if this were a favor... when I travel for work I do that nearly every time - so that "accommodation" was nothing special;  no doorman to help with bags, or hail a cab;  had to contact the hotel staff FOUR different times after check out to have a copy of my folio emailed to me... the first three times I called I was yessed to death, but did not actually receive the folio until after my fourth call

Overall, I had a poor experience, and it would take a significant upgrade in customer service and a big break in pricing for me to consider staying at this hotel again.

title: Terrible Service
text: We were nor provided the room we booke . We requested an extra robe and towel because the room was only set up for one person. The AC was turned off while we were at dinner and someone stripped the TV of cords, we were charged minibar fees for items we never touched, all in all terrible!

title: Awesome 13th Birthday Getaway
text: When we arrived on Friday afternoon, the manager and the rep that checked us in were both very helpful. They made sure that the room was decorated and that the cake was in the room for our daughter's 13th birthday. The cake was delicious - my daughter's favorite now. Both of them were very discreet with the plans. The hotel smelled amazing every time we walked in and out. Everything was super clean and nice. We would stay here again. Everything is super close and walking distance.

title: Conditioning not working .
text:
Stay there in July as we checked in our room was very warm 80° turn the air down to 67. I had to go have cocktails and dinner with friends,turning at 1 AM still 80°.
 Maintenance coming up at 1 AM had to reset the air it works for about five minutes and turned off again .
 Called back again at 3 AM nothing they could do at that point .
 Not changing rooms at 3 AM .
 Call back at 8 AM told him we were checking out and would like to speak to the general manager . Offered us 20% off .Which is ridiculous sleeping in a 80° room in the summer.

title: Great stay
text: Great stay. The rooms are tiny but it’s manhattan. The staff was great, excellent location, fantastic bed and I love the showers! There were plenty of outlets that are easy to get to and the umbrella in the room came in handy!

title: Very, very fine
text:
I came to New York (after living here for 13 years) for a quick board meeting and a few meetings. I figured I would stay close since I had an 8am start. 

There isn’t anything terrible about the Mondrian but there really isn’t anything great. Rooms were ridiculously small, even by New York standards. I ended up next to a woman screaming on the phone to a friend over FaceTime. Walls are thin so I could track every detail of the drama. I had just checked in (it was late) so I moved rooms.

Restaurant was fine - had lunch as a last resort with a friend and it was as expected for an unknown hotel restaurant). 

I didn’t experience roof or happy hour, which may be great as I know Mondrian origin story is nightlife oriented. 

With so much competition in New York, I struggle to see how Mondrian emerges to the top in their category.

title: Lovely hotel, prime location
text: The Mondrian is literally in the center of it all. We couldn't have picked a better location. The rooms are on the smaller side, but very clean and chic. We didn't get a chance to check out the venues on property, but they all seemed amazing. Lovely service as well - shout out to Alex and Jay! We had a great weekend in NYC!

title: Another fabulous day!
text: My girlfriends and I came here after seeing it all over Instagram. It looks just as good in person. There is a minimum on food and drinks if you aren’t staying at the hotel, but when 2 drinks are $40 it’s easy to reach. We loved all the food and frozen drinks we tried. Mia and Cynthia are straight up amazing servers. Paul at the bar makes a mean skinny margarita! Overall we loved our time there!

title: Small Rooms
text: We had a balcony room which was really small! The bathroom had more space than the bedroom which was odd - I can't understand why the layout had been planned like that. There was therefore no room to store our cases. The hotel also had no lobby area and it just felt like a rent - a - room. Definitely not worth the price.

title: Small rooms, good location
text: This property is centrally located making it easy to get around, the rooms and bathroom are on the smaller side as well as the small table and one chair for work space, staff are great and very accommodating with request - they have a nice "Lounge" with outdoor terrace. Safe is difficult to find, closet space is adequate for couple days. They do offer a adroid mobile phone that you can use and take out with you.

title: Love the Mondrian!!!
text:
Ok, it’s New York so the rooms aren’t the biggest, but they are comfortable. 

Upon entering the Mondrian, the music, scene, and calm lighting set me at ease. The staff is very professional and courteous. I LOVE that they give day passes to Equinox rather than having a fitness center onsite. 

The rooms are sleek, modern, well-appointed, and comfortable. My only complaint is the vessel sink - it’s not a good use of space. 

I’ve stayed here several times and will miss it as my company moved offices out of the neighborhood. 

The umbrellas in the room are so helpful too. 

Highly recommend.

title: Amazing Stay at an Incredible Hotel
text: The Mondrian Park Avenue is an amazing hotel in a great location.  The staff are incredibly nice and fun.  The room we had was VERY comfortable and functional.  It also had an amazing view up and down Park Avenue and overlooked the Rosé Terrace.  Upon checking in to our room, we had lunch in Cleo which was a great experience.  The wait staff were very attentive and made sure that any allergies were addressed for each course.  The food came out at the perfect temperature for each dish and tasted great.  One evening we had drinks on the Rosé Terrace which was another great experience.  I can't say enough about this property, it exceeded my expectations in every way possible and I will be staying there again.

title: Could easily be improved
text:
No block out blinds - there’s blinds & curtains but they don’t block out light. 
Air con units are ridiculously loud. 
Room was clean but had no coffee or tea making facilities, without requesting them. Should just be in room anyway. 
Service to get things brought to room eg iron, kettle is terrible. Then they didn’t bring tea, milk etc - so didn’t end up using kettle anyway. 
Shower pressure is dreadful. 
Staff not very competent or assuring.

title: Beautiful Suite Life
text:
My partner and I stayed for 5 nights in a corner suite at the Mondrian Park Avenue Hotel on the 17th floor.  My favorite part was the layout of the space; a sliding door partitioned off the living space from the bedroom and bathroom.  This is key in creating an inviting and comfortable space that truly feels like a home away from home vs a large box studio with the living space included in the room.  The south and east exposures gave us great morning light and a private balcony allowed for a special way to take in the cityscape.  The rooms were impeccably clean and housekeeping always did a fantastic job of tidying up the space.   

Room service was prompt and always arrived within the timeframe they quoted and was delivered within 30 minutes of ordering.  Breakfast at the restaurant on the ground level, Cleo, was delicious and the service was attentive.  On the first morning, it was freezing in the restaurant as the AC was blasting and when I mentioned it to our server, she was kind enough to let the restaurant know and they made the adjustment. There is an amazing rooftop bar on the 15th floor of the hotel with a selection of great sharable bites, cocktail menu along with great wines.  Unknown to the public, there is a private club inside the hotel! I believe the club opens starting Thursday evenings. Another great amenity is the gym located a couple blocks away at the New York Sports Club.  

It rained a couple days while we were in New York and the hotel provided sturdy umbrellas in the room as well as in the lobby for us to grab on the way out.  The hotel is situated on 30th Street; making it equidistant from the 28th and 32nd Street stops on the 6 train.  It's just a couple blocks away from Herald Square in case you need trains that will take you to other parts of the city.  It's in an extremely central location but removed enough from the hectic hustle and bustle of New York City.  Despite being on an avenue, it was quiet for a restful sleep.  The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were just right instead of being too high, which most hotels err on.  All the staff were helpful and it was a delight staying at this property.

title: Perfect NYC escape
text: I feel like I found my new go-to hotel for NYC. It was super clean, the room was so cute, check-in was smooth, location is amazing. My only complaint was that the shades on the windows let in so much light, it would have been nice to have even have curtains to block out some of the sun early in the am.

title: Quality hotel, but rather small rooms
text: Nice hotel in a good shopping area location, easily accessible to anywhere in Manhattan. Very clean hotel and nice helpful staff, did not quite like our room as was very small (though deluxe). Restaurant ok, not a huge choice but all good quality tasty food and value for money in comparison to the area generally. Me personally next time will go to a quieter area of Manhattan.

title: Great location, good value
text: We thought the location for our needs was excellent.  It was a good value although somewhat pricey for the amenities.  We were over the roof top lounge and there was a private party for two nights of our three night stay.  It was fairly loud, but other than that, it was a lovely room with a balcony.

title: Fantastic stay
text: Modern, clean, very nice.  Bed and pillows extremely comfortable.  Would have liked a coffee maker in room.  A really nice rooftop bar.  Restaurant food was delicious.  Bathrooms very clean with nice rain shower.

title: Horrible Experience with Temperature/Air/Ventilation - If you are sensitive, you will get sick
text: The room is so tiny and the one HVAC vent in the room has only two modes: Saharan Desert (off) or Arctic Blast (full force air).  It completely messed with my sinuses and head the first night because it BLOWS DIRECTLY AT THE BED.  I couldn’t escape it in my sleep, and didn’t like the Saharan Desert option, so I woke up congested and with a headache. I knew I couldn’t last another night like that, we were unable to sufficiently adjust the direction of the airflow ourselves, so we called maintenance who at first said he couldn’t do anything and then my partner asked about putting cardboard up to divert the airflow. He came back with a box lid and tape and it helped, though not ideal because it kept falling down and the thermometer no longer read the temperature properly, so it would not cut on as often as it should have. The room was more warm than not, but at least I wasn’t sick. To make matters worse, the smell of cigarette smoke started coming through the HVAC bent in the shower in the bathroom. I assume this is from someone in another room of the hotel smoking. I’m sensitive to cigarette smoke, so the smell was really bothersome. We tried keeping the bathroom door closed and the balcony door open as much as possible while in the room, at times running the shower to mask the smell. It was rough. It was the worst room experience I’ve had in a really long time in any part of the world. No matter the amenities, if I cannot regulate the temperature well, get sick from forceful direct air blowing in my face while I sleep, and can not breathe clean air within the confines of my room, it is a horrible experience.

title: No lobby, poor service plus they charge you for the water at your bedside. Better off elsewhere
text:
I will advise discerning travelers to avoid the Mondrian as it doesn't best represent the broader Group experience..
If you check in early - there is no lobby. Stand around and wait. What should be free water at your bedside table that is not in the mini bar will cost you $10. No facilities to have tea or coffee in your room and with no lobby at the hotel to just relax and unwind, this makes the hotel an unbearable experience.
If you enjoy quality and used to a good standard of service, then opt for the James which is in the area but provides much better experience.

title: great property and great location
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the mondrian.  The location is perfect, in between central park and soho, out of the tourist times square area.  We really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again when in NYC.

title: Best location and prive quality in NY
text: Outstanding hotel with a great location. The quality of the bed and shower are also worth mentioning. Mondrian is a no-brainer to have a pleasant stay in NY. Would recommend it without any doubt. Thanks!

title: It is not a Mondrian.
text:
The room for 3 people have very Small beds. 
Bad service at the bar. Nobody attends. Very unkind.
Very expensive for the service offered.
Regular Location.
Do not agree with the spirit of the Mondrian that I know.

title: Overrated
text:
Overrated for how it’s marketed and for the pictures you see. Spending a little bit more you can get much more.
Good location though (both for tourists and for business) and good Mediterranean in-house restaurant.

title: Not really worth the money.
text: There is a lot to be improved with the Mondrian in terms of service and food. The rooms are okay and spacious but everything is 100% subpar and there are far cheaper hotels with greater value and more beautiful. I really do wish I could say that the staff or the hotel itself was accommodating but the whole trip- I couldn’t wait to check out.

title: Amazing property, Wonderful Staff
text: This hotel has fabulous rooms, a great bar and restaurant, in a prime New York City location and the staff is literally amazing. The rooms are chic and have beautiful views overlooking the city. I had a large group booked there for several days. Everyone was elated with the accommodations. My company also hosted an event in their roof top area which went perfectly. The Mondrian Park Avenue is definitely the place you want to be for any group or event needs in NYC. Make sure you speak with Esther Song. She was my point of contact from beginning to end, and I couldn't have imagined the process going any smoother.

title: From Los Angeles
text: I have been to many establishments throughout the world. Mondrian Park is a truly one of kind hotel that truly keeps their clients in mind. I was truly in awe of the all thst it had to offer . I will be returning most definitely .

title: LOCATION, STYLE and GREAT STAFF
text: Great location, great roof top , working areas. Rooms are small but like every room in NYC. Ask for the corner balcony room as it offers extra space. Concierge is very accommodating. Great bed and bedding, towels and toiletries.

title: Loved!
text: Had the best time and loved the surprise of face masks! Beautiful rooms and comfortable bed. Loved it. Thank you so much Esther. Will recommend to the rest of my colleagues.  Hope to see you guys soon!

title: Room is adequate. Hotel experience = Zero
text:
This is a property with a collection of rooms. It is not truly a hotel. I shall explain:

- there are no common areas other than a small lobby with no where to sit 
- there is no business center - I had to use the hotel’s computer at the front desk to print something 
- there is no place to make a private call outside of the bedroom
- there’s no ambience, it akin to an apartment building and not a hotel

If the response to these notes is the fact there’s an adjacent restaurant and a rooftop patio, then the hotel management is missing the point. My dietary restrictions make the restaurant unusable and therefore irrelevant and a rooftop bar is not conducive to a meeting or just a place to talk to someone. Additionally, they are not features of the property, they are simply other spaces used in the building. 

As for the room, there are some oddities:
- there is no coffee in the room
- there’s an enormous bathroom with no place to put anything
- there is limited space for your clothing
- wifi could be a lot better
- no pad of paper or pen to write something down 
- and other odd design elements making the stay in the room rather clumsy

Good location. And it’s clean. 

I cannot comment on service because there is nothing to serve. It was a disappointment. If you need a place to stay in that part of the city and require a bed then this is a fine choice. If you enjoy a hotel experience you will be utterly disappointed.

title: Every day got better!
text: We were not so happy when we saw the size of our king bed room - we upgraded for a balcony which was wonderful - but our room was just over the rooftop bar and was really small.  But- the bar noise didn't bother us when the door was closed, and the level of personal attention we received - chambermaid noticed we liked more floor mats, staff left a bottle of wine for my birthday - even though I never told them it was my birthday - bar and bar staff (other than one disinterested female bartender) was fabulous, the modern art and amenities was refreshing, and we enjoyed entertaining intown family and friends at the rooftop bar.  We ended up absolutely loving The Mondrian!

title: A bit better but still did not deliver
text: In November of 2018 I reviewed this hotel and was contacted by management.  To entice me back they offered two free nights and free breakfasts for 3 people for the length of our stay.  Free nights in NYC is hard to turn down, so on May 10 we returned.  We were greeted warmly and they even had our room ready for us at 8 am.    I was asked to provide the gift certificate, which I did.  I inquired as to how we obtained the free breakfast and was told the restaurant kew what to do.  When I checked out the system was down and it wasn't until later that I received an itemized summary of the harges.  Lo and behold all the breakfasts were charged.  We chose to eat at the hotel only 3 of the 7 mornings as the food was subpar, served cold and the service was indifferent at best.  We chose not to complain about this as the meals were to be free.  After calling the manager informed us that the breakfasts were limited to $25 a person and that was all they would remove from our charges.  At no time and in no place was that listed and we were not told that when I asked about the breakfasts.  $25 a person does not get an entree, coffee and juice.  I am extremely disappointed that again the hotel has not lived up to their word.  The manager told my husband that she would get back to him but we have waited and it is about 2 weeks after the initial contact and we have not heard from the hotel.  Apparently, they think we have forgotten.  My son has relocated to NYC and we visit frequently.  We will not stay there again and I suggest if you want an honest place to stay that you find somewhere else. As a side note for those that read my initial review in 2018, they still moved our things around but it was much less than before.

title: Excellent service
text: Excellent service from the front desk staff that made my feel extremely welcomed and looked after. Rooms were clean and offered a great night’s sleep after a long commute and conference. Everything was well presented and managed by the hotel team

title: Great service!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mondrian!  The location was super, the bed was very comfortable but the stand out was the great service!   The whole team were so accommodating every step of the way for all our requests!  Particularly Jazz who made it all fun and easy with a few logistical arrangements on our side!   NYC is expensive and the rooms are small as a general principle - so I am bias about value - but overall we all had a super stay!

title: Bijoux boutique hotel in great location
text:
Mondrian Park Avenue - Great location, lovely boutique hotel.
We stayed a week at this centrally located hotel. You are about 10-15 minutes walk from Grand Central station, 10 minutes from Empire State Building, 10 minutes from Union Square. It is a fantastic hotel especially if you upgrade to a king room with balcony. It is so special to be able to look up and down Park Avenue from your bedroom. We could see the Williamsburg Bridge in the distance. 
The beds are  huge and very comfortable. Shower is excellent with 2 heads. There is not much room for hanging your clothes up. They have gone for aesthetics rather than practicality.  There is lots of smoked glass and reflective surfaces which give it a warm feel. The rooms are not huge, but compact and comfortable.  We thought it was fabulous to have a balcony as it really gave you an extra dimension of being in New York.  This was our first time and we found the location excellent.  We walked most days and never got lost due to the grid system in NY.  Excellent coffee shop next door called Felix Roasting Co and a couple of blocks up, our favourite restaurant, Wolfgang's. An amazing steak house with a great atmosphere.
We would definitely stay again reserving a balcony room.

title: Very nice hotel, quiet, spacious rooms, very clean, with a great roof terrace
text: Very nice hotel, quiet, spacious rooms, very clean, with a great roof terrace. Downside is, you will be asked to pay a resort fee of 30 or 35 dollars per day and i dont know what it includes; one carafe of coffee and one of tea in the small lobby wont justify the charge (there is no coffee machine in the room or any facility fro guests to make coffee or tea in the rooms). I understand there is a gym as well but i wasnt aware of this when i stayed there. The rooms are spacious and very well decorated, mirrors everywhere, it smells great and the sheets are bright white. My room was also quiet so the NYC noise did not bother my sleep. the roof terrace bar has stunning views

title: Not worth it’s value.
text: Room was too small even though we booked a 28 sq mt room. We didn’t get what we paid for. Location is great. We were on the 14th floor and it was really loud as the bar is right above. There was vomit in the elevator.

title: unethics
text: A complaint was made of me smoking. I was called then visited by employees whom all admitted there was no smell of smoke. I would say this was after 9pm. Then, upon check out, there was a smoking charge! It was removed after I complained and was told they had no proof I was smoking, which I was not. I think its highly unethical to even attempt to charge me for smoking even after an employee admitted they had no proof!?

title: Great Location
text:
Great location and very clean. Room we had was very small and was difficult to get in out of bed as it was too close to the wall 

The hotel is walking distance to subway and attractions and good restaurants

title: Won’t stay again
text: The king rooms are too small. There’s not enough house keeping staff. I had to wait all day and night for house keeping to service my room. They didn’t come till 7:30pm one of the days after at least 6 calls to front desk and operator  almost every hour. There terrace bar is a joke. The manager there seems like he is trying to make it seem all exclusively and something it’s not. The had a dead tree in the corner, & tacky fake wisteria from amazon taped to the perimeter. They should invest in some landscaping. They didn’t even serve bottled water or pineapple for my  tequila

title: Great value with friendly and professional service
text: A lovely hotel well situated with professional staff willing to help with all. And a good restaurant and bar.  A sophisticated clientele with comfortable rooms at reasonable prices.  Great views up and down Park Ave South.

title: Quick trip
text: Easy access ,clean and quiet. love the rain showers. Secure rooms ,though a little on the small side if your with more than one person occupancy.I was by myself and loved the comfortable bed and the size of the TV.Extremely clean in my opinion

title: Nice but overrated
text: Hotel is nice but very basic, my only reason to stay is the distance to our offices as for this price you should get much more.room is very basic but the bad is super comfortable. No gym in premecis but they have a deal with external provider.

title: Park Ave Sass
text:
Finally, a Park Ave hotel that isn't full of creepy old people.
Thanks for stepping up the neighborhood.
Everything is well prepared and thought out except the morning coffee.... but that should be an easy adjustment by Monday!

title: Bello molto bello !!!
text:
Albergo moderno ristrutturato da non molto, posizionato in zona al centro di NY. Camera non molto grande ma funzionale per un soggiorno da turista. Bagno nuovissimo con doccia stupenda! Pulizia giornaliera. Prodotti da bagno ottimi. Materasso comodo. Stanza silenziosa anche al piano 3.
Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo. 
Sarà il mio albergo di riferimento per i prossimi viaggi nella città di NY.

title: Perfect
text: Struttura moderna e confortevole, in posizione strategica. Stanza non molto grande ma funzionale. Doccia grande. Materasso comodo. Pulizia ottima.Stanza silenziosa.anche se al piano basso. Non ho disservizi da segnalare.

title: Decent size comfortable rooms with a free mobile for your stay
text:
After deciding to get the subway from JFK, we jumped out at 33rd/Park Avenue and were about 40 metres away from the hotel entrance.

Arriving 40mins before check in time we hit the bar “Cleo” whilst housekeeping finished up with our room. Before we finished our drinks, we were given our room key and advised our luggage had already been taken up for us, a cracking first impression.

Unfortunately, we then had to wait almost 15 mins to settle our drinks bill as the staff member had disappeared (a friend of the team went to find them for us). This was our only visit to the bar although at check out someone else had managed to add their drink to our room, I have to say this was quickly sorted by the Reception team so no complaints here.

Our room was larger than expected which was a pleasant surprise and kitted our with everything we needed. Iron/ironing board could be requested which we did later in the stay and it was delivered to our room in a timely fashion.
The room was clean and very comfortable and even came with our own mobile phone to use for the stay. We only used this for one local call to reconfirm a restaurant booking but we were free to take it out, use the internet and maps feature to aid our stay in NYC. A great idea and one we under used! 

The hotel also had a roof top bar and a club in the basement - we used neither (just due to our plans for our stay) but neither created any unwanted noise and we slept very well each night.

Location wise the hotel is great. Walkable to Central Station and on to Times Square or over to the East River ferry terminals on 34th street. The nearest Subway gave us access down to Brooklyn Bridge and the September 11th memorial area as well as the airport as mentioned earlier.

Plenty of places to eat within a short walking distance - especially for breakfast which we hadn’t booked. Coffee and Tea was supplied on a help yourself takeaway basis every morning which was a nice touch to head out with. 

The hotel doesn’t have a gym but you can use one just a short walk away, if you don’t get your pass whilst checking in just ask and they will quickly sort it for you. We had intended to use it but after walking over 100km in 5 days were more than happy with our work out!

Great location, clean and comfortable with a few lovely added extras to make it that bit more special.

I’m sure we will be back

title: Good location for my needs, but overpriced and odd
text:
Warning: Complaining review ahead!

Issues: 
1. Walls are so incredibly thin that you can hear every guest walking through the hallway and your neighbors tv as though it were in front of your face. 
2. Mirrors EVERYWHERE.  The decor felt straight out of the home of an elderly woman in the 80s. 
3. Small beds. This was booked for corporate travel and I was shocked when I saw two double beds. Even in NY, I expected at least full beds. 

One thing I did like however is that you are able to chromecast to the TV (so you can watch netflix, youtube, etc)

title: Great stay
text: First time stay at this boutique hotel. Rooms are modern and clean. Complimentary coffee and tea in morning nice touch. Enjoyed Rooftop experience with friends. Location is convenient to Gran Central and a good midway point to any neighborhood. Happy we chose the Mondrian.

title: The mondrian NYC <> Mondrian LA
text: If you're thinking about staying at Mondrian NYC after visiting LA, understand you're not close to getting apples for apples. Service is poor, no pool, no attached gym, and the only gem which is the 15th floor terrace operates only in the evening and has a "velvet rope" style "are you on the guest list" type attitude to hotel guests as well as just plain visitors. Would not recommend unless its a special deal and just make sure your expectations aren't high.

title: Generally dissapointing.
text: Great location but otherwise pretty dissapointing. Service was slow, cleaning times erratic (we were expelled from our rooms in order for the room to be cleaned on two occassions), roof terrace often closed and sound-proofing in the room was largely non-existent which, combined with the loud AC unit, made sleep difficult.

title: Brilliant hotel & excellent location
text:
I’ve nothing but good things to say about this hotel, from the check-in onwards the staff were super helpful and the rooms were excellent in terms of design and housekeeping. 

The place has a nice vibe to it without being in your face, understated quality throughout. 

It’s a bit of a long walk to the Javits Centre but at least it’s one straight road!

title: Excellent, comfortable with great customer service
text: Whether making reservations, checking in or needing something else, the Mondrian staff are customer focused, friendly and polite. The CLEO restaurant next door has excellent food and attentive servers. You will be happy with the art around, reducing the hustle of NY city and having a relaxing experience. Clean, high quality, and I highly recommend.  Will be coming back again and again for work and time off.

title: Mauvais séjour
text:
Très déçu de cet hôtel. Nous avons passé trois jours au Mondrian que nous regrettons à tous niveaux. La chambre au 18e étage était ridiculement petite et exiguë, même pour Manhattan. Le service du  restaurant de l’hôtel, le Cléo, était lamentable avec du personnel au visage long, sans le moindre sourire, affichant des attitudes désagréables. Avec à peine 12 personnes au petit-déjeuner il a fallu plus de 10min pour venir au moins offrir un café et pour 66$ US pour une omelette nature et une assiette d’œufs bénédictine sans aucun fruit ou accompagnement, c’est du vol. Qui plus est, ils avaient oublié un jus de fruit qu’ils ont d’abord facturé, puis ont corrigé la facture à notre demande, mais sans un mot d’excuse ni pour l’oubli ni pour l’erreur.

Le lendemain nous avons commandé le déjeuner à la chambre, mais ils n’ont apporté que la moitié de la commande avec, notamment, une seule tasse de café ! Une heure plus tard, nous avions finalement le reste, mais ils voulaient nous faire signer une nouvelle facture. En sortant pour l’après-midi nous sommes allé à la réception en expliquant le cas et nous n’avons eu aucune excuse de la part de la réception.

En revenant vers 5 pm, les plateaux du petit-déjeuner n’avaient toujours pas été enlevés dans la chambre et l’odeur était épouvantable. La chambre n’avait toujours pas été nettoyée à 5pm ! Nous avons téléphoné à la réception qui ne savait pas trop quoi faire, nous sommes descendu furieux et après un imbroglio de personnel venant frappé à notre porte, nous avons décidé de partir pour qu’ils puissent enfin nettoyer la chambre. Ils n’ont jamais offert une chambre d’appoint ou des rafraîchissements gratuits en attendant. 

Ils ont effacé la deuxième facture du petit-déjeuner mais aucun message d’excuses du gérant de l’hôtel pour l’incompétence de leur service à la clientèle. En faisant le Check out certaines taxes sont apparues et comble d’insulte, on reçoit à notre retour à Montréal une facture pour une bouteille d’eau du minibar que nous n’avons jamais prise (à 10 $ US la bouteille faut-il préciser) ! Heureusement qu’il y a plusieurs autres excellents hôtels à New York !

title: Good Location, Great Service
text:
I have stayed at a number of NY hotels and would say this has been one of the better ones. Had an ok sized room for NY, and location should suit those looking to get to most areas within manhattan by either subway or cab. A decent middle of everything location.  
Service was friendly and staff were happy to help where needed.  The hotel is not a massively high building (20 stories?), and most of the rooms people holidaying will be choosing will invariably see them given lower level rooms, but, given the total height of the building, you would be unlikely to have any real sort of view if higher up.  If view is important then look for a hotel with more floors.  We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there are numerous decent options within short walk nearby.  For those coming via train into Penn St, its about a 12min walk from there.   Yes, i'd stay here again for sure.

title: Ok
text: It was his experience I hope to develop for the better Provide better services as well as employees are developed information to benefit the  Thank you for allowing me to express the opinion of the hotel resident of the hotel

title: Extremely small room
text: Nice hotel, but room was extremely small. It was totally unexpected. There wasn't even room to open up my bags. My wife and I literally were climbing over each other. The service was decent, but because the rooms were so small I would not stay here again.

title: Petite semaine à NY
text:
Hôtel très sympa, bien placé sur la 30e avec subway station aux 28 et 33e rues, accueil parfait. Nous avions une chambre au 17e avec vue sur l’Empire State. A noter le bar au 15e avec sa super terrasse sur Park Avenue. Café et thé dans le lobby dès tôt le matin et possible de prendre le petit dej à Cleo le restaurant de l’hôtel.
Adapté pour nous couple + ado moins de 16 ans avec 2 lits doubles très confort.

title: Great weekend in NYC!
text: The Mondrian was in a great location! It was centrally located, so it was easy to go up to Times Square or go down to Soho and shop. It was a very clean hotel. The room was really nice and a decent size for an NYC hotel because most hotel rooms in the city are super small. We really liked the Cleo restaurant that was connected to the Mondrian. We ate there for breakfast one morning and had drinks and apps there one evening. Very good food! The only thing that bothered us was that one night, we had called down to the front desk to ask if they would bring us up water bottles (they give out complimentary water bottles down stairs) and instead of bringing up the regular complimentary water bottles that they give out, they had the restaurant bring us up huge bottles of the still water. Then they charged us for them and it was like 10 dollars a water bottle! Moral of the story, just go to cvs and get some waters for your room.

title: Review
text: Always love staying at the Mondrian Park!! Great location for me, friendly and accommodating staff. Pleasant ambiance, very comfortable bed, great room size.  Easy access to  subway and taxis. And always looking forward to coming back soon!

title: My top choice!
text: I stay here anytime I'm in NYC for work. Upscale, clean, friendly environment. Great location, although I like staying in and dining at their restaurant. Their bar/lounge is also a great spot for evenings after work.

title: Not as expected...
text:
On a positive note, the pictures of the main lobby are accurate. I also had to wait in the terrace for my room to be ready, which has an outdoor/indoor feature. This was nice and I was able to open my laptop and get some things crossed off of my list.  Also, when I checked out, the fella at the front desk was very friendly and offered to flag down a taxi, which was very nice. 

On a negative note, my room looked nothing like the pictures shown on this website.  There was 1 tiny window on the left side of my room. By the pictures shows, I expected airy, light and modern. After my first night, I left very early for work, and returned late afternoon. I didn't realize that you have to put a sign out on your door to have it cleaned. They offered to clean it later, but by that time, I just wanted to decompress.  Lastly, I was looking forward to heading to the gym and using a foam roller. They did not have a gym, but they did offer a pass to a gym that was down the street.

Regarding whether this is mid-range/luxury, I don't know how to classify. I paid over $433 the first night, and $319 the second.

Would I recommend that you stay here? Not really.  Thought to give it a try, but I've enjoyed better in NYC.

title: 3 days in New York
text: Great location in central Manhattan, large and trendy rooms. Very comfy beds. Nice attentions like a free mobile phone to be used during your stay, a bottle of water when you arrive and leave,.... Highly recommended

title: Nice hotel
text: The hotel entrance is very nice and the hotel is at a great location, close to everything.  The room was smaller than expected, but that was to be expected in New York.  The room was nicely decorated and well equipped.  Would stay again.

title: Mondrian
text:
Stayed for 5 nights.  In a great location.  The room was very comfortable except for a night where there was a lit of noise from outside till around  3am.  
The hotel is a bit pricey especially with the added taxes.
The staff was very nice and helpful.

title: Good location Few issues in Room
text: Great location. nice hotel but rooms are tiny. Shower towels are constantly having stains so be careful and look before using. Restaurant is good. Staff is nice but didn’t resolve my issues. Also nice to have equinox passes.

title: Mediocre Stay
text: Stayed here for 4 nights with a family of four.  The hotel is in a good location however basic service is lacking for any hotel let alone a 4.5 star.  Had to call front desk for soap on the first day.  After a long day of touring and looking forward to a shower,  there was no soap,  shampoo or  conditioner in the room.  I called the front desk not once but three times and waited over an hour and still nothing.   It’s not the end of the world but an annoying problem to have to deal with and something the hotel could have easily solved. It would have been easier to walk to corner store to buy these basic essentials.    Apart from location,  nothing special about this hotel.   I would not recommend staying here.

title: Weekend Trip
text: Great location.  Within walking distance to many landmarks and great shopping.  Seemed like a safe area.  The food was great and the rooftop bar was very nice.  The room  was very comfortable and clean.  Staff was very pleasant and helpful.

title: Nothing to write home about
text:
Pros: convenient location on Park Avenue; furnishings/finishes are new given recent renovation; nice toiletries.

Cons: Just about everything else.  
Rooms are hideously small even by NYC standards; the website is particularly misleading in this regard.  I could not even sit at the "sitting area" (just a chair and tiny cocktail table that could barely hold my laptop); I had paid extra for a room with that "feature" and would not do so again.  
Common spaces are nonexistent except for the upstairs lounge area which, as others note, is often closed for private events.  It was closed for almost my entire stay here due to a corporate party (and time for setting it up and breaking it down).  Because of this, there was literally no common space to use; and as noted already, the room was uncomfortably small.  Adding insult to injury, we had a balcony room above the lounge and were kept up until the wee hours by the corporate party's pounding music.  
Cleo is fine but it is very specific cuisine; should really be another option for food at a decent hotel.
Lack of a fitness center is inexcusable.  I appreciate the Equinox pass, which I used, but the whole process of going there, filling out liability waivers, etc. is cumbersome and nothing like popping into an in-hotel fitness center.
Elevators: I rarely waited less than 5 minutes for an elevator to arrive.

In all, this hotel seems to be relying on the Mondrian name because it is just not up to par otherwise.  Not my worst NY hotel experience, but with so many wonderful hotels in this city, I can't see a reason to return.

title: Location and comfort on Park Ave.
text:
I stayed here on a business trip for a couple of days and found the staff extremely helpful, the bed comfortable and the overall experience very pleasant. The location is also very central and wonderful. Close enough to the 'action' in every direction by foot. 

I would bring my family to stay here.

title: Moving on up
text: Always have a great stay at the Mondrian. This time, I was treated to a fantastic upgrade to a suite - definitely worth checking out if you can. Service was fantastic - shoutout to Hector and Esther.  This hotel has a great location, is clean, comfortable and always a solid choice for business trips.  One piece of advice is to ask for a room that's not on Park Ave - view is still good and you don't get as much noise from the street (it's not bad at all, but I prefer the quiet).

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This is a lovely clean fresh hotel. 18 months old. Great breakfast available in the restaurant downstairs at a reasonable cost. Super comfortable bed with four pillows blackout blinds or soft light diffusing curtains if you prefer. Very large television screen. Well stocked minibar and snack bar. Rooms are well insulated and I didn’t hear any of the late night  chatter and people moving around in corridors that you often do in New York. Reception staff are very attentive and knowledgeable. The hotel is ideally located  with two subway stations only a couple of blocks away. Also I never had to wait more than 20 seconds for a taxi!

title: Mod Mondrian
text:
This hotel, one subway stop from Grand Center and a few blocks from Madison Square Park, is on a bustling stretch of Park Avenue South and a good area to launch your explorations of Manhattan. 

The lobby is chic and light, but quite small, and during my stay was often crowded when even small groups of people were congregating or checking in/out.  The staff I dealt with were all friendly and helpful, even when there was some initial difficulty locating my reservation.  

My room, 307, was a "premier king" on the 3rd floor.  The room had high ceilings, a small loveseat and table seating area, and good light.  The bathroom was beautiful floor to ceiling marble with a multi-head glass shower.  In my opinion, the open closet area is not a tidy way to store things, nor is it keeping in line with the rest of the luxury vibe of the hotel. 

The bed was very comfortable, and the shades blocked out much, but not all, the light.  There were definitely a fair amount of street noise, at least on the lower floor where I was.  I'm used to city noise, but there was a lot of 2a dumpster action going on.  This isn't the hotel's fault, but it was noticeable.

Loved the style and location of this sleek hotel.  Well worth considering if you can get a deal on their (slightly aggressive) prices.

title: Not worth the price
text: Absolutely not worth the price, dont bother making any special requests because they will not be honored. I specified that I am 8 months pregnant and would need a cot in case I was tossing and turning in bed and they did not honor that request upon arrival, had to wait over 2 hours to receive the cot, after being told that the room I booked wouldn't fit on, had to go back and forth. Would never stay here again.

title: Unsure how to feel about this hotel...
text:
I think the part of this hotel I am most annoyed with is the trash disposal in the room. There’s a can for both normal waste and for recycling; while I sorted it into the respective receptacles, I saw two different maids on separate occasions empty them into the same bag to dispose of them. I would prefer if there was no separate recycling disposal, rather than have the lie. 

The beds were absolutely lovely! Some of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever actually stayed in!! 

I wouldn’t recommend the room service - I think the chicken nuggets and chips were overpriced. 

The staff on the checkin desk were absolutely lovely. The gummy bears as part of room service were DELICIOUS!

title: Not a 5 star hotel
text: Very disappointed that the terrace bar was not opened daily as advertised on their website. No comfortable area in reception to sit at check out etc. Too far from times square  etc as yours tend to go from there. Beds very comfortable.

title: Excellent Staycation
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for a mini staycation. We had the most wonderful time! Between the beautiful room, the excellent food at Cleo Restaurant and the insanely fun night club, called The Boogie Room, there was not a moment that missed the mark. They even have a rooftop Terrace which is BEAUTIFUL. 

Regarding the hotel specifically, from the moment you enter through the doors, you get a warm welcome from the Mondrian team. Check in was a breeze and our bags were brought up to our room. We were greeted with a note from the hotel welcoming us. 

The room was LARGE for an NYC hotel. Even more importantly, the bathroom was very spacious, as well. The bed was comfortable- and the hotel made sure our room was de-feathered, as we have a feather allergy. 

This hotel is so centrally located, I can also see it being an ideal spot for the business man/woman. There is one large conference room + quiet areas for meetings in Cleo Restaurant and the rooftop Terrace, Mondrian Terrace. It has a very high end feel, which can be great for meeting clients, etc. 

All in all, this stay was 5 stars!

title: Another great stay at my New York home
text:
The Mondrian Park Avenue has become my home in New York for the week I spend here each month. Once again, it provided exactly what I needed to support an exhausting quarter-end.

Early Check-In -> While I never enjoy starting at trip with a Sunday night red eye flight, starting Monday is a lot easier after checking into my room. This is the second time (2 for 2) that this hotel has done this for me.

Great meal -> The salmon, Brussel sprouts and lavash bread I had on Monday was the best food of this trip. It was tasty, fresh... and easy. Their restaurant, Cleo, had enough energy to be interesting but not so much to be tiring.

Beds & Pillows -> I found this place last year when scouring reviews for the best hotel pillows in New York. They still have them. Full size, well stuffed feather pillows and soft linens make their beds the best hotel beds I’ve slept in on business travel.

Friendly staff -> The entire staff is very friendly and helped ensure every aspect of check in/ out went smoothly. I am continually and pleasantly surprised by how many people know me by name, even staff members I haven’t met before.

Until next time (next month)...

title: Disappointing last minute stay due to room proximity to Club
text:
Really the title says it all.

We live in NYC and booked a night last minute on a whim at the Mondrian while out celebrating. The idea was for the lovely hotel stay to cap off the night.

What we got however was a very small room (fine) that looked entirely into a brick wall (hysterical - but it was late already so that’s fine too). It was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Short stay, who needs a huge room, right?

Upon check in the front desk informed us that Cleo was open until 11p and the club was open on the downstairs level. We opted for a night cap at Cleo and to not visit the club, we live here and figured we could always come another time. Drinks at Cleo were fantastic.

Went to bed and were awoken at 4am by very drunk, very loud club goers leaving. Apparently our room was located in some proximity to either an exit or outdoor space for the club (??), seeing as we looked out directly onto a brick wall I was no quite sure HOW it was so loud. Noise went on for some time and honestly spoiled our last minute stay. For the price we paid we could have stayed at multiple other properties within blocks of the Mondrian.

The hotel is very beautiful and I’m sure there are better experiences to be had here - however, we did not get one. I do not foresee us recommending or visiting the Mondrian again. Upon check out the very nice desk staff, when hearing our noise complaint, said yes - floor 3 does get noise - how unfortunate. Why would you place people in those rooms knowing they’re going to most likely have a terrible night sleep?

C’mon, Mondrian - you can absolutely do better than this. In fact I know you can, I’ve stayed at your other properties.

title: Great Staff
text:
Good size room, comfortable beds, clean and very nice decor, the bell staff friendly and helpful.
We didn't get a room with a view but really didn't matter, made it cozy enough to sleep and silent, we still had a window to an alley. The price was excellent for the location and the features.
I will come back.

title: Great experience service and quality...
text: We had a very romantic evening. The hotel was lobby smelled great, the entire hotel is very ambient. The restaurant "cleo" was great. The room was clean and modern with a warm feel. ROse colored mirrors and great bedding....Facing Park ave can be loud...

title: Hotel Mondrian New York
text:
Perfettamente in centro a Manhattan ad un passo dal MADISON square garden e a 50 metri dalla Metro.
Ottima pulizia e di ottimo impatto visivo. 
Design di eccellente abbinamento fra arte e cultura . 
Lo consiglio vivamente

title: Best find in NYC
text: Been coming to NYC for 30 years. First time at the Mondrian.  Best hotel I've stayed in.  Great location, price and rooms.  Will definitely be back.  Looking forward to trying the restaurants next time,  Thanks for a great stay.

title: Slight issues with an otherwise great room
text:
Positive:
Our room was very spacious, nicely decorated, and the bathroom showers were excellent. We had a great view of the Empire State building too, and the hotel was in a very handy location. We also had a free smartphone with data, which was possibly one of the most useful features! 

Negative:
Our room was quite dusty, which is something I only noticed after realising that the air con was exacerbating the issue. 

The hotel bar was only open on Fridays and Saturdays as it was not "peak season", and this was a pity as we wanted to make use of it. 

We were also charged halfway through our stay with no notification that this would be done. Upon checking in we were told we could pay on checking out, and I had also specifically asked to ensure that my card would only be charged for room service/in case of emergency etc. When I complained, the reception staff were very unhelpful and not responsive.

title: Five star service
text: Fantastic hotel in a great location with spectacular city views - would highly recommend paying more for a deluxe king with a balcony. Absolutely spotless - everything is brand new. Fitted with all you need for a trip including a well stocked mini bar. Staff were friendly and helpful - would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

title: Spring Break in NYC
text: Our family of four recently stayed for 4 nights. Other than the beds being double beds rather than queen size beds, our stay was excellent!  Rooms are somewhat small but we spent very little time in the room.  Incredibly clean rooms with very nice aesthetics. Wonderful location overall and would definitely recommend this property.

title: Pleased
text: Very nice hotel, modern and clean. Good value. Beds sleep very nice it was quite overall walls a bit thin. Will stay again!! Bar area large enough but was always packed with outsiders. Restaurant looked amazing we did not eat there ran out of time. Great place.

title: Wonderful all around!
text:
I had a quick weekend trip to NYC on 3/18/19 and couldn’t have asked for a better experience than the Mondrian! After a long flight, it was wonderful to be greeted by such kind people - and side note the lobby smells amazing! 

Our room was beautiful, so clean and the beds were very comfortable - a good size for NY standards. The bath amenities were also very good - the shampoo and conditioner didn’t leave my hair dry and the moisturizer actually moisturizes!

What impressed me the most was the hotel team. Everyone we interacted with was kind, and always had a smile. Special kudos to the morning restaurant manager who personally brought up our coffee early Sunday morning so we could have some before leaving for our flight. And to the door valet who went and stood in the pouring rain to get us a taxi to the airport.  

I will definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC - highly recommend!

title: The Perfect Stay
text: I was only there for a short time but my stay was amazing! The staff were very helpful and my room was super clean and had everything I needed. I really loved all the little details in the room and tin he hotel itself. Would definitively go back :)

title: Would totally stay again
text: This hotel totally met my expectations. The hallways were clean and i loved the wallpaper. The staff at the hotel were so friendly. The room services price were not that bad for NY rates. And you got a free pass to equinox! I had such an amazing stay here and am planning on staying again in the future.

title: Happy Ending. Solid Hotel with Style..
text: Small chic hotel. Good location and ambience. Room was nicely decorated but basic. Big TV which was cool. Restaurant was closed do to unforeseen circumstances. Coffee was not ready in the morning. A bit unorganized, but in the end very responsive and addressed our concerns. I would stay here again. It was a very good value by NYC standards.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Eric Salvadar and Claudio made our stay extremely special and memorable. They went above and beyond in accommodations and in service. I wouldn’t hesitate to bring my friends and family to this hotel whenever I’m in NYC. Seriously the best hotel in the city. Well done!!

title: Very good, upscale hotel.  Not 5*, but a good 4* option.
text:
I've stayed her for work and personal trips.  I think this is good value for money if you are looking for a 4 star property and don't want to break the bank, understanding this is NYC and everything is pricey.

1) Well maintained and generally upscale feel.  Rooms are very clean.  Furniture is new. Amenities are just above mass market.  

2) Rooms at a lot of hotels in NYC are small.  These are fine and not overly small.

3) Bathrooms are nice.

4) The gym is the Equinox gym up the street.  This is an awesome amenity. 

5) The staff is really excellent.  The front desk always seems to remember me - and this is a pretty busy place!  I've been to the bar and it's also well run.

Definitely recommend.

title: Great central location
text:
A really nice compact hotel, nicely furnished and clean. Staff are courteous and smiley 
No tea or coffee in the room, however they do offer free coffee and tea in the bar area.
The only negative, was when our neighbors left the room, they were very inconsiderate and basically let the door slam, which shook the whole headboard, and when it happens up to 8 times in the night, not fun. I did speak to the front desk who handled the situation and we could enjoy the last two nights of our 4 night stay.
The facilities that are available like a gym, are in a different building, not ideal in winter.
The gym, town car and free phone that you pay extra for in your “resort tax” is not worth it, the car is only available on a first come first served basis, (understandably) for 5 days per week up to 5pm, these extras should be optional and not charged as a tax. 
We didn’t use the restaurant, but it looked fine.
The bar staff are friendly and pour a mean G&T!
The location is very good, most things are within walking distance including the underground. Grand central is minutes away. We were attending a concert at Madison Square Garden and it was a 10 min walk.
Lots of great restaurants near by, Thai, Vietnamese, Indian, almost everything you could want.

title: Disappointed
text: Not quite up to the standard we had expected from Mondrian, although location is good. Service,  rooms and overall experience disappointing and nowhere near Mondrian London standards. Unfortunately we will not be returning.

title: Not at the same level as the Mondrian London ( Now Sea Containers)
text: Having stayed a few times at  the fantastic Mondrian London , we were expecting a similar experience in NYC.  Unfortunately the service levels,  rooms  and overall experience were well below our expectations. Sadly we will not return.

title: Fab Stay
text: Stayed in king balcony room hotel is 5 mins walk from empire state building and the complimentary house car is available to drop you off up to 15 blocks which was a bonus for us Cabs pretty cheap for return journeys. Warm welcome staff were amazing nothing was too much trouble. Thank you all we had a great time.

title: Girls getaway weekend
text:
First, let me talk SERVICE! From even days before arriving, Esther is Sales was in communication with me to make this girls weekend getaway perfect. She made sure rooms were next to each other, billing was settled prior - she surprised us with welcome amenities in the room and late checks outs. She went above and beyond

Everyone we encountered with had a warm welcoming smile on their face. 

Rooms are large and designed beautifully. 3-4 girls in the double rooms felt comfortable. The bathroom was large and bright and the shower had great water pressure.

The location is perfect- so much to do in walking distance but if you’re looking to stay on property you can enjoy their terrace lounge with beautiful views or Cleo their restaurant which had the best zucchini chips

Thank you Mondrian team for making this weekend unforgettable. I hope to be back again soon :)

title: My first choice in NYC
text:
Mondrian has become our hotel of choice since our son moved to NYC. Great location,
Great facility, not too noisy, and the staff, from top down, starting with the Manager Alexander, are truly the best. Very professional, accommodating and friendly. 
Thank you for making us feel welcome.

title: EXTRAORDINARY Boutique Hotel with a Strong Personality
text:
Beautiful hotel focusing on service with a sleek, sophisticated style.  The best pillows & beds I've ever experienced!  Wonderful Mediterranean  restaurant, CLEO, attached to hotel with Room Service. Great location close to Empire State Building & Madison Square Park as well as being surrounded by numerous fabulous restaurants.  Two of my favorites...breakfast, Sarabeth's (Park Avenue South) and dinner, Scarpetta (88 Madison Ave).  

Exceptional attention to detail with a friendly, service oriented atmosphere.  Quality personified!  AND they have a complimentary Lincoln House Car for guests...first come, first serve basis (up to 15 blocks). Very convenient. 

Thoroughly enjoyed my visit!  Thank you Mondrian Park Avenue!

title: Pre valentine
text:
I absolutely adored my stay at the Mondrian! All of the employees at the front desk were super friendly, helpful, and more than accommodating. My room was beautiful, clean, and welcoming. The accommodations within the room anticipated my every need including a stocked mini bar with cocktail recommendations and a phone I could take around the city for navigation and phone calls. In terms of my self care evening, there was a memory foam bed and down comforter, as well as a smart TV for me to watch some of my favorite movies! All around it was a wonderful experience, one of the best I have had in NYC.i spent the next morning on the balcony taking in the views.
Would recommend everytime.

title: Best Business Hotel in Nomad
text: I've tried just about every other hotel in the Nomad area and have decided the Mondrian is the best when I travel on business. Clean, spacious rooms, Equinox gym access, and consistently great service cannot be beat. My team and I always choose the Mondrian when we come to NYC for business.

title: Amazing!!!
text:
I stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue for the first time the week of February 3-8th and I must say, may stay was nothing short of EXCEPTIONAL!!! I think this hotel has key ingredients for success. From the Front Office staff to the restaurant, everyone was excited, attentive and ready to assist. I was so happy to entertain my clients at the property and they were thoroughly impressed. The sales team is AMAZING, Esther, Sarah and Vincent treated my like VIP and made me feel very at home during my week long stay... Your clients are in great hands!!! Looking forward to my return! 

See you soon! 
LB

title: Great Location, Clean Comfortable Room, and Cleo to top it all off
text: As a frequent traveler too many parts of the world location and comfort our key when choosing a place to stay.  The location is great close to Union Square and Penn Station.  The rooms have style and are clean and comfortable.  Instagram worthy if that is your sort of thing.  Also having Cleo as the restaurant on the property tops it all off as our go to hotel in NYC.

title: Stood out of the rest
text: I am in New York often and I have tried many hotels, Mondrian stood out of the rest,very friendly stuff, the room was very spacious  and nicely decorated. It was very large, probably I got a VIP room as I booked with my gold status in Expedia. The only criticism is that the pillows were too high/large for my very fragile shoulders. However this does not change my rating. Location wise, it is in midtown, very close to flatiron, with good connection in foot or train to many sight seeing places, trains, work out facilities  and excellent restaurants.

title: Valentine's Stay at the Mondrian
text: My wife and I had an incredible experience at the Mondrian Park Ave for Valentine's day. We booked a suite for the evening and the room was amazing! The room was extremely large with state of the art amenities. Amazing views of the city from every room! We also chose to have our Valentine's Dinner at "Cleo" Mondrian's restaurant. They had a special "Pre-Fixed" Menu for Valentine's Day that was absolutely delicious. The food and service were top-notch and the overall experience of the dinner and stay left us both wanting to book another 2 nights! Great experience and will definitely be back soon!

title: Great location, great value and a comfortable room
text: The Mondrian is a perfect location if your commuting to the city via Penn Station.  We could walk to the hotel from the train station, it is also only a short walk to Madison square park.  The lobby is definitely bare and lacking any character or charm but how much time do you spend in the lobby.  The rooms are very efficiently designed, on the small side but still very comfortable.  The bathroom is also on the small side but still the shower was roomy and nicely done.  There is a facility fee that every hotel seems to charge now, it does give you gym access to a local gym which I did not use, I think an Equinox.  I will definitely stay here again when I plan on being out and about in the city and not spending much time in my room.

title: One of favorite in NYC
text:
Highly recommend this Phillipe Starck designed gem to anyone look for an oasis in NYC. It is amazing and relaxing. The design of the rooms is very comforting. 

The rooftop bar is also very special. They also have a club downstairs.

title: No gym, big problem
text: All gyms have hotels. $600 a night hotel. $65 a night hotels. Some are good. Some are bad. The Mondrian has zero. I have an 11 am flight so I thought I’d go to the gym at 7 am. Very reasonable. Front desk alerts me they don’t have one but give me a pass for a gym 3 blocks. Ok, not terrible. Except it’s 18 degrees outside. I stomach it. Make it to the gym. CLOSED. Thanks front desk team for handing me a pass and giving me directions how to get there. Shouldn’t the pass say the gym hours?  The rooms were pretty nice and they gave me a free upgrade when I checked in...hence 2/5 rating

title: Facility Fee Ripp-Off
text: The hotel is actually quite nice, nothing special,  but ok. However, it is one of those hotels that charge their guest a „facility fee“ or whatever they call it. So you will be charged 30 dollars more per night than you were told when you booked, for exactly nothing. More and more hotels in New York and other places in the US have resorted to this fine-print scam tactic and each and every hotel that charges such fees, also called „resort fee“ or other creative names, will get the lowest rating for disrespecting and ripping of their clients. Its a disgrace to treat your customers like that.

title: Amazing!!! Best hotel in NYC
text:
I will start by saying that the staff takes great pride in what they do.  It seems they truly care about the guests. From the front desk to the housekeepers,everyone was genuine. Every time I arrived, the doorman and front desk remembered us. I encountered the housekeeper in the hallway and she was friendly and kind to my children. They loved the attention. 

The room I had was very clean and nicely decorated.  The bed was a dream and the sheets and towels super soft and comfy. The bathroom is white,clean and convenient. Had breakfast in the restaurant and was also very good. 

I found this hotel by chance and will be my new go to spot in the city.

title: Resort fee for no reason
text: The hotel is fine, but there is absolutely no reason why they charge a $30 resort fee. When I checked in, the staff told me that the resort fee included wine at the lobby restaurant Cleo from 8pm to 11, but no such deal exists. When I asked again at the front desk on the way to Cleo, the staff person looked at me like I was crazy. So the $30 only covers coffee in the hotel lobby in the morning and access to a gym two blocks away. Not worth it!

title: Beautiful hotel very nice location
text: Loved this hotel, the reception people were very nice, the rooms were beautiful and inside it was perfect, nice bed, bathroom is perfect, minibar, big safe to fit laptops, liquors and mix to do your own cocktails, restaurant on site, you can take the parking but we found parking on the street

title: Another Great Stay
text: Another great stay at the Mondrian.  Friendly staff, great food and clean rooms - what more could you want. I stay here 2-3 times per month and they are always friendly and going the extra mile.  It's NYC so the rooms are sized accordingly, but most are well above average size in my experience.

title: Very disappointing. Tiny Rooms.
text:
Unfortunately, the Mondrian Park Avenue was very disappointing.  It is a new hotel however the rooms are super small.  We booked a corner suite and were given a room which was apparently the same category of room but not on the corner.  The room was super small and had no bedside table on one side and the bathroom counter was chipped.  When I requested a bedside table, so that I didn’t have to put my reading glasses on the floor I was looked at like I was speaking a foreign language.  A table was sent up to our room, but it was a meals table which clearly didn’t fit in the room let alone fit next to the bed – very odd???  After a couple of days, we were moved to the suite we had booked.  This room was significantly larger and comfortable and surprisingly had 2 bedside tables not 1!!!!
The other issue with this hotel is there is no drop off or pick up for hotel guests.  Our taxi driver was given US$120 fine one day when he dropped us off and the concierge could not have cared less that the driver got a fine!!!  My husband and I ended up paying half of the drivers fine since we felt so bad that he got a ticket!  Shame on the Mondrian for not providing suitable drop off and pick up locations for their guests.
Things that I liked was that the bathrooms were nice, new and clean.  The location is good. And the décor in the rooms are nice. And 50% of the staff I encountered were a pleasure to deal with (the other 50% were rude and unhelpful).  I won’t be staying at this hotel again since the Royalton Park Avenue down the road maybe an older property but has far superior service and the rooms are gigantic compared to the Mondrian!

title: Holiday
text: Beautiful hotel mid town new york. Fantastic staff and service. Great restaurant and bar attached to the hotel. Beautiful room and roof top bar. Sensational location, just perfect. If you are into the ice hockey then the Garden is literally a couple of blocks away. Empire state building again only a couple of blocks away.

title: Stopover in NYC after return from EU trip.
text: Would love to give a 4 or 5, but amenities are not 5 star or even quite 4.  Rooms are clean and new, yet our King room was too small to have two suitcases open at the same time, no where to actually sit and open a laptop in th he room other than on the bed, and no real lobby or common area for meeting and chatting other than in the restaurant/bar attached.  Loud dance music playingin the lobby and bar area as well, even at 6:30 a.m. when up to walk to the gym 3 blocks away (hotel does not have it's own fitness centre/spa).  Thzt being said, the staff is young, nice, professional and the hotel is fairly well located.

title: Very clean room with a beautiful view
text: Was greeted by a lovely concierge by the name of Moe. He checked me in quickly and told me about the promotion that I had received that I would have been unaware of if it weren't for him. My room was very clean and very spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the showers were great. My only complaint would be that I stayed directly above the terrace bar which was a little loud, however, the front desk offered to move me if I wanted.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel in great location
text:
I had a wonderful experience at my recent stay at The Mondrian Park Avenue.
The hotel staff was very friendly and answered all my questions. Check-in and check-out was easy.  The room was clean and very well appointed with plenty of space for personal items, the bathroom had a very nice shower as well.  Great big screen TV and the bed was very comfortable.  Room temperature was perfect.

title: In love with NY and it’s wonderful People
text: I only ever write and review with credit where credit is due. I spent two nights at the Mondrian hotel arriving late after a busy day in the city, the restaurant stayed open for us. The staff were just the nicest and most openly friendly people I’ve had the pleasure of chatting with. The food was incredible, thank you chef. The desert board was off the scale amazing. I truly can’t thank all the staff at Mondrian enough. Room is sexy, great views over the city, best night sleep for weeks on the comfy bed. Couldn’t be more central, great location, easy access everywhere,  A few images of the surrounding area below. Thank you to all the team for making my stay so relaxed.

title: Ottima soluzione, con qualcosa da rivedere.
text: Premetto che sono un estimatore della catena Mondrian, che frequento soprattutto quando mi reco a Londra. Per la mia settima volta nella grande mela, nel periodo di Natale, ho deciso di prenotare in questa struttura. La posizione é perfetta, su Park Avenue, in pieno centro ma senza essere nel caos. Nei dintorni c’è praticamente di tutto: 2 fermate della metro linea verde, a 50 metri dall’hotel, 2 Starbucks per fare colazione, diverse banche e negozi dove acquistare tutto ciò che può servire. Noi avevamo una Premier Room al quindicesimo piano, di dimensioni abbastanza soddisfacenti, così come il bagno. L’hotel è nuovissimo, di conseguenza anche tutti gli arredamenti, moderni e di ottimo gusto, e le aree comuni. Non è una struttura gigantesca come molte altre a Manhattan, ma ha il suo fascino. Abbiamo provato sia il bar in terrazza che il ristorante Cleo al piano terra; non sono male, ma possono essere decisamente migliorati in termini di qualità dei drink e del food. Buona la pulizia della camera per tutta la vacanza, tranne per gli ultimi 2 giorni che abbiamo dovuto richiedere per ben 3 volte alla reception, prima che ci venisse fatta, nonostante avessimo lasciato il cartellino sulla porta la mattina prima di uscire. Inoltre qualche volta mancavano shampoo e doccia schiuma, che puntualmente dovevamo richiedere; sono piccoli dettagli, ma per un hotel di questo calibro non è ammissibile. Comunque nel complesso è assolutamente a consigliare

title: Close to everything
text:
I stayed for 3 days during the Christmas holiday. The hotel location is great, with close proximity to almost everything. I didn't need a ride during my entire stay. the hotel staff were awesome and welcoming too.

The room was good, spacious enough (Considering NYC standards), clean, and the bed was comfortable, but I couldn't find any coffee or tea station there.

I would stay there again

title: Great front desk and managers team - solve the guests problems
text:
About the service at Mondrian: In our last trip to New York, we stayed at the Mondrian Hotel. But in our first night in the hotel, we had an unpleasant event. 

I was scared and annoyed at what happened, and complained at the reception, and as you would expect from a Mondrian-level hotel, the receptionists (the front desk team) and managers were horrified about what had happened, and they did everything they could to repair what had happened with us, and make our stay the best it can be.
Special thanks to Mol and Alex, thank you for making our NY week more enjoyable.

In a certain hotel standard, mistakes should not happen. But if it does happen, the important thing is to know how to repair, and Mondrian's team knew how to do it (Alex and Mol).

Although we have had annoyed with what happened with us, we would stay at Mondrian Hotel again. Mistakes can happen, but what sets a reasonable hotel from a good hotel is the way they try to fix a mistake.

And about the hotel: our room was large and had beautiful decor. The room was quiet. We liked the location of the hotel.

title: New York City - trusted hotel
text: Lovely Mondrian Hotel Park Avenue Hotel. Convenient location. Clean facility. Friendly staff. Comfortable bed. Great lounge. Highly recommend for business or holiday stay.  Early arrival accommodation which was perfect given my overseas flight. Thank you!

title: Really amazing hotel
text:
We stayed here on our most recent visit to the big apple. The staff were great always tentative and helpful and there when you needed.

The rooms were great, amazing, comfy and roomy everything we needed and despite being in a room curb side the noise wasn’t that bad, we only really heard the emergency services every now and then.

title: Brand new renovation - sparkling and excellent
text:
I stay here for business at least once a month and it is excellent.
-Warm and professional staff the moment you walk in - staff holding doors on the way in, welcoming and friendly front desk staff
-Beautiful marble entryway and modern elevators (unlike so many hotels in NYC)
-Rooms practically brand new. Beautiful bathrooms with bright white marble, always excellent showers
-Quiet rooms. Windows seal airtight for noise (but can open which is nice in good weather)
-Extremely comfortable beds, new white duvets 
-Rooftop bar a hidden gem for a summer drink (overlooking Park Ave). Has cool tent structure in winter
-Free passes to Equinox gym (2 blocks away) - once of the nicer gyms in NYC instead of the usual converted room with lousy equipment

I’ve tried over a dozen hotels in the midtown area and this is easily the best going.

title: Fantastic introduction to NYC
text: We rolled into the Mondrian at 8:00 a.m. on New Years Day, having just taken a redeye from Seattle. We figured there was no chance of an early check-in and were just there to drop off luggage, but Eric, the Guest Services Manager, immediately welcomed us as his first guests of 2019 and found a way to get us into one of our two adjoining rooms! Words cannot express our gratitude as the opportunity for all of us (two adults and four children) to lay down and nap for 90 minutes before going out to explore the city made all the difference! We only stayed at the Mondrian one evening, but I cannot say enough about it. All the individuals at the hotel were so positive and thoughtful, helping with restaurant recommendations, constantly supplying us with bottled water, etc. Great location, great rooms, great hospitality. Would definitely recommend and would return again.

title: Loved It
text: This was our first stay at the Mondrian and we loved it.  Great room with more space than a usual NYC bedroom.  Good walking area to either Chelsea Market or Times Square (about 1 mile).  Close to the Morgan Library which is a must!  We had breakfast at Cleo two mornings in a row because it was the  best breakfast in NYC.  Big fan of the avocado toast.  Will surely stay again!!

title: Superb
text:
Stayed here the week before Xmas with my two grown up children and what a lovely hotel it was.I’ve stayed in New York seven times but this was definitely the best place.
      The hotel staff were very friendly and very attentive,the place felt like home for our entire stay.Our room was spotlessly clean with a huge bathroom and an almost as big flat screen television.A well stocked minibar,safe and super comfortable beds just complimented the room.Didn’t explore the roof terrace but heard it was fantastic.
