      The location was brilliant for sightseeing,only a five minute walk from the Empire State Building and the local subway.All in all the staff and the hotel deserve to be in the five star bracket,will definitely stay again.

title: Business and Leisure friendly
text:
A group of 30 or so colleagues, myself included stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue in November for around a week. We found the hotel to be perfect for our needs - the front desk were receptive to our requests and queries where we had any, they were prompt and responsive. Queues did form in the lobby but other staff were typically available to help.

Rooms were of varying size in the same price category - a bit of luck involved there perhaps but again most NY hotel rooms are very small and they were certainly not too small as to cause concern over cost. Most were above average size. 

The beds were very comfortable and suitable AC/Heat controls are available on the room for extra comfort.

The bar on the 15th floor was a nice place to relax after dinner with a nice vibe and decent (NY) prices. The servers were polite and attentive.

In summary, the part that tells you what you need to know, I would gladly count this hotel as my go-to hotel for New York - it’s in a fantastic location, quieter than busy Times Square area and close to many top attractions.

Many thanks to all the team, especially Sarah in the Group/Events booking for helping organise our stay - it was very much appreciated!

title: Small Boutique Style
text:
Stayed with family and friends for 6 nights. 

We found our room fine, great bedding which was cosy and comfortable. Tiny bathroom but doable! Not much hanging room for two ladies together, but not a deal breaker 

Front desk were friendly and helpful, but I can’t say the same for the restaurant staff, unfortunately!!!

title: Slow service
text: OK stardard although the spaces are very small. Not very pleased with the service. Found a filthy towel on to of the wardrobe when we checked out. Took more than an 1 h to get an iron when we got ready for dinner. We got only 2 towels every day when they knew we were 4 of us.

title: Great Value and Amazing Staff
text: I worked in NYC for 14 years.  My office was in the building and now it is converted into the Mondrian Hotel.  When we arrived the staff at the door was polite and welcoming.  The front desk people were willing to accommodate all of our request.  It was my wife's birthday and they helped my wife's mother decorate the room.  They place was clean and staff were amazing.  It is a small Hotel in a great location, but not for those looking for the highest end places with pools and more of a high end experience.  However if you want a smaller place with value, the staff does as much as possible with what they have.  It also has a great rooftop bar.

title: Another great stay
text:
The Mondrian is my go-to hope for monthly business trips to New York. Several things keep me coming back:

1) Staff / service - everyone is so friendly. They make me feel at home every time.

2) Beds - theirs are the most comfortable hotel beds I’ve slept in.

3) Location - perfectly located for business from Midtown to Flatiron.

title: Nice location but issues :(
text:
I really liked the hotel location and it’s relatively new but the critical reviews are correct. 

First the housekeeping was an issue almost every day one day included dirty sheets and glasses, which was unfortunate and second, I prepaid for the room and found a change of 140 dollars after the fact that was a “daily fee”. 

There’s no gym or business center that I saw so that was a little weird.

The front desk staff was really nice and it’s a new hotel but I would probably stay at multiple other places that are most consistent in New York. I also left something in the room as I was checking out and the housekeeper refused to let me back in.

I’m sure they are working out the kinks as a newer place so hopefully this is an isolated incident.

title: Incredible one night stay.
text: Everything about our stay at this hotel from start to finish was impeccable. The property is at a prime location on Park Avenue, walking distance from literally everything NYC has to offer. My girlfriend and I were only in town for one night for her birthday, and stayed here based on a recommendation from a friend. After we checked in, we had a late lunch at the hotels downstairs restaurant/bar, Cleo, which had incredible food and drinks. The room itself was beautiful, very modern, chic and spacious. We were on the 20th floor. The shower had a “rain” style head on the ceiling which I loved! Giant Samsung HD tv, and a well stocked mini bar with craft cocktails available. The view which was amazing, overlooked the Empire State Building. Checkout was simple and quick, it was done through the smart tv. I was shocked at how great the pricing here was, it was extremely reasonable for such a great high quality experience. However, the one thing that really stood out to us was the awesome and incredibly friendly doorman/bellhop. (I didn’t catch his name) but as soon as we arrived, he actually saved us a parking spot right outside the hotel after another car left. He also gave us incredible recommendations around the city, helped us with our bags, and made sure we weren’t waiting around. Thank you to everybody at the Mondrian! Next time we’re in NYC, we will definitely be staying with your hotel!

title: Very good hotel
text:
This is a very good hotel located in the midtown on Park Avenue. 
The staff is extremely helpful, very polite and friendly. The rooms are decent size. Room service is good and fast.
The bed is extremely comfortable. If you are on a business trip or just visiting NY this is a great hotel to stay at.
The rooftop bar is open during the day for business meetings or if you need a quite place to work you can use it. After 4PM the place has a great vibe and the place is literally packed.

title: Excellent staff
text: This hotel is superbly located, less than ten minutes walk from the Empire State Building and just a short walk to the nearest subway. The room was small, as I expected (we booked a double double) but the en-suite was huge and well stocked with toiletries. The absolute selling point is the staff, they were friendly and extremely helpful, going above and beyond, from the lads on the door, all on reception to housekeeping. Thank you for making our stay so great.

title: Nothing special
text:
It's a nice hotel ,the staff is very nice as well . clean and in good location for business, however extremely expensive for what you get. no gym (they have a deal with external provider) , no pool , no breakfast and they are charging you "resort fee" ... why? for the internet that you would expect to get for free from an hotel that respect itself…. 
rooms are clean but nothing special. the only good thing is a hotel car that can take you up to 15 blocks for free (based on availability) all in all , not worth the money for or what you get my opinion .

title: LOVED IT!!
text: Hi, Just wanted to share my thoughts about this great hotel. We stayed in Room 1608. It had a great view of the Empire state Building and was so quiet! Ample room with a large bright white shower and a great bed and crisp clean white sheets. Huge TV!  The 2 bests things about this hotel is that it offered a car service within a 15 block radius of the hotel, this was especially great on the first morning when you don't even have your bearings yet, no wasted time going to see your first attraction! Also, the hotel provided a cell phone(HANDY PHONE) to use during your stay , This was especially great coming from Canada where we have to purchase data. Not needed this time,  as the phone provided google map service , cell service and all the apps needed to stay in touch with loved ones back home. Free coffee every morning and bottled water was available at the front desk whenever we asked,  free of charge. friendly bell boys always available to hail a cab and open the door. Great location 1-2 min to the subway station. Quick elevator service , the hotel had a nice smell and the hallways were always warm! Included was free wifi thruout the hotel.

title: Overpriced
text:
We stayed here for 2 days after 2 weeks in a downtown hotel.
We have been in a number of boutique hotels around the world and wanted to try the nyc experience too.
It was a letdown as room was average with view on a dark building, lobby weird and tiny, free coffee was Americano only, smart TV crashed often.
We were charged $35/night for a mandatory resort fee including access to the gym (that we didn’t want) and internet access (!?).
Free car available to take you to within 15 blocks distance but not available in weekends and only mon-fri 9am-5pm (!!).
Smartphone included in the price was useful for internet access when around the city.

title: They never get back to you
text:
Stayed 10 days each side of thanksgiving. The WiFi was down for 4 days for chrome cast. The beef burger in room service actually lamb... the team all say “it should be”. Well in customer service you should know. It’s symptomatic of the manager who is still yet to return my message - although as I was informed when I checked out. The manager “should” call you today. That was 6 days after my email. It’s now 16...

There is so much choice of hotels in the area. I stay every other week in one. But this trial was unsuccessful. Back to the edition and royalton for me and my company!! Just takes no time to actually respond. Disappointed!!!

title: This hotel is amazing.....beautiful, modern, clean, excellent location.
text: I have been working with Esther at Mondrian for year now...hard to imagine using any other property in NY. Excellent service, amazingly clean...koudos to housekeeping...and I cannot say enough about the level of service and professionalism one gets when working with Esther. The hotel is in a prime spot and always delivers a top notch experience.

title: Construction noise. Odd staff interruptions.
text: Construction noise. Staff interrupting constantly. In room dining and restaurant food truly average. The rooms are nice but I’ve never been so tired......so much ongoing unnecessary visits and calls from staff. Major works going on below so you’re woken super early (and if jet lagged you’ve no hope of catching up). Manager is lovely but overall 4/10 as an experience.

title: Hotel decisamente interessante
text: Hotel decisamente interessante. Cortesia, pulizia e attenzione al cliente. Stanze silenziose (ero al 10 piano) più grandi del solito, letto molto comodo. Tutto molto funzionale. Abbastanza attenzione al "green". Ci vorrebbe qualche sforzo in più.

title: Perfect weekend getaway.
text:
Stayed overnight celebrating my friend’s birthday. Upon checking I was greeted by  Mo, so pleasant and personable. I asked for a higher floor and he said not a problem and upgraded our room. 
The room was beautiful. Nice view of Empire State Building.  I asked for ice and was delivered immediately. 
Went for brunch at Chloe’s, said it was my friend’s birthday and they brought complimentary mimosas. Food was delicious and servers so attentive!
Had fun at the new speakeasy in the hotel. 
Checked out with Hector, Mo and Alex and were so helpful with letting me keep my car with Valet while I walked off the delicious bloody Mary’s. 
Will definitely be back!!. Pleasant staff, beautiful delicious restaurants, tapas bar, upstairs lounge and a club for fun night life. 
Especially on a cold wintery weekend It’s nice to be in a hotel that has everything!

title: Excellent hotel in a great location
text: The hotel is extremely clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and efficient. The location is excellent. There is a vibrant restaurant and lovely bar on 15th floor. A great place to stay for a weekend in New York

title: NYC's Best Hotel
text: The Mondrian in NYC is my favorite hotel in the City. It is a hidden gem! Great location, the staff is super friendly, clean, new, modern, amazing views of Park Ave. I was on the 6th floor and could not hear any of the NYC noise, it makes a huge difference when the windows are sound proof. The food from Cleo is so good. I would stay there again and will definitely recommend this to anyone who will be in NYC for vacay or work.

title: BEST girls night out in NYC at this incredible Hotel - Love you Mondrian and see you again soon!!!
text: From the moment I was greeted by the friendliest bellman and escorted through the most gorgeous lobby I could just tell that this was going to be a great night in NYC.  The Mondrian did not disappoint -Mo at the front desk was so warm and welcoming and was so helpful throughout our stay.  Where do I begin... the ARTWORK!!! the ROOMS (so sexy and has everything and more one would need - rain shower, makeup mirror, COMFY BED, Stocked fridge/snacks/drinks, full length mirror, sexy vibe and incredible view of the Empire State building - Located in the coolest Neighborhood - had we not already made plans to meet friends nearby we would have never left the hotel - We did stop at the Terrace bar to have a drink and heard there was a great club downstairs but will definitely be partying there when we return (already planning my next stay) - The icing on the cake was the most delicious brunch at the Cleo restaurant near the hotel lobby.  The food was insanely tasty and the host gave us a free round of mimosas to celebrate my birthday (THANK YOU!).  We noticed the Tapas bar hidden in the back room and will definitely be back to try that out as well.  This hotel ROCKS!  the staff - the art - the vibe - IT'S THE WHOLE PACKAGE AND MORE!!!  Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable and look forward to seeing yo again real soon!!!!!

title: A Hidden Gem- Great Hotel, friendly staff, amazing room
text: I can’t say enough about this fabulous property.  I was having dinner at Cleo and a nice couple asked me if I was staying at the hotel which was associated with Cleo.  I said no,   they said I should  take a look at the property.  So, After dinner we went to the front desk and Alex was so nice, friendly, knowledgeable and excited  about the hotel he worked at that we had no choice but to give it a try.  So on my next trip to NYC ( only four days from me viewing the property) we selected the Mondrian.  Best decision ever!!!!!!!  Upon checkin the-rooms manager Leilani wanted to make sure my stay was perfect and actually showed me a few room types.  I never had a rooms manager care so much about my stay.  The front desk couldn’t do enough for us.  So friendly and professional .  I felt like this was my home away from home.  Thank you Alex, Leonela and Leilani. Our room was very modern yet sophisticated .   We even got a welcome gift of a bottle of wine, face masks ( loved that) and large Evian bottles of water. These little things make such a difference.  If you want a gorgeous room, perfect location, amazing rooftop bar and the friendliest people working at a hotel this is the place for you .  The other greAt benefit is they have a car that will drive you to a close location.  We had the nicest driver.  He went out of his way to take us to dinner, the Macy’s thanksgiving parade and shopping.  Top notch

title: Friendliest staff and a great location!
text: From the bellman to the front desk and to housekeeping! The staff always seems to exceed our expectation with friendliness, to cleanliness - Margarita the housekeeper did an amazing job during our week long stay. Always smiling and friendly. Alex at the front desk was also very helpful. The location is perfect and very close to many restaurants and shops. The house car was very convenient to use for nearby appointments. Can't wait to re-visit.

title: Best Hotel Ever! THANK'S MO!!!!
text:
Amazing Hotel in the Hearth of Manhattan. Young dream team, smiling and keeping care all the time, from the breakfast till night. 
A special thank's to Mo, the best concierge - receptionist - manager i have ever meet!
He gave us amazing suggestions for our dinner around New York, and we ate SO GOOD! He took care about my parent's stay, about what we asked him every day, and our room was incredible beautiful.
Thank's to Mo and to all the crew, YOU made our stay in New York!

title: Excellent Stay
text:
The hotel rooms are ample, clean and quite. This hotel has an excellent location and practical to move around in this non stop city. The restaurant has an excellent menu and they have great service  personnel. From the doorman to the front desk folks, everyone seemed to enjoy their job.
Highly recommended.

title: Nice yet rough around the edges
text:
Stayed here for two nights in November.
We arrived late, the check in clerk and door man were both very pleasant, all the staff members we came across were very helpful and nice.
Room is a typical size for NYC, nicely appointed following the Mondrian style. 
There are some areas they could definitely improve in.. 
We visited the 15th floor lounge and were served wine/cocktails in plastic cups. We’re all adults here, it’s a nice establishment, no need to treat us like children when we’re paying $20 for each drink (and no, there’s no pool). 
Chromecast in the room wouldn’t connect, water pressure in the shower is low and has temperature swings, shower door gets stuck opening and closing, towels aren’t plush, minibar chocolate almonds were pretty bad. 
Overall it was an average stay. I had higher expectations for a Mondrian and SBE but I suppose this is what you get. It’s time to  shift some of the marketing/ branding  budget into room upkeep and upgrading amenities.
Didn’t win me as a customer return customer.

title: Heavenly One- Week Stay at Mondrian
text: I checked in the Mondrian for a week while I was on my vacation in NYC. As it is my first time to visit NYC, I wanted to stay in an area which is near or accessible to several sights, restaurants, bars, subway stops and fitness centers. I was also keen on getting a room with a splendid view of the busy streets. I had gotten more than i bargained for with the Balcony King room that was given to me! At 275 square feet, i thought it would be tight considering I had opted for a room with a balcony rather than the bigger Deluxe King. However, the room was big and cozy! The very comfortable queen sized bed was located right across the window so it made my dreams of waking up to a spectacular view of the city come to life! The bathroom door also doubles as a huge full length mirror — a must for every woman hoping to plan her daily outfits for sightseeing! Service was likewise impeccable as a room was made available earlier than the standard check in time of 3pm. Hector in concierge was very accommodating and ensured to orient me of the perks that came with the room like complimentary coffee served daily until 11am, appetizers from Cleo- the mediterranean restaurant at the lobby, cocktails, and more! Josh, the doorman always ensured to open the door for me each time i left to go sightseeing or returned to the hotel after an entire day out in the cold. Josh and Hector also advised me on which routes to take to get to my planned destinations. Since the hotel does not have a gym, the guests get complimentary passes (up to 2 for each guest) to all Equinox clubs in the city, a very posh fitness chain. The nearest branch is only 2 blocks away and a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I was likewise greeted with complimentary Evian, a bottle of red wine and facial masks upon check in and on my last night stay. The one of a kind service truly made it difficult to leave the room especially during the coldest days on Thanksgiving weekend. Food in Cleo was likewise delicious. I enjoyed the Lamb, grilled salmon kebab and brussek sprouts very much. My stay was splendid that I even decided to extend for another night! It was certainly top of the line service at an affordable price.

title: AMAZING Foof
text:
the hotel has a very convenient location for business purpose.
The food is just delicious, for breakfast the avocado toast is amazing. The room service is super fast and very good just like the main restaurant. .

title: The Staff made the trip great!
text: Everyone from the valets to the front desk, the staff was so friendly and made our stay a pleasant one. We were a group in town for business and needed a nice area to have a large meeting. Sarah from sales was able to accommodate all of our asks and we transformed the Boogie Woogie from nightclub to fancy meeting area in no time! Highly recommend if you need a great support staff while traveling in NYC.

title: Gave us wrong room..
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Mondrian, the location is EXCELLENT. However we had a rocky check-in. Once we we got to our room, we realized that it was NOT the room we booked. We had paid extra for a deluxe king room (which Mondrian advertises as spacious with lots of windows) but what we were given was their regular (superior) room with one small window and a tiny bathroom. We went back to the front desk and the girl assured us it was "one" of their deluxe king rooms. We told them that their website indicated something completely different and we paid extra for that specific room. Luckily a real deluxe king room was available and were put into that room, but the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth, like they were trying to dupe their guests. I actually read a similar review on here so it seems like this isn't the first time they've done this. Beware if you book the deluxe king and make sure they actually give you the room that you paid for.

title: Bday vacation
text:
I want to thank the hotel and specifically MRs. Esther song for the great stay , and all what you have done to make my vacation perfect , i really appreciate it a lot.

From check in till check out after 19 nights everything was perfect.  

made the mondrain my first option and for my family , already planning my next visit in march , thanks a lot and will see you soon , you are the best ♥️🙏🏼

Note : the balcony king rooms are the best in town that has a spacious balcony.

title: Small but Unique
text: The rooms here are small. The cool thing about this hotel though is that most rooms have a private balcony! A balcony feature is unique for NYC and definitely worth the price if your up 15 floors or above.

title: Love this place!
text:
Stayed here for business and absolutely loved this place! 
Great rooms, brilliant rooftop terrace (not the best in NY, but certainly worth the visit) and good food in the restaurant!

What I liked is that the hotel is modern, but still homely and personal - a lot of hotels in NY go minimalistic with small rooms, but this hotel felt very warm & comfortable.

Stand out person of the stay was Maria
from Room service. I called 10.50pm and was unable to get hold of Room Service and when I finally got hold of them I got told that the kitchen was already closed (not good) but when I explained that I tried to calls he offered to open the kitchen for me and her my burger & fries - 3 min later she knocked on the door with my Burger and such enthusiasm and positive energy (despite my order probably extending her working day) that it made my day and actually the whole stay!

title: Comfy bed, inhospitable staff
text:
This was the first time my partner and I had been to New York and we were very excited to stay in a “luxury hotel”, especially as we had recently become engaged a few days prior.

We booked our stay through Luxury Escapes which generally is amazing, however the Mondrian Park Avenue was not. First, they could not find our booking. After waiting in the LobbY for over half an hour we received our room key. The receptionist was pretentious and unapologetic. We did not receive our complementary welcome “gift” whatever that may have been and had to ask several times for our breakfast vouchers. I honestly mean several times. These issues could have easily been forgotten if it wasn’t for the staff.

As a previous reviewer mentioned, the clientele here is best described as jerks with money, I guess I’m used to living in a city where if you have money your not instantly converted into a jerk. The staff here pawned to these people, and disregarded us as we did not give off the illusion we were cashed up. That’s just not our vibe, no matter how much money we have.

We stayed an extra night in New York and moved up Park Avenue closer to Central Station, to a much better located and hospitable hotel.

If your looking for a great hotel in New York without the pretentiousness don’t stay here.

title: Disappointing, to say the least!
text:
Where to begin? We had problems with the Mondrian from the very start. Check in was an extremely slow and lengthy process. We were told our room was not ready and that they'd call us when it was available. We went out for a few hours, and still no call, so we just returned to the hotel. At this point, it was well past the stated check-in time, and yet, the room STILL wasn't ready, so we waited in the lobby for quite a while until they finally gave us our keys. 

The room itself was OK, but arranged really oddly. Why is the love seat facing the closet instead of the TV? Why are the bed and desk blocking the mirrors? Why is there no in-room coffee maker? The bathroom was the worst part. They've got weird European toilets that barely have any water in them, shower heads that spray at the wall instead of down onto the person, and no hooks for hanging wet towels. Plus, the shower had some sort of leak, which led to a bath mat that was always soggy and literally never dried. There is no makeup mirror and almost zero counter space to keep any of your bathroom products, which is probably not an issue for men, but is a real pain for women. 

By far, the biggest problem we had was the noise level. We were on the 11th floor, but the window panes are not very thick, so there is still a lot of street noise, despite being on a higher floor. There was also a constant commotion coming from a nearby club, and the thumping bass was audible through the hotel walls at all hours. There was a wedding taking place the weekend we stayed, and the guests decided to have an after-party on our floor. All night long, they were yelling, screaming, slamming doors, banging on the walls, and we could hear their conversations as clearly as if they were in our own room. Mind you, this went on until 3:30 in the morning, when we finally complained to the front desk. They offered a weak apology, but did little to amend the issue. We paid just as much as anyone else in the place, but our concerns were brushed off and dismissed, which we did not appreciate. 

Additionally, there is a rooftop bar in the hotel that is open to the public, so anyone off the street can come into the hotel and take the elevator to any floor. There are only two elevators, and there are no security measures for accessing the floors with rooms (such as requiring a room key to take the elevator to those floors). As a result, we ended up in an elevator with a bunch of obnoxious drunks, and when the elevator stopped to let us out on our floor, one of them cursed and verbally assaulted us because apparently, we were delaying them on their way up to the bar. Money can't buy class, as you will quickly learn when staying at the Mondrian. 

The clientele at this hotel could be summed up in three words: jerks with money (which are the very worst kind). Everyone seemed to have such a rude and entitled attitude. The worse you act, the more the staff fawns over you, which would actually be funny if it wasn't so sad. Obviously, we were not impressed with our stay. There is a wonderful hotel a few blocks away called The Giraffe. You can bet we'll be staying there in the future. We would never again stay at the Mondrian.

title: Birthday get away.
text: First time in New York with my wife for my 40th. Had an amazing time. The staff at the Mondrian were tremendous! They made my wife and I feel like VIP's. The rooms were sumptuous and clean. We had breakfast at Cleo's (the hotel restaurant) and the food was excellent. Can't wait to go back to New York and I will definitely stay there again.

title: A horror story
text:
My husband I stayed at the hotel from October 29-November 5 2018.  We stayed in a Premier King.  This was our second stay at the hotel and we were excited to be able to stay there again.  I travel to NYC 4-5 times a year to visit my son and was happy to have found a hotel in a good location with nice rooms.

Unfortunately, we won’t be staying here again.  On October 31, we returned to our room at about 4 pm.  We were meeting our son at our hotel a little later for dinner.  Upon arriving at our room the room attendant was cleaning it.  We had left the room before 7 am but did not mind dropping a few things off and going to the lounge for a drink.

At about 5:30 pm we, my husband, son and myself, returned to our room to quickly pick up a sweater and jacket.  At that time nothing in the room seemed to be in disorder.  We went to dinner and returned again at approximately 10:00 pm.  Upon entering the room we saw a huge clump of hair that looked like something from a horror movie.  The hair looked as if it had been pulled from someone’s head. Perhaps as a result of a domestic dispute. It was about 12 inches long and blonde in color.  I have dark hair and my husband has grey hair.  My husband went down to the front desk to find out who had been in our room, and to get our room changed.  

While my husband was downstairs I discovered that my clothes had been folded and moved around with my dirty clothes combined with my clean clothes and all of the items that had been on my nightstand had been placed in a bag where I stored my electronics.  Unfortunately, the items on the nightstand included liquids that spilled in the bag ruining a portable stereo speaker that attached to my iPhone.  In addition $12 worth of tea tins were missing.

My hats and scarves and gloves had been moved from the location I kept them, gathered all together, some had been used on the subway and were filthy thus combining clean and dirty belongings.  The same had been done with my pajamas.

Moving rooms was not an option as the only room available was above the restaurant where an extremely loud party was taking place.  The front desk informed me that the party was for the owner of the hotel’s daughter and that the owner did not care if the party disturbed guests.  When I was downstairs, numerous guests were complaining about the noise and asking to have their room moved.

My husband and I did not sleep, and in the morning we attempted to speak to the manager.  Finally, at about noon our room was changed.  We trudged back to the hotel to switch rooms that took about 2 hours of our time, including travel time to and from the hotel.  We spoke with the manager at the time and were told that the hair was from a wig and was probably brought in on the shoes of the room attendant or the mini bar attendant.  The hair was not on the floor when we were in the room at 5:30, somehow it entered the room after that time.   The manager minimized the impact saying it was just one of those things.  There was little to no recognition that the lack of sleep was ruining our vacation and one of the few times we were able to be with both of our children at the same time.

The manager offered to take one half off of our room for the previous night.  I told her that was unacceptable and that a free stay was what would be acceptable.  She then told us that we should switch hotels.  I was not going to spend the precious little time I had with my children finding and moving hotels, which would have been near impossible as the NYC marathon was that Sunday, and the city was packed.

The manager also told us that it was the hotel’s policy that the room attendants move guest’s personal belongings and organize them for them.  I have traveled extensively throughout the United States and the world and stayed in everything from the finest hotels to Motel 6 and I have never stayed in a hotel where this was the case without notice.  And in fact, this was not the case on our previous stay.  Had it been I can assure you I would not have stayed again.  I do not believe it is appropriate for the hotel staff to go through my things.  

When my husband spoke to the general manager she determined that taking the entire night off our bill plus one-half of our last night was the best the hotel could do.  I do not think this is at all reasonable.  The night’s that were discounted were of course the least expensive nights of our trip.  We refused housekeeping for the remainder of our trip since they would not guarantee that our things would not be gone through and moved around.  I stay in a nice hotel so that I have housekeeping daily and fresh towels and a clean shower and fresh sheets.  

After we moved rooms we never heard from the hotel management again.  Never an apology, nor a bottle of wine or an offer to buy us dinner.  Any one of those would have gone a long way towards alleviating this horrific experience.  While it may sound amusing, finding a strangers clump of hair in your room and your personal belongings gone through is actually quite creepy.  We do not trust the hotel to keep their guests safe from intrusions and believe that someone likely used our room while we were out.

title: Amazing staff, wonderful hotel and great customer experience
text:
I stayed with my Italian family at the Mondrian for my birthday, this was a very special occasion as for most of my family members it was their first time in the big apple.
The staff is so accommodating, in particular we had the nice surprise to interact with Manya, a manager at the Mondrian hotel, who was very helpful and proactive and made our stay very special .
The hotel rooms are very spacious, quiet and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel is in the heart of the city and close to Grand Central.
I will happily come back to the Mondrian in the future when visiting New York again.

title: Very Average hotel, but Great location for Midtown/ Downtown NYC
text:
I stayed in the Mondrian for the last 3 days of my trip... I had just moved from the Trump hotel so I could split my time between the upper and lower areas of NYC. The experience was quite different to Trump International!

Pros:
- The room was suitably clean and all amenities refreshed.
- No bath, but there was a good shower (with a rainfall option which was nice), I liked the glass doors as opposed to the manky shower curtains that so many NYC hotels seem to adopt.
- The lounge looked nice (and popular) but I did not really use it.

Cons:
- When my taxi pulled up to the hotel, there was no one to assist me with my bags. I had to juggle my 3 large bags by myself all the way inside where all the bellboys seem to remain before they took over... I appreciate it's cold, but they should really be a bit more proactive when taxis pull up outside of their hotel.
- The room was very small... this wasn't an issue for me (as I was solo), but I think could be for couples.
- I really don't like it when hotels don't offer a single bottle of complimentary water (I think it's in poor taste given many guests will have travelled long distances). They had a 750cl bottle of Evian on the bedside table for $10... I mean, c'mon... there's Trader Joes down the road and CVS everywhere, so I suggest you spend 5 mins picking up a few bottles.
- Room service menu is quite limited - don't expect pancakes or French toast... or anything elaborate. I like to treat myself if I stay in hotels, but nothing on the menu screamed out unfortunately.
- No iron/ironing board. I guess you can call for this, but I was in a rush so did not have this option when I discovered they were not in the room.
- The hotel has 2 elevators only (over 20-something floors) and a busy lounge and bar, so expect a long wait if it's rush hour (I think around 7pm).... Waited a good 10 mins one time and a queue was building up!
- Noise was a major issue for me... Could hear everything outside. PLUS, Possibly one of the noisiest air cons... This was literally on top of the bed and I had to sleep to the loud scratching sound every night...
- Also, I difficulties controlling the room temperature - it was either too hot or too cold.
- Terrible view from my room.

This isn't the worst hotel I've stayed at in NYC. The location is very good, you have flat iron on your doorstep, Soho and Chelsea are walks away. The price I paid was also not too bad. I also commend them on the cleanliness, but I think the noise issue alone would prevent me from staying there again. It also does not have the wow factor if you're looking to treat yourself - the staff just didn't feel very warm and friendly (they were nice enough and not in any way rude), I like breakfast in bed and didn't like the menu, room was too small...

title: Tres joli hotel, tres bon emplacement
text:
Nous y avons séjourné la semaine dernière et avions choisi l hotel en fonction de son emplacement central (Midtown) pas loin de Central Station, de la 5th ... nous avons adoré la discretion du personel, le check in et out hyper rapide, la chambre tres joliment décorée style artsy et le confort du lit - nous sommes tombés en pleine periode d halloween donc nous avons eu droit a une belle ambiance dans l hotel 
Il y a pas mal de restos et bars super sympa à proximité... dont celui de l hotel le cleo (méditerranéen sympa) et le roof top de l hotel sympa aussi ...
Le staff de l hotel est tres serviable et discret ... 
On  aime et on y retournera c est sur !

title: Weekend family visit
text: The Mondrian is a little pearl close to grand central and once inside a little oasis. The staff is so accommodating and helpful. The manager Alex was wonderful. He and the hospitality team put together a gathering and were very flexible and tried to make everything perfect

title: Not as advertised
text:
I rarely review hotels but I've never been so disappointed in a hotel stay so I wanted to share my thoughts.

We traveled to New York for my wife's birthday and the Mondrian looked fantastic on paper. I contacted the hotel prior to our arrival and they agreed to leave a note and something special in our for her birthday.

The receptionist that greeted us upon arrival was friendly and acknowledged my wife's birthday and said a couple of glasses of wine would be brought up to our room. So far so good. 

It went downhill from then on. We arrived in our room and our immediate thought was whether or not we had been allocated the correct room. There was no note or anything in the room for my wife's birthday as had been agreed. Mondrian's own website shows a Deluxe King room as being bright and spacious with multiple windows with a wing back chair and side tables. In reality our room was dark, had one small window, no wing back chair and not even enough room between the bed and wall for a side table. I understand hotel website pictures are representative of the room and the exact room may not be provided but this was so far removed from what was advertised that I can't really put it into words. After a long trip we decided to relax in the room for a few hours, the glasses of wine that were promised never appeared.

I attempted to phone front desk to enquire about our room/drinks however got no reply. I went downstairs to find an enormous queue so decided to send an email. Within an hour the promised drinks arrived however they failed to reply to my email and my questions went unanswered. 

On the plus side the bed was comfy, the terrace bar is a great place for drinks and the hotel is in a great location for exploring the city.

Overall, poor service, small room, misleading website, and pretty poor value for money. We would not recommend.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: El hotel es muy bonito, las habitaciones son amplias y está en una ubicación perfecta, el servicio de recepción muy atentó desde que llegamos, sin duda se recomienda mucho! A unos 10 min de time square

title: Magnifica estancia
text: Muy buena ubicación, hotel muy limpio y elegante, el trato magnifico, en concreto Hector Leonela, que nos ayudo en todo. Las habitaciones amplias y con vistas estupendas, el servicio de chofer muy util para ir a todos los sitios.

title: It's the PEOPLE that make this hotel great!
text:
The Mondrian on Park Ave. in NYC is my new favorite hotel, mainly because they know good workers....

The location ( for me ) is perfect to everyplace I want to be. Blocks from Union Square, Macy’s and the Empire State building, and a wonderful walk up 5th Ave for great shopping.

The hotel’s rooms are wonderful by NYC standards. Not too small, but big enough to have all the comforts you need. They are updated and modern, with ample mirrors, outlets and storage. The bathroom was small but very functional with a large shower, and  ample places for toiletries.

There is a wonderful lounge area on an upper floor that is great for hanging out during the day, and nice for drinks at the end of the day. Jade and Leslie greet you with a smile and are always happy to help!

While the front desk staff was good, the best person at the Mondrian was the  first person you may encounter; Gregg! He is at the front door and is a great help at the hotel for many things! Gregg REALLY made my stay special, always with a SMILE and a kind word as well as knowledge of the NYC area and Professional service. ! He is the BEST! (His recommendation for dinner one night was GREAT!)

The Mondrian has a restaurant located just off the lobby. Cleo is a wonderful Mediterranean inspired restaurant where you can get breakfast in the morning, a quick lunch in the afternoon or a wonderful dinner in the evening. Two great things: Cleo is the room service provider for the Mondrian and they have wonderful entertainment on Sunday’s.!

The location, rooms, or services will not be the main reason I will stay again at the Mondrian.. IT WILL BE THE PEOPLE!!!!!

title: Great stay
text: My husband and I came to New York for a long weekend for some business & some fun. A friend suggested we stay at Mondrian Park ave & after looking at the photos I reserved a room right away! When we arrived were created by very friendly staff & checked into our room. It was beautiful just like the photos & CLEAN! Even the bathroom was beautiful which is a big deal for someone like me who really valued hygiene & cleanliness. The beds were comfy. The sheets were crisp white, the pillows could have been more comfortable but in general we were very happy with our room. We had a view of the street which was nice that we weren’t facing a wall and the hotel gave us a bottle of wine for my husbands early birthday! The first night we ate at cleos and the food, service & ambiance was absolutely divine!! I definitely suggest the lamb shwarma but honestly anything on the menu we tried was delicious! Afterward we went to check out the lounge downstairs it had great music, comfy seats to relax & good ambiance as well. Before heading out we wanted to check out the rooftop & that was by far my favorite part. The views are amazing & there was a bar and couches & nice patio furniture outside so we could enjoy a drink with the view!! We stayed for a total of 4 nights and the ONLY thing that wasn’t 100% was the service to the room. We’d have to call down multiple times before we’d get anyone to come up. I think as far as that goes the communication could have been better but other than that I’d give our experience a solid 9.5 out of 10! We will definitely be back!! Thank you to the manager on staff who truly treated us like valued customers it’s so refreshing to be in an environment where you can feel the people who work there genuinely care. Thanks again for making our stay one to always remember!

title: Most amazing visit to a hotel, EVER!
text: I recently took my Mum to NYC and our stay at the Mondrian Hotel far exceeded any expectations I had.  The service was FIRST CLASS - impressive amenities, beautiful rooms with a view of the Empire State and an incredible roof top bar that had views to die for.  Vincent went above and beyond to make this trip extra special for my Mum and I and I can't thank him enough - that kind of service is few and far between, he is an absolute gem and a 11/10 for customer service!  We will be back in a heart beat - be sure to try the Cleo Restaurant, amazing breakfast and the coffee was excellent!  Thank you Mondrian for making this trip for my Mum extra special!

title: 非常推荐
text: 来美国出差就一直住这家，房间干净装修时尚酒店也比较新。地理位置也优越，步行到帝国大厦只需5分钟。前台的帅哥服务员态度也非常好，总之非常推荐！

title: Anniversary weekend trip
text:
Had a wonderful experience. The hotel staff was amazing. We mentioned it was our anniversary and concierge Greg went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed our stay, even after we had checked out. The service was remarkable and the hotel was lovely! We've never been treated so good! We will only stay at the Mondrian when we visit New York.

Thank you Greg and staff for such exceptional customer service!

The Kings

title: Vacation
text:
Fantastic hotel. Manager Leilani outstanding and Mo on the front desk 
and other staff excellent. Rooftop terrace a sophisticated experience. Well located. Close to 6 train Subway with good access to downtown. Cab from Newark $80. Highly recommend the hotel. 
Peter and Leisa Moore

title: A Great Stay
text: By fair one of my favorite hotels in the Manhattan area. Hector was amazing at check in he answered all my questions I had. He even gave me recommendations for sightseeing and food options in the area. Thank you Hector and the Mondrian  Hotel I had an amazing time, see you soon.

title: Very good hospitality and environment
text:
I have been here for several times for business trip and the service and all the staff here is very friendly and welcome. It feels like home when you stay here. 

One particular staff gives me huge great impression is Hector, he is very passion and proactively care about your stay and needs. Which makes you feel very comfortable and easy when coming back from a long business day. 

The location is good and convenient also for different purposes of your stay. Very closed to central station and very easy to use the metro on Park Ave or Madison Ave.

title: Loved this hotel
text: This was my favourite place to stay in NY so far. The rooms are glam but also very functional.  We had room 712 which although no real view with that there is the bonus of being shielded from NY noise. The hotel is very boutique, staff are great and lobby is never heaving with people. Manager is visible and attentive. Felt well looked after. Great stay. Thanks!

title: Fantastic yet again!
text:
After a great visit last December we returned to The Mondrian again, this time bringing our son.
As last time this place certainly doesn’t disappoint, it’s fantastic 
Here’s my brief review in my usual style hope it’s useful to people.
Staff - The best!
Met by Greg, what a top bloke, I know American service is another league but Greg was another level, what a lovely, genuine, polite man.
We also were so lucky to meet Dominic, Top bloke, please keep in touch.
Room- we were lucky to get a top floor room with views of Empire State. Super room, comfy beds, spotless clean, big shower, lovely toiletries, great TV , couldn’t ask for more.
Location- it’s great, you can walk to all main spots and just get tube to Brooklyn Bridge it is magic there.

In summary- Best hotel, best staff, great location, why go anywhere else! We certainly won’t.

title: nice small hotel convenient to Penn Station
text: nice room, pretty small, but amenities were all there.  Nice shower/bath/comfie bed, but the layout would be crowded for two people.  Staff very friendly.  Just popped in an popped out, so did not use the restaurant or visit the bar.  convenient location to Penn Station and MSG.  Typical street noise for a NY hotel - try to get an upper floor.

title: Booked several rooms for VIP guests coming from London
text: I was in charge of booking four rooms for visiting guests from abroad. Each guest had different requirements/needs (such as hypo-allergenic pillows or special food needs). I found the staff at the Mondrian very helpful with all requests (from transportation tips, to restaurant guidance and making certain that my clients were welcomed with helpful information). I was told by all guests that their rooms were comfortable, attractive and that the location was superb. The staff at the hotel were helpful and thoughtful throughout their stay, problem solving on the spot as personal needs arose! Highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure visit to NYC.

title: Perfect Boutique Hotel with the most professional staff
text:
First, I'd like to thank all that helped me celebrate my birthday. Leonela Radoncic is outstanding. She will help with everything and is kind as can be. I will go back just to see her! The night manager, Moe, couldn't have been nicer. Great person. He had a special surprise for me when I came back to the hotel after my birthday party! I forgot to make seat place cards for my party. I asked the staff on duty that day where i could have them made, last minute.  They made them for me!!!!. They were beautiful. Thank you everyone for making my stay the best. As, a newly relocated New Yorker, I really felt at home.

The hotel and rooms are as clean as can be. The restaurants and bars are terrific. I will be back.

title: Wonderful stay!
text:
This was my first time at the Mondrian.  I wasn’t disappointed at all. The Location was great, the room was clean, and the staff was friendly.  Looking forward to becoming a frequent visitor. Thx for everything 
Hector and Mo.

title: Nichts besonderes
text: Ein Hotel, wie es viele in New York gibt. Positiv zu erwähnen ist allerdings die hervorragende  Qualität der Matratzen. Leider hört man aber den Straßenlärm der Park Avenue. Dem Hotel angeschlossen ist ein Restaurant mit mediterraner Küche, da gibt es allerdings wesentlich bessere, überdies ist es sehr laut

title: Good on paper - nothing to write home about.
text:
Aside from the fact that the bed was promptly made and the towels folded (minimum hospitality standards), it felt like staying at a house where nobody was home. 

- The welcome card on the desk was made out to another guest.

-  The minibar and toiletries were never replenished (and very much used every day).  

- I left the laundry bag with garments and the form filled out (on the bed, out for anyone to see)  for 3 days in a row only to find it moved from the bed to the desk without it ever being taken to wash. 
- 
Nothing outstanding or positively memorable about the stay and for the rate ($370 USD), there are other true 4 star hotels around where I'll be going back to.

Positive aspects: 
- Yes, the location is very convenient. 
- Yes, the overall newness of the beds/linens/baths/facilities is good.

title: Perfect NYC Boutique Hotel
text: This is a great hotel in a great location. It still looks brand new, rooms are always clean and the bathrooms are generous for Manhattan standards. The Lounge on the 15th floor has amazing views and great food. I stay here as much as I can whenever traveling for business.

title: Idéal pour un break de 5 jours
text: L'hôtel Mondrian est situé dans le quartier NoMad, north of Madison Square, à proximité de l'Empire State Building et de Macy's, bien desservi par le métro. A conseiller à ceux qui ne supportent pas Times Square, ses lumières et sa foule. Nos chambres étaient situées au 7e et 14e étages, petites, mais confortables avec une literie au top. Bars de l'hôtel très sympas, personnel à l'écoute et réactif après un souci électrique vite réglé. Restaurants sur Lexington à proximité.

title: Otimo
text: Excelente localização, acolhedor e moderno, bom atendimento e café da manhã delicioso. Quarto bem decorado, bom banheiro, de acordo com os hotéis em ny. Possui um rooftop muito gostoso. Vale a pena, boa relação custo x beneficio, retornarei com certeza.

title: Amazing! Will stay here again!
text:
OUR STAY WAS GREAT!!!! I was in town for my art exhibition! The minute I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by a gentlemen named Greag, who was wonderful throughout my entire stay! He walked our bags to the front desk and offered us water upon immediate arrival!! Amazing staff at the front desk, woman with blonde hair! offered us many amenities, and options to chose from through a booklet in NYC! Room was exceptional, bed was very comfy, bathroom is HUGE, AND TWO SHOWER HEADS!

 Great walked our bags to our room, and engaged in conversation with us. I informed him about my first art exhibition in NYC, and later that evening, I was greeted with a kind gesture, and a "Good Luck Card" to my room! Throughout my stay Greag answered all my questions, hailed me a cab when needed even in the rain!

I will certainly stay here again, and recommend to anyone! 

GREAT STAFF!!
GREAT LOCATION!!
GREAT ROOM!!!

ONL COMPLAIN, TOWELS WERE A LITTLE ROUGH!

title: Small room big mistakes
text:
Absurdly small room. Less than 2 feet clarance on each side of the bed. No drawers no closet no towel hook no desk no coffee maker. There is a chair but it faces the bed. It also blocks the minibar from opening. It has an absurd 16" square table next to it but theres no coffee maker anyway no idea what its for. 

If you want to watch tv you must lay on the bed. Your wet rain coat? Hang it on a lamp fixture theres no hook for that either your wet towel you just leave on the floor.

Room suitable only to sleep in and shower. Do not unpack and make sure you are alone. Fancy fixtures art work but they cant even provide a coat hook or a coffee maker.

 All style no substance. I did not book here my employer did had I booked I would have left immediately. Its really almost fraudulent to offer this as an accomodation unless expressly offered as an "overnights only" or " layover room" or something like that and at a deep discount. The room is 12 x 12 with a small entry foyer and a tiny bathroom off of that. Bathrobes hair dryer and makeup mirror are placed on a shelf outside the bathroom (?) next to the bed they cant fit in the bathroom. Idiotic. You cant even take the bathrobe into the bathroom unless you lay it on the toilet while you shower. Whoever designed this place needs a fundamental knowledge of ergonomics. 

What does it take to provide a basic amenity like a coat hook ? If you get a room like this get your money back.

title: Staff and service is incredible
text: Great hotel. The staff were the highlight. Attentive, friendly and engaging. Rooms are small but well designed. One issue is noise... if you are a light sleeper, don’t plan on getting a nights rest. Banging doors, noisy air-con and it’s general location are a constant nightly feature.

title: Not great, not poor, not memorable
text:
New-ish hotel in a great location midtown Manhatten, just around the corner from the Empire State Building.
Not a huge amount to complain about - moody receptionist, functional but unglamorous micro-rooms typical of major cities - but not a huge amount to write home about either. 
The food at the restaurant was nice enough without exceeding expectations, a description which could sum up our overall experience of the Mondrian.
The only thing exceptional about our stay was the service and greeting from Paul the doorman who seemed to go out of his way to give us a cheery start to each day.

title: Brilliant location
text: Lovely hotel with a great location. Easy walk to main attractions and subway. Lots of nice eateries and bars nearby. Rooftop bar had a nice ambience, had a lovely drink whilst relaxing outside. It ticked all the boxes. Staff were all lovely, we had a very enjoyable stay. If I visit New York again, would look to stay here.

title: Business trip to New York
text: Good service of hotel staff and room quality are two important factor for business trip. In my prospective, this hotel managed both factors so well. Room was clean and hotel staff always provided me great answer kindly. If I go to New York again I will definitely choose this hotel because there's really everything that I needed. There's a bar with balcony seats around 17th floor(not sure about floor). If you decide to stay in this hotel, you should seat there and enjoy the sunny day with awesome view. (Plus, it's in the middle of Manhattan, so it guaranteed easy access to everywhere in Manhattan)

title: Great hotel, well located
text: After a bit of a rocky start, and changing rooms a couple of times, I had a great stay. The staff were very patient with the room changes which was an issue with the travel organisation that I made my booking through.  My corner room was lovely and rather quiet by New York standards.  The food at the Cleo restaurant for breakfast was really good, and most of the wait staff in the restaurant were excellent.  The doormen were very helpful. I wasn’t too sure about the location when I booked, but it worked out well.  There are several very good restaurants in the area and you are within walking distance of the the major attractions.  The subway is very close by.

title: Malek ghanem
text: Highly recommended!!!  Very nice hotel, rooms are very clean, amazing service and helpful staff ... relaxing atmosphere  ... Quite neighborhood    I will visit this hotel again for sure.... thank you everyone

title: Tiny Rooms
text:
The Mondrian is a boutique hotel, it is clean and modern and located walking distance to all the major attractions and subway stations.

The hotel does not provide the same facilities as other hotels do in the same category around the world. It does not provide tea and coffee making facilities in your room, it does not provide at least a couple of small bottles of water, it does not provide an iron and ironing board in your room – only on request and it takes over an hour to get to you and the iron leaks and your clothes are completely wet so don’t bother trying to iron with the useless iron provided.  The hotel does not provide hooks in the bathroom to hang your wet towels on. The Mondrian Hotel does NOT do any of those things.
Our room advertised as spacious but was in fact TINY.  The room had quality fittings, a nice large television, an air conditioner that worked really well, a comfortable bed with nice pillows and the room is decorated very tastefully.  

The room is only big enough for you to shower and sleep in, and it does lack some practicalities if you are having a longer stay, for example the hanging space provided for your clothing is tiny and it makes it very hard to hang a weeks worth of clothing in the tiny space provided, there are no draws and the room is small so you can’t leave your suitcase open to grab things.  

The blinds and curtains in the room are not block out curtain, so that sun wakes you up every morning.  If you are a poor sleeper or just like your sleep you might like to pack a sleep mask to use during your stay.  The hotel provides a portable make up mirror, however there is no room or accessible plug to use it, so why bother having the make-up mirror in the room on a shelf? Well I suppose it is decorative but not practical -  it seems so pointless.

You are also unable to hand wash any items during your stay as there is no plug for the hand basin, which is quite frustrating is you are staying for more than a few days. The bathroom is equally small, but had a good size shower recess with a choice of two shower heads, however our shower door was not sealed/fitted properly so that every time you had a shower it would flood the bathroom floor and every time you went to use the toilet in the bathroom or wash your hands you would be stepping on a very soggy bathmat where the shower flooded the bathroom floor and bath mat, this was extremely frustrating and gross.  We also found it frustrating that the bathroom did not have any towel rails or hooks to hang your towels on. 

If you are looking for accommodation to only sleep and shower in for a few days, the hotel is adequate.  If you require space or like to spend time in your room, you might be better off looking somewhere else to stay.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Wonderful hotel in a great location. Attentive staff with nice complimentary amenities. Easy access to all nyc has to offer. Liked the location with nice restaurants within easy walking distance. Looking firwRd to the next time I can free up a weekend and return

title: Simply Amazing - time and again
text:
I travel to NYC frequently for work. The staff at the Mondrian has gone out of their way to make each stay feel more and more like home.  I have had clients stay as well and again, they remarked how the staff went above and beyond to service their needs.

The hotel is updated, clean, stylish and neatly appointed.

title: fantastic trendy hotel for weekend in NYC
text: small boutiquey lobby, but decorated nicely and very clean and modern. lovely rooftop lounge for drinks! we were able to have drinks outside on the balcony. also took advantage of happy hour at the restaurant. great wine and beer deals, as well as seafood specials! amazing oysters, crab claws, clams, and shrimp. room was also quite lovely with fantastic natural light. our room was available early which was greatly appreciated. very clean and modern and nicely appointed and decorated. small, but we booked the smallest room option and didnt need much space. the bed was extremely comfortable. we mentioned that it was a special occasion in passing and the lobby sent a bottle of wine to the room which was such a lovely lovely touch! great location too.

title: dont judge a book by is cover
text: Nice hotel,rooms are very small though, both elevators were out of service one evening. security had to bring us up through the frieght elevator. seen the overnight manager alex smoking weed by a alley way

title: Strepitoso !!!
text:
Hotel di design, ottimo in tutti i suoi servizi !!! Camere ottime, consigliato !!! Ottima anche la sua posizione, facile raggiungere tutte le migliori attrazione che la città offre.
Personale molto cortese e attento alle esigenze della clientela,

title: Terrific for long weekend in NYC!
text: My wife and I just completed a weekend getaway at the Mondrian Park Avenue. We had a wonderful time. The staff are friendly, helpful, and responsive (greeting us every time we returned, quick turn-around on requests such as extra towels). The room and lobby have a modern decor style. We had a king bed room with a balcony overlooking Park Avenue, which was really great. 25 min walking distance to the theater district made this far enough away from Times Square to escape the crowds, yet close enough for walking (or an inexpensive cab/ride-share).  Bed was very comfortable. Heated bathroom floor was a nice surprise. Would definitely stay again.

title: cash was missing, staff without respect
text: I booked this hotel for three nights. I left my wallet in my bag in the room. However, my cash was missing when I came back. This was my very first time to encounter this ridiculous situation ever since my birth. The total amount is more than 1000 dollars. Hotel and police actually did nothing for me. Meanwhile, when I claimed my luggage, one staff was laughing about a goyard tote among my stuff even though she knew what I experienced in this hotel. Also, she stared at me very impolitely several times. This is definitely discrimination. It was horrible experience. It has 5-star tag on booking, and obviously it does not deserve that stars.

title: Very Modern and Clean, Great Location.
text:
We stayed for 3 nights at the Mondrian Park Avenue and loved our stay. Not sure if this was a regular thing or just a promotion but they were offering out free Gin Cocktails on arrival which was a nice touch after a long journey. 

Our room was perfect for us. We had a deluxe double so there were 2 beds which was great as I was sharing with my parents. We hadn't asked for this but it was obvious that the room was an 'accessible room'. This was of great benefit to us.

The room was very modern and smart, spacious and clean. Never had a problem with the housekeeping. The window looked out onto another building but we didn't mind so much as the rooftop terrace more than made up for this. 

The rooftop bar is definitely worth a visit. Lovely views and atmosphere. Would highly recommend the cheeseboard. It was amazing.

All of the staff were welcoming and friendly. We especially enjoyed meeting Dominic (at least we think that was his name) the greeter at the rooftop bar. Great banter and a lovely guy. 

This hotel is a great place to stay in midtown. We would definitely come back here on our next visit to New York.

title: Our family Wedding , great place to stay.
text:
We stayed at the Mondrian hotel for 3 nights as we'd come to New York to celebrate the marriage of our son and new daughter in law at the Top of the Rock.
We found the Mondrian to be a fab place to stay and staff were more than happy to assist you at any time.
Reading the review before this, it sounds like we were put in the accessible room  (disability) with the wet room bathroom. 
Whilst the parts of the floor did get wet after showering, there was plenty of mats and towels to stand on and the housekeeping always made sure it was perfect upon return. I hadn't asked for this room, but found it extremely comfortable, clean and fresh, and the added benefit of the very large bathroom with handrails and seat in shower I found very helpful as a arthritis sufferer and after long walks on the New York City streets.

On our sons wedding day, we valued the space and comfort to get ready and we were really looked after by Dominic at the rooftop garden bar, who made our even g special and welcomed the newlyweds for cocktails. 

I've stayed in a few places in New York and so far this is the best. We grabbed our free coffee in the morning from the restaurant and took to the streets for breakfast and didn't return til later in the evening. The beds were so so comfy and the room was peaceful, not hearing too much of the city traffic and noice. The room price was excellent value for money for 3 people sharing a 2 double bedded room. Minibars are always expensive so we avoided it as usual., but I'd say we were more than happy and will return when visiting again.
Thank you Mondrian staff and yep.....what a great place to keep with our special memorable occasion in New York 2018.

title: Mondrian Park Avenue August 2018
text: The first room we were given had a handicap bathroom which got flooded as soon as I showered. So we spent part of our evening getting rid of the water. So we asked the next day to change room. The new room we got had a normal bathroom and a view of the Empire State building. The room is of a decent size. Cleaning was not done properly as a bottle of water left by the previous guests had not been removed. The hotel is conveniently located close to subway stops though the closest one on 28th street was closed for renovation. The real minus with the hotel was that they do not offer breakfast options. You have to go to the hotel restaurant Cleo and order a specific breakfast. This proved costly, eggs benedict, fresh grapefruit juice and a tea for 50 usd tip included. This may be New York but I was in London recently and paid 25 usd for a high quality buffet breakfast at a Radisson Blu hotel. The other option is to go to the nearby Pret à manger or Starbucks, but healthy breakfast options are limited. The roof top bar is nice. The staff was good though you would realized they did not have a special training in the hospitality business. One minus, we forgot a set of earphones in the first room we got and it was impossible to find them back. But overall a good experience.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Great location, clean and modern rooms, excellent shower and wonderful upstairs lounge - both a large inside room with comfortable chairs and couches and a large outside terrace. Tried two excellent restaurants only a few minutes away - Marta and Upland.  Union Square restaurants are only a 15 minute walk away. Walkable to Times Square and Central Park though the latter is a longish walk away. The male staff - front desk, bar tenders, door man were all so warm, welcoming and friendly but  both myself and my husband found it strange that none of the female staff were particularly helpful or warm. That being said we’d highly recommend the hotel and will stay here again next time we are in NYC.

title: Amazing Experience
text:
I started my Mondrian experience in the rooftop lounge (as I ended up arriving earlier than my check-in time), and enjoyed a beautiful view of the city while catching up with work emails.  I then headed downstairs, grabbed some delicious (and free) coffee, and explored the city.  The area is close enough to Times Square where I could do touristy things, but far enough away where I felt tucked away from some of the hustle and bustle of the city.

Once I returned home, I got to experience the joys of a spacious shower (with TWO shower heads), a comfy bed, and a fairly priced private bar.  My friends who had sprung for a hotel nearby had a less than ideal experience, so I got to brag about how much cooler my hotel room was than theirs.

I had an easy time saying goodbye to NYC, but a hard time saying goodbye to my room.

title: I Spent One Night in Luxury
text: I got the pleasure of staying at the Mondrian for one night. I wish i had the time to extend my stay. The Staff was very helpful and top notch, The Next time im in New York ill be staying there for sure

title: Che delusione!
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con i miei famigliari per una vacanza. L’avevo scelto perché nella spiegazione della stanza era riportata una camera premier con vista sulla città ,34 metri quadri ,zona salotto separata.
 All’arrivo , in tarda serata,  l’accoglienza fredda alla reception non ci ha entusiasmato poi all’arrivo in stanza la sorpresa è stata negativa, quarto piano su una strada secondaria trafficata e rumorosa. Alle nostre rimostranze ci hanno affibbiato una seconda stanza ad un piano un po’ più alto ma su un cortile interno, senza salotto separato è molto più piccola dei 34 metri . 
Ciò che mi ha colpito è stata la totale indifferenza degli impiegati della reception decisamente poco gentili e poco disponibili.
Lo sconsiglio vivamente e , se decidete di andarci ,non fatevi ingannare dalla foto della stanza che sicuramente non esiste vista la dislocazione dell’ hotel all’incrocio di due strade e senza neanche l’ombra di alberi o di viste particolari

title: Great place near Murray Hill.
text: Cool vibe to this hip hotel.  Nice bar on the ground floor as well as the rooftop.  Rooms were modern, very clean, but small and a little tight.  Typical NYC hotel room, though.  Staff very nice--took a long time at reception to get checked in, very busy, so they gave me some drink tickets to use while waiting.

title: Modern, chic & spacious rooms with a great terrace bar
text:
We made arrangements for the Mondrian through their sales associate, a Ms. Esther Song. She was attentive to the needs of our traveling delegation (larger rooms, extra dining table, extra fridge without the minibar, etc) and was there to greet upon arrival. 
The folks at the front desk are friendly, as is the staff in Cleo and Terrace Bar. Make sure to try a drink or two by Hera one of their bar whiz'! 
Given meetings for our delegation would start as early as 8am, it is so lovely that breakfast at Cleo opens at 7am, even a little before that. It is perfect for early morning debriefs over an array of good complimentary breakfast choices-- salmon benedict, hash & eggs (!!) etc. 
The suites are surprisingly spacious for New York standards. The bathrooms are long and have rain showers. Both suites we in had sofas for extra seating. Although the desks were quite funky-- does not have ample working space, but there is a conference room area in the hotel.
All in all, for the price you pay (pretty decent for the location and swanky, chic interior decor), the Mondrian is a great option. Central to everything and overlooks beautiful Park Avenue. Would highly recommend and plan to send our future delegations through to Esther and her team.

title: Clean and Comfortable in a Great Location
text: Check in was super quick and they easily extended our check out time upon our request. The room was spotless and the bed was vert comfortable. Numerous mirrors made a New York City hotel room feel bigger than it actually was. If you've ever stayed in Manhattan then you know how difficult a feat this can be. Fantastic shower pressure and we really appreciated the raw-edged bathroom sink top... very nice touches. My only complaint would be that when room service stopped to check and see if we needed anything, I inquired about having our welcome drinks (that were included in our booking) delivered to our room. She said she was unsure if this was possible, but told us she would find out and come back to let us know. She never returned or contacted us. Otherwise, great location, great hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Will stay again
text: This hotel is conveniently located in Manhattan - close to all sites and even the subway.  Staff were super friendly and helpful, even with recommending good restaurants and shows.  Hotel was clean, modern, and an overall good stay was had.  I'll definitely return to this one.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
Muy bien ubicado, cerca de estación de metro y de puntos de interés. Fácil ir caminando a muchos puntos de interés. El personal muy bien, educados y atentos. Las habitaciones acogedoras, muy silenciosas, siempre impecables y con un baño grande y muy bonito. 
Si algún día regreso a la ciudad, sin duda repetiré hotel,

title: Stylish and modern, spacious rooms and good lounge terrace
text:
Spent 3 nights here with family: hotel was very reasonably priced for New York City and rooms much larger than many I have experienced. All feels quite new and very modern, stylish furniture in rooms. Lounge on 15th floor is great, and comes with a nice outdoor terrace as well (but not always staffed if you want a drink). Cleo mediterranean restaurant (in the building) is excellent for lunch/dinner and you can charge meals here to your room.

Things to be aware of: 
1. The only way to get breakfast is off the (short) room service menu
2. Only 2 lifts so getting to and from rooms can be slow at peak times
3. Although this is reasonably priced, note they do charge a $25 daily "facility fee". I've never been somewhere that does this - basically it's just a rip off to justify adding $25 to the price after you've booked. They should be called out on this, I think its legality could be questioned.

title: A Mixed Bag, but Overall an Okay Place to Stay
text: There's nothing grand about the Mondrian Park Avenue. The lobby (even with its high ceiling) is small as are the hotel's elevators and corridors. Despite this, my room was reasonably spacious by NYC standards. Beyond this, there are hits and misses. The overall style of the hotel is nice; it's modern without being over-the-top, but some of this design comes at the expense of comfort and luxury. The "closet" it pretty small, at least for hanging clothes; the bathroom sink is pretty to look at but difficult to use, and the stylish chair and table outfitting almost all rooms aren't much of an excuse for a desk. My king room came with a spacious balcony that was impossible to use other than for standing because it's outfitted with no furniture. But the nice view from my room made up for most of these sins. The real misses, those to make it likely that I won't return, relate to more significant maintenance issues: Halfway into my stay, I realize that the wall-mounted television in my room didn't work. Likely a power issue since the minibar below didn't cool either. Not wanting to pack up and move, I had to stay in a room without a TV or any cold water--this is a pretty material disappointment for me. And then I discovered that the plug behind the sliding bathroom door didn't work, making it difficult to iron. (There is no iron in the room by the way; you have to call and ask for one.)

title: Nothing complimentary here
text:
Start spreading the news.....

So the Mondrian is in a great location. The staff wear snazzy gear.

The rooftop bar is pretty cool, the bartender on duty July 4, was very polite, very good at what he does, and just a good all-round bloke...... on the other hand, the waitress had bad attitude, but you can't be too fussy when you realise people are working when others are not....

The rooms are pretty reasonable, with our standard room offering street views. And for NYC, the size was fine, so really, no complaints there.

So when we arrived we were told coffee and wife was complimentary.... The dictionary definition of complimentary is: 'given, or supplied free of charge.'.... 

Upon checking out, I was slapped with a facility fee. I know this is standard in NYC, which it should not be, but it is.... when I asked what the facility fee was for, I was told, for the gym, the complimentary coffee and the complimentary wifi.... Oh dear.

So because I had an early morning flight, I didn't argue the obvious point, paid my bill (which also included an incorrect tip of $20 for $30 of drinks, I tipped $8 & an incorrect charge to my Australian VISA which incurred outrageous international transaction fees... I had told the lady to charge to my MasterCard which had no fees)..... 

To their credit, after I challenged the facility fee and the VISA transaction fee, Mondrian's accountant gave me a refund with minimum fuss. So this is a good thing.

But, please Mondrian, tell your staff, and perhaps the 3rd party booking agents (ie, Booking.com, hotels.com, etc), that complimentary wifi, coffee does not hold true when you guys charge that ridiculous facility fee, which you shouldn't. I'm just saying.

Mondrian is OK, but in NYC, you can do better.

title: New & hip, but $200 beware
text:
1st visit here.  Newish facility w/ young & attentive hotel staff. (Bar, maybe not so much).  Rooftop bar staff seemed far more interested in styling & profiling than actual service, but nice place for a drink if you're not in a hurry.  Walkable location to most everything.
Not sure why '4 star' hotels insists on a mandatory cc hold (here - $200) for 'potential incidentials' - sort of insulting.  A young guest checking in ahead of me was obviously on a budget, & the $200 made an uncomfortable dent in his plans.  Really?  C'mon, NY - acknowledge that your guests are due some credibility & respect.  How much can a terry bathrobe cost?

title: NEWEST HIP HOTEL ON PARK AVE
text: Mondrian Park Avenue is a great addition to Park Avenue. Surrounded by shops and restaurants, this upscale hotel in the NoMad district is a 2-minute walk from the nearest subway station, a 7-minute walk from the Empire State Building and a 13-minute walk from events at Madison Square Garden.

title: Nice stay
text:
We enjoyed staying at this hotel...
we loved the location & the staff were nice.  The only thing we didn't like was the air conditioning system.  Hot then cold etc so that was aggravating our sinus' s a fair bit.  Also keep in mind they slug you with yet another fee when checking out which adds up to make it quite an expensive stay.  But it is New York after all.

title: Amazing stay
