text: Stayed at the Mondrian with my husband this weekend and we loved it! Great location, quiet hotel, beautiful decor, comfy spacious mattress and room layout. Very friendly and welcoming hotel staff that attend to any customer need. Will be staying here from now on every time I’m back in NY.

title: Our new hotel in NYC
text:
My mom and I loved staying at the Mondrian for a weekend trip. We had an amazing view of nyc from our bed. The bathroom was really nice, big shower, very comfortable bed, big tv.

The restaurant was very very good. Highly recommend.

title: Quiet clean reasonable hotel
text: We stayed in July for a week. This hotel is central to many tourist attractions and businesses. The price was within the lower range of a high end hotel. Very clean, guest services were on point when asked to do anything. They have a doorman to help. A restaurant and bar on site. The bed was a king and very comfortable, same with the pillows. The nights were quiet, our window faced a side ally. There is subway access a half block away and bus access 2 streets over depending which way you need to go. If you can walk, most attractions are under 45 minutes or less away. We would stay here again.

title: Don't stay here
text: My room was above the outdoor bar, very noisy.  All the lifts broke down for my 16th floor, they compensated me one night - very nice.  When I checked out, I had extended by two nights and only gave me the account for the last two nights -  I paid cash.  I asked them not the charge my card when I checked in, they charged my card for the first two nights.  After I saw the charge on my card I called them and spoke to the front desk, I received no paperwork for the first two nights and they charged my card without authorisation to do so.  Apparently there has to be a note in their system from the person who checked me in.  They don't care because they already have their money.  It's noisy and wouldn't stay here again.

title: Great service
text: During my stay here, there was a steam pipe explosion that took out the power in the elevators. They were very professional about it and offered free drinks for the inconvenience. Since I were on the 18th floor, they let me use the service elevator to get to my room. Overall, this was a great hotel with amazing service.

title: Stay all the time for business
text: I started staying at the Mondrian for business about 7 months ago and have always had an excellent experience.  The rooms can be a bit small for two people, but the amenities are very nice.  The location is excellent for access to mid-town, and the 6 train is right there.  The bar on the 14th floor is great, and the outside deck is huge and rare to find in NYC.  The elevators are quite slow so leave extra time when you want to leave.  I have stayed at dozens of hotels in the city and this is my favorite place to stay.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: I stayed here with a large group (15 people) recently. It was the most amazing experience. We especially enjoyed the rooftop lounge and restaurant Cleo. The views from the 15th floor lounge are breathtaking and the indoor-outdoor options help to maximize our stay! The entire hotel is spotless with extremely attentive staff. It is in the heart of NYC with a lot to do nearby!

title: Great location. Cool hotel.
text:
Just needed a night’s accomodation in New York and Amex suggested this one.
What a pleasant surprise. Great outdoor high rise bar and terrace and the rooms were very cool. Definitely to consider. Fabulous.

title: Great location, hip hotel
text: I stayed here one night in May and enjoyed the stay very much. The room was small but clean and modern since the hotel is pretty new. The bathroom was lovely with a great rain shower. The restaurant in the hotel was lovely, great breakfast before I had to go to my meeting. The location is nice as you can walk easy to Flatiron or Union Square areas. I would stay here again for sure. Lobby is very small but not really a major issue.

title: Eating our way through NYC
text:
We had an amazing stay at the Mondrian. Beautiful hotel but it was the people made it particularly special. Leilani, director of rooms was great. She tended to a room change detail personally. 
We will stay here again on our next visit to NYC

title: A Favorite Hotel and great location!!
text: The Mondrian Park is a perfect find in NYC. Since our recent move to Long Island, we were looking for a boutique hotel near my husband’s office.  After trying many boutique hotels in the Nomad area, the Mondrian has become a favorite go to hotel. My husband and I have stayed there many times and have recommended it to friends and family. We love the location and rooftop for drinks.  The entire staff is very attentive and accommodating to their guests. Hats off to Hector at the front desk and Manya in reservations management.

title: Boutique Hotel Midtown Manhattan
text: We arrived after a very long flight. Reception staff very friendly and quick with processing. Hector in particular. Great efficient service. Room superb, small though very cosy. Loads of storage space. Beautiful large modern bathroom with large mirrored sliding door. The king size bed to die for, so so comfortable and slept so well. we stayed for one week. The breakfast at Cleos was ok, the waiters were friendly and welcoming. Could have done with a coffee maker in the room as I like to have a coffee first thing when waking. we stayed for one week, would've loved to have stayed longer. Complimentary late check out offered on the last day as we had a late flight. Loved the place and so central to everything NYC has to offer. Fernando on the door was super helpful. I can't wait to visit again!

title: Fabulous hotel, great location, would definitely return!
text: Stayed at the hotel for a girls weekend. The room was clean and beds were comfy. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The location was central to all the main attractions and great restaurants. My friends and I had a blast in NYC and staying at the Mondrian. Would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to visit NY. I would also recommend dining at Carmine's, Wine 30, Sarabeth's and checking out Carlo's bakery. Oh, the rooftop lounge was also great - beautiful view and the dj was awesome!

title: NOT RECOMENDED
text:
The location is good and the rooms are ok, but the reason I'm writing the review is: 1. The a/c in the room was extremely noisy, the hotel sent technicians a few times but they couldn't fix the problem, and when I asked for a solution from the reception I was told that all the rooms have the same noisy a/c and there was nothing they could do to help me. Needless to say that the 7 nights I slept in the hotel I didn't have a proper night sleep.
2. At check out, we were charged for "facility fees" an extra $28 USD per day. Fees we were not told about when we checked in or made the reservation.

title: July 4th
text:
Stayed here for July 4th and a couple of meetings. While the room isn't large, it's definitely not small by NYC standards. Bathroom was very modern and spacious, with a really big rainfall shower. I didn't get to dine at Cleos, but did enjoy their morning coffee.

Rooftop bar has a great view - my group certainly preferred the Macy's fireworks from that vantage point, rather than the chaos on the ground! 

Although it may depend on what you're aiming to do in the city, after many trips to NYC I find this location to be perfect. Very close to the 6 line (green) subway at 28th street, walking distance to many awesome restaurants and bars. 

Lastly, the service and attention to details at this hotel was really superb. I've stayed at the (now under different ownership) Gansevoort down the road where I found the service to be more aloof and indifferent. 

I'll be back!

title: Great place to stay!
text: I stayed here during a business trip to the city, and I can’t say anything bad about the hotel whatsoever. The hotel was very stylish and clean. I had a corner room with a couch and it had plenty of space. The bed was comfortable as well. I did hear some street noise in the very early hours of the morning, but it didn’t bother me too much. Loved the rooftop lounge and the restaurant downstairs had a great happy hour with $1 oysters and other seafood! Would definitely love to stay here again!

title: Very new upmarket hotel in midtown Manhattan
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the Mondrian Park Ave Hotel for 7 days while on holiday in New York city. The hotel was less than 1 year old and as such is a beautiful hotel in a fabulous New York location. The rooftop lounge bar is a lovely place to relax with indoor and outdoor seating. 
We originally booked a standard room but decided to upgrade to the next room up for a bit more space. Very glad we did as I would imagine the standard room to be very compact. However the rooms, beds and bathrooms were beautiful. The staff were generally very friendly and helpful although I did find some of the front desk staff a bit surly at times and the service in the rooftop bar a little inconsistent. Also one thing to be aware of: If a continental breakfast is included in your package, this is not an open buffet but rather a voucher thst provides for a limited selection from the al a carte menu. It is limited to $20pp. It wasn't a problem for us and the breakfast is beautiful but it may be for big eaters. The necessity to be served at breakfast may also slow you down of youre in a hurry to get out and explore the city. All in all though, a fantastic new and beautiful hotel in mid town New York.

title: Great location, Great staff
text:
I just stayed for the second time at the Mondrian Park Avenue for business meetings and I must say this is now my place in New York.
Excellent location, a super helpful young staff and great cosy rooms.

title: The Mondrian - our home in New York!
text:
My wife and I took our nephew to New York to celebrate his graduating from High School.  This was our first visit to the Mondrian.  It was wonderful!!  It greatly exceeded all of our expectations. 

We had reserved two rooms, and we arrived VERY early in the morning off of a red eye from the West Coast.  Even though it was many hours prior to check out time, the wonderful people at the Mondrian (especially Leilani and Antoinette) had one of our rooms ready for us immediately!  It was great to be able to drop off our baggage in a room and freshen up before heading out into the city.

Our service for the entire weekend was tremendous!  The rooms are immaculate, and set up very nicely.  Large King beds with a huge TV in front of it.  The hotel has a great restaurant (Cleo) and a great bar on the top floor.

It is also in a very convenient location!  A subway station is a block and half away, which can take you directly to Yankee Stadium in one direction, or Brooklyn in another - no transfers!

My wife and I will return to the Mondrian EVERY time we are in New York!!  Thanks to all the wonderful people at the hotel who made our stay so enjoyable. 😀

title: Beautiful & Contemporary Hotel in NYC! Great for large corporate events.
text:
This modern and luxurious hotel is located in the heart of midtown Manhattan. It is absolutely stunning with impeccable staff and service. It is the perfect place to host guests for a business conference or a large group event.

Before I continue, I would like to personally thank Esther S. and Jennifer Z. for their kindness and hard work to make this all possible. The owners and managers of my company were overjoyed and cannot wait to return to this fabulous hotel in the near future. Our time at the Mondrian Park Avenue was outstanding and it delivered a seamless customer experience. Esther and Jennifer went above and beyond and I can't thank you enough.

My company is located on Park Avenue, just 10 blocks away from the Mondrian. I reserved over 30+ rooms for our annual international conference and could not be happier with my selection.

I have never received so much positive feedback on the hotel choice for our company events. All owners and managers of the company I work for were absolutely THRILLED with the Mondrian Park Avenue! The rooms are absolutely beautiful and the staff is lovely. The rooms are clean and spacious with gorgeous views of NYC. In addition, I highly recommend checking out all of their amenities. The amenities such as the roof deck, bar & lounge, gym, boardroom, etc. are beautifully renovated and the restaurant inside the Mondrian called CLEO is delicious!

Everything about the Mondrian Park Avenue is PERFECT. If you want comfort and luxury at a reasonable price in a beautiful and convenient location in NYC, stay at this hotel!! I promise that you won't regret it.

title: Rien à reprocher !
text: Chambre un peu petite mais très belle et très propre. Le Rooftop bar au 15e étage est très agréable pour un verre en soirée. Près du métro et bien situé. Personnel très agréable ! Je recommande à tout couple pour un séjour à New York !

title: Excellent business hotel...nice on the weekend too
text: The Mondrian Park Avenue is my go-to hotel when in New York on business. They have the most comfortable hotel beds (especially pillows) that I've experienced in years, and the service is impeccable. The rooms are thoughtfully designed for comfort and utility (eg. USB ports integrated in electrical outlets). Typically, I'd only expect this level of service at 2x their usual rates.

title: Very solid hotel
text:
Enjoyed my stay at the Mondrian for a week. Hotel is very cool and appears to be a go to venue with the rooftop bar in constant use which is irritating for guests as it shares the same elevator.

The hotel gives you free access to the Equinox gym which is superb.

Room itself is compact with nice decorative additions and well appointed and modern bathroom.

No coffee facilities in room but access each day downstairs 

All in all a good choice in central NYC

title: High quality hotel in mid-town
text: This hotel is relatively new. I've stayed here many times. Attentive staff & comfortable, well-appointed rooms. Also features a nice roof and great restaurant. Try to reserve a room on 4th floor or higher.

title: Good location and comfy
text: I visit NYC every year and tend to stay in Times Square area hotels for their accessibility to everything. Turns out this Park Avenue spot may be a better choice. We walked to the East Village easily and up to Central Park. High marks for location. The rooms are standard NYC size, i.e., small. But really, you’re generally not there to hang out in a hotel room. We were on the 9th floor and found that the street noise was not too intrusive. I didn’t like the closet setup though. Not enough room for two people to use. Also wish the bathroom had a fan, which it didn’t. Overall not the best design. However, the beds and linens were excellent!  Fresh, crisp and cool.  Loved the bed. Enjoyed the rooftop bar and took our coffee up there before starting our day. Staff was friendly. (Even the other guests were atypically friendly.)  The Mondrian was a good choice and I hope to return soon.

title: Very comfortable stay
text: Super comfy bed and lovely quiet hotel. Great wifi and easy location to move around the city. Quick walk to Madison Square Garden. Only disappointment was breakfast package included in our stay was inadequate for two people.

title: Awesome dinner in NYC
text: Top notch service and food!!!! This food is to die for!!! Cloe is my favorite restaurant in NYC!!!! This is my go to spot when I am hanging out with fellow foodies:) There are many options of restaurants in New York but no matter how long my train ride is the food at Cloe is worth the long commute.

title: Refreshing NYC hotel experience
text: I am an extremely picky traveler and have very high expectations for hotels, especially in NYC.  My experience at the Mondrian could not have been more exceptional.  The room was stylish, new, and impeccably clean.  Although I was only on the fourth floor the windows kept the noise out and I got a wonderful nights sleep and was able to work during the day.  The service overall was fantastic from room service to housekeeping, to the front desk.  The restaurant Cleo was amazing. I highly recommend this property!

title: Top notch
text: My girl friends and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend for some city fun. Staying at Mondrian Hotel Park Avenue for one night was an experience of a lifetime. It’s like staying at one of the finest hotels in history. The balcony suite we stayed at was impeccable with a great view at night. The service was excellent! We felt like royalties from the moment we arrived, to when we checked out the following day. We also had an enjoyable lunch at Cleo. All the food was very good along with the prompt and courteous service. We had drinks at the Lounge. The place is beautifully decorated. The room service was awesome. We ordered a couple of desert that came in no time. We also asked for extra bath towel and a blanket that was brought to the room promptly. We will never forget our experience. The staff of this hotel as well as the Cleo restaurant staff went above and beyond our expectations to make our stay remarkable. I would definitely recommend staying at Mondrian Park Avenue.

title: excellent hotel in a  great location,can't wait to return
text:
My friend and I stayed here back in November and I have thought off and on about writing a review,but it is on of those cases of kind of wanting to keep something on the down low. The rooms are not huge, but by NYC standards it was just fine.  The bed was super comfortable and there was plenty of space for the 2 of us for 4 nights.  The location is really great, we walked everywhere. the snacks in teh "minibar" were different and good.  We had coffee adn snacks in the restaurant downstairs one afternoon, it was nice.  
The restaurant had really good coffee available in the morning. The weather was so good we were able to sit outside in the roof top deck area- it would be amazing in the summer.  The concierge gave us some great insights and was able to get us theatre tickets and sent us to a really good restaurant, that funnily enough was in our second choice of hotels, after which I was really glad we picked the Mondrian.  
I hope they can keep their magic and not become one of the overpriced NYC places  I woudl definitely return- in fact have already looked into doing so.

title: Great hotel and great price in a great location!
text: Really enjoyed my stay here. A very clean, modern hotel with great service. It has a huge flat-screen TV. The king bed's extremely comfortable. Also has a nice, really big walk-in shower. I'll definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

title: Great hotel in an awesome location!
text: Starting with Fernando & Johnathan at the door, the service was stellar. Everyone who works at the hotel is incredibly kind and helpful. We had a corner room facing Park Avenue and it was surprisingly quiet and very comfortable. We'd absolutely stay here again!!!

title: What a Great Stay
text: Impeccable Staff & attention to detail. Great location, close enough to where you need to be without being in the center of the noise. Rooms are well kept and rooftop is a nice touch--Look fwd to coming back hopefully in near future

title: nice location, stylish hotel, cool staff
text:
We (family of 4) staid 12 nights as I had that business trip. Our room was located in floor 11, unfortunately not with street view. We had great times over there, due to the cool, nice staff at the door (Fernando & Jonathan) and the frontdesk. The rooftop Lounge on 15th is great! 
Sure, rooms are small, but welcome to NYC! Rooms are perfectly cleaned by the room maids. Bathroom with a huge shower, good for the kids, nice Duravit ceramics.
I would love to come back for the next Business trip.

title: Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful
text:
I have been in touch with this Hotel from afar and am now having reguylar contact with Esther Song, who has been impeccable. What amazing service and we have not even arrived as of yet. We were pleasantly surprised by a room upgrade and amenities for our young 2 year old in the suite.

We cant wait to arrive now and this is the pinnacle of customer service in my opinion.

I shall review on departure but am sure it will be awesome !

SG

title: Great (Midtown) NYC Stay!
text: Overall great experience! Service was fast, friendly, and helpful (and I was given a complimentary drink voucher to the lobby bar as a "welcome"! - such a nice touch!). Rooms were a decent size (on the smaller side.. but 'big' for NYC standards!), with very 'hip'/trendy decor. The central location was ideal for getting around the city. Big pro = there is no gym at the property so I was given a pass to use the Equinox for the duration of my stay (just 2 blocks away)!

title: Great stay - amazing staff
text:
From the front desk to the housekeeping - first class staff.

Lobby area quite small but has attached restaurant and bar.
Apparently a swanky higher floor bar also - we weren’t able to visit. 

Room was quiet, spacious for NYC and very well located.

Overall A+ and we would return.

title: Everything a New York hotel should be!
text:
The Mondrian met and exceeded our expectations for a hotel. My fiancee and I booked the Mondrian for a staycation and as resident New Yorkers our expectations were high! 

In every aspect the hotel was great! The staff are super friendly, location couldn't be better, and the rooms were everything we had hoped for. Traditionally hotels in New York can be claustrophobic and the staff can be hit or miss.

Would definitely recommend!

title: Great Location
text: Super cool neighborhood, loved our stay!!!  Staff is excellent in particular Esther who I reached out to before our stay and was able to help us out with planning what to do and give us more detail about the area.  Super impressed!!!

title: Wonderful hotel with the perfect NYC location!
text: We decided to book our trip at the Mondrian based on a friend's recommendation! It was for a girls weekend in NYC. The location is awesome bc it is a few blocks from the 6 train which can take you anywhere. It is removed enough from Midtown that it is not highly touristy & you can also get quickly to downtown. The rooms are modern and spacious for NYC standards. The bar Cleo is awesome & they even have a terrace which got quite fun in the evenings! The staff was very accommodating & they are even dog friendly!

title: Now that's Hospitality
text: Staffs were friendly and professional, but most importantly each staff member followed through with all our specific needs and amenities. Location was very convenient and the rooms were incredible. This hotels provides the right service and they listen to what you have to say. Now that's Hospitality. Thank you for a great time.

title: First time Trip to NY - the hotel didnt disappoint
text: Great location. Very helpful staff. Lovely Decor around the hotel. Disappointed that the 15 stories bar didnt open until 430pm on a Sat afternoon - they didnt advertise/ inform us on check in that there was actually a free shuttle for guests to venues - we learnt that on check out when someone else was informed. Very nice food on the first night... but would have preferred to be seated to the rear rather than have everyone put into the smaller area at the front as the tables are seated close to one another. All that being said, it was a lovely stay in a lovely room in a great central location. Highly recommend and endeavour to return

title: Boutique with room on the small side
text: This hotel is in a nice midtown location, 2 blocks to the 4, 5, 6 subway. The hotel features a restaurant, two bars, one on the roof. There is no fitness center, they will give you a pass to a nearby Equinox.  The staff is friendly and the rooms are in good condition, but small. In our Premier King suite the bathroom was quite tiny, difficult for two people to move around in.  The room was also a bit cramped, the sofa and table are pushed to the side-otherwise you cannot clear the bed.  Housekeeping was very good, but they are skimpy on amenities. One tiny bar of soap for the sink, not the shower, no razors and some very low quality toilet paper. For these reasons, it gets a 4, but not a 5.

title: Best Hotel!!
text:
I come to NYC every month on business/pleasure trips. An I can say by far Mondrian Park Ave is the best hotel I’ve stayed at hands down. Both the service and location are amazing! Close to great restaurants and tourist attractions. The nightlife at the hotel is awesome too! 

I was introduced to service manager Jennifer Zelouf and she has been helping me with reservation and assistance throughout each stay for over a year now. Every request no matter what it is I get the response “no problem!” Which is so rare!! 

I recommend staying at Mondrian park ave and booking through Jennifer Zelouf to all my friends and co workers, and they are more than happy every time. Enjoy NYC!! 

Cheers!!

Michael ;)

title: Très bon hôtel.
text: Je me suis rendue dans cet hôtel en mai 2018 avec une amie. La déco est moderne, le personnel est très sympa et vraiment aux petits soins (on vous ouvre la porte, on vous monte les bagages, on vous laisse des petits mots personnalisés). La chambre standard était cependant plus petite que je ne le pensais (23 m salle de bain comprise). Notre chambre 513 était calme hormis la première nuit où il y a eu des travaux à côté de 4h du matin à 6/7h. Le lit était très confortable. Les draps n'ont cependant pas été changé pendant notre séjour (5 nuits). Le lit était très grand comme attendu. En plus des serviettes de bain, vous avez des énormes peignoirs mis à disposition. Il n'y a pas vraiment de place pour laisser les valises ouvertes mais une belle armoire "ouverte" est disponible pour le rangement. Pas de place dans le mini bar pour vos propres affaires et pas de bouteilles d'eau offertes. Dommage... En ce qui concerne la salle de bain, la douche est énorme et prend la moitié de la pièce. Vous avez des petits produits à disposition (gel douche, shampooing et après-shampooing, body milk). Le jet de la douche n'est cependant pas très fort. La chambre était très propre mais pas impeccable. Très bon hôtel mais pas le meilleur qualité/prix. Enfin, l'emplacement est vraiment le point fort de cet hôtel. Métro à 2 min (sur la 33th ou 28th alors que hôtel entre la 30th et 31th). Je retournerai avec plaisir dans cet hôtel car une valeur sure !

title: Great location and staff
text:
Excellent location! Easy access to both downtown and walking distance to Midtown / Financial district. 
Great staff from the bellboys to the Manageress Antoneta. 
Room was really clean, lovely bathroom. 
I had an issue (not the hotel's fault) and Antoneta the Hotel's Manager helped me out personally and followed up all the way to my departure and beyond. This is a hotel where the Management care about their guests and their reputation on a personal level. Even the Bellboys remembered my name and small details. 
If you are looking for a boutique in NYC this is a great hotel to try.

title: Modern rooms, great restaurant, hidden gem of a rooftop bar!
text:
Had a nice little staycation here with my wife. We loved basking in the sun at the rooftop bar/lounge/restaurant area. 

Hotel restaurants are often disappointing but both the food and staff at the Cleo downstairs were good.

The rooms weren't huge but that's typical for NYC hotels. They were calming and well appointed. Location was just blocks from the subway and close to Madison Square Park. Easy to get to where I need to go.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Hotel très bien situé, accès au métro en 2 mn. Le personnel est efficace et très agréable.
Les chambres sont bien tenues et conformes au descriptif du site internet. Nous étions au 19e étage en king bed.
Le bar au 15e étage est agréable, bonne musique, en terrasse ce "quasi roof top" c'est vraiment sympa.
La climatisation est légèrement trop bruyante à mon gout mais on arrive à dormir quand même sans problème.
Le petit déjeuner est correct mais sans plus (nous avons choisi le continental breakfast donc choix limité à viennoiserie ou bagel ou toast + jus de fruits + café ou thé). Juste à côté il y a tout plein d'endroits sympas pour prendre son petit dej. Donc si vous avez le courage de le prendre à l'extérieur, il ne faut pas hésiter.
L'hôtel garde les bagages la dernière journée (si avion tardif par exemple), normal pour un 4 étoiles. Par contre pas de guest room si vous devez vous changer.
Hôtel recommandé.

title: Very nice hotel (and people) but missing a few details
text:
It's the details that separate good from great in the hotel business. Recognizing that the rooms are small upfront (at least our superior king room) is one thing, but the lack of storage space (shelves, hangers) for two guests on a three night visit was a problem. Likewise the lack of little "touches" like no amenities in the bathrooms, no gym onsite. Not a big deal, but telling by its absence. 

All this being said -- a very friendly and competent front door and bell staff, comfortable beds, nice rainfall showers, and surprisingly quiet considering its location. More reasonable than its neighbor the Royalton (formerly the Gansevoort) but...not quite at the same level for the reasons mentioned above. Still, worth a try.

title: What an amazing night at Mondrian Park Avenue
text: Had a few clients on the out door dining patio can i tell you what an amazing time we had. The food, service and views were all delightful.  Kudos to Esther the Associate Director of Sales for holding down the perfect location in NYC. I will definitely visit on my next trip to NYC.  Must try: Page Turner cocktail and Spiced Lamb flatbread....yummy!

title: I definitely don't recommend this hotel.
text: As I arrived with my bags I had to leave them on the sidewalk to open the two heavy doors because nobody was there to help. Next the check in was not so welcoming as I expected and they would call me 6 hours late because my room was not ready yet. But until 9 pm no ody called me so I believe the check in is not at 3pm but any time after 3pm. Room is small and lacks comforts like slippers or coffee machine, for example (or space) . There is free coffee and hot water in the cafe but having it in the room is different. The furniture in the room is not bad but doesn't make sense. Doors of the cabinet opens in a way you don't have a place to fit your bags. Location is not one of the best in Manhattan but not the worst. There is a concierge I have never seen and was never useful to us. 160 is the average rate I believe it is worth.

title: Perfect BDAY
text: Last week I stayed at MONDRIAN PARK during 4 nights. It was my birthday and they made it very special. One day I had a bottle of wine as welcome gift and on my bday small delicious cakes as a gift. What a beauty! THANK YOU GUYS. You really made me feel special. Stay cool. Federico

title: Top to Bottom - best HOTEL EVER!
text:
1) The hotel is BEAUTIFUL, with incredible attention to detail and decor. All hotels in NYC are basically upward-climbing boxes so Mondrian truly takes advantage of small, aesthetic design touches - from rose gold mirrors everywhere, to some actual art pieces in the room, the cute retro outfits they make the doormen wear, to light music and even a nice scent in the lobby!! Very high end for being a pretty small, compact hotel.
2) THE MOST COMFORTABLE bed I've ever slept in. Seriously, after 5 nights of the best sleep I've ever had, I didn't even want to come back to my pedestrian bed at home!
3) They treated us like ballers even though we're nobodys. They put us on the 20th floor (I even had a celebrity sighting, I know I'm a loser) and even gave us a bottle of wine for my birthday!! And 2 free cocktails at the bar... I think this came with our particular room rate so if you can find that I highly recommend it. 
4) That leads me to... the 15th floor bar!! It's beautiful! It doesn't have the most incredible views so go elsewhere for that, but the drinks were strong, the vibes were stellar and the music was good. I went for Friday night happy hour, picked a gin and tonic for my free cocktail, and people watched and jammed out. 
5) The location is perfect. It is right off the 4 and 6, and you can also easily access the R and W trains a few blocks away. It's in a bit of a corporate/work area, away from the tourists but still so easily accessible. Lots of great food around, being close to Koreatown! 
6) There is no gym here, so they give you access to the Equinox down the street. It's not the most mind-blowing Equinox I've ever been in, but it gets the job done! Like I said, the location is in a financial area so it's mostly people coming in, getting their workout in, and getting out. Tons of cardio, even some specialty pieces like a self-powered tread. A functional area with kettlebells and Viprs if you're into that, and a full class schedule. I took Firestarter - kicked my butt. It's a good added value because normally you'd have to pay for a day pass at Equinox. 

Basically I got to feel like a baller in New York City, which never happens if you're a regular schmo. We got a rate of like $300/night which is apparently pretty good for New York value. Book here if you get a deal like that!!!

title: Beautiful balcony; ideal for work or post-work cocktails!
text: Great addition to the neighborhood - wonderful service; and a huge balcony for New Yorkers and visitors alike to enjoy city views with great eats and drinks.  Will definitely be returning early and often!

title: I love the service here!
text: The Mondrian has amazing service and rooms- It is our go to for our international patients and their rooftop lounge is a beautiful escape from the city streets- great food and cocktails. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

title: Excellent stay at Mondrian Park Ave.
text: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Mondrian Park Avenue this past weekend. The service is professional and incredibly friendly and our room was beautiful and immaculate.  Plus, our suite (rm 1703) had a wrap-around balcony which we took full advantage of! The location was perfect for our needs as well: an easy walk to the theater district and surrounded by great restaurants.  We will return!

title: My new favorite hotel in nyc!
text: The service in Mondrian was amazing. Everyone made sure we were well taken cared of from the moment we stepped in the door. Also, dont miss a visit at their rooftop bar that offers tasty food, delicious cocktails and beautiful view of the city among others!

title: Nice hotel
text: We will update when we depart again but so far reception was very warm and professional. Complimentary drinks showed hospitality. Nice room but little small . Stay tuned for more information as we explore the rest of the hotel and services.

title: Average stay at “new” Mondrian hotel
text:
We stayed two nights last month with our 1 year old son and found our overall experience with the Mondrian Park Avenue just average. 

Pros: good location, very close to train and lots of cafe and restaurant options nearby; front desk were friendly and helpful; comfy beds, blackout blinds, usb chargers, WiFi 

Cons: decor and interior felt old and kitschy, size of the rooms, lifts (only two and took a long time), lacking amenities (have to request kettle, no free water)

Despite being a relatively new hotel it did not feel very new on the inside (aside from the lobby area). I understand that it used to be an old office building which they renovated but it doesn’t feel like there was enough done and the interior feels old despite the new paint/furniture/etc. There are 5 additional floors they added on top of the original building so I believe those rooms would be nicer. These are also the rooms advertised on their website but there is a good chance you will not be in one of them. 

The rooms are small which is to be expected from NYC but for the price range you can definitely get bigger rooms at similarly ranked hotels in the area. The front desk did offer an upgrade to a suite (for an additional charge per night but still below the advertised nightly rate) so my son would have more room to crawl around. We paid for the upgrade as the original room we would have been in was just too small. Even the suite I would say is on the smaller side.

One final comment, the front desk were thoughtful and added a complementary breakfast with our paid upgrade but sadly didn’t communicate this clearly to us. I only realized when we checked out and I saw it written on the bill.

title: Modernt hotell med bra läge
text: Ett fantastiskt hotell på nästa läge. Stora rum med sköna sängar, stort badrum och väldigt rent och välstädat. Som bonus har man även som gäst tillgång till ett toppen gym några kvarter ifrån hotellet

title: Great overall experience
text: Everything in relation to my stay went off without a hitch.  Check-in went smoothly and the front desk was very helpful through the entire process.  It didn't hurt that I got upgraded to a suite upon arrival either.

title: Lovely, excellent location
text: Staying at hotels is what i do, I must say me and my son were very impressed hands down this is what 5 star is suppose to be elegant rooms , really beautiful scent throughout the hotel. Mondrian has super awesome rooftop bar along with the Delish  food at Cleo's. Front desk super helpful and professional a must do when in NYC for everyone .  Loving it!

title: Great Service but not as luxe as Soho location
text: After having stayed at the Mondrian in Soho and loving it, I was willing to pay the higher price than other options in the neighborhood of Mondrian Park Ave expecting comparable accommodations. However, while the service is wonderful and I appreciate the team at the hotel being so friendly and helpful, the rooms were not luxe (or even "mid range") at all. The doors are that of an old cheap hotel, the flooring is carpet and the decor seems cheap. I was expecting more and am disappointed. I would much rather stay at the Roger or another nearby hotel at a cheaper price but higher quality touches.

title: Welcoming Stay in a Great Location
text:
We spent four days in the care of the accommodating and attentive staff of the Mondrian.  Every request was met happily and promptly.  Within a day Fernando Rodriguez and his fellow doormen felt like friends with their abundant smiles and sound suggestions.

The clean modern design with quiet and comfortable rooms provides a great respite from the frenetic pace enjoyed in NYC.  The location is not in the center of Manhattan’s action but is readily accessible to just about anywhere by foot, subway or taxi.

title: Cool & Modern in the centre of Manhattan
text: We had a great week long stay here recently.  The hotel has I believe only been open around 9 months so the rooms are very nicely decorated in a hip modern way.  Though not that large the room we had on a corner with wraparound windows was plenty big enough.  Compact but nice bathroom.  Staff were all helpful and friendly.  We loved the location it is a 15 to 30 min walk to just about anywhere you would want to go.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great service and location in NYC
text: Three of us visited NYC recently and had a great experience at Mondrian Park Ave. The room was clean and modern and plenty big enough for us. We enjoyed the rooftop lounge which was quiet during the day but busy and happening when the bar opened in the afternoon. The staff were friendly and took good care of us. Highly recommend this property for good service, price and location in NYC.

title: Park Ave N.Y.
text: Great hotel in lower MANHATTAN. Just far enough away from the crowds but still with plenty of choice of excellent restaurants. Laundromat only couple of blocks, grocer store, Irish bars and train substations 5min ea way. The hotel was well serviced, staff friendly and helpful. Good breakfast choices and a terrace bar on the 15th. We stayed in king studio away from rd for a week and would recommend highly. Look forward to coming back again soon.

title: Totally ok
text: This hotel is totally ok and I would happily stay here again. Don't expect a five star experience, but a decent room, a good roof top bar, and a good and central location. Bathroom is very new and nice. Beds comfy.

title: Wonderful hotel in the best location
text:
This hotel just opened in October of 2017 and everything is brand, spanking new. The hotel staff are great and when we were stranded for two days recently due to bad weather at home, they went above and beyond the call of duty to make the extra days affordable, and to do what they could to reduce the stress. It is at the corner of 30th and Park, so everything in Midtown is walkable and the subway is just a few blocks away.
Our premium king room on the 14th floor was spacious and quiet. Our shower was fantastic and bed was very comfortable. Room decor is very modern but interesting. The mirrors everywhere make the rooms feel larger and brighter.
The bar and restaurant off the lobby are nice and the bartender was very friendly. There is also a rooftop bar with great views and great lounging furniture should you get the gorgeous sunny weather we had for a few days.
This hotel will become my "go to" for New York visits and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to other travelers, with the only proviso being that some king rooms are small with a sliding door to the bathroom, but for a single business traveler this would not be a problem.

title: Amazing hotel. Large rooms.
text: Just finished a stay at the Mondrian. It is a beautifully done hotel. They have incredible staff. The room was large by any standard but especially by New York standards. Great location. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Maravilloso!!!
text: Nos alojamos con mi esposo 5 días, cuando llegamos teniamos la habitación disponible, cosa que nunca me pasó en NYC . El hotel súper moderno, la habitación con vista al Empire!!!!!, excelente atención, muy buena ubicación , GRACIAS  HECTOR  y STACY  súper atentos nos ayudaron en todo!!!! Sin duda volveremos!!!!!

title: At Home
text:
On a short staycation, we decided to book a nice hotel within the city and run around the city with a home-base closer than commuting back to Brooklyn. 
Let's just say we barely left the room!
The staff was very attentive, so friendly, and helpful with all our queries. The location was fantastic, but the room was the real kicker! It was modern, yet homely. It was an incredible weekend of decompressing in a beautiful room with calming amenities and a fantastic staff. We also ate at the great restaurant downstairs, I believe the name was Cleo, soooo good!
Highly recommend!

title: Amazing Location and Attentive Staff
text: Mondrian Park Avenue is such a beautiful hotel with carefully curated elements that truly set it apart from its competition.  The rooms are spacious and elegantly decorated.  There is a terrace with a stunning view of the city and the food and drinks are delicious.

title: Good location and great staff
text: The hotel is very well located, the room are not very big but extremely clean and very comfortable, Breakfast quite expensive but very qualitative The staff is great, really the entire team is very helpfull and nice and they make you feel at home! Thanks Fernando to you and your colleagues  for your smiles, help and great mood! For sure we will come back!

title: Good location, Friendly Staff
text:
Good location . Its a $40-50 taxi fare from La Guardia. Conveniently away from times square and broadway , but walk able (30 mnts) Its on green subway line. Staff is courteous. Has a restaurant, lounge and restaurant. Did not try any of those. There is a bread and butter store next for hot Breakfasts and to grab a bite on the go. Get a room facing the front for more natural light

Only issue I found is the room was a bit stuffy/dry. Maybe because of the heating.

title: Amazing hotel in s great location!!!
text:
From the moment we arrived when the reception staff all wished my husband a happy birthday, I had emailed them s few days earlier to arrange a bottle of wine for  our room, to our departure, all the staff were amazing. The doormen, in their fab uniforms always had a smile and all had a great sense of humour. The bar staff were friendly and mixed a mean cocktail, I recommend one called lotus flower, which we had in Cleo’s. Reception staff always had a smile as you passed through on your way out and back in. They were on hand to offer advice and answer any questions. Our room was a good size with a really comfy bed and a good sized bathroom. There is nothing I can fault about this hotel!
Thank you Mondrian, you were amazing!

title: Modern chic friendly comfort
text:
This is a fairly new addition to the array of boutique hotel choices available in Manhattan (I believe the front desk said they opened in October).  We've been to a number of NYC hotels that only seem to care about how their property looks in photographs so I'm always skeptical when I see a hotel that seems to be "design-heavy."  However, much to my happiness, this place shows that it really does care about guest comfort along with having a design focus (except for the super uncomfortable petrified wood-looking "bench" taking up most of the little lobby area -- there were some little kids that seemed to enjoy climbing on it but sitting on it as an adult is painful).

First, every staff person we encountered on our little one-night stay was committed to hospitality.  They were all a pleasure to interact with and have clear intent to be helpful. Our room was on the small side, even for NYC, but it was designed to be very practical.  For example, the little tables used as nightstands had storage shelves, there were handy ledges in the bathroom, the bathroom basin sink was at a usable height, there were wastebaskets where you'd want them, etc.  And all of the materials used were of good quality, like the metals in the bathroom and in the room itself were sturdy and built to last, the linens on the bed were long enough to tuck under the mattress and were of high thread count, the stone around the basin sink was rough-hewn on the edges but had a polish that will keep it clean, etc.  Sometimes you walk into a hotel room and you feel like they had set it up like a movie set -- looks good but if you touch it you realize it is meant for a camera lens and not really practical.  Not here -- it looks good but it feels good too!

The bed was comfortable, the HVAC worked great, and the massive TV first seemed like it might be too big for the room but actually was fun to watch.  Everything was super clean.  

I reviewed them separately but we really liked Fifteen Stories as a little rooftop bar.  The servers were attentive and the cheese plate was not only interesting but scrumptious, as was the cocktail I had.  And it continued the chic comfort vibe.  We were there early in the evening so I don't know if the atmosphere changes or not, but it was nice to be in a rooftop lounge where couples, singles, after-work folks and even families felt at home.  (Note that even though I've let TripAdvisor know weeks ago, as of this writing the TA listing for Fifteen Stories is spelled incorrectly so it might be harder for people to find reviews for the lounge -- TripAdvisor has it listed as "15 Stories.")  

This hotel will definitely be on our list for future staycations in NYC -- they get most everything right!

title: My new favorite NY hotel
text: From the moment I walked into The Mondrian Park Avenue, I felt welcomed. The staff behind the desk greeted me and were pleasant as they quickly got me into my room. The room itself was just what I want when traveling - comfortable, clean and a place I could immediately feel at home in. The entire stay was terrific and I already have my next trip set. The room rates were also not what I would've expected from a luxurious hotel but it was NOT the usual overpriced Manhattan hotel.

title: Excellent stay!
text: A beautiful hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Loved our room, hotel location and whole  experience. We stayed here in April with our two kids. Had large room with two beds and massive bathroom. Loved design of hotel throughout. Great attention to detail. We will definitely be back!

title: Top! Top!! Top!!
text:
Just an all around amazing weekend experience!!

We were warmly greeted at curbside by a friendly smile from the doorman (Jonathan) and the meaningful engagement continued through out our stay.

The desk staff are exceptional! We were acknowledged every time to exited and returned to the hotel. Offered assistance with transportation etc. 

Modern, clean, comfortable rooms with top guests amenity. Housekeeping staff were outstanding as well. 

Great drinks on rooftop bar. The views are spectacular btw. 

Just a great, chic hotel, conveniently located. Lots to love about this hotel. We look forward to our next stay in June.

title: Deceptive & misleading descriptions of rooms
text: If you stay you'll find a good staff and nice decor but please be wary of room descriptions on their site. The room I stayed in appeared to be smaller by a third than its advertised size and what was described as a "generously proportioned seating area" was in reality a very small dining room-style chair wedged into a corner. The hotel defends its marketing, which makes this all the more troubling. I have checked off all Mondrian and SBE properties until they address this.

title: No complaints
text:
Stayed here for a couple of nights over Easter.  Good, smart new hotel, with a cool and stylish vibe.   Room was a decent size, with a large bed.  Particularly liked the monsoon shower in the bathroom.

Free coffee available first thing in the morning from the hotel restaurant.   We didn't take advantage of it, but they also have a car and driver available to take you within a certain range of the hotel.

Good location - plenty of bars and restaurants etc nearby.

title: Over-rated: Small Rooms and So Noisy
text: First the room was small even by NYC standards.   The queen bed fit and not much more.  There was a small table but you couldn't fit it in so it blocked the path from the bed to the bathroom.  The decor is wannabe hipster.  They must have gotten lazy because they hung the same photos on either side of the room.   Was supposed to stay a second night but checked out early because last night was miserable. A nightclub nearby was pumping music that sounded like it was in the room next door until 4am.  Then for the next hour the people who left the club were outside having fun and that sounded like it was coming from our bathroom.  Elevators are slow so leave extra time to get in and out of the place.  OF the dozens of hotels I have stayed at in NYC, this is the worst blend of comfort, design and noise level.

title: New Years Eve 2017
text: We had a great night at this hotel.  The customer service was perfect.  They were genuine and nice.  From the moment we walked in, we felt welcomed.  We checked in early and they were able to find us a room that was ready and although there was an error with our room they made up for it immediately, with a complimentary bottle of champagne.  They did this without hesitation or question, which I could appreciate.  They had a New Years Party in the lower level floor of their hotel and it was ok.  It was a pretty small area so it felt pretty cramped and every time the door swung open we froze.  The room was small but super cute, not much of a view.  I loved how they designed it.  It was perfect and clean.  I loved the shower amenities and their pens! lol We plan on staying again this year and hope the same genuine positive energy they displayed in their customer service is there again.  I stay at many hotels around the world for work and this will officially be my NYC hotel.

title: Good new hotel but few annoying NQR elements
text: Stayed for 5 nights at Mondrian Park Ave - part business, part pleasure.  Hotel is new and rooms are nicely furnished.  Great bed and linen.  Good location.  What can be improved to make this hotel really good, if not exceptional?  Having sound proof windows, decent toiletries and ensuring shower is sealed properly so water doesn’t leak out.  Floor we were on (level 9) constantly smelt of bad Chinese food, perhaps consider piping the signature smell in lobby and bar to all floors.  Average breakfast is a rip-off really (dish plus juice and coffee easily comes to $40), and tables spaced are way too close together in the restaurant which made dining awkward.  The concept of a daily service charge (for coffee/tea, gym access) is bit silly, if you want to do this then just be upfront about it and include it in the overall price.

title: Great Experience
text: We flew in for a red carpet premiere and the hotel was more than what we hoped for. Hector was wonderful. He checked us in, offered us cocktail passes for Fifteen Stories (rooftop lounge), and made sure we had a comfortable stay regardless of our busy schedule. We received fantastic room service and the staff was very kind and friendly. I highly recommend this place

title: Exceptional value for money
text:
You will really struggle to get a room as good as this for the price elsewhere in NYC, it may not be perfect but in terms of luxury value for money I can't beat it. 

Brand new well appointed rooms, beautiful bathroom, heavenly bed and a superb location.

Minor negatives: hilariously expensive mini bar & room service, some service lacked the personal touch that I experienced at the Mondrian in London. 

I would thoroughly recommend a stay though. 5/5

title: Great hotel in a perfect location in the City
text: Loved the location of this hotel - its the perfect mid-town spot.  Hotel is clean and easy to navigate.  Food in the restaurant was fantastic as well as on the 15th floor in the bar.  Really had a nice time visiting this hotel.

title: A BED MADE IN HEAVEN
text:
I Stayed in this hotel for 1 week to discover the  vibrant city of NY.
The high points were the bed, the shower and the big tv. Wonderful!
Low points : small room for 1 week stay! Even I was told I was upgraded to a deluxe room.  We had to spread our bags througout the floor. Small closet It was a little disapointing at first but then we got used to it. 200$ taken of your credit card at check in just for extras!.. I understand the procedure but It should be less!
The location was ok , not the best one , but close to the subway.
Free wi-fi that worked perfectly!

title: Clean and convenient
text: I enjoy the Mondrian in London and booked this based on that experience. It lacks some of the "destination" vibe of the London property, but is a strong midtown selection. Very accessible off the 4/5/6, nicely appointed with comfortable rooms, an excellent restaurant in Cleo, and attentive service. Some oddities - I was charged for what I thought was a complimentary drink, and same for morning coffee if you sit down vs. take to go, but overall a good experience and likely to return.

title: Love love love the location!
text:
Staff were very friendly, In Room Service was stellar, Cleo the main restaurant was very good and very busy, saw Venus Williams having lunch there as well. The location on Park Avenue South is only a few minutes from Penn Station.
The showers especially the rain soaker was a great way to end the night.
Overall the property is very nice considering it opened late in 2017.

title: Excelente hotel en NY
text:
Nosotros nos hospedamos en la habitación 1406. La verdad que la habitación nos pareció muy amplia, cómoda y limpia.
La atención del personal del hotel es excelente, en particular Hector que nos ayudó a conseguir un taxi y a cargar las maletas cuando hicimos el check out.
La ubicación del hotel es muy buena. Se encuentra a unas pocas cuadras del Empire State y de Times Square. Te podes manejar caminando perfectamente, o sino tenes una boca de subte a una cuadra.

title: Comfortable stay, great wifi!
text: I stayed in a balcony room on the 20th floor, which sounds great in theory until you actually step outside and the vertigo sets in. Regardless, I had a great stay. The amenities are first rate, the wifi is remarkably fast (10G down, I tested), and the beds are very comfortable. Looking forward to my next stay!

title: Excellent NYC hotel - A hidden GEM in mid-town
text: I have stayed there on several occasions as I work in the area and sometimes work late. In my many stays over the last 5 or 6 months, I have always found the entire staff to be nothing but friendly and professional. They seem to enjoy helping out. Several others from my company have stayed at Mondrian and always report the same results. Esther has gone out of her way to make sure that The hotel is positioned nicely in mid-town. it's very clean and modern and very welcoming to weary travelers.

title: Great location and wonderful staff
text: Our hotel stay was terrific -- the staff was wonderful and the location is great. Our room was SMALL (for New York standards not too small) but cozy and clean. The hotel staff was super helpful and the bar on 15th floor is very cool and happening. You do pay a facilitates fee of $28 but it includes 2 complimentary drinks at the bar (which normally are $19 each --yes, welcome to NYC), gym passes to Equinox and wi-fi. There is also a hotel car that can take you 10 blocks up or down --so fun!

title: Great value for NY
text:
A warm welcome by attentive staff, especially Arva (concierge team) and Matt in the restaurant and of course the doormen. Clean and comfortable bed, central location close to the subway, Our room was small but good amenities and sufficient for our stay. You can pay more for a larger room. A courtesy car was available first come first serve basis which a a number of occasions was much appreciated by us and the driver and the vehicle very classy and made us feel special. it has limitations on the perimeter that it can take you which was not a problem for us. 
Our room was on the 7th floor and Park ave street front. The honking of horns seems to be a NY past time!! but that noise during the night was disturbing. so I would request a room off the Main street if possible.next time.

title: Hip, trendy and very centric
text:
I stayed at the Mondrian for almost a week on business.
The hotel is very centrally located, within walking distance from several attractions. It has a very cool / trendy vibe going on, specially loved the lounge on the 15th floor. Too bad it was a very cold week otherwise I would've been working at the terrace every single night sipping a glass of wine!
The rooms are spacious enough with all types of amenities you'd expect to find.
The staff was extremely accommodating and nice!
The restaurant Cleo, always has complimentary coffee so that's nice. Food there is very good, full of spices and flavor. It seems like it's the place to hang out on on Fridays as it was packed on my last night, good ambiance.
Front Desk ladies very super nice, very helpful and always smiling.
The only comment that I have and merely as feedback as it did not impact my stay, was that the Hskp staff made some noise on one of the mornings, slamming doors around my room which you could wake up to if you're not already up!
Esther Song from Sales was very nice, always anticipating our needs. 
Will definitely return!

title: Amazing trip to NYC
text: We stayed at Mondrian Park Avenue for one week. The hotel is super nice and clean. It was a very pleasant stay and the entire staff we got in touch with was extremely friendly as well as helpful. We have absolutely nothing to complain about! Perfect!

title: Great new hotel
text: Beautiful new hotel.  Modern rooms with clean lines, comfortable beds and great bathrooms. Great location in the city, nice & helpful staff. Corner rooms with lots of windows. Restaurant and rooftop!  We will be back!!

title: A Room with a view!!
text: Fab hotel, great location, amazing staff that go the extra mile for their guests. Modern and chic rooms, bar, lounge, restaurant. A must stay! Booked 5 nights and I couldn't fault it. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely long weekend
text: I stayed here for 4 days with some friends, and it was a wonderful visit. The staff was very accommodating, and let us check in early. They were extremely attentive, especially the wonderful doormen. The rooms were impeccable, and extremely clean. The beds were very comfortable after a long day of walking around the city. The bathroom was beautiful, and shower was wonderful! I would definitely stay at the Mondrian again! Great location, service, and accommodations!

title: Wonderful
text: Wonderful service. It’s in the middle of everything and I never even had to open a door. The modern aesthetics are also very simple and pleasing to the eye. The staff was nice and even accommodated our baby with a crib so we didn’t have to bring our own. It was a very nice gesture.

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed at the Mondrian Park Ave with a friend and our baby for 4 days. The location was perfect. There is a 6 train 2 blocks away, and it is situated so you can walk just about anywhere. 

A double room was a perfect size for three adults and a baby (they provided a playpen too!). The rain shower was a lovely reprieve after walking all day. The beds were like falling into clouds and the rooms were spotless. And the hotel staff were incredibly friendly, accommodating, and helpful during our stay. 

We enjoyed the complimentary coffee/tea bar each morning in Cleo before hitting the streets. And, we delighted in the gorgeous and delicious Mediterranean cuisine at Cleo one evening. 

We most definitely recommend the wonderful Mondrian Park Avenue. We will return.

title: Mondrian Park Avenue - Great Hotel
text: I really enjoyed this hotel.  The rooms were exceptionally clean and the beds were extremely comfortable.    The hotel staff was quick to answer any questions, help with bags, and make recommendations for NYC venues.   They were professional, kind and made every effort to accommodate us.  The restaurant in the hotel, Cleo, had fabulous food and wine. The service was also great.

title: makes you fee at home away from home
text: Staying here for the second time and love the place. Staff is super friendly and always happy to assist. Location is great and rooms are new with great bed, linens, very clean and good internet. Definitely will come back.

title: DISGUSTED!!!
text: Like always we check the room before anything. I pulled off the sheets and there’s a blood stain than I checked the bathroom and there’s mold in every corner black and pink ! pee smell , stains on wall

title: Best staff and hotel experience in NYC!
text: I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. From the moment I walked through the front doors I was greeted with friendly smiles, eager service and an absolute willingness to meet any of my or my companies demands. I’ve been staying for work for almost three weeks now and everyone I have brought along with me agrees this hotel is five stars all the way. Location is excellent. Easily accessible to every part of the city by train, foot or car. The rooms are clean, spacious and the bathroom is a nice size. The 15th floor is a great place to meet after work for drinks and the restaurant Cleo has excellent Mediterranean options as well as full bar. I am thrilled with my stay here and could not recommend it higher.

title: March 15 to 17, 2018
text: New hotel on Park Avenue for a weekend family visit. Room was clean, new and had everything that we needed, would definitely recommend staying here (area surrounding hotel has plenty of places to get food). Hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. Special thanks to Leonela (front desk attendant) - she was very helpful and patient when I was trying to print my boarding passes and was able to answer all my questions. People like her make me want to stay there again when I'm visiting New York. Also, the restaurant, Cleo, is great. The food was wonderful and the staff very knowledgeable about the menu, water was always filled and the food was definitely fresh. Would highly recommend this Mediterranean restaurant.

title: A good choice
text: While it’s very different from the Mondrian in LA, what is similar is the friendly and very helpful staff. Everyone seemed more than eager to help whenever possible, sincere and engaging. Lionela and Jennifer at the front desk were always exceptionally helpful.  Clean and ample rooms and convenient to transportation. The bar on the 15th floor was great for drinks and I only wish that the weather had been more cooperative to sit outside. Next time.

title: Lovely hotel with a few glitches
text:
All in all, this is a great hotel and I'd have no problem recommending it to someone. That said, there are a few things that could've made this a better experience. The location is great, especially if cabbing in from Laguardia airport. There is a subway close by and lots of restaurants to keep you satisfied in the area. So A+ on location.

The hotel is aesthetically beautiful, both the lobby and the rooms. However, I do think the rooms could've used a kettle or coffee maker. Instead, I had to order room service just for tea and it becomes quite pricey. Realistically I could've just gone a block away to the Starbucks to grab tea but I was in pajamas and wanted it while laying in bed. The point is, it would be a nice addition, and one that I think is expected in most 4 star hotels.

I personally did not find the beds comfortable to sleep in and found the sheets overstarched. I know someone else who stayed in the hotel at the same time, and though they found the sheets stiff too, they slept fine. So perhaps it's just me being picky but I struggled sleeping for the 5 nights I stayed there. But the room was lovely, and I enjoyed laying in bed watching movies on the large TV at night. The bathroom was also very nice - loved the two shower heads in the large shower.

When I first checked in, the receptionist was quite rude and grunted at me. We hardly exchanged any words. However, the rest of the staff throughout the stay were extremely pleasant and warm so I'm assuming that lady was having a bad day. Honestly, everyone else was so extremely kind, it made her attitude even more glaringly rude.

I don't often eat in hotel restaurants but I made an exception this trip and tried the restaurant Cleo for breakfast. The food was good, but extremely overprice for what it was. Skip the hotel's breakfast and go two blocks down to Sarabeth's, or any of the other restaurants in the area. I don't mind spending a lot of money on a lush breakfast, but this was hardly worth the price.

Another thing I should note was that there was a facility charge added on - at $25 a day - that hadn't been listed anywhere online when I booked. Now, at check out they were very understanding because I had booked before the policy came into place. Because of that, the fee was removed and I appreciated it. But for all those going forward, be warned... you are paying an extra $25 a day to your booking price for "facilities". 

While I liked the hotel, I don't think I'd book here again with that extra surcharge. Perhaps that $25 could go towards putting tea and a kettle in the rooms.

title: Beautiful Experience
text: This hotel was the perfect location to all the sights, but without all of the craziness you would typically get in NYC. From the second we walked in the door was held for us and the front desk staff gracefully greeted us. Tyler was so professional and made sure everything was in order when we got there. Fernando was so pleasant and personable helping us with our bags, and even got us a complimentary car to the train. When we went to the bar, Joey introduced himself, shook our hands, and made sure we enjoyed our drinks. Highly recommend!!!

title: Recommend!
text: A lovely hotel with a professional personnel, nice service provided. Very good location, several blocks away from Madison park, flat iron district, where you can find plenty of good restaurants! The prize/quality is good!

title: Home Away from Home
text: If your looking for a home away from home during your business trip, family vacation, or if your in town for a quick get away, The Mondrian on Park Avenue is defiantly the place for you! From the moment I walked through the double doors I felt a warmth and peacefulness that has carried over everyday single day of my stay here.  For starters, their staff! hands down are the coolest and most endearing group of people you will met! They are always present and ready to assist you with anything you need! Secondly, its a dog friendly hotel that not only provides a comfortable bed for your pet, they also have a dope signature "Bark box" that provides treats, toys and extra goodies for your four legged friend. The day my bulldog, and I walked into building everyone knew her name and treated her as if she was a guest in the hotel! To me It's the little things that truly go a long way and the staff at the Mondrian really go the extra mile for you! Lets not forget the food, and wonderful drinks at the bar and lounge! Even if your not staying at the hotel, i definitely recommending stoping by and trying the ravioli! These are a few of the many reasons why the Mondrian should be the first on your go to list! Definitely check it out!

title: One of the NICEST STAYS in NYC EVER
text:
Mondrian Park Avenue was beyond what we had hoped for. We stayed on the East Side to avoid the crowds during the holiday season and this was a hotel I randomly chose. My sister and I will never stay anywhere else in NYC. Not only were the accommodations amazing, but the staff was friendly and inviting! Hard to find in the city. 

The room was HUGE - room enough for two double beds PLUS room to cartwheel. The shower was its own room practically. Check out the pictures, you'll see what I mean.

Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!!!

title: Perfect for a long weekend break!
text: This is a beautiful new hotel. I stayed in a Deluxe Room with my partner for 4 nights and it was so perfect for our New York stay! The bed was dreamy and the shower was lovely, the room was bigger than other hotels we had been looking at in the area so great value for money. The TV had chrome cast which was a bonus - rainy mornings called for Netflix in bed! The rooftop bar was very sophisticated and had great views, although it was very quiet whenever we seemed to visit in the evenings. Unfortunately, our room on the 12th floor was particularly noisy. I understand this may often be the case with hotels on Park Avenue, however we felt it was the noise from guests staying in nearby rooms that spoilt the experience (and the weird noises coming from the AC unit..) Perhaps staying in a different room/side of the hotel would erase this problem! Overall, we found this hotel cosy and welcoming, it is in an ideal location for exploring and the staff were all lovely.

title: Hip hotel on Park Avenue
text: First off the simple lobby and gorgeous restaurant make the hotel a stand out on Park Avenue. In an area that has at least 4 new hotels pop up in a two block radius choosing the Mondrian was the best decision. The front desk staff was extremely professional and polite. The room was gorgeous and had beautiful details that made me feel inspired and comfortable. It was luxurious but still successful. I would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure it is sleek, sexy, trendy yet classy all at the same time. Great stay!

title: Weekend Getaway
text: Mondrian Park Avenue exceeded our expectations! The staff was absolutely amazing and the room itself was perfect! My husband and I were in the city for a weekend getaway and we had such an amazing time! We can’t wait for our next stay!

title: New hotel of choice
text: We stayed here for 3 nights just now. Overall impression: Our new home in NYC! Check in flawless, room spacious, 100% clean and neat, nice art on the walls, very light, bed was amazing, bathroom 1A (huge and comfy walk in rain shower, plenty of shelf space, beautiful and artsy  marble sink, nice lighting). Breakfast very good and quick, check out easy and quick. Location is amazing, Nomad, everything conveniently reachable. At least 10th floor very quiet. Nothing more to ask for!

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: This hotel is great! It has a perfect location in midtown - very close to the subway. The 15 stories lounge has a wonderful rooftop with great views and spacious seating. I also went to their restaurant Cleo which was spectacular. Overall the hotel was brand new, the staff was attentive and kind and I had no problems. Would come again.

title: Excellent Hotel - worth checking out
text: From the moment I entered the Mondrian it was a wonderful experience. Enjoyed a free upgrade to a deluxe room, a complimentary cocktail at the rooftop lounge (which entailed a great atmosphere, well made drinks and delicious food.  Front desk, room and hospitality was top notch. Will be back frequently.

title: A great hotel
text:
I recently spent 5 nights here for business and found this hotel to be wonderful.
The room was great and the bed was also comfortable , great location and the staff were amazing.
Very central to everything NY has to offer , the staff were always happy to help with any questions or recomendations.

title: Amazing time!
text: I went there for my birthday weekend because I heard good things from friends and family about the place and i wasn't disappointed. The hotel service was amazing everyone was friendly got to know them on a first name basis jennifer, stacy, johnathan, antonetta and fernando treated me and my friends with great respect. They send me a complimentary bottle of champagne for my birthday. The overall experience was great, honestly already looking for a new date so I can stay there again or any excuse to just spend a weekend there. The area is great and they really help you plan your day if you aren't sure on what to do.

title: Amazing Experience
text: The beautiful new Mondrian on Park Avenue exceeded our expectations.  We stayed after a concert at the Garden and immediately felt at home in the spacious, beautifully designed, immaculate room with it's comfy King size bed and the BEST PILLOWS EVER.  Breakfast was very enjoyable and we were even offered a car service to take us to Grand Central.  LOVED it and would recommend to anyone and everyone! Thank you for your customer service!!!!!

title: Great hotel for a weekend in NYC
text: My husband and I stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue while visiting our daughter.  It is a crisp, clean brand new boutique hotel with small, smartly decorated, comfortable rooms.  We stayed in their Superior King Room, which is their smallest room type.  The bathrooms are fitted with large showers with dual rain shower shower heads.  The staff were excellent, especially Klaudio and Jennifer K. at check out.  We enjoyed our complimentary happy hour drinks in the rooftop cocktail lounge and daily morning coffee.  It was an unexpected treat at checkout when they had their house car transport us to our daughter’s apartment

title: Nice new hotel
text: The hotel is brand new, so it is very clean, smells nice and everything is in good condition. Location is very good. We had a corner room that looked nice but it was quite loud. Room had windows overlooking 30 St and Park Ave so we were getting the traffic noise from both streets. In addition to that every time our neighbors door closed (they slam themselves automatically) it was very loud and our wall where the bed headboard was vibrated very badly, waking us up very early in the morning some days.

title: BEST HOTEL EVER
text:
My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel for four nights as a girls trip. It was our BEST decision ever! 

We stayed on the 20th floor with INCREDIBLE views of the Empire State Building. 

In every city, there are many luxury hotels. As such it becomes difficult to distinguish oneself as "the best luxury hotel" - the Mondrian Park Avenue does so by providing the most luxurious customer service!! 

The staff is incredible. We've had the pleasure of traveling to many luxury hotels before, including different hotels from the  same branch, and we have never, ever met such friendly, helpful, and genuinely nice staff members.

The girls at the front desk became our friends, and I will never stay at a different hotel in the city ever again!! 

The night club Never Never is very fun and posh. The food at Cleo is incredible, and the amenities are amazing (equinox fitness!). 

Please ask for Stacey, Leonela and Jennifer!!! These girls are amazing!

title: Epitome of Excellence
text:
There is no doubt in my mind that staying in the Mondrian Hotel surpasses all hotel stays I’ve ever had. The style is outstanding. 
From the moment we arrived, we were greeted and treated with the upmost highest customer service. 
Our rooms were beautiful and ultra comfortable. We had a breathtaking view of the Empire State Building. The features of our room included a spacious and unique shower, in room safe, an incredible flat screen TV, and the most comfortable beds you can imagine. Breakfast at the Cleo was excellent and of high quality.
Finally what made this hotel was the staff. They treated every guest with unique excellence. From the managers, reception, concierge, waiters, bar staff and room maids.
We must say a special thank you to everyone at reception, who worked hard to make our stay as happy and comfortable as possible.

title: Another excellent stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue. This hotel is an absolute gem with fantastic staff!
text: I love my stay at Mondrian. The hotel is fantastic, from the bell boy to the front desk they always try their best to make your stay relaxed and enjoyable. They are the reason why I love to come back.

title: All Round Excellence
text:
As a frequent Business and Leisure traveller to New York, i'm always looking for my home away from home. 

Stayed here for the first time in January 2018 for an extended stay of 9 nights. 

Everything was excellent - the doormen courteous and polite,  front desk staff were exceptional and professional, the room was comfortable with modern amenities and the lighting was superb. Special mention to Leilani who was most accommodating to my particular requests. 

The location is excellent - centrally located and super convenient for quickly getting in and out of Manhattan via taxi/subway. 

Looking forward to my next stay here in a few weeks.

title: Book it
text:
Now one of my favorite hotels in NY. 
Staff is very attentive and welcoming, John was the best!
Room: spacious by NY hotel standards (stayed in a King Deluxe, I believe, 11th floor). Very clean, smartly decorated.
Bathroom: great size, two shower heads (a regular and a "rain" one). Immaculately clean.
Restaurant: had a plentiful breakfast with eggs and bacon, but menu had a fantastic selection of healthier options. 
Cleo restaurant for dinner (same space): Chef accommodated my selection to a lactose sensitivity.  Had the filet kabob and salmon kabob, superb.
The bar upstairs had a great, chill atmosphere, I'm sure would have been much busier if it hadn't been snowing and the rooftop patio could have been utilized.
Would recommend and would definitely stay again.

title: New, beautiful hotel with the nicest staff
text:
