We’ve stayed at this hotel for a whole week and it couldn’t have been better! The hotel is brand new, confottable, very well located and it’s staff is amazing!
Very special mention for Fernando Rodriguez and all the bell boys, which are super nice and always ready to help.
I defenitely recommend staying there!

title: 5 STAR SERVICE
text:
I highly recommend this outstanding hotel. We received exceptional service, especially from Hector Matute.  I had broken my wrist and was not able to do much.  Mr. Matute went out of his way to make sure I had everything I needed and I didn’t have to lift a finger.  He certainly made our stay by being so attentive and caring. We will be sure to stay here again and recommend this hotel to all our family and friends.  Thank you for having such a valuable employee like Hector Matute. 
5 STARS⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: * 10/10 * in NYC ! ! !
text:
Being from NYC - I expect superior service when booking a staycation.
The Mondrian Park Ave is all that and more ! From the hot decor to client service to the FABULOUS rooms and Location Location - beautiful views out to Park ave and beyond and very chic room decor ! I am giving this property a 10/10 ! I stayed here this past SAT night for my birthday weekend and couldn't have expected more ! Every expectation I had was met. LOVE this hotel and will definitely stay here again very soon ! Thank you Mondrian Park Ave for your help in making my weekend so memorable ! My photo's can be judged for themselves :)

title: Absolutely Amazing!
text:
I could not believe I found such a nice hotel with such amazing service in New York City! And it was great value for money! Everything was exceptionally clean and classy, the staff from the doorman to the front desk to the Bell boy was very helpful and the check in process was very smooth and simple. They were very accommodating and cheerful, the doorman Fernando, always got a taxi and the door for you before you could even ask him.
I will always be staying at this hotel when I go to New York!

title: Ideal für einen Städtetrip
text:
Das Hotel ist perfekt gelegen, nur ein paar Blocks vom Empire State Building. In der näheren Umgebung viele Coffeeshops, Restaurants und Bar.
Die Mitarbeiter waren sehr, sehr nett und bei jedem Anliegen super hilfsbereit. 
Das Ambiente im Eingangsbereit ist sehr gediegen und edel. Das Restaurant ist sehr stylisch, allerdings haben wir nicht dort gegessen. Die Bar am Abend lädt auch zum verweilen ein und den ein oder anderen Absacker abends zu trinken. Im Hotel ist ebenfalls ein Club für den man sich via Rezeption auf die Gästeliste setzen lassen kann.
Die Zimmer entsprechen europäischem Standard und unser Zimmer verfügte über ein großes Kingsize Bett mit richtiger Bettdecke (!), riesigem Flatscreen, Föhn, WLAN, Safe usw. Nachdem wir jeden Tag erschöpft von NYC ins Hotel gekommen sind, habenwir uns sehr wohl gefühlt.
Wir waren als Paar 5 Tage in NYC und haben uns auf Grund der Lage für dieses Hotel entschieden - zu recht! Defintiv empfehlenswert.

title: Fantastic!
text: Wonderful hotel. The lobby is small, intimate and sexy. Our room was excellent--good size, style and fantastic beds. Absolutely loved our experience. Staff was excellent!I would highly recommend this hotel. I will certainly be back.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Very nice size rooms for NY City. Beautifully appointed. Lovely rain head shower in bathroom. Hotel staff very pleasant, helpful. Great lounge on 15th floor with views of Manhattan. Super location, an easy walk to Grand Central Station to the north and Madison and Union Squares to the south. Super close to subway stop. Definitely recommend a stay. Would love to go back.

title: Perfect hotel for a weekend in NYC
text:
What a perfect hotel for a romantic weekend in NYC.

The lobby is beautifully decorated with an enormous rock and it's really impressive.

The rooms are really nicely decorated too and you can tell that they really invested a lot of energy not the decor to make sure that every inch of space was maximized.

Our room had a little balcony with a nice view.

The location is pretty great as it wasn't too far from LaGuardia and close to all of the touristy places we visited.

On the negative side, I called the concierge to help me book tickets to a Broadway show before our trip. When I called I was told he would have to call me back. After 2 days, I just booked them myself.

Also, the front doors are really heavy, luckily the doorman was there to help me as I really struggled with it.

I definitely to recommend this hotel. The staff was nice and it's perfect for couples and sightseers!

title: A gem! book it while you can before the rest of the world finds out
text: I come to NYC every month (from California) for the last 6 years. This is my new favorite hotel. Trendy, cool rooms that are still very functional. Nice decor. Good quality toiletries. Unique mixed drinks in minibar (didn't try them but they did look cool). Great little restaurant downstairs (breakfast was excellent) and superb team at the front. Location works great for going to work in Midtown or going shopping in Gramercy/Chelsea. I love everything about it.

title: Excellent 1-week business stay!
text:
I was quite impressed by the quality of service I must say, especially for a new property.
I would particularly highlight the warm & personal welcome I experienced with Antoneta Nikci, Guest Service Manager. The room was spacious and very comfortable. 
I very much enjoyed the location: I reached many of my appointments walking + enjoyed it over the weekend as well. The Mondrian Park Avenue is very close to the Empire State Building.

title: Front Staff
text:
My husband and I recently stayed here and I have to say, best staff ever! hands down! Love the bellman very friendly. Stay in a lot of hotels but this is by far the best. Special thanks to Leonela. She was very helpful with every request and questions she helped me with restaurant recommendations went above and beyond she had a smile every time we walked in and knew my name, this is what service is about. 

No gym on property but arrangement at Equinox which is great. Restaurant Cleo was amazing as well. Good location of the hotel. Overall it is the staff that makes me want to come back and Leonela definitely made my stay even more enjoyable. Will be back soon!

title: Great location, great room, decent service
text: If you've read my reviews before, you'll know that great service is very important to me. There are lots of hotels to choose from - especially in NYC - and what distinguishes one for the other for me is service. Anticipating needs and filling them. This hotel was just recently opened when we visited, so I can appreciate that there were still some kinks to work out. The rooms were great - clean, well appointed and well thought out to maximize space. You can't beat the hotel location - prime Park Ave. real estate. Which also means that space is at a premium. There isn't much of a lobby, so the hotel cleverly invites guests up to their 'rooftop lounge' to wait if their room isn't quite ready. The challenge when we checked in was that they invited us up to the lounge to wait for our room, and left us there. The lounge was unattended and left over food wrappers dotted the lounge tables. Had there been a staff member there to greet us, offer us water, coffee or even a cocktail and to let us know when our room was ready - what a different experience that would have been! I will be back - in part to see if they've worked out some of the 'opening day' kinks.

title: Ótimo hotel e excelente serviço!
text:
Estive hospedado no Mondrian Park Ave por 10 dias na época do Reveillon 2017/2018.
Ótimo serviço, instalações e staff. 
Meu quarto estava localizado no 16º andar (suíte com sacada). Quarto e banheiro grandes (banheiro enorme). Nestes andares superiores, o número de quartos é reduzido (creio que 6 ou 8 por andar), o que torna a estadia ainda melhor e mais tranquila.
Parabéns a todos, com certeza voltarei.

title: Amazing experien
text:
The rooms were beautiful, clean and comfortable, location is perfect, couldn’t ask for better restaurant within the hotel,
And above all the team at the reception were amazingly helpful (thank you Arva and Leilani)
, we are defiantly coming back !!!

title: Room is different from a picture at morganshotelgroup.com
text:
I am at the Mondrian right now. 
Pros: Clean and Nice staff. 
Cons: I booked a Premier King. It’s different from a picture at the morganshotelgroup.com and I am sure it’s smaller then 35 sqm . Part of the room is eaten by supporting wall, air conditioning and something else  
No coffee machine, no ironing board.

title: Lovely hotel on Park Ave.
text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights earlier this month. The front desk team, doorman, restaurant staff, literally everyone, could not have been nicer. I would absolutely return to this property the next time I'm in NYC. Special shout out to Leonela, JZ, Emir, and Hecor for being extra nice.

title: Above and beyond expectation!
text: I have stayed at many boutique hotels and this by far was the best experience I have had.  The design is modern, calming, and inviting, with an artistic flair. The two spacious rooms we booked just after Christmas were super clean, fresh, and chic, with large showers, and great amenities. The beds were comfortable! Most importantly, the staff was amazing. Their friendliness and professionalism was refreshing. Starting with the door men, the front desk, bar staff, room service and cleaning staff, we were made to feel important, and very welcomed. I used to stay at another boutique hotel nearby in the Garment District, but have had too many bad experiences there, like messing up my reservations, noise, terrible service, and a dirty room, so I took a chance on the Mondrian after reading reviews and I am so glad I did. We will be staying here again and I highly recommend it Great bar and lounge with awesome wine list, btw. Oh, and really convenient location!

title: Quiet Luxury on Park Ave
text:
I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure - it has a brand new designer feel.  
Pluses - Art everywhere, luxe sheets, towels, and robes made the space very warm and well-appointed. 
Ample room (around 300sf) including well designed bathroom with roomy shower.  
Quiet room - I never heard noise from the street or neighbors
Two blocks to 4-5-6 Subway 
Restaurants and stores close by in Murray Hill or uptown to Grand Central 
The windows open so you can test the real feel of the weather.
The temp was perfect - not too cold, too hot or too dry, even in winter 
Staff are welcoming and take the initiative to help
Housekeeping staff did not bug me when I wanted to stay in the room.

Thanks to Stacy, Gregory, Paul, Alex and Hector who helped me with smiles for miles. 

Considerations :
Park Ave is on the east side -- 4-5-6  subway is close but the other lines are a 10 min walk away

title: Fantastic location, wonderful service
text:
I stayed at the Mondrian for a business trip in January and the location was perfect: a quick cab ride from the Jacob Javits convention center, close to Chelsea, and with plenty of great bars and restaurants nearby for business dinners and meetings. 

The staff was wonderfully friendly throughout my stay, and my bedroom and bathroom were both spacious and clean. The design is beautiful, and the value for money for a New York Hotel was spectacular. Would stay here again in a heartbeat for a business or personal trip.

title: Believe the hype- this place is 10/10
text:
After reading the glowing reviews of this place I booked my family in here. Firstly the customer service and the general attitude of this hotel is exemplary. They made us feel important, catered for and ensured this trip felt special.
It was a trip to celebrate my dads 60th. We only mentioned this in passing and they left us wine and macaroons.

They printed and hand delivered my work to my our room. They gave us extra blankets without quibble on a particularly cold night. The wonderful doormen learned my dads name and welcomed him personally every time- they even ran to the door ensuring to open it before we had a chance. 

So we took the trouble to find out their names and all we staff we personally encountered on our 4 day trip!

Jonathan, Fernando, Hector, Hafsah, Antonetta, Emir, and Alex - guys, thank you so much!

title: Place to stay in NYC
text: Mondrain Hotel is amazing and has a great location in midtown NYC- nearby Empire State Building etc. The rooms are super clean and beautiful. The staff is friendly and helpful. The Lounge bar has a great atmosphere to chill out and enjoy the drinks and food. There is an outside roof area to check out the NYC skyline.

title: Wonderful Experience
text:
We stayed at the Mondrian in early December and it exceeded our expectations. It was a good location for us--easy access to the subway for travel to our various destinations. Our room was quiet and comfortable.
Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. Hector was an awesome resource when we needed directions to a location or restaurant suggestions. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again on our next visit.

title: Great stay!
text: We had a great stay over 3 nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and quite. We could enjoy our stay in New York City and thanks to the hotel location we could sightseeing every corner.

title: Nice new hotel in NYC
text: Nicely decorated modern new hotel on Park Avenue. Easy check in, however, we were given a queen bed instead of the reserved King.  Stayed on the 10th floor.  Narrow hallways but never saw or heard another guest!  The room was small but great use of the space.  Small couch and table, desk, and very nice bathroom with enough room to store your toiletries. Great shower, great towels. No coffee machine. Visited the bar, Fifteen Stories, and the drinks were great. Was not crowded for a Sunday night so service was great as well. Sunday morning at about 11;15 went to the restaurant for a mimosa and bloody mary but the bar was not open for drinks!  Overall great stay and would be happy to return.

title: Nice hotel for a good price, shame about the price of drinks
text: We stayed here from the 31st to the 6th of jan 2017-18. Staff were really welcoming and friendly.  Hotel was very clean, the room could have been a little bigger and our view was a white wall on the 14th floor, as we knew we wouldn’t be in the room we did not complain. The real annoying part was the price of the drinks. You do expect to get ripped off in hotels but the Mondrian went above and beyond. $25 for a vodka and coke. We looked at the wine list and on it was a $60 bottle of wine, cheapest there, that is only £6 in Asda. This for me stopped us from drinking at the hotel 800% on a bottle of wine, minus the currency, That is discussing.

title: Artfully glamorous but missing some essentials
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Mondrian. The location is so convenient to the 33rd Street stop of the 4 and 6, which made traveling easy. Staff are incredibly friendly. The lobby is beautiful and everything functions well. The rooms are gorgeous and cozy. My only gripe is that the beauty comes at the cost of some basics-- there's no coffee machine, no iron, no extra blanket for the chill of January. Aside from that, I enjoyed it, though.

title: Great location on Park Avenue South
text: Beautiful decor and great location on Park Avenue South.  Only issue was that I had reserved a Deluxe King room, and instead received a Superior King.  Upon expressing my concern to the front desk, the situation was not remediated.

title: Mondrian Hotel A+++++
text: I travel a lot to New York for work previously staying at Gramercy Park, Arlo & Public... This is definitely my new favorite hotel. The staff including the door men are AMAZING! Hotel is SUPER clean and bed was so comfortable I didn’t want to leave it. Can’t wait to be back in 2 weeks.

title: Phenomenal hotel, and awesome restaurant!
text: Came here for dinner / drinks on a Tuesday night, and was really impressed by the food, staff and decor! Will definitely be back in the future, and would happily stay at the hotel on any subsequent visits to NY.

title: Great hotel, great location...
text:
I’ve stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue a couple of times on business now and have to say that it is outstanding both in terms of quality and value.
The staff are all helpful, polite and courteous and the customer service and attention to detail is fantastic.
The rooms are all good size, clean and everything you would expect in a new hotel.
I’d definitely recommend choosing this hotel in New York - the location is also excellent for both business and pleasure..

title: Great New Hotel on Park Ave South
text: I stayed here on a Thursday night.  This is a great location for this very new and modern boutique hotel.   I thought the staff was super friendly and attentive.  I did not get to check out the amenities beyond the room.   The room was small but very well appointed, spotless, and the bed was comfortable.  The restaurant Cleo was closed for a repair the day of my stay but receives top reviews.  The Director of Rooms Leilani Nocon was especially helpful - for my next booking I received a double upgrade for being a returning customer.    I see a promising future for the Mondrian.  My only qualm was the pricing of the minibar items in the room.  Stay here, but get your drink downstairs!

title: Growing pains but definitely a very good new hotel
text:
Stayed at the Mondrian for six nights and will return monthly for the next 10 or so months.    Also had the pleasure/misfortune of staying there during the "bomb cyclone" winter storm which brought snow, wind and zero degree temps.   Yikes.

First, the hotel is new.   Everything looks crisp and clean.   We changed rooms after a couple of days to one with a larger bedroom area and, while the room was small, it was fine for two people.    And the bathrooms are gorgeous...white tile, glass walls...think iPhone bathroom.  :-)

The staff is also new and there are still some growing pains, as has been mentioned in other reviews.    They are all extraordinarily friendly, however, which something you don't always see in New York properties.

While I was there, a pipe broke in the basement and caused the restaurant and bar to be closed the entire time we were there.   The 15th floor lounge did open for a very basic continental breakfast each day, though.    It was very obvious that everyone was "winging it" but it was a rough situation and I can't fault the hotel for that.

Overall, (a) great rooms, (b) nice people and (c) fantastic Park Avenue location.     Will be back again and again.

title: Good location, new hotel, staff could use some training
text: The hotel is a very modern boutique hotel in a great location, cool art deco and mirrors in rooms. Nice bathroom. However, the staff is a little young and millennial and when I asked them for help in hiring a driver (yes, some of us still hire a car service vs. uber or cab), they stared at me like I was an alien. Also, when I asked them to take a tip up to the room for the maid, once again clueless looks. But overall, the hotel is cool and very clean and perfectly located.

title: Fantastico!
text: Accolti benissimo in questo bellissimo Hotel, camere e servizio fantastici! Letti meravigliosi, enormi! Il personale di una gentilezza lodevole, tutti molto giovani e professionali! Posizione centralissima a pochissimi passi dalla metro! Se dovessi tornare a New York, soggiornerei di nuovo da loro!

title: Chic hotel
text:
Stayed in this lovely hotel over the Christmas period. Lovely and helpful staff, the door men were exceptional with their local knowledge! Hotel room was very clean and well maintained. Bed was large and comfortable, shower was great with a choice of rainfall and individual shower head. Overall great stay, although a false alarm with fire alarm on my first night was a little scary as I was in bed asleep. 
Late check out was offered and greatly received (as I’d been out partying until 4am!)
Restaurant was also very pleasant and offered a good variety of dishes and some lovely wines. Hotel is in a busy part of Manhattan but windows certainly keep the noise out. Subway is a short walk away, and 10minutes to either the Flatiron or Empire State Building by foot. Really wonderful hotel! Throughly recommend!

title: Excelente serviço com algumas ressalvas!
text:
Estivemos hospedados no Mondrian no réveillon 2017/2018.

Os serviços do hotel são muito bons. Vários mimos da gerência e principalmente os serviços do Hector que nos auxiliou com as bagagens e sempre cordial em tudo seja com informações ou nos auxiliando com compras, etc.. 
O quarto é bem confortável, limpeza muito boa e estrutura adequada. A localização é privilegiada perto de tudo em Manhattan.

O estacionamento é caro e fica externo ao hotel. Ao pedir o carro demora-se de 30 a 45min.  A recepção é bem pequena e não existem áreas de uso comum. Ou seja, se você chegar antes e precisar aguardar na recepção para o check-in, ficará desconfortável. Há um restaurante no térreo e um lounge no 15o. andar porém com custos bem altos.

A opção é muito boa com as ressalvas principalmente do estacionamento caso você vá de carro.

title: Felt like home  for me & my pet.
text:
This place made me feel at home. I live only 2 blocks away but my building lost heat and needed a place to stay pronto. I immediatly thought of this spot because i LOVE the restaurant Chleo  & the doorman and are always nice when i walk by with my dog. 
When i arrived the front desk  was very nice,  accommodating & patient with me while i vented about my heat issues. 
The room i stayed in was designed nicely, small, very clean and just perfect for me and my dog. My dog got a very lovely bed to sleep in, she was delighted. 
The next day i headed out for a walk only to be met with new front desk team and they were just as warm and friendly. 

I work in many hotels each weekend as a wedding hairstylist and this hotel really impressed me. 
Great Price, Great Staff, Great Location. Great restaurant on site. 
ENJOY.

title: Viaggio di nozze nella Grande Mela
text: Abbiamo soggiornato una settimana in questo ottimo hotel. Subito un piccolo problema con la carta di credito per il plafond mensile non ancora ripristinato gestito con cortesia ed efficienza dalla giovane manager (credo Jennifer). L’albergo, struttura moderna e di recente ristrutturazione, si trova su Park Avenue a due passi dall’Empire St. B., quindi in posizione centrale rispetto a Manhattan e a due passi dalla metro. Ottimo per visitare a piedi tutte le zone di Manhattan, da lì facilmente raggiungibili. Come se non bastasse su Park Ave. passano taxi in continuazione. Nelle vicinanze è possibile trovare un’ampia scelta di locali di ogni genere e categoria per colazione, pranzo e cena. L’hotel ha inoltre al suo interno un ristorante/bar molto gradevole dove poter assaggiare la cucina mediterranea e fare colazione. Al 15mo piano c’è un lounge bar e c’è anche un bar al primo piano interrato che non abbiamo visto. Direi quindi ideale per ogni esigenza se non ci si vuole spostare dall’hotel dopo una giornata faticosa. Stanza al 18mo piano assolutamente notevole, silenziosa, moderna, spaziosa, sempre pulitissima e luminosa, dotata di balcone con una vista spettacolare dove ogni mattina vedevamo sorgere il sole (vedi foto allegata). La camera è dotata di ogni comfort o quasi, manca la caraffa per prepararsi thè e caffè per il resto veramente tutto: asciugamani a volontà, accappatoi caldi ed eleganti, set da bagno, asciugacapelli e televisore hd dove poter vedere parecchi canali e collegarsi dal proprio device e godersi Netflix e tt i servizi che sfruttano la tecnologia Chromecast se si è stufi di sentire parlare inglese 😂. Letto ampio è comodissimo. Non posso che lodare il personale: giovane, accogliente, cordiale, gradevole e molto efficiente. Menzione speciale per Jennifer, Leonela, Antoneta e Hector ma direi tutti di alto profilo professionale. Unico appunto, ma è veramente un dettaglio: hall non molto spaziosa e arredata con due improbabili finti sassi in plasticona nera che ne occupano metà dello spazio che dovrebbero fungere da divani e murales che con Mondrian non c’entrano molto. Per concludere tornerei sicuramente al Mondrian Park Avenue. Da notare che durante il nostro soggiorno le temperature sono state veramente glaciali e tornare in hotel dopo una giornata da girovaghi, nella nostra stanza nr 1802 è stato davvero un piacere unico!!!!

title: Hidden gem
text:
We recently stayed here a few days prior to Christmas as we needed to find a hotel room for our family of four on short notice. This hotel just recently opened so we felt very fortunate to have found this hidden gem!

Location: Amazing location - within walking distance to many attractions including most of the major holiday sights.  Right next to the Empire State Building.  Lots of great local restaurants to choose from, I especially loved the nearby Korean restaurants and cafes.

Room: I loved the design! Very clean, modern, and spacious (that is...spacious by NYC standards).  We have stayed in NYC hotels several times in the past and by far this was the most spacious room.  Lots of room in the shower with a dual shower head.  Crisp modern design but also very cozy and inviting.  

Staff: Exceptionally friendly staff - I felt I was welcome from the moment that I stepped into the lobby.  The front desk staff were courteous, professional, and efficient.  The doormen went out of their way to be extra friendly - even ensuring I had an umbrella for my frequent walks.  

Overall, I honestly could not believe our luck in booking such a great hotel in NYC on short notice.  We look forward to staying here again.   We did not get to fully explore the grounds or the restaurant so we are looking forward to checking that out on our next visit.

title: Hotel Maravilloso¡¡
text:
Es mi primera visita a NY, tenia otro hotel reservado pero no se como llegue al link de Modrian , y fue espectacular mi estadia. Hotel nuevo, camas y almohadas de lujo, baño extremadamente limpio con el piso tibio para caminar sin nada. Me senti fenomenal, mi habitacion tenia vista a Manhattan, sin ruidos Gracias por hacer mi estadia de fin de año Maravillosa.
Los empleados atentos a cualquier consulta, le doy las gracias a Stacy, Hafsah ( espero haberlo escrito bien) Hector y Gregory...

title: They stole my heart
text: I was in NYC, visiting dear friends, 3 weeks ago. I go there often but this was the first time I stayed at this property. It is small, elegant, understated, impeccable-- so, do not go there if you're looking for the typical NYC tourist trap monstrosity. The room was perfect. So was the service, the location, and ambiance. Unfortunately, in the middle of my visit, I suffered a horrific bout of food poisoning (from a cheeseburger I had at another hotel where my friend was staying). I spent a day and a half unable to move from my bed. The staff at the Mondrian, from the front desk to servers at in-room dining to bell boys, were angels to me during that time. In particular, Hector, one of the doormen, went out in the freezing cold to get me all sorts of things from a nearby pharmacy, delivered it with utmost concern, and followed up on me throughout the day. His concern was very comforting and a detail I so appreciated. Servers delivered towels, ice, ginger ale and offered to take me anywhere I needed. I am most grateful. It is these types of details that make all the difference in a world of cheap and impersonal consumerism. Recognition is highly deserved.

title: Great front desk staff
text: My experience during my second stay at the Mondrian within the past three months was even better than my first.  When I reported a thumping sound from music in the first room I was initially given, I was given a second, more quiet room immediately, and with apologies from the front desk staff.  The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are very clean, and housekeeping does its job in a timely manner.   Great customer service is clearly one of the key goals of management, and I very much appreciate it.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great Hotel, located in Manhattan on Park Ave and 30th Street, walking distance to time square and other New York City Attractions, hotel room was larger then other NYC hotels bed was comfortable, room service was great and quick. Hotel staff were professional. Hotel was very clean and modern looking. Would stay here again. I was on the 3rd floor you could here a bit of the noise of the city at night but it is New York.

title: Trendy, Modern and Ran like Clockwork
text: We had 3 kids aged 6, 13 and 16 in 2 twin room. It's our first time in NYC. For a hotel to have only opened for 2 months, it ran so smoothly and like clock work. Check in and out was less than 5 minutes. Jennifer was excellent in front desk. Jonathan and Fernando was always there to greet us with a smile every time at the door. The room service guys did exceptional job to make sure my 6 years old turkey bacon and toast comes right on time every morning just the way he likes it. Location was great as it's surrounded by excellent breakfast places. The access to Equinox gym was very good as I hate hotel gyms with very few machines. One last thing - the BEDS and PILLOWS are to die for! THANKS MONDRIAN NYC. We will be back.

title: Fabulous hospitality at trendy hotel
text: As a lifetime New Yorker, I had to check out the newest and hottest hotel in NYC. I was greeted by Hector who was extremely accommodating. He provided a tour of the hotel and was very knowledgeable about the area and latest events going on. I later returned with friends for drinks at Cleo. When I came back, I was shocked Hector remembered me by name. What professional and friendly service! Our bartender, Sharon, was fantastic and made some of the best drinks. Definitely looking forward to returning to the restaurant and hotel soon!

title: Super pleasant, modern minimalist hotel
text:
We decided to stay at the Modrian Park Avenue Hotel  for 3 night for the same price as two night at the  Park Lane from the 27th to the 30th and were glad we did. The front desk staff was amazingly friendly and always commented on our 3 and 6 year old girls  when we came and left. The room was modern and the bathroom average by NYC standards. The staff accommodated our every request. We had an amazing view of the Empire State building in room 2006. The doormen were youthful and always greeted us the a smile. The TV in the bedroom was huge. General strengths were the location ( two Starbucks within one block), one block to the subway, general cleanliness of room, Temperature control and comfortable mattresses and prompt room cleaning. 
The quote negatives were very minor. We had two double beds but honestly had our children been > 10 yrs old, the two double beds were too small for 4 older children/ adults. They were not queen size beds in our room.  The first day we asked for two additional bath towels as we had 4 people in the room and again had to ask for another one as they kept giving us < 4. There is no iron or ironing board, but one was supplied immediately upon request. We sensed that the people before us smoked cigarettes due to a mild unpleasant smoke scent. However, room service supplied us with a large electric air freshener and by the end of the stay it was almost gone. There is no gym and the rooms are in fact a bit on the small side

However, we really felt welcome and the stay was great. It is a great choice for couples and suspect that the double room is best for people who are not obese. We would stay again for sure. What nice people!!!!!

title: Gem on Park Avenue
text:
Had an exceptional stay at Mondrian Park Avenue on multiple occasions throughout the Fall. Here’s why :

Service. Everyone smiles, everyone pays attention, everyone is nice. And, mind you, they aren’t pretending to be nice... they mean it! Someone took their time recruiting a lovely group of people. It shows. Arva, the concierge, is particularly delightful. 

Rooms. The rooms are great! Anyone complaining about room size in New York City is foolish... I booked a Premier and it was fine. The beds are amazing, and I was happy to see they rolled out room service. Got a Mediterranean-style burger, fries and spicy cigars. Seriously good. 

Rooftop. It’s called Fifteen Stories and it was a nice, quiet civilized place for a cocktail... very much the opposite of...

The Club. Which is called Never Never. And you will never never get in looking like a bum, so dress to impress and be ready to do bottle service. It was an extremely cool space with a great vibe. They’re run separately from the hotel but I did not notice a lapse in service. Met Jeremy at the door, who was extremely accommodating. 

The Restaurant. It’s called Cleo, which has outposts in LA and Miami... Spot on with service, loved the food. Mediterranean with a few twists. Very much enjoyed!

I’m a huge fan of lifestyle hotels, and I must say that these guys hit it on the nose. Everyone smiling, everyone on top of it, doing their job. Would come back for sure! Snatch those rooms up before rates skyrocket, because they will!

title: Great weekend stay
text: From the time I arrived, everything was perfect. Hector greeted me, and was very friends and knowledgable about the property. The place was clean and central. The highlight was when we grabbed drinks and apps at the bar! The food and service were 5 star (Sharon did a good job explaining all of the menu, making for a great meal)

title: 🎄 trip
text: First time stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue.  Great location, nice updated modern hotel, awesome amenities with excellent service!  Ordered room service a few times and was pleased with the food.  Only suggestion is larger coffee cups in the AM 😊

title: Life Saver
text:
My partner and I stayed here for several weeks while waiting for a visa application to be processed, and our stay at Mondrian Park Avenue could not have been better. From the bellmen to the concierge to the housekeeping attendants, everyone was warm and inviting and truly tailored their interactions with us to our unique situation as longer-term guests and made us feel like the hotel was our temporary home. We joked when checking out that we felt sad about "leaving our friends" because they went out of their way not just to make us comfortable but to make us feel normal in an otherwise abnormal and frustrating life situation.

I travel often for work and pleasure, and I could not give a better rating for Mondrian. Thanks, again, to everyone who made it an enjoyable stay.

title: A great hotel that should be better but is clearly trying hard
text:
This is a difficult review to write as we had some of our best and worst hotel experiences here. However, I would strongly recommend anyone looking for a midtown hotel should consider this place.

Its entrance is unconventional, almost hidden and the lobby level seems designed to be uninviting. Happily, though, our room was ready and we were checked-in very quickly. The room was very impressive. The king-size bed (Simmons Beautyrest) and the huge TV (with built-in Chromecast -yay!) were the highlights. Storage was largely open (I like that) but adequate as was the space in the room. Lots of USB sockets for charging - again  yay! We did not care there was no desk. Very nice art books, though. I cannot comprehend other reviwers enthusiasm for the bathroom. It is small. There is no bath (not a problem in itself). There is a wall mounted shower and a rain-shower. But these two showers do more or less the same thing. I read into the reviews that the wall-mounted shower offered flexibilty (I would have preferred wall-mounted horizontal jets and given how up-to-date the hotel feels almost expected them.) But no- we had two fixed vertical showers for no apparent reason. All the rooms are the same in this respect it seems. How dumb is that?! But clearly some customers don't mind. However, I firmly believe that the first priority of a hotel is to offer a good night's sleep and the Mondrian gets top marks in two respects. Firstly, the bed is so good we unzipped it to find out who made it.And secondly, the atmosphere in the room was so good we did not even look for air-conditioning controls - I think that is a first for me. However, there was a strange rolling noise from the courtyard five floors below us in the early hours. So our room (611) might not be ideal for light sleepers. Breakfast in the Cleo restaurant was among the best ever anywhere (pricey but there are two Starbucks, a Pain Quotidien and a Pret nearby) . Unfortunately, the rooftop bar is not the asset we thought it might be.

Our bad experience was on Christmas Day when we returned to find our room unmade and requested fresh towels. This experiience is unlikely to be repeated and the way the management (in the form of Alexander) dealt with it the next day was exemplary and gives me confidence that after a while this will be a really great hotel. It might be worth pointing out that we booked late and got a very good price. I confidently predict that this place will fill up and we will never get such a bargain again. Despite the showers I think it deserves to succeed.

title: Nice slick rooms
text:
Stay at the Mondrian Park Avenue for an overnight trip. Room was the "king deluxe" or whatever the next-step-up from a most basic room is. Good size room, though somewhat awkward layout. Most amenities you would expect were there, including many USB ports for charging phones, etc. Nice big windows in my corner room. Shower was FANTASTIC. Took a couple showers in less than 24 hours. 

I've never been to the Mondrian Soho, but have to the original in West Hollywood. If you're expecting a big, breezy lobby, you won't find it here! The lobby was tiny. I thought the lobby scene was a Mondrian trademark, but I guess not.

title: Absolutely fantastic!
text:
Stopped here last week for four nights so here goes with one of my detailed, honest reviews.

Location - it was our first visit to New York so we wanted a hotel near to all the main attractions. This is it! You are a 20 min walk from everywhere the only time you need to catch tube is to Statue of Liberty and Chelsea market. 

Staff- as expected in USA staff are amazing, polite, pleasant and helpful. Why can’t Brit’s be like this! Special mention to Mani and Jonathan they were great.

The room- the room had no view but to be fair we did t request one on the front so this was no problem, as it was on the back it was nice and quiet though. The room was spotless clean, amazing comfortable bed, great TV, beautiful bathroom . It wasn’t massive but was easily big enough for the two of us.
Just one thing to note it doesn’t have tea coffee facilities so if you want a brew when you get up in the morning you need take your own travel kettle. Suppose you could use room service but that gets expensive.

The restaurant - looks lovely but as we were room only we didn’t eat there so can’t comment.

Roof top bar- again lovely but we were out exploring the city so didn’t have a drink there.

In summary this hotel has great reviews and you can see why, it’s in a great location, it’s really new and modern which is what we like 
Definitely five star!  We will be returning to New York next year and will definitely be stopping here again.

title: 100% recommandé!!
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé, il est possible de se rendre à pied vers la plupart des points touristiques.
L'hôtel dispose également d'un "house car" très pratique les jours de froid quand on souhaite moins marcher!!
Les chambres sont très propres et agréables.
Et surtout le vrai point fort est "la team" du Mondrian Hotel!!! Hatsa, Stacy, Alex, Leilani, Jonathan, ils sont toujours accueillants, souriants, disponibles...... un vrai plus qui fait toute la différence et qui rend votre séjour tellement agréable!!
Sans hésiter j'y retournerai pour un prochain voyage à New York.

Nora

title: Honeymjoon before the Honeymoon
text: My daughter reserved a one night stay prior to our travel and I so appreciated a nice bottle of wine left by the Management team celebrating our nuptials on what was the coldest day of the year.  Thanks for adding to our special day.  Room was clean, quaint and comfortable!  Thanks for your thoughtfulness Mgmnt!!

title: Princess Nightingale Seamstress to the rescue
text: When I arrived from my flight from Zurich at the Mondrian NY - the front desk personnel were welcoming and kind.I asked where I might be able to get my tuxedo altered for an event that evening. They immediately introduced me to the magical seamstress in the hotel who altered the sleeves and buttons to perfection. Since this occurring I have stayed and brought 3 of my team to stay and now my family and i are staying this coming holiday week. Food at the restaurant is unique and welcomed for Manhattan . Manya is a wonderful ambassador for the Mondrian .... As for the gym it is amazing -  Mondrian comps your Equinox usage and is a 6 minute walk on the famous Park Avenue.

title: Holiday in new york
text: I stayed in the above hotel for a recent visit of 8 days in new york in november. The hotel was lovely in every way: luvly bedroom with a view of the empire state building from our room, beds v comfortable, luvly bathroom and the staff at reception v courteous and kind. The guys who help with d luggage and opening the doors etc at the hotel enterance hector and fernando and cant remember d other names were so so nice. Overall a very nice hotel but it is expensive and new york to eat out is costly also it wud b nice tonhsve coffee/tea facilities in your room but i would happily recommend this hotel i wss there with two friends. Clare armstrong

title: Lovely Stay
text: Staff could not be nicer and extremely attentive with out being intrusive.  A very nice room, well stocked with anything I would need. Although the hotel does not have a gym, they happily gave me passes to the Equinox down the street.  I would definitely stay at this lovely hotel again.  I do wish they had a bigger lobby but the rooftop bar/lounge and the connected restaurant make up for the lack of hotel communal space. Thanks to Daniel, the doormen and Stacy for an excellent stay!

title: Just OK
text:
This is a nice hotel but it is lacking some basic room amenities and has some teething issues. The staff are nice and very accommodating, however the rooms are small and quite basic when you break them down- no complimentary water, no coffee or tea maker, the sync function for the tv doesn’t work-we even had tech come up to look but he was unable to resolve the issue. 

It can also be very noisy, the walls seem quite thin as every time a door would slam we could hear it clearly from the room -on the 11th floor.

Can’t comment on the bar /lounge as we didn’t use it. 

Overall it was just ok , I don’t know that we would stay here again and I wouldn’t consider it a luxury hotel

title: Cool boutique type of hotel
text:
Our VRBO in Brooklyn fell thru, so at last moment we had to find a place in NYC during busy Holiday season. We decided to stay right in Manhattan and found the Mondrian online. Even with late booking, somehow we lucked out and got a neat room on top floor (20th).
A very cool place....we were able to walk to most venues/attractions. This is apparently a brand new hotel. The logistics are still a work in progress...but we were handled with great care. Jonathan and his brother Fernando cared for us during our weekend stay....they were real good, kind and informative. The rooms are a bit small, but nicely appointed, kinda of a chic European look. The shower stole the show, although the Park Avenue balcony and comfortable King bed came in strong seconds. We had a dinner at Cleo's, the hotel's restaurant, the menu was quite unique and the food was very good. The artwork within the bar and restaurant is quite extraordinary.
You won't go thirsty as we had cocktails, between our travels, at street side bar and a lovely 15th floor bar within the hotel.

title: Do not stay here! Staff hasn't been trained; hotel missing basic amentities!":
text:
Definitely my worst hotel experience EVER...and I travel a lot. From the start, I arrived at night and watched as the doormen didn't help my driver nor myself with 2 pieces of luggage from the car, through the entrance and to the desk.

The front desk manager (Alexander [--]) told me he didn't have a reservation for me (even though I had a confirmation). I requested a quiet room and was put in a corner room overlooking Park Avenue and 30th on a low floor next to MAJOR construction and steel plates. The windows have NO noise blocking elements, the room is without basic amenities like q tips and shower caps, the hotel is without a gym. My room was left uncleaned from 6am-5:45pm. When I called to complain, Christy, came to my room because apparently I would want to talk in person about my unmade room rather than receive a phone call about it. She suggested I go downstairs and grab a bite...which is exactly what people want to do after vacating their room ALL day beginning at 6am (and what we pay for too!)

Throughout my 3 night stay, my room was entered THREE separate time WHILE my DO NOT DISTURB sign was on my door (as thought it meant nothing). Each time, the person (Sorraya, Zalia, etc.) didn't think this was an issue. Alexander promised to have my room moved to a quieter area and rather than deliver on that ONE promise to make this experience better, he called to tell me he confirmed the wrong hotel dates upon check in and that I was leaving the hotel the day of my room change (even though, I was not and he was the same gentleman who checked me in).

Everyone on the staff kept saying they were 2 months old as an excuse for the mistakes and overall incompetence, but I don't think it's an excuse. I kept asking for a manager and kept hearing from assistant managers vs a GM or whoever was actually in charge (and this was 3 days of problems and requests for change). Cleaning a hotel room, allowing people to sleep with do not disturb signs, understanding simple requests...they're all pretty basic/common sense situations. I can't imagine this hotel doing well or staying around with the current staff for long. DEFINITELY AVOID!

title: VERY MODERN
text:
Stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue for one night.  The first thing I noticed about the place is its very modern structure.  the Place is very clean and the staff friendly.  the room we were in had a King size bed that took over most of the room.  However, it was good enough for our needs.  The bathroom was very clean and "sterile" as I said earlier...very MODERN.
if you're staying with a family, make sure that you have a room with enough space.  I certainly do recommend it.

title: WOW!
text: Very nice new trendy hotel. Welcoming, friendly and accommodating staff. Impeccably clean, comfortable, cozy room. Front men Hector and Fernando went out of there way to take care of us. If you have a chance stay here, we will again.

title: Convenient boutique hotel that is close to everything!
text:
I'm a fan of the sbe/Morgan hotel group from spending a few years in LA. They run excellent restaurants and bars. This is the first hotel under their management that I've been too.

We were looking for a weekend stay in NYC in December last minute... Yea... Surprisingly came across Mondrian at a surprisingly reasonable price. The Holiday Inn was more expensive... So of course we jumped on the opportunity. 

The location is really the most attractive part of this hotel. It's about a 10min walk from Penn Station and Grand Central, similarly to Bryant Park and Madison Square Park. Rockefeller Center was a nice 25min stroll up 5th Ave. K-town is next door for great Korean food and the options are endless if you go just a few streets uptown or downtown. There are several subway options within a 5min walking radius as well.

As with many things in Manhattan, things are small. Our deluxe room doesn't offer much walking room around the king size bed. The pillows are very comfortable but I could use a slightly thicker comforter. The bathroom is compact but I loved that they dedicated most of the space in there to the rain shower. We didn't watch any TV but that thing is huge, in an out of proportion way to the room itself. We had a window facing Park Ave and had no issues with noise, but there is an ever slight cold draft that is just noticeable.

As for other amenities in the hotel, we only checked out the restaurant Cleo downstairs for dessert and cocktails which were decent. They also have an upper floor lounge and an basement bar.

Things that can be improved on: 
- This is the first hotel I've been to where there was no iron/board in the room. We had to call for them to bring it up and had to leave before it was able to be delivered. 
- My husband forgot his iphone charger and the kit they provide does not work at all.
- I know space is limited but there's no gym here. Thank goodness for Classpass...

Overall a nice boutique hotel in a great location. A solid choice to use as a base to explore the city but less so if you want a "stay in the hotel and relax" type of trip due to some limited amenities.

title: Very good service/brand new hotel
text: Very well located. The hotel is new. The rooms are comfortable and well thought. The service is very good and they have an agreement with a very complete gym two blocks away. Downstairs you have a fantastic restaurant, Cleo.  Showers could have more pressure

title: Wonderful respite
text: Spent a weekend at the Mondrian.  The staff was so friendly, most especially the doormen/bellmen Johnathan and Fernando!  Couldn’t have been more helpful or welcoming each time we passed in and out.  The room was very comfortable, well appointed and blessedly quiet.  Only one block from the 33rd St subway station and a very easy 15 min walk to Penn Station made it very convenient for us.  Nice view of the Empire State Bldg from our room.

title: Splendid!
text: At first we were hesitant to book this brand new hotel - We’ve had one to many unpleasant experiences and its just either a hit or miss scenario. This certainly was a hit! My wife and I have had our own share of travel experiences in line with our profession. We get to stay at all sorts of hotels from swankiest to cheapest and all. This hotel is different - looks complicated with all the art that surrounds the spaces, and a very nice affluent crowd in the next door restaurant, but once you set in you are greeted with genuine smiles - young crew with great attitude. We were upgraded to a much larger room with a balcony overlooking the East of the city, really comfy bed with oversized pillows and the biggest telly by far in a hotel. The only thing we missed is having a tub. But what really sets it apart from others is their staff. We had to utilize their expertise one night when my wife craved for pizza - no food service late at night. One call, within 20 or less minutes, food delivered, done deal. The best part, they gave us a whole pie and was complimentary - for the “inconvenience” from the hotels general manager. I would have willingly paid but they took the extra step to satisfy us by doing this. Certainly above and beyond! This hotel is by far on top of our list. No pretensions just a humble genuine and dedicated service provider to their customers. We will definitely be back with our children in the summer.

title: A Dream
text: My partner and I have been staying here for an extended period of time (due to a botched relocation) and our experience could not be better. The entire staff has been unbelievably warm and accommodating. I’ve traveled a lot and stayed in many hotels and this has been truly above and beyond. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed, the restaurant is great, the location is very convenient, but, as with most things, it’s about the people- and that’s what makes them really stand out. Couldn’t recommend it more.

title: Great stay in a new NYC hotel
text: Super clean, brand new luxury hotel in great location (30th and Park). Rooms are decorated nicely and staff is very friendly. Amazing shower for an NYC hotel. This was a quick business trip but I will plan to stay here again for my next visit.

title: Sweet spot!
text: Yes, the hotel exceeded my expectations.  First of all it is brand new (opened Q4 2017) and everything is stylish and shiny.  The staff are extremely friendly with no attitude.  The doormen recognize all the customers (special thanks to Hector and Jonathan and the front door who are always smiling -- + there was 1 more doorman that i forgot to note his name).  The hotel is not trying to be trendy.  It is just plain stylish and very functional.  Very central and fantastic location is a huge bonus. Only to note that the small rooms are probably a bit too snug for 2 guests.  Better to get a larger room to accomodate 2. i would definitely return.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
THE BEST HOTEL AND STAFF!!! Love the location. 
If In NYC this is a must hotel to stay. Very clean hotel, rooms are comfortable and neat.  Beautiful rooftop view, steps away from Empire State, one of the best restaurants (CLEO) and great night club.

title: Christmas experience staying at the Mondrian
text: We stayed at the Mondrian Park Hotel as a base to see the Christmas window displays and had a great experience.  Hasfa, Fernando, and Raphael could not have been nicer or more helpful;  We had a very comfortable bed and the artwork theme was fun and sophisticated, I just wish that they had a coffee maker in the room, but the room service coffee was really great.  I would stay there again in a minute.  The rooftop bar was very cozy and inviting.

title: AMAZING experience would definitely go back!!
text:
I am not one to ever leave a review, but I have to say that my experience there was worth it! Staff was very nice, rooms were comfortable and location is by far the best! The hotel offers you access to the club Never Never which has karaoke night and has a great bar and selection of alcohol. They also have an amazing rooftop bar 15 Stories that has great view, comfortable seating, delicious cocktails and food and good vibes all around. The hotel has everything you need to host a group of friends for events like birthdays. And let's not forget the restaurant Cleo in the hotel. The food was incredible 
 and the service was great! Location is ideal for anyone visiting because it is so central to everything and easy to take public transportation or car service. I am so happy with my stay and can't wait to go back! Highly recommend staying here!

title: Good option in South Manhattan
text: This is a new contemporary small hotel in South Manhattan. Metro stations are nearby. uneventful check-in and out. The in-hotel has little options for breakfast, but there are many options around the hotel. Good wi-fi connection. This is a good option for a NYC stay if all you need is a base in the city.

title: Beautiful hotel, perfect location.
text:
A friend recommended this new hotel on Park Avenue - perfect location! 34th street shops are just a few blocks away and close to many great restaurants like Upland and Wolfgang. Beautiful new hotel with great interiors and amenities.

Tried the roof top after dinner but they seemed to be very busy so we went to Cleo instead. It was packed but service was great! Good wine selection! 

Although the only available room had two beds, I didn’t mind. Lots of space in the room but the real bonus was the view of the Empire State Building.  Thanks for the upgrade! I will definitely stay here again.

title: Simply the Best!
text: Wow! First time I stayed here last month I was impressed as I had a problem with the shower and the Engineer came to my room could not have been more gracious helping  me!  He was so helpful and kind.  My second stay the team at the front desk remembered me and was greeted by name. Must try Cleo their restaurant it was amazing!! Can’t wait to return a must stay on your bucket list!

title: Great Scene Great Food!
text: As we entered Mondrian Park Avenue, we were greeted by a very friendly doorman. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming... people were all smiles. Cleo in Miami is one of my favorite restaurants and I was excited to hear that they were opening one in New York. It did not disappoint... Everything was on point - from service to food. What an amazing experience! Must visit!! The hotel looked lovely and will recommend to visiting friends and family out of town.

title: Rough start with a great ending!
text: Hotel is nicely furnished and new - the lounge on the 15th Floor is small but the food and cocktails were great! Rooms are loud, but I suppose I am accustomed to that, having lived in NY.  We were awoken to a false fire alarm at 430 in the morning, and then they lost my room service breakfast order...but they were quick to bring it up once they identified the mistake and they did refund it after being asked to.  The bellhop on the way out, Hector, was fantastic however!! He noticed my broken foot (and my muttering out loud about a Lyft driver’s delay)  and promptly whisked me and my bags into a limo/black car to get to work, courtesy of the hotel.  All in all, the hotel is nice and will hopefully work out the service issues with room service etc but the door staff was fantastic in their recovery!

title: Love this hotel!
text: I spent the weekend at the new Mondrian on Park Avenue with my husband. We were thrilled with our overall experience. The hotel is brand new (smells delicious, very cool decor and clean and nicely renovated rooms) and the staff is friendly and super experienced and professional. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel (Cleo) and even went down to the club/lounge located in the basement which had such amazing dance music and a very cool vibe. We will definitely be back for our next trip to New York in the Spring. We highly recommend this place!

title: perfect quick NYC getaway
text:
I'm always cautious that brand new hotels will look great but the service won't be.. But this was not the case. The hotel is beautiful, the staff are friendly and on their A game. It was a great place to hang out and invite friends when I wanted to do that, and also great to come back to after a long day in the hustle and bustle that is New York.
Thanks guys, I'll be back !!!

title: Great hotel and staff!
text:
I absolutely loved my stay at the Mondrian and would love to help promote it in any way.  Typically, I stay near the Meatpacking district as our offices are in Chelsea but soon as I had the chance, I moved out of the hotel(s) that I usually stay there - Gansevoort, Dream, etc.

Mondrian was much more down to earth, not pretentious and the staff that helped check me in as well as answer my questions were really on top of their game.  For example, I had asked if the hotel had a lint remover (pretty standard question) and didn't have to ask twice before someone brought it up to my room.  Whereas, at the other hotels even though we are a corporate client, I felt brushed off and just a number (not a guest).  They also lent me an iPhone charger which was critical in helping me continue a business call.  I did not expect such service since I'm very much used to the transactional nature of some of the larger name brand hotels I just mentioned.

I just wish I could remember who was all at the front desk to thank them.

title: Gorgeous boutique hotel
text: I was in nyc on business and stayed at Mondrian. The hotel is gorgeous and sleek. Customer service was a 10 with everyone beyond friendly. The rain shower was a particular delight. Hotel also offers a rooftop bar and restaurant.

title: A new NYC favorite!
text: I travel to NYC a lot (10-15 times a year) and have been looking for a new favorite hotel.  I think I may have found it.  Good price which I hope continues to stay somewhat reasonable considering this is a luxury hotel.  New, clean, good location. Very nice rooms, comfy beds.  The staff was very nice, very helpful and seem committed to making customers happy.  I only stayed two nights but plan on coming back twice in December which will account for 6-10 nights.  Will update after that longer stay.

title: Brand New Hotel
text: Great facilities in room and great place to base yourself from.  Biggest smart tv I’ve seen in a room!  Mini bar and safe & great fast Wi-fi . Bathroom small, but functional great to headed waterfall shower in deluxe room.

title: Fun, relaxed gem of a Hotel in great Manhattan location
text: From the moment you walk in, you feel the eclectic vibe -- the valet staff dress like Ratpackers (loved it!).  Everyone is welcoming and warm.  The rooms are small, but well appointed with books and art about NYC and, of course, Mondrian himself.  The bathrooms are large in proportion to the room and have a rain shower option.  I snagged a 19th floor terrace, and enjoyed my evening wine and morning coffee with a front row seat to NYC.  There is even turn down service in the evening - so use the DND card if this is not your thing (it is my thing -- I love the attention).  If you are planning a longer stay with lots or wardrobe changes, you may want to ask if they supply portable racks.  The closet (really just an open box with hangers and shelves) in my room could not accommodate much in the way of hanging clothes.  However, there was room in the bathroom for a rack if they are available.   I did not get to try the restaurant or bar, so I have reserved my final star.  Also, if you use the valet parking service, make sure you understand the pricing.  I did have an issue, but a manager immediately corrected it to my satisfaction.  This hotel is celebrating its Grand Opening (re-Opening?) and offering great deals right now!  I rated it "Mid-Range" pricing, but I don't know how long that will last.  Take advantage!

title: Great value
text:
We usually stay at the Lotte Palace but it was booked for Thanksgiving weekend. I chose the Mondrian because I received an email alerting me of a grand opening special at the Mondrian. Based on traveler feedback, I decided to give it a try. 

The hotel is centrally located off of Park and 31st street. This is a small hotel. There is no lobby and it has a small restaurant, Cleo, next to the hotel check in area. We booked a double room for our family of four. This room will work well for 2-3 people but it's tight for 4. The bathroom is a nice size with a great shower. All of the bathroom toiletries are top notch. The beds are very comfortable, with top rate linens. There is no closet in the room, just a small area to hang some of your things.

I give it a 4 because it's missing some of the features I would expect from a 5 star. There's no lobby, no gym and only one restaurant. Cleo is okay. I feel like they were still working out the kinks when we are there. 

All of the staff is lovely, they all deserve high marks for being so courteous and helpful.

title: Great value for a fancy NYC hotel!
text: Stayed here for 6 nights (mother & daughter from Sydney Australia) Firstly the staff were incredible, especially Hector and Steve who greeted us so warmly when we arrived after a long flight & remembered us throughout our stay always suggesting ways to integrate with the city. Rooms were good size for a NYC hotel. Food in the hotel excellent. Aesthetics & design carefully constructed, offering spurts of inspiration & disconnect form the real world outside (or your own!) Hotel walking distance to everything you need, even the smaller pockets like Lower East Side, East Village, Chelsea & Gramercy. Amazing coffee only 2 min walk away at Cafe Marchio, where you fee like you are in Rome. We loved this hotel, everything about it and would highly recommend it!

title: Perfect!!
text:
Everything in the hotel was just what I need as a traveller - smiling staff (entrance doors are too heavy so they do a lkt of excercise while opening them), kind receptionists, good smell ( not common in NYC) welcoming room, very clean, a great shower and a very comfortable bed. Even coffee was good (relatively to US coffee).

Thank you staff and keep on doing a good job.

See you soon.

title: Beautiful modern hotel
text: Just got back from a 4 day trip with my gf.  From the minute we walked through the door the staff was friendly and accomodating.  The rooms are beautifully decorated in a modern vibe.  There are black out blinds so you can get great sleep if you like a dark room. Pretty roomy for NYC.  The hotel is new so the mattresses are great to sleep on.  The location could not be better.  (30th and Park).  So central we walked everywhere.  We went up to the rooftop for drinks and that was a lovely spot as well.  Great cocktails (pricey).  The best part was the staff. Jonathon and Fernadez were so helpful and full of information.  The rest of the staff also great.  I have been to NYC many times and stayed at many different hotels and I would 100% stay in this hotel again.

title: Brand New & Beautiful
text: Beautiful hotel and design! Located in a convenient area on Park and 30th. I was able to walk easily to the Subway and directly to many destinations. The hotel was brand new and still had many services available. Their 15th floor lounge was great for meeting with my co workers and had a well put together drink menu. I just wish they had heat lamps to enjoy the balcony. Decor was clean and Piet Mondrian inspired. I highly recommend this hotel and will look to stay again soon!

title: Idyllic stay on Park Ave.
text: The location was perfect, the ambiance divine.  Wonderful amenities and attentive service.  Loved the upstairs lounge and patio with picturesque views of NYC.  Even though the hotel is brand spankin' new, they seemed to have it all figured out from day one.  Plan on staying again soon for future business & pleasure trips to NYC.

title: Tremendous stay!
text:
Oh! Time buzzed by and I only now got to my review.
Life is all about people's interaction and location, this place delivers. 
I like its hip, but understated elegance. 
Front desk staff are lovely and helpful. Thank you, Jennifer, Stacy, Vincent and Mafsah, you made me feel so welcome from beginning to end of my stay. 
The sharply dressed doormen were equally charming and helpful, especially pushing those gorgeous heavy doors. 
I loved petrified forest decor at the lobby, though a bit small, however, take the elevator to the 15th floor, wow! A beautiful bar and roof top terrace, I feel a possibility of a summer time party up there. We did visit the basement nightclub and bar, very fun. 
Had lunch at the restaurant, served by the sweet and kind staff, people who are happy to be there, and why should they not, hosting us in such fine place with delicious choices of Mediterranean fare. 
Ok, I stayed at the 19th floor, what a fabulous view, with a balcony, I felt very privileged. The room was well decorated, the bathroom offered a delicious shower, and the bed was yummy too. The room was not very generous in size, neither in closed space. But perfect for a love's holiday.
Anyway, I hope to return again and again.

title: Having some serious growing pains
text:
We stayed recently at the Mondrian Park Avenue hotel.  Although the hotel's decor and accommodations are nice, the staff seems to be experiencing some serious growing pains.  In addition to telling us three times that things were open in the hotel like the restaurant and bar, both were closed earlier than we were told.  On one of those occasions, we were also told by the host in the restaurant that there "were other places around the neighborhood where we could get breakfast."  I think that in a city like New York, that is fairly obvious -- I found that to be an unacceptable response.  In fairness, the manager offered to comp us our breakfast the next morning, only to have it show up later on my bill.  They have since said that they removed the charge from my credit card -- we will see.  In addition, on one morning, it seemed that five or six staff we just standing around at the front desk really not doing too much.  It was at that point that I heard another gentleman tell one of the front-desk staff that he didn't get the coffee he was promised.

I understand that the hotel recently opened but they really need to get their act together in terms of overall service.

title: Great New Boutique Hotel
text: First time here and loved it! Great, friendly service, nice restaurant attached, beautiful room and the most amazing shower. Check in and out was quick, friendly and easy. Even the elevator has nice touches! Location was perfect for the meetings I had to get to. Definitely going back!

title: Great New Hotel- 5 Stars for Style, Service and Location!!
text: Mondrian Park Avenue is one of the newest additions the city.  Centrally located which is always convenient, the property is ultra hip and cool, without being pretentious.  The service and staff were amazing without being in your way.  Cleo, the restaurant on the ground floor offers a great breakfast and their dinner menu is worth hitting up multiple times. I did not have the opportunity to go to their roof top bar, but from what I saw, the views are amazing.  Will be back for sure!  Oh... and the views of the Empire State Building from our rooms was magnificent.  The TOTAL NYC experience.

title: Beautiful new hotel
text: I've stayed for the first time in Mondrian and was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is new, rooms on a smaller side but very comfortable, and the best part was great bathroom with large walk in shower (I really don't like bath tubs in hotel rooms and much prefer walk in showers). The staff was very friendly and very helpful. I needed late check out time and got it without any problem (and without additional payment). Had a great dinner at hotel's Cleo restaurant. Highly recommended if you look to stay at that part of the city.

title: Star on Park avenue!
text:
Spent a weekend at the brand spanking new Mondrian Hotel.It is ideally located on 30th st and Park Ave, a central location if you are planning to go uptown or downtown.The design is very modern and cool with white marble with unfinished edges at the reception ,bar and in the bathrooms.The staff at reception are really friendly and go out of their way to make you feel  welcome. A Special shout out to Antonetta and Alex the guest managers  who went out if their way to accommodate me. 
The rooms are beautifully designed and easily compete with the top 5 star hotels in NYC.beds are extremely comfy with high end linen.  A large wide screen TV set up to include Netflix so you can chill! The bathrooms are kinda small but hey! this is New York, you want space you go  Central Park!
The restaurant serves Mediterranean cuisine, the Octopus was delish.The bartender made a real nice non alcoholic cocktail, served with  smile.
 A hotel is only as good as its  staff and its hospitality and the Mondrian has this in spades.Im planning on a return stay this Friday  to  say hello to my new friends.Keep up the good job, Guys!

title: Great Hotel - Exceptionally Friendly Staff
text: I have stayed here four times so far and every visit has been excellent.    The hotel itself is modern and clean with well-appointed rooms.   TV is excellent.    The people working there are outstanding.   I usually check in with Stacy and she is a ray of sunshine.    The guys at the door remember you and say hello.    A+ for personal customer service.   Have not tried the restaurant yet, but the rooftop bar is very nice:  The Gym is not onsite, but it is only two-blocks away and is an Equinox.     So far, really great hotel and I will stay again - in fact this week.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: Everything about this upscale hotel was great - location, staff (front desk - Stacy!!), room (superior king was large, clean and classy), quiet (room 1409).  Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will definitely return.

title: Excellent hotel for business stay
text:
I stayed for two nights on a business trip. 
Check in was a breeze with Vincent and Stacy at the front desk.
Hector was the jovial first face at the hotel, ever ready to assist and help with suggestions on local dining and entertainment options.
Overall very good location and the friendly staff made all the difference.

title: Excellent
text: Really enjoyed my days at the Mondrian, the staff was the friendliest and most conscientious I️ have had in the City. Will be my new home in midtown. If you like Mediterranean food the restaurant is really good.

title: Next level hospitality
text: It is a fantastic hotel to stay.  Young, fun, attentive, professional...everyone from porters to senior management is firmly committed to make guests feel good and at home. Rooms are comfortable, Cleo is great all round restaurant from breakfast to drinks and dinner.  What set this hotel as a next level experience from the pack are its amazing people.  Bravo.

title: Nice Chic Hotel
text:
Great location! Near nice and amazing restaurants, coffee shops & pubs!
Friendly and helpful staff!
Nice, comfortable and modern rooms.
Great rooftop!!!
Delicious Mediterranean Restaurant on the Lobby Level

title: Phenomenal hotel
text: My best friend and I took a girls trip to New York City and we stayed at the Mondrian. We were there within the first week of their grand opening and we were the first guests to stay in our rooms. Everyone was exceptionally professional from the front desk to the door attendants. Upstairs there is an incredible rooftop restaurant and bar and in addition breakfast is offered complimentary each morning which included fresh pastries from a local bakery and coffee and juice. Our rooms were adequate with a king bed and shower and a mini bar if you choose to indulge in alcoholic beverages or champagne or snacks. And my favorite amenity in the room was the shower! The shower is incredible it has the rainforest type nozzle and various temperature settings and water pressure options. The rooms were immaculate and the closet was perfect with open shelves for you to store your items. Also there is a turndown service provided in the evening wear housekeeping comes in midday and prepares your bed and closes the curtains for you. I will definitely rebook my stay upon visiting New York City again in the future loved it!

title: Location! Staff! Room!
text: Loved being in this new midtown hotel with my family.  Everyone (Fernando especially!) was friendly and informative.  Room was good size, well-equipped, clean and bright.  We walked everywhere--Park Avenue is a great street for walking downtown, uptown, or across.

title: Super Nice People
text: Super Nice People. Not very experienced in some points but one of the most polite people around. Especially Fernando Rodriguez and his team. The aria is Okay but there are better ones. Around Times Square or village...

title: very nice new midtown hotel
text: Was really pleased with everything at the hotel, from the friendliness of the staff (especially Leilani and Drita), to the comfort of the rooms.  Midtown Manhattan is not generally where i'd go to stay at a cool hotel but this place had a really nice vibe to it not typical for the area.  I didn't get to try the restaurant because I was there before it opened but they offered a really nice comp breakfast on their rooftop which is a great place to enjoy a coffee or a beer.

title: The whole package
text: I recently decided to stay at the Mondrian Park Ave, a brand new hotel in NYC, on the recommendation of friends.  What a beautiful, amazing hotel!!  The team here really knows how to take care of their guests....I felt like I was receiving head to toe royal treatment from the moment I walked through the front doors.  It's a beautiful space and the staff are all very friendly and eager to accommodate.  I slept like a baby in the oh-so-comfortable bed...I could hear the sounds of NYC beneath me but it was surprisingly quiet.  And the view?!  Phenomenal.  The rooms were very comfortable with super cool decor, the rain shower was heaven, the quality of linens as good as it gets....and there was a fun selection of tasty snacks in my room which is always a nice surprise.  This hotel really hasn't missed any of the small details.  It's luxurious, it has a cool hip vibe, the staff are incredible, the dining and nightlife options leave nothing to be desired....it's perfect.  Five stars for Mondrian Park Ave, you apparently aim to please....and that you did!  You exceeded all of my expectations and I can't wait to return.

title: Great new boutique hotel with outstanding guest service!
text: Stayed at this property two weekends in a row. Entire staff is very focused on the guest from the time you check in until the time you depart. Restaurant  Cleo is very good as well as the roof top bar.  Our new favorite hotel in NYC! Great location.A must visit when in New York.

title: The doormen's hats
text: We stayed at the Mondrian a few days after it opened.  The hotel was lovely and very quiet.  The check in staff was great and we really loved the doormen in their cool fedoras! Always willing to help find a cab or with directions.  Looking forward to returning and trying the restaurant.

title: Beautiful Hotel and Aaazing Staff
text: The Mondrain just opened a few weeks ago and it is beautiful! The staff is very nice and helpful. They make you feel very welcome. My friend accidentally spilled a drink all over me and I was soaking wet.  The staff was super helpful and got me a hairdryer from maintenance so I could dry my jeans in the bathroom.  My night would have been otherwise ruined!  Eric Liebhart the manager at the 15th floor bar is fantastic!  A must go!

title: Luxury and Superb Customer Service!
text: Just came back from a trip to New York, we chose Mondrian because it looked Hip and beautiful! It did not disappoint, the rain shower is divine... shower big enough for 2! Rooms are lovely, the Premiere is a great size for 3 or even 4 comfortably. The King room is beautiful as well, nice windows, and views. The beds are so comfortable you won't want to leave it ! The staff at the Cleo downstairs bar are so fun and welcoming! The food is amazing, no need to worry about finding a restaurant! Thank you Sevastian, Joey, Michael Latasha for a great time! The desk and doormen are always smiling and helpful, Thank you Stephen, Fernando! Couldn't have been nicer! Not once did I open a door entering myself, they are always right there! Desk staff was great as well, remembering our names and ready to help, Thank you Hopsfah... ! Great experience and great staff! Will stay again!

title: Super
text:
Extrem freundliche und hübsche Mitarbeiter die wirklich sich Mühe geben , vergleichbar mit 4 Jahreszeiten in Europa 
Die Lage ist wunderschön . Die Zimmer klein aber in Verbindung mit der gesamt Umgebung sehr charmant . Empfehlenswert

title: The best new NYC spot hands down !
text:
This is a brand new terrific hotel!
The hotel is a in a great location , close to all but in a nice quiet area.
The staff is perfect , the rooms are brand new, spotless and very comfortable.
The 15th floor lounge has a great space and a nice vibe.

title: Weekend in NYC
