text: Brand new hotel, very helpful and friendly staff. Roof top is nice too, great for a weekend trip! An iron would have been nice but otherwise no complaints. Location is in midtown Park Avenue and E31st, our room overlooked the Empire State building which we loved!

title: The staff here are amazing!!!
text:
My curb-side greeting was what started this awesome experience at Mondrian Park Avenue. 

Staff are superb in every way and in every department, from front desk to concierge to even the linen porters. 

Rooms are small but no smaller than the rest of New York. Great selection of in room amenities. 

15 stories is the roof top bar with great views and yes, great staff. Hotel has just opened so the bar wasn’t too busy.   

Good location and easy to get around. Thanks Mondrian. See you again soon.

title: Amazing!
text: This hotel was excellent.  The staff was super friendly and the rooms are brand news.  The terrace upstairs is great to get a feel of the city and enjoy a free continental breakfast.  The restaurant Cleo downstairs if pretty yummy too.  I would defiinitely stay here again.

title: well worth the move ! great hotel and great service !
text: moved over from the James hotel which was not ready for prime time. mondrian totally exceeded my expectations from the super nice room, big modern bath, nice lounge on 15 with super friendly and accommodating bartender and valet Jonathan Guzman went out of his way to get me transportation and help with bags and direction....such a breath of fresh air not always found in NYC. I will be back!!!

title: Great NYC Hotel!!
text:
My daughter and I frequent NYC pretty often.  We rented 2 rooms for my cousins and ourselves for his birthday weekend and needless to say... "Our stay was amazing!!" (a quote from the birthday boy). The staff was phenomenally accommodating from the moment we arrived.  The BEAUTIFUL front desk agent Hafsah greeted my daughter and myself with a very warm welcome and provided the best accommodations they could offer us once we let her know we were renting the other room for a relatives birthday.  Everyone was extremely professional and exhibited the best customer service I've received from a NYC hotel.  The door guys were very friendly with a terrific sense of humor as Jonathan graciously took a photo with me in his cool hat!! 

This hotel recently opened and they seem to be off to a great start. Their modern chic looking hallways smelled good and the rooms were beautifully decorated with cool paintings and mirror decor in them. Pricing was GREAT for 2 rooms for a NYC hotel and convenient for us to get to travel to places we went for dinner to celebrate. 

I am only giving the Mondrian a 4 out of 5 star rating because there were minor things not available yet (we checked out before the opening of their restaurant) but the the rooftop bar and lounging area was a blast and great for photo taking.  

However, out of a 5 start rating for the staff I give them a 10!!  I will definitely stay again!!

title: Just ok....
text: When you pay a rate over $450 per night, you kind of expect a few conveniences - an iron and ironing board, a treadmill and maybe coffee. Well-l-l.... irons are on request and an affiliate fitness center is located a few blocks away.  They opened the new Mediterranean restaurant today and many items listed on the menu were not available.  Perhaps growing pains?  In all fairness, the doormen and the front desk agents were sincerely nice and very engaging.  They saved this review from being posted as a 1.

title: Amazing new Hotel
text:
I must tell you I stay in about a hotel a week in NYC for work! I've stayed in some amazing places but this hotel earns major points for its extremely cordial and helpful staff! They could not do enough for me! The rooms are not huge I had a room with 2 dbl beds, but that's typical for NYC... The room was very clean.
They have an incredible rooftop for drinks and lite bites.
It definitely seems like it will attract an upscale business crowd.
Location couldn't be better!
Front desk staff was the best of encountered in NYC especially Steven, Alexander and Soraya! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
The bellman on staff I don't recall his name but it was on 10/10/17 and he was amazing!
Can't wait to become a regular here! Hope I can get a Rez when I need it;)

title: Great start for a beautiful hotel
text:
The hotel was brand new when I stayed last week, so I feel the reviews SHOULD all be great at this point.  Bad reviews in week one don't bode well for the future - so kudos to the Mondrian!  I gave four starts solely because I travel constantly for work and I've stayed in 1000+ hotels in my life so it takes a lot for me to give five stars.  

Hotel was comfortable and the staff was absolutely stellar.  Beds were great.  Stacy and Hafsa at the front desk were amazing.  I can't remember his name, but the friendliest concierge in the world with the beard was just adorable.  Door guys were all smiley and chipper.  Staff gets five stars for sure.

Bathrooms were a bit snug, but there was some counter space and a shelf for the ladies to put their various items.  Showers had great water pressure AND had the option for the rain shower or wall shower head.  They have a complimentary driver that will take you anywhere within 10 blocks of the hotel, which came in handy going to Penn Station really early in the AM.  

The restaurant was open so I cannot comment on that.  They did offer continental breakfast for us since there was no restaurant, which is always nice (even if it was a little basic.)

As with most hotels in NY, there is the noise from the street no matter what floor you're on.  That all can't be helped b/c NY is unbelievably noisy at all times of the day.  BUT, if you're staying for work, you may want to request an interior room.

title: Major Disappointment
text:
I am currently a guest at Mondrian Park Avenue, and to say I’m disappointed would be an understatement. While looking for potential hotels to stay at during my visit to NYC, the 5 star rating this hotel earned by every single reviewee seemed too good to be true, and indeed it was unfortunately. Check-in went smoothly, and I was escorted to my room by the doorman, Manny, who turned out to be the most helpful of all staff members. 

I booked a premium king room, and I find it to be small; the unnecessary placement of 2 chairs, a couch, and 2 tables in the same space don’t help at all with making it seem larger. The bathroom, on the other hand, is even smaller— only 1 person will comfortably be able to fit inside at one time. The room was not prepared at all. There were no racks to place my luggage, and even worse, the bed had hair strands that certainly did not belong to me because I have black, not blonde hair. I also found eyelashes & pieces of string between the sheets. In addition, I found more strands of hair stuck in the shower drain, and the sink + shower were wet even though I haven’t used them. My first impression of the room made me doubt the cleanliness of the hotel— my utmost priority. After speaking to a member of the housekeeping staff regarding what I observed in the first 10 minutes of my arrival, he told me that the manager will be informed right away. I waited for more than 30 minutes, and yet no one got in touch with me whatsoever. Following a very long wait, I headed to the lobby, only to be greeted by Manny that asked about how I found everything so far. After explaining everything to him and showing him the hairs + threads that I’ve found, he’s the one that took action. He’s the one that apologized for the poor cleanliness & saught to ensure I was satisfied, not anyone else in the hotel. I was transferred to the same room type, but on a different floor. This is the first “luxury” hotel I’ve been to that offers no complementary water in the rooms and no bath slippers. In addition, I would hardly refer to the turndown service as being considered one to begin with according to luxury hotel standards; the only change made in the evening is that the curtains are shut— lights aren’t dimmed, small touches like chocolates or water by the bedside table are neglected, and the bed isn’t made. Not only that, but the walls are too thin; yesterday night, I couldn’t sleep because I could hear the guest next to me speaking on the phone, people chatting in the halls, as well as music being played. 

On my down to the lobby during my first day here, I heard people in the elevator discussing how big of a disappointment the hotel is turning out to be. I didn’t want to believe it because I made the decision to stay here rather than at the truly luxurious, 5 star Langham Place just 10 minutes away. They were right though—absolutely right. My stay here is turning out to be such a disappointment, and I cannot wait for it to come to an end.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Stayed at the Mondrian for two nights and the service was great. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and always willing to help. Received a complementary upgrade and early check in upon arrival. The bed and shower were great and it helps that everything is brand new! Only complaint was the lack of housekeeping during the day when we arrived back to our room around 4pm. However the turn down service staff quickly took care of it as we left our room for dinner. 

Looking forward to staying here again in the future with the new bar and restaurant openings.

title: Great new hotel addition to New York
text: Just stayed at Mondrian. The hotel was just 3 days into being open. While the restaurant for example was not open yet, the experience  - customer service, hotel room, ambiance - all was top notch. The rooms are tastefully appointed, quiet, and comfortable. The lounge on the top floor has a fabulous view and is a great place to do some computer work. There is a bar and one can order a few light bites. I would like to see more food options, but overall, just great. I will stay at Mondian again.

title: Amazing
text:
Was so lucky to stay at this hotel in it’s opening week! I stayed in a Balcony suite with a gorgeous view over Park Avenue. 

The reception team was efficient and friendly, and the rooftop was gorgeous!! Breakfast every morning was so nice. Will stay again next time I’m in New York City.

title: AMAZING!!!!!
text:
What an impressive team and experience at Mondrian Park Avenue!! I cannot say enough how amazing the service was!! 

The concierge team was perfect - they arranged us tickets to Kinky Boots, and recommended some very cool places in the West Village. This is my new home in Manhattan!!!
Steve C

title: Blown Away
text: For a hotel that has only been open for 1 week, I must say, they exceed all expectations of a 5 star property. The staff, from the bellmen and front desk agents, to the housekeepers, were all incredibly friendly and willing to ensure I felt like royalty from the moment I walked up to the front door. Do not even get me started on the room and bedding. I could not bring myself to get out of bed every morning. A very special shout out to the housekeeping department for doing an amazing job cleaning my room each day. Not only was every detail of the room cleaned head-to-toe, but the turndown service at night was so relaxing to come back to after a long day exploring the many iconic NYC locations nearby. I truly cannot wait to come back !

title: Lifestyle Luxury at its Best!!
text:
Great service throughout the hotel from all departments.  
Doorman and Concierge were on point each day, very good looking staff working at the Mondrian is a plus ;)
Housekeeping Service was impressive - Very clean and they organized my belongings daily.  Thank you all for making my stay wonderful for the week we spent there.

title: Amazing experience..
text: I recently stayed at the Mondrian Park Ave on Business for a week and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is new and clean, the room spotless and I slept like a baby in the cozy bed. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the complimentary continental breakfast served on the 15flr was delicious, not to mention the spectacular view. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again on my next trip to New York..

title: one fine stay...
text: they say do not judge a book by its cover... well, this one you can. what you see, is what you get - and more! what friendly service - when you walk in, you feel like you have been here.. it certainly felt like home. eager to show you around - its great to have people who still believe in the classic human touch! the roof was amazing... breakfast there was so relaxing - loved the furniture... the bedroom embraced me... I could not get out of bed - it was so quiet... the bathroom was simple but sweet - very spacious, clean - and thank goodness for the rain shower!  the mini bar was unreal - no, really - the chocolate gems were called Unreal and they were Unreal (healthy chocolate!).  thank you very much for a wonderful weekend... i will certainly be back - next time, with the kids!

title: Stayed over the weekend
text: We stayed at the Mondrian park on a weekend and absolutely loved our stay. The room was cozy and comfortable, and the artwork quite pretty. The front desk service was excellent, the doorman very kind and Alexander was very helpful. We will definitely be going there again!

title: THE PUNK OF PARK AVENUE...IN THE BEST WAY POSSIBLE
text:
The Mondrian is the outlier of the block. Its cool, vibey, and much more interesting than what we have been seeing lately from new hotels. The sleek check in space designed to be a meteorite crashing down from some post dystopian world, reflecting off the high glassed ceilings, along with the black resin sofa rocks in form of art, was a fabulous way to welcome their guests into a new mindset while experiencing check in...The staff were dressed cool, very attractive, and were super enthusiastic. Id also like to mention the music, hence "the punk of park avenue."  Its not common to hear A Tribe Called Quest, Blondie, Gang of Four, or Radiohead while roaming a beautiful luxury -lifestyle hotel in the middle of the city. There was just enough coolness at this Park Avenue address, which I was delighted to see and feel.

The rooms were obviously brand new, and well appointed. There were beautiful leather chairs, and fun art throughout the room, with very practical closet space and larger than normal all white bathrooms.  My rooms had a small couch and desk, and great use of mirrors as well...One of the better rooms Ive stayed in a while.

I also got to enjoy some great cocktails and bites on the roof top called 15 Stories. The room was sexy and the views are amazing. Cant wait to go back and experience it again. The restaurant and nightclub weren't open yet, but Im sure based on the other properties that Journal Hotels have, they will be a lot of fun.

title: Superb Stay Opening Week
text: I stayed at this hotel during opening week and it was an outstanding experience. The GM and his team have put together a great hotel combined with superb guest services. Every detail of the hotel has been well thought out and comes together to provide an unforgettable stay. The staff is outgoing and provides a uniquely tailored experience. The room I was in had a good view. Room amenities top notch and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. The hotel is located just a few blocks from world class entertainment and attractions. I highly recommend giving this property a try.

title: Amazing New Hotel
text: Had the pleasure of staying at this property over Columbus Day Weekend and was blown away by the staff, rooms and rooftop views. Location was convenient and nearby  all major attractions. Can't wait to revisit again once the restaurant is open

title: Amazing Stay During Opening Week
text:
We stayed at the Mondrian Park Avenue for a few nights during their first week in business. The hotel is beautiful and in the perfect location. Absolutely check out the 15th floor terrace lounge. The drinks were great and the views even better. I also don't remember the last time I slept so well in New York City.

The best feature of the hotel by far was the staff. Most hotels would (understandably) fumble a few times when they open. The Mondrian's staff didn't miss a beat and were clearly professionals. I was actually shocked when I asked how long ago they opened. They definitely operate like a team that has been working together much longer than a week. 

Keep up the great work!

title: Mondrian Stories...
text:
I am visiting from Europe and met with my boyfriend who lives in New York. We were not quite sure about this new hotel, but wanted to try something new. Mondrian Park Avenue did not fail.... we had the best time! They made it so special for us.. an amenity of New York selection was waiting for us. This lovely gentleman from the front desk took us to our room and made us feel at home. The rain shower was amazing!! I could not have asked for a better bathroom!! Hehe!! We enjoyed cocktails at their roof top - this is what we are looking for... a relaxing time overlooking park avenue!! The ambiance was just so relaxing - continental breakfast was also on the rooftop lounge and it was perfect! I never enjoyed coffee like it did over there!! Thank you Mondrian Park Avenue for a
Lovely time!!! Until we meet again!!!

title: Beautiful New Shining Star on Park Avenue
text: I was lucky enough to stay at Mondrian Park Avenue on it's inaugural night. You wouldn't know it was their first day based on the service and incredibly personalized help I received. The bellman Jonathan welcomed me enthusiastically and after a smooth and friendly check-in he took me to the room and showed me around. You can tell how proud of the rooms and the hotel he was. The artwork, the smart TV, the glass and chrome finishes and the amazing view of Park avenue with the sun setting. Everything was so well appointed and curated. I love the light in the rooms and the bed is super comfortable. This is true elegance but with a youthful energy that permeates everyone who works there. I loved the rooftop bar and can't wait for CLEO restaurant to open. I've been to the one in LA and can't wait to see what they do with it in NYC. Don't miss all the artwork in the lobby and the view of the mirrored ceiling. If you're an art and architecture lover this is the place for you. I can't wait to come back!

title: New amazing hotel on Park Avenue!
text: I am currently staying at Mondrian Park Avenue and I am loving it! Great views, comfortable bed! This hotel is dog-friendly and when I checked into my room, there was a bed ready for my dog with treats and toys from barkbox, such a nice touch! The 15th-floor lounge has sweeping views and the MPA Margherita was delicious. Special thank you to  Arva and Steven for all your recommendations. Congratulations Mondrian Park Avenue, you have the nicest staff! I will be back, can't wait to try Cleo and your Yours truly soon.

title: One for the books
text: I am smiling so much that I'm not sure If I can bring my very fingers to the keyboard to begin this composition! The Mondrian in New York checked all my boxes and created new ones to be fulfilled. The hospitality, the service, the location.... beyond me. I was greeted into the hotel by a warm, good-looking, friendly dark-haired woman who immediately took my bags and offered me a spritz (delicious, by the way). From that moment on, I texted my friend Julie back at home in Chicago saying she'd never see me again! I wanted to stay in that lobby forever. The rooms were modern-chic with a dash of color, but not too much to overwhelm my aesthetic experience. The food was tasty and the complimentary charcuterie inside the room was inspiring. The artwork... everything you want to feast your eyes on and more. I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking absolute and utter excellence. See you soon, Mondrian.
